description: In this generous interpretation of Nuits Saint-Georges, ripe berry fruits burst through the typical dry tannins. It has plenty of red-fruit flavors, a generous texture and structure. Drink this already attractive wine from 2018.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2013  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: The Stewart cuvée is lightly smoky, with plenty of up-front flavor. It marries cherry fruit to citrusy acidity, with a chunky, robust core and a crisp, clean finish.
title: Boedecker Cellars 2013 Stewart Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This medium-bodied wine emphasizes texture and structure instead of ripeness, and that's a good thing when serving with a rich roasted duck or quail. It has black-cherry and clove aromas, moderate fruit flavors and a tight mouthfeel due to full tannins and bracing acidity.
title: Maggy Hawk 2013 Afleet Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Longtime value producer Firesteed has another winner. This pretty Pinot shows excellent ripeness and full-bodied fruit flavor, thanks to the southern-Oregon components. Strawberries and tart raspberries come through cleanly, with a touch of cola in the aftertaste.
title: Firesteed 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Light red cherry, dried sage, black tea and thyme show on the nose of this bottling from the iconic facility in the heart of its namesake valley. There is a lot of action on the palate, where tart cherry and plum skin flavors meet with dried mint and earthy shrub elements.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This well-crafted wine is reflective of the vintage, which brought its share of challenges. Tea-leaf flavors run throughout, along with quite light red fruits and plenty of acid. The finish is on the green side, but not so much that it's detrimental. Drink this wine while cellaring the bigger wines from riper years.
title: Raptor Ridge 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Soft, gentle and generous cherry notes color the nose and light palate. This is pliable and has pleasant edges of peppery, tingling spice and freshness.
title: Kuentz-Bas 2013 Trois Chateaux Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Very ripe and fruity in character, this wine smells like cherries, raisins and spiced plums, and has a grippy texture from good acidity and moderate tannins for a little bite of astringency.
title: Foursight 2013 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: The winery's top wine in a tough vintage, just a single barrel of this was made. It delivers an extra dose of extract, with the same characteristic pine needle and raspberry flavors found in the estate bottling. It's potent and powerful, with the fruit and alcohol in perfect balance. It winds down with a citrusy finish.
title: Styring 2013 Wit Reserve Estate Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: A brooding texture and fully layered concentration of intense flavor spark the palate and mind in this estate wine, which is showy in cola, bark, black cherry and black tea. Medium bodied and well-made, it finds balance between its coastal influence, its crisp acidity and the burlier aspects of fruit and weight.
title: Fort Ross 2013 Fort Ross Vineyard Stagecoach Road Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: Styring releases their wines with plenty of bottle age and doesn't shy from high alcohol. The level of ripeness in this bottling is not for everyone, veering more toward Zin-like power than Pinot Noir elegance. It's lushly aromatic, with dominant pine needle and raspberry extract flavors. A dense, concentrated and pungent wine with a spicy top note.
title: Styring 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Full bodied and robust, this wine is abundant in earthy mint, strawberry and rhubarb,. It is also fully infatuated with its cool-climate aromatics of sea breeze and morning fog. Cherry rules the day on the palate, taking on a richness across the voluptuous finish.
title: Mira 2013 Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This impressive wine is full bodied, round and dusty in texture, filled with deep cherry fruit and dark chocolate notes. It finishes long and softly tannic. Drink now–2025.
title: Clos Henri 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Sourced from the Omaka Valley, this Pinot Noir is fermented and aged in 1000-liter casks, hence the Big Barrel moniker. It's medium bodied and silky in texture, with only minimal oak-derived flavor. Instead it offers crisp red fruits like cherries and pomegranates, plus subtle hints of tomato leaf and smoked meat. Drink now–2021.
title: Bird 2013 Big Barrel Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A pretty shade of pale pink, this dry and spicy rosé has a boisterous personality. Its watermelon and strawberry flavors come with a kick, showing real depth. Juicy acidity keeps it fresh and forward.
title: Elizabeth Chambers 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Pungent earth is met by dark handfuls of baking spice, dried cherry and chocolate in this rich, velvety and full-bodied wine that's smooth and rounded on the palate.
title: Fog Crest 2013 Laguna West Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a medium-bodied, silky rendering of Pinot Noir. Restrained aromas of cherries, dried herbs and vanilla lead into similar flavors, then pick up a touch of mocha on the long finish. Drink now–2020.
title: Giesen 2013 The Brothers Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Dark-pink-orange in color, this wine is muted in floral tones of beauty and simplicity. Crisp, clean and simple layers of creamy vanilla are mixed with Meyer lemon and white peach. Refreshing and light on its feet, it's memorable in its stony minerality and its full embrace of citrus intrigue.
title: Via Giusti 2016 Estate Quattro Mani Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Fermented in neutral oak barrels, this tasty wine is loaded with pretty raspberry and cherry fruit. It's fresh and vibrant, with excellent concentration and length.
title: Duck Pond 2016 Hylo Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine's lovely rose petal and strawberry aromas, along with other tart and tangy wild berry notes, gather with appealing weight and length. It's quite dry and finishes on a lively dash of white pepper.
title: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Zippy upon opening and even a day later, this tight, bright and lightly pink-orange rosé shows a tangerine rind influence on the nose along with red apple, pluot and a steely minerality. The vibrant sip shows flavors of tangy orange and Meyer lemon peel, and is bursting with a simmering acidity.
title: Presqu'ile 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is plush and oaky, with cedar, vanilla and baking spices layered atop cherry-berry fruit. The midpalate is rich and round, while the finish is a bit astringent. Try in 2019.
title: Giesen 2013 Clavin Single Vineyard Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This juicy, fruity Beaujolais-style wine is instantly appealing. Its grape, raspberry and cherry flavors are highlighted with orange peel scents. It's definitely made to be drunk young.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2016 Whole Cluster Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Another white Pinot Noir, this offers juicy apple flavors, evoking both pulp and skin. There's a hint of grass that's almost Sauvignon-like, but barrel fermentation and partial malolactic has helped smooth any rough edges.
title: Duck Pond 2016 Blanc Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Bold and full-bodied, this tasty rosé mixes berry, cherry, orange and tangerine flavors with ample acidity. It's not particularly complex but rather fruit-forward, fresh and delicious.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2016 Whole Cluster Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This sophisticated and stylish Pinot Noir from the south of France was made a Burgundy producer. It has fine tannins, juicy red cherry-driven acidity and a warm, ripe aftertaste.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2016 Tramier Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: The off color of this wine is a hint that it's unusual, and a white from Pinot Noir is indeed not too common. This shows roundness with acidic balance. A pop of melon and peach flavors turns slightly bitter on a fresh yet fairly long finish.
title: Aniello 2016 Soil Blanco de Pinot Noir (Río Negro Valley)

description: This cool-climate Pinot Noir is soft and gentle. Its ripe tannins and cherry flavors are both lightly structured and juicy. Although still young, it's ready to drink.
designation: Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly
title: Eric Louis 2016 Alphonse Dolly Les Doigts d'Or de Dolly Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This late release sourced from several vineyards dating back to the 1970s and 1980s is thin on the palate, with tart plum, herb, orange peel and of pineapple hints. Low alcohol reflects the cool vintage.
title: Ransom 2013 Selection Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is a tangy fruity wine. It has crisp acidity along with spice as well as red-currant fruitiness. It is light and refreshing and ready to drink now.
title: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Petit Bourgeois Rosé de Pinot Noir (Val de Loire)

description: Fully mature, this light-bodied Pinot should be consumed before the end of 2017. Scents of cola and earth add interest to cherry fruit, ending with lingering acids.
title: Cairnbrae 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Cherry and plum aromas are earthy but not distinctive or pushy. This Pinot from Patagonia is lifted by bold acidity, while spicy red plum and peppery flavors finish juicy and steady.
title: Aniello 2016 006 Riverside Estate Pinot Noir (Río Negro Valley)

description: This is a light, crisp wine for current drinking. Herbal notes make the cherry fruit resemble cherry tomatoes, while the acids carry through the tart finish.
title: Hunter's 2013 Jane Hunter Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This ripe, cherry-flavored wine has touches of toasty spice from wood aging. It's smooth and soft, with juicy acidity that offsets its rounded texture.
title: Barton & Guestier 2016 Bistro Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: The Savigny-lès-Beaune-based producer shows his Pinot Noir skills with this wine. It's generous, with red plum flavor, light wood-aging notes, ripe tannins and crisp acidity. It's rounded and ready to drink.
title: Doudet Naudin 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Sharp pine needle and tart berry scents dominate the nose. Low alcohol and pungent flavors emphasize the acidity, leaving a puckery mouthfeel with little impression of fruit. Best with mild cheeses and salted nuts.
title: Sokol Blosser 2016 Estate Cuvée Rosé of Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Aromas of cedar and leather leave a savory impression that's echoed on the palate, where flavors center on cola, baking spices and mushroom. A crisp finish provides bright contrast. Drink up.
title: Fault Line 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This light, cool-climate Pinot Noir is crisp with red currant fruit and herbal-tinged acidity. It has a zesty character that keeps it lively and tight. Drink now.
title: Saget la Perrière 2016 La Petite Perrière Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: One of the single-vineyard-focused winery's more affordable appellation blends, this is a plush, velvety wine with aromas of black cherry, cola, roasted fennel and a touch of graphite. The palate starts quite earthy, with thyme and rosemary notes, then winds to tart cherry fruit that's lively and long-lasting.
title: Testarossa 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This wine seems to have just barely ripened in this vintage, but is very well made and interesting. The tart, waxy red fruit has a vein of pine resin threading around rhubarb and sour berry. Firm and focused, it will work best with poultry in an herbal preparation.
title: Francis Tannahill 2013 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: While there is little varietal character in this Pinot Noir, it is still an attractive, light and fruity wine. Red berries come through strongly sustaining acidity and some tight, mineral tannins. The wine is already well developed and ready to drink.
title: Quinta de Sant'Ana 2013 Q de Sant'Ana Pinot Noir (Lisboa)

description: Done in a somewhat rustic style, this three-clone blend fills the mouth with smoky, oaky, dried-cherry flavors. It's a full-bodied country red, tasty but not necessarily representative of most Oregon Pinots.
title: Plaisance Ranch 2013 Papa Joe's Private Stash Pinot Noir (Applegate Valley)

description: Several wineries make a Momtazi cuvée, an indication of the high esteem in which the vineyard is held. Here a touch of volatility attenuates the nose, leading into a bright, acidic young wine with flavors of orange peel, red berries, toast and nut butter.
title: Fullerton 2013 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This wine shows dusty-earth aromas over ripe red cherry and raspberry. The light-bodied palate is silken in feel, with soft tannins that build upon flavors of red plum skin, currants and pink peppercorns.
title: Shady Lane 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Leelanau Peninsula)

description: Aromatically elusive at first, with good, clear color, this wine then reveals dots of cranberry and cherry that give way to a crowd-pleasing juiciness that makes it approachable and likable with food. It veers into cola vanilla on the finish.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2013 Director's Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: While the nose seems dominated by oak, with charred bacon and cola aromas, the palate shows plenty of fruit, offering velvety dark cherry in the lead. Savory spice notes streak across the plush, structured palate, giving way to a mocha finish. There's enough acidity and tannic structure to explore how this will develop in the years to come. Give it another year or two for the oak to integrate further.
title: Brys 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Old Mission Peninsula)

description: Rhubarb, turned earth and iron aromas power the nose on this bottling by Sabrine Rodems, who also makes Wrath wines. The iron character extends to the palate, picking up flint and gunmetal notes along with raspberry fruit and more fresh dirt flavors.
title: Scratch 2013 Kw Ranch Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: The Dardis designate is a mix of Wädenswil and Dijon 115 clones, aged in 30% new French oak. This is light and tangy, showing detailed flavors of just-ripe berries framed in citrus-peel phenolics. The oak is hiding at the moment, but the acids are in full view.
title: Fairsing 2013 Dardis Pinot Noir

description: Light and subtle, this offers tart cherry fruit with hints of mushroom. The texture and definition somewhat compensate for the overall lightness and lack of depth. It's a graceful, elegant wine best enjoyed young.
title: WillaKenzie Estate 2013 Emery Pinot Noir

description: Light and clear in color, this wine veers into cool-climate, restrained territory in its well-defined lines of sage, dried herb and stemmy earth. Dry tannins give an oomph of power beneath traces of dried rose.
title: August Truth 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Two bottles were tasted, with significant variation. The better bottle showed moderately ripe cherry fruit framed in chocolate and orange peel. A 50/50 mix of Pommard and Dijon 777 clones, this is best enjoyed soon.
title: Quintet 2013 Ribbon Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Elegant and aromatic, this 2013 offers light flavors of apple and raspberry, a dusting of cocoa and excellent balance. It does feel a bit thin as it fades out, but keeps its definition and focus.
title: WillaKenzie Estate 2013 Jory Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This wine has a light delicacy that provides an ethereal quality to its wispy layers of wild strawberry, dried herb and spearmint. Bright and crisp, it finishes smoothly with buoyant acidity.
title: Bouchaine 2013 Bacchus Collection Swan Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Pronounced notes of strawberry and red cherry are laced with notes of vanilla and brown sugar on the nose. The light-bodied palate follows suit, with toasted vanilla lingering to the finish.
title: Blustone 2013 Pinot Noir (Leelanau Peninsula)

description: Juicy and bright, this pushes snappy raspberry and cherry fruit front and center, with a tasty touch of spice as well. It's a good introduction to the more elegant style of the 2013 vintage wines.
title: Dobbes Family Estate 2013 Eola-Amity Cuvée Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is a bright mix of brambly berry, peppery herb, pine sap and tree bark. It definitely falls into the herbal/forest style of Oregon Pinot, with tart, spicy fruit in the background.
title: Soléna 2013 Hyland Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: In this appellation blend from the single-vineyard-focused Los Gatos winery, aromas of cherry and chaparral scrub are pleasant if reluctant to emerge. The palate laces tart pomegranate and cranberry with licorice and forest-floor elements.
title: Testarossa 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This vineyard-designate saw 40% new French oak, putting some pastry and baking-spice flavors around the cherry fruit. There's a suggestion of the tack room, and a finish that turns a bit dilute, with a Dr Pepper zing to it.
title: Fullerton 2013 Croft Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: An earthy geranium note lingers above a core of dark cherry and raspberry on the nose. The medium-bodied palate boasts light tannins and a flavor profile of cherries, wilting red flowers and anise.
title: 2 Lads 2013 Pinot Noir (Old Mission Peninsula)

description: This full-bodied and effusive wine has a sweet, oaky aroma and similarly rich flavors of black cherry and blackberry jam. It feels smooth and luxurious.
title: FEL 2013 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Opening aromas blend earthy red fruits with a whiff of leather. It's a nicely sculpted wine, tight and stiff, with pleasant berry and cherry flavors that stop abruptly as the finish turns a bit sour.
title: Fullerton 2013 Five Faces Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Ripe black cherry dipped in cola marks the nose of this bold offering. With 13 months in French oak (50% new and 50% second use), the palate carries some weight, offering dense black cherry supported by grainy tannins. A tensile line of cranberry acidity draws everything to the vanilla-laden close.
title: 2 Lads 2013 Cuvée Beatrice Pinot Noir (Old Mission Peninsula)

description: Forget Burgundy, this is a rich, New World style of Pinot Noir, concentrated and without great subtlety. It is just black fruit, dense tannins and some bitter extraction that shows in the dark coffee flavors. It should calm down somewhat although still with a sense of power. Drink from 2017.
title: Adega Mãe 2013 Pinot Noir (Lisboa)

description: This is a tangy, not entirely varietal wine that's dense in black tea and black fruit, with layers of tobacco and dried herb. Give it time in the glass to open.
title: Meadowcroft 2013 Cornerstone Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Pomegranate, dark plum and slate show on the simple nose of this appellation blend. The palate is light, with hints of strawberry and plum as well as pencil lead and mace. It's a great option for chilling a bit and drinking on the beach.
title: Mignanelli 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Rhubarb and cranberry fruit, along with a touch of red apple suggests minimal ripening. It's a tangy, pleasant wine, light and optimal for near-term drinking with simple poultry dishes.
title: Le Cadeau 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This light but firm style of Pinot shows spicy, slightly herbal and oaky aromas. The palate is fresh and fruit-forward, with a medium body and enough concentration to create a lingering finish.
title: Castle Rock 2013 Cuvée Pinot Noir (California)

description: The nose boasts ripe dark cherry and raspberry aromas, with a dash of spice for nuance. Light, smooth and juicy on the palate, cherry and blackberry flavors resound in this easygoing Pinot Noir.
title: 2 Lads 2013 D. Cuvée Pinot Noir (Old Mission Peninsula)

description: The antithesis of a squeaky-clean commercial wine, this funky but compelling and complex bottling is an adventure to drink. Brownish in color, it conveys strong earth, spice and new-leather notes in the aroma, followed by flavors like black tea, rhubarb and cedar. While it was aged for an unusually long time in 70% new French oak, it comes off as layered and spicy but not at all overoaked.
title: Talisman 2013 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

description: This is a deliciously spicy exploration of wild strawberry and succulent waves of medium-bodied earth and structure. Lengthy and complex, it makes a case for the beauty that can come from blending from various vineyards.
title: David Bruce 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Adastra is an organically farmed vineyard and the wine shows an earthy profile that's substantial and defining. Full bodied and ripe, it rides a tension of acidity that provides freshness, seasoned in tart cherry and pomegranate.
title: Talisman 2013 Adastra Vineyard Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

description: This wine is made entirely from the Martini clone of the variety, a heritage clone that imparts a lovely perfume of raspberry and rose that's hard to resist. Moderately spicy cola seasons a voluptuous midpalate that fills with length as the wine develops, never letting go of its unshakeable prettiness.
title: En Garde 2013 Olivet Court Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This fragrant red opens with aromas of violet, rose, woodland berry, tilled earth and a whiff of new leather. The polished, fruity palate delivers juicy morello cherry, red raspberry, white pepper, and mineral alongside refined tannins and bright acidity. A licorice note wraps around the lingering finish. It's already tempting but will be even better in a few years. Drink 2018–2023.
title: Fontodi 2013 Case Via Colli Pinot Nero (Colli della Toscana Centrale)

description: This is a clear, light wine, aged lightly in oak, only 30% of it new. Wild brush and burnt orange dominate in taste and aroma, with additional characteristics of rhubarb, red cherry and lovely rose.
title: R2 2013 Guidici Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: From a sloped vineyard in Green Valley, this impressive wine is spicy in cardamom with plenty of forest floor character, a tanginess dominant on the full-bodied palate. Orange zest and cranberry accent fine-tuned tannin and subtle oak.
title: Talisman 2013 Gunsalus Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Though pale in color, this is a tannic and flavorful wine with an earthy underpinning. Lightly spiced red-fruit flavors unfold and gather strength midpalate. This nicely captures the elegance of Naramata Bench Pinot Noir.
title: Foxtrot 2013 Foxtrot Vineyard Pinot Noir (Okanagan Valley)

description: There's complexity to the nose of this Leyda Valley Pinot courtesy of leather, fresh mushroom and spicy plum aromas. A smooth, elegant palate delivers flavors of earthy plum and spiced black cherry. Mild toast and Middle Eastern spice notes help the finish.
title: Valdivieso 2013 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: This earthy, cool-climate wine is perfumed in a delicate layering of rose and spice, with subtle additions of brown sugar, tart cranberry and rhubarb. The oak is muted and supportive, while the body is light and bright.
title: Ron Rubin 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Light in color and lightly spiced, this wine has a leathery undertone that veers into intriguing aspects of baking spice, white pepper and sap. Full bodied and densely concentrated, the fruit is clearly defined and on the brighter spectrum of red cherry, strawberry and cranberry.
title: En Garde 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Tightly wound and floral, this wine has bright acidity with earthy cola and clove accents. Medium bodied, with some heft on the palate, it's ripe and rewarding in cherry and berry fruit flavors.
title: Acacia 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Smoky, charred berry aromas include notes of tea and crushed leaves. This modern Pinot feels big, with lemony acidity. Dark, roasted plum and black-tea flavors end blocky, with smoky woody notes. Drink this ripe, round wine through 2020.
title: Cono Sur 2013 Ocio Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: There is something smoky and grilled about the nose. While the red fruit of strawberry and cherry is fresh, there are also aromas of roasted oak. Nonetheless, the fruit itself is delicate and tart, translucent and unforced. The palate is slender and fresh, with a deep core of red berries. This may take time to come into its own. Drink 2018–2024.
title: Martinshof 2013 Galgenberg Reserve Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)

description: This wine is big in tannin, extracted and full bodied, with dense blueberry and maple syrup at its core. For fans of a rich style, it will impress for  its ripe, dark fruit and sizable yet velvety mouthfeel.
title: Acacia 2013 Thornton Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This clonal study could have used a touch of help from other clones, but it's still a very tasty and vibrant wine. Quite light in the glass, it shows rust, earth, forest floor and tart berries on the dainty nose. The equally demure palate offers light cranberry plus touches of thyme and white pepper.
title: Wrights Station 2013 777 Clones Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A light garnet color along with lightly earthy and spicy flavors fit this wine into the old school, where it offers nice balance, elegant texture and complex nuances of tea, cherry and raspberry. There is no heavy, overripe fruit or extreme oakiness to get in the way of pure enjoyment.
title: R2 2013 Day Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Though quite light in the glass, this bottling shows dark Indian spices and cinnamon as well as strawberry and candied cherry on the nose. Those same red fruits arise on the palate, lifted by thyme, more cinnamon and a peppery spice.
title: Wrights Station 2013 Far Away Block Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This wine is bold and brawny, defined by big, oaky tannin and concentrated weight. Fresh black cherry develops a candied quality in the glass, while an earthy undercurrent of minty forest adds complexity.
title: Acacia 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this offers strawberry and tomato aromas. The round and ready palate provides raspberry, green tea and a touch of vanilla alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Baracchi 2013 Pinot Nero (Toscana)

description: This wine is somewhat shy in aroma, with rust, light raspberry, cherry, gravel, dust and a slight cola element arising with patience. Bright red-cherry fruit and hibiscus shows on the sip, yet it's a tad dried out. Slate and riverstone touches add minerality, and the structure is defined by a rocky grip.
title: Carmel Road 2013 Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: Light in color and texture, this wine at first is muted and shy, getting spicier and earthier as it goes, with a baked strawberry-compote flavor at its core.
title: Calstar Cellars 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Fig, black plum, dried cherry and chai spice show on the nose of this bottling from River Road south of Salinas. Heavy flavors of dried black cherry and dried cranberry show on the sip, lifted by eucalyptus oil, juniper and black-tea elements.
title: Pessagno 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Lightly herbal cherry and plum aromas are earthy and dry. This feels austere, with fresh acidity and firm tannins. Peppery herbal plum flavors are spicy, while oak-related spice notes stick out on a solid and tight finish.
title: Casas del Toqui 2013 Terroir Selection Gran Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: This is a smooth, well-mannered and distinctly varietal wine, richly rewarding in cola spice and earthy black tea, with a juicy finish.
title: En Garde 2013 Starkey Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is marked by a woody, herbal undertone that evolves into cardamom and clove. Fruitier, full-bodied waves of cherry, wild strawberry and vanilla play out on the boisterous, boldly built palate.
title: Aiken 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

description: This is an estate-grown wine from a vineyard planted to three clones. It has an air of forested truffle, pine and cinnamon within a stemmy and somewhat unresolved body of medium weight.
title: Marimar Estate 2013 Mas Cavalls Doña Margarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Baked strawberry, burnt orange and rose petal combine aromatically and on the palate in this moderately flat wine.
title: Calstar Cellars 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From a vineyard located close to the coast of Aptos, this bottling shows dewy chaparral aromas on the nose, as well as light cinnamon, nutmeg and smashed graphite, with a dense pomegranate-hibiscus core. It is tightly wound on the sip, with cranberry, raspberry, rose petal and rose-hip flavors. The texture and tension are impressive, and will unleash continued intrigue from 2018 to 2033.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2013 La Vida Bella Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Clear, light color reveals the elegance at the core of this coastal wine. It reigns in ripeness without sacrificing flavor or complexity. Stemmy, earthy overtones meet a vibrantly spicy bite of cherry and white pepper. The silky texture compels one to want more.
title: Flowers 2013 Seaview Ridge Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Soft and earthy, this wine's herbal, funky nature suggests Carneros as much as Sonoma Coast, with black tea and crunchy dried cranberry lurking on the back of the palate. Medium in weight, it eases into a mellow finish.
title: Bruliam 2013 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Light and appealing, this well-priced Willamette Valley bottling offers hints of rose petals, raspberries and thin cherry fruit. There's a whiff of sweet toast also, and the overall balance is spot on.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Fruity and forward, with a spritzy mouthfeel, this is like a bowl of cherries, with a cherry candy finish. Highlights of orange and grapefruit come through also. Drink now through 2016.
title: Vidon Vineyard 2013 3 Clones Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: From a trio of vineyards in the appellation, including the producer's estate, this wine has an herbal, feral quality around layers of red berry and dark currant. With big shoulders and a velvety texture, it goes down easily and finishes light.
title: Schug 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This warm-climate Pinot Noir appeals to those who prefer density on the palate. Cranberry and tart cherry dominate on the nose, followed by richer elements of strawberry tart, earth and milk chocolate.
title: Ca' Momi 2013 Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: Despite its youth this is quickly peaking in flavor. It's light but interesting, with rosewater, red apple and strawberry flavors. Tannins are soft and there's a suggestion of saddle leather. It offers plenty of enjoyment for a Pinot at this price.
title: Hinman 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This has a rather deep red color and a slightly smoky rim. It offers profuse aromas of black cherry and blackberry, medium to full body and a generous texture. It's enjoyable for the fruit flavor, and easy to drink due to the soft texture. The finish is lingering and almost sweet.
title: Greenwood Ridge 2013 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

description: Baked strawberry and a bittersweet note of cherry play off the palate around a medium-bodied frame of subtle tannin and oak. Dried cranberry comes in as a secondary detail, before the wine finishes in a blaze of leather and black tea.
title: Chateau St. Jean 2013 Sonoma Estates Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is an effusively fruity wine blended from three coastal counties, deep in color and jammy in aroma. Ripe and generous in flavor, it features black cherry and boysenberry, moderate tannins and a medium to full body.
title: Reata 2013 Three County Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Tart cran-apple fruit—some of it from 35-year-old vines—is at the heart of this vineyard-designated cuvée. It has a woody/earthy undertone, tart acids and some stiffening tannins.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2013 OSU Woodhall III Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This has a very deep-red color with a reddish-purple rim, followed by very ripe, jammy aromas like boysenberry jam with spicy, smoky oak accents. Flavors are ripe, effusive and nearly sweet, as the wine goes for broke in terms of well-ripened grape flavors and generous helpings of sweet-spicy oak.
title: Meiomi 2013 Pinot Noir (Monterey-Santa Barbara-Sonoma)

description: Light, perfumed aromas are feint on the nose. The palate is intense and tightly presented. Raspberry flavors are direct prior to transitioning to oak and related peppery spice. A hot sensation rises up on a snappy finish.
title: Apaltagua 2013 Coleccion Limited Edition Pinot Noir (San Antonio)

description: Spicy cranberry/raspberry fruit is at the heart of this bright, quaffable and value-priced wine. There's a light dusting of pepper also, but it's the fresh fruit that stands out.
title: Rainstorm 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: A foundation of truffled earth and forest floor give this a rustic edge, complemented by savory herb and black tea. Weighty, it shows its backbone of oak aging well, finishing abruptly in cranberry and dark cherry.
title: Gehricke 2013 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

description: A slightly earthy aroma leads to rich, ripe berry and cherry flavors that seem to coat the mouth and linger on the finish. It's medium bodied and almost soft, with little acidity or tannin detectable. All that opulent fruit flavor keeps it pleasing.
title: HandCraft 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Fruity and big-boned, this opens well with pleasant plum and cherry flavors. It doesn't quite hold together, turning sour and leaving an off-taste in the finish.
title: Eola Hills 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: A robust structure of tannin and oak in this fuller-bodied wine masks the finer components of black cherry and blackberry fruit that lurk underneath layers of tobacco and cigar box.
title: Markham 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: An earthy, edgy character derives from slightly funky, smoky aromas and flavors, and a rather sharp texture. Savory and earthy flavors dominate the subtle fruit, and a core of dry tannins emphasizes the lean profile.
title: Peltier 2013 Hybrid Pinot Noir (Lodi)

description: This is relatively light, with straightforward fruit aromas, flavors of pomegranate and strawberry, and a smooth, soft texture.
title: Gnarly Head 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Light, earthy and thin, this doesn't bring much in the way of either fruit or pleasure. Tannins are substantial, which may be a plus if you want to pair it with a burger.
title: A to Z 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Strawberry, sagebrush and graphite show on the nose. The palate offers red fruit that fades quickly into a more sour style, with dried citrus peels.
title: Jackhammer 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Dark slate, ripe raspberry and black cherry greet the nose on this wine. The palate shows mocha, sharp pomegranate and a bubble gum esther, with a burning acidity.
title: Chloe 2013 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: The nose on this wine is a bit flat, showing hints of cherry, cola and iron. The palate is not varietally typical, with tarry and sour red fruits, and quite a bit of textural grip.
title: Consilience 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Seductively smooth and intriguingly aromatic, this blend of several knock-out vineyards along Westside Road—Allen, Bacigalupi, Bucher, Rochioli Riverblock and Williams Selyem Estate—is instantly delicious, sharing a concentration of cherry, strawberry and citrus that perfectly captures the essence of the fruit, accented by a tease of black tea. An earthy minerality wraps around dry, polished tannins, with a streak of just-right acidity, giving it a realm of juiciness and flavorful sophistication. Enjoy through 2023.
title: Williams Selyem 2013 Westside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Silky, with pronounced tannins that should mellow in time, this is an earthy, stemmy and perfumed wine. Succulent and balanced, it's brightly exuberant in black cherry yet brooding and complex throughout, changing slightly from savory to floral and back again. It's an incredible wine out of the gate; cellar with confidence, through 2021.
title: Williams Selyem 2013 Olivet Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine, a regional blend, shows remarkable achievement in winemaking. Wild strawberry and red cherry exude on the entry, alongside floral elements of violet and lilac. Velvety, resolved tannins make it enjoyable from the get-go, layered in acidity for a buoyant lift on the midpalate and finish, which suggests cinnamon and tea. Enjoy now and through 2020.
title: Williams Selyem 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Brian Loring's bottling of this vineyard planted by Gary Pisoni and Gary Franscioni is bursting with raspberry syrup, cola and peppercorns on the nose. The palate boasts notes of strawberry juice, red berries and hibiscus. It's luxurious and sexy.
title: Loring Wine Company 2013 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Minty fresh and significantly herbal, this is a lighter-styled, stemmy and earthy wine from a longstanding vineyard source that just shines from start to finish. Pomegranate, black cherry and tea combine to delicious effect, giving the wine enough body and soul to remain memorable through the long, tea-stained finish.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2013 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Delicious aromas of ripe cherry pie and black cardamom are quite sexy. The palate is far more complicated and layered, with the tartness of plum skins, richness of strawberry, balsamic reduction and spiciness of black sage.
title: Foxen 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Power and grace combine in this tour de force from Helen Masters, Ata Rangi's winemaker. Toasty oak frames intense black cherry fruit, with hints of herbs adding a savory element. Firm tannins provide ample structure, while the lengthy finish prolongs the pleasure. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Ata Rangi 2013 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: This is the producer's first vintage from this vineyard—the grapes were previously sold. The site, which sits within Green Valley as well as the Sonoma Coast, is planted to the same clone as sister property Quail Hill, in coveted Goldridge soils. Soft, round and decadent, the wine is full bodied, with bursts of red fruit and crushed stone.
title: Lynmar 2013 Susanna's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A whopping deal at under $30, this shows seductive and intriguing aromas of cherry tomato, chopped oregano, thyme, tomato lead, incense, rose petals and hibiscus. There's iron and cherry pit at the tip of the sip, which settles into mace, allspice and cinnamon, ever-evolving throughout the plum fruit flavors in the glass.
title: Mignanelli 2013 Highlands Ranch Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: From a historic vineyard planted in 1971, this bottling show savory and dark notes of strawberry, raspberry, licorice, slate, sage and a touch of oak smoke. The palate boasts earthy structure and vibrant acidity, with flavors of slightly bitter cherry fruit, beet juice and bay leaf.
title: Testarossa 2013 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A barrel-selection of Susanna's, this wine has grip and yet is also silky and elegant. Cranberry and plum star on the palate, bright and plush, the acidity tightly managed and brought to life. Medium bodied, this wine has depth and breadth, finishing in clove and cardamon-dusted orange peel.
title: Lynmar 2013 Susanna's Vineyard Anisya's Blend Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Complex aromas greet the nose on this top-level offering from a veteran producer, with dark strawberry and black plum treated to a eucalyptus and sagebrush twist. The palate mixes fruit with spice as well, showing raspberry-blackberry juice cut with clove, allspice, nutmeg and Mediterranean herbs.
title: Gainey 2013 Limited Selection Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A bold, chewy expression of the variety, Summit exhibits its 15% whole-cluster fermentation. It also is given more oak, a chance to tame its wild black cherry and lush cola spice. Black tea and a trace of red fruit play into the personality of the wine, adding a brightness to what is otherwise a decadent, full-throttle wine, barely tamed at that. Drink now through 2023.
title: Lynmar 2013 Quail Hill Vineyard Summit Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From a vineyard off of Lakeville Highway in the heart of the Petaluma Gap, drilled by winds, this is a concentrated, thick-skinned wine, dark and oaky. A fistful of earthy mushroom, herb and forest surrounds a foundation of blueberry compote and cola, the acidity high and well mannered. Drink now through 2023.
title: Lynmar 2013 Terra de Promissio Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A hint of red currant fruit appears on the nose. The slender, translucent palate then expands into a harmony of tart, fresh berries, restrained smokiness, forest floor and earth. There is something honest and pure about this that lets the exquisite purity of those tart berries shine. You simply crave more.
title: Hillinger 2013 Terroir Pinot Noir (Burgenland)

description: This intensely powerful wine is named in honor of the winery's co-proprietor and founder. Chewy and earthy, it's concentrated and robust, strong in black-cherry cola and truffle. From the estate vineyard surrounding the winery, it's for those who love their Pinots bold and velvety.
title: Lynmar 2013 Quail Hill Vineyard Lynn's Blend Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Richly expressed black plum and strawberry notes mesh with Red Hot candies, purple flowers and potpourri aromas, along with flashes of rosemary and pine. The palate is perfumed with touches of lavender, anise, dried black sage and mint, laid across alpine strawberries, black cherry and raspberry fruit.
title: Potek 2013 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A barrel selection off Craggy Range's estate vineyard in the Te Muna Road area of Martinborough, this isn't a huge blockbuster style, but one that favors elegance. The aromas and flavors are ripe, oozing with hints of plum, black cherry, cola and licorice, but what makes the wine special are its subtle spice shadings and silky texture. Drink now–2025.
title: Craggy Range 2013 Aroha Te Muna Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Yeasty like baked bread, this is a robust wine embodied by mint and dried herb, the tannins smoothly polished. The fruit speaks to edgy cranberry and red cherry, never getting sweet, yet still offering plenty of juicy flavor.
title: Davis Family 2013 Soul Patch Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a sturdy, tannic wine, but one that should come around in a few years. Vanilla, cedar and dark fruit notes have the spotlight for now, with hints of mocha coming on strong on the long finish. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Mt. Difficulty 2013 Bannockburn Long Gully Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Light notes of pomegranate and hibiscus intertwine with Earl Grey tea and lavender on the nose of this wine from one of the region's most famous producers. There's lots of California chaparral spice on the nose, with aniseed, wild fennel and a cinnamon character decorating the cranberry, pomegranate and light strawberry flavors.
title: Talley 2013 Stone Corral Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Plum and cranberry mark the entry into this clone-specific wine, which becomes expansively juicy as it makes its way on the palate. Orange peel, cranberry and cardamom provide an exotic take on the variety, ending in earth and spice.
title: August Briggs 2013 Dijon Clones Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: This upper-tier label shows condensed strawberry fruit against an herbal backbone of marjoram, black cardamom, rainbow peppercorns, dried tobacco and green olive. The palate is tangy with woody fruits of elderberry and juniper, likely to thrive with age.
title: Potek 2013 Rancho La Vina Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Floral hints on the nose give way on the palate to a deep, concentrated core of forest fruit: there is the tartness of wild cranberry, the alluring aroma of wild raspberry and darker overtones of bilberry, all framed by brooding aspects of oak. Fruit and oak are in some kind of chiaroscuro dialogue that intrigues. Best to wait a little longer since real pleasure and elegance awaits.
title: Meinklang 2013 Pinot Noir (Burgenland)

description: One of the Hahn family's top brands, this bottling shows cola, clove and dense cranberry juice aromas, offering dense yet tart red fruit against uncrushed spice. Mossy earth plays into the palate, where more dried cranberry notes mix with thyme, dried sage, juniper and eucalyptus.
title: Lucienne 2013 Lone Oak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This lovely, luxurious wine hails from the Terra de Promissio Vineyard. It stands out for its thickness of earthy forest floor and exuberant fruit, a mix of candied raspberry, blueberry and cherry. Building structure and power as it opens in the glass, it finishes strongly tannic, suggesting more time in the cellar may be of benefit; hold through 2023.
title: Lombardi 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Woody aromatics of myrrh and frankincense meld with crushed cinnamon, condensed hibiscus, red berries and black pepper on the nose of this bottling. Black cherry shows at the tip of the sip, then drops into incense, pine and juniper flavors, revealing cola and coffee notes toward the finish.
title: Testarossa 2013 La Rinconada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A full-bodied, complex and supple-textured wine, this offers plump, ripe black-cherry aromas shaded by hints of forest floor and sautéed mushrooms, along with mild plum and cherry flavors. While soft and soothing on the palate, a fine layer of tannins wraps it up and keeps it appetizing.
title: MacPhail 2013 Toulouse Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Aromas of black raspberry, black cherry and a cinnamon spice are laid across a slate-driven minerality on the nose of this bottling. It's plush on the sip, with hibiscus and raspberry notes, lifted by pepper, camphor and white sage elements.
title: Mignanelli 2013 KW VIneyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Red cherry, root beer, a touch of sage and bay leaf and an shiitake-powered umami sensation decorate the nose on this wine from one of many single-vineyard expressions in this producer's portfolio. The palate shows cooked cherries and cranberries that float across a Mediterranean elements of olive, fig balsamic and menthol.
title: Testarossa 2013 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Slightly reductive on the nose, this bottling from a very coastal vineyard outside of Cambria shows mossy forest floor, jerked meat, dried cranberries, turned earth, sesame oil and salt on the nose. The palate combines concentrated, lush raspberry with bay leaf, lots of turned earth and chaparral seasonings.
title: Stolo 2013 Creekside Estate Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: How unusual—a Pinot Noir from Wachau! Appetizing notes of fresh red currants give this a delicate, light-bodied aspect. The tart berry fruit is again reinforced on the palate where red currants are joined by cranberry. White pepper fizzes around the edges and makes for a lot of charm on a slender, smooth and translucent body.
title: Tegernseerhof 2013 Pinot Noir (Wachau)

description: The 2013 vintage was a solid one for Pinot Noir in just about every corner of New Zealand. This is medium-bodied and slightly creamy-textured, with dark notes of cola, mocha and plum, spiced up by hints of cinnamon and clove. The lengthy finish is supple and velvety. Drink now–2025.
title: Greywacke 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Made in smaller amounts than its sister label, Starmont, this wine has more complexity and layering of flavors and textures. It opens juicy and exuberant, almost brawny, in black cherry and berry. Oak, currant and clove provide a spicy flair midway through and on the finish.
title: Merryvale 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Woody fruit notes of elderberry and bramble meet with graphite and sagebrush on the nose of this block-designated bottling from the longtime growing family. Plums and cranberries get a serious juniper and pine-sap twist on the palate, laid across lots of loamy earth. The grippy character will soften and protect this wine, so drink 2018–2025.
title: McIntyre Vineyards 2013 Block 3 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Orange and cranberry take center stage, while savory cinnamon and cardamom dance in the background, shimmering around full-bodied tannin and oak. Mildly exotic, there's an intensity to this wine, that ends in fig compote.
title: Frank Family 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Wild earth and forest floor surround elements of truffle, black tea and cardamom in this vineyard-designate, a savory and wholly compelling wine. Crisp orange blossom and orange peel buoy the minerality and sensation of crushed rocks and rose petals.
title: Davis Family 2013 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Hints of ripe red cherry and tart Morello combine on the nose. The palate is light but has a frame of fine tannins. Freshness and lightness are the chief attractions here, with conifer in the background. Overall a light, traditional, savory Pinot.
title: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 Rouge des 2 Cerfs Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This is a fine introduction to the winery's low alcohol, elegant stable of Pinots. Rhubarb and strawberry fruit comes with a lightly toasty note, and a dash of cocoa. Whole cluster fermentation and indigenous yeast ar the playbook at this winery.
title: Amalie Robert 2013 The Uncarved Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This full, fleshy and affordable wine gets treated to small-lot ferments in neutral oak barrels. The fruit seems young and fresh—Gamay-like, with bright and spicy berry flavors. Drink this over the next couple of years while that freshness remains in full force.
title: Eugene Wine Cellars 2016 b2 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: As the low alcohol suggests, this is a light and just barely ripe rosé, a salmon shade with a blush of cherry red. Tart flavors of strawberry and rhubarb are dusted with a dash of Thai spices.
designation: Queen of Quite a Lot Rosé of
title: Angel Vine 2016 Queen of Quite a Lot Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Red cherry notes on the nose hint at ripeness. The palate presents this ripe fruit with simplicity and freshness. There could be more focus but this is juicy and easy.
title: Meyer-Fonné 2016 Réserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This youthful wine pulls from several vineyards across the appellation, offering strong floral aromas of rose, geranium and lavender. Sizable tannins add to a feeling of full-bodied richness, highlighted in black tea, forest and clove.
title: Pali 2016 Bluffs Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A pretty shade of strawberry pink, this light tasty undemanding wine has strawberry fruit and a touch of white pepper. It was briefly barreled in a mix of stainless and neutral wood.
title: Z'IVO 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: With its cherry notes on the nose a little muddled, the palate nonetheless is bright fresh and vivid in a crunchy red-cherry note. This is simple and a little rustic, and would also work as a lightly chilled red.
title: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Cuvée Mathieu Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: A rather earthy nose leads onto the fresh, slender and balanced palate. The body has a kind of rustic simplicity, with honest, clean red-cherry fruit. This is easy and fresh and would be ideal for a country-style lunch. Drink soon.
title: Martin Schaetzel 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Fully 70% was fermented whole cluster in neutral oak, yielding a wine with bright cranberry and raspberry fruit, juicy acids, and a touch of citrus. The wine avoids excessive stemmy flavors, though a bit of cardboard comes out in the tannins.
title: Minimus 2016 Dijon Free Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Just a touch of red cherry fruit show on the nose. The palate is light and slender but fresh in feel, with smooth, unobtrusive tannins. This will work well chilled. Drink soon.
title: Willm 2016 Réserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The name identifies this as the winery's Internet-only cuvée, and it has much the same character as the Uncarved Block Pinot. Rhubarb and tart strawberry fruit, low alcohol, and an overall balance emulate the lighter style of Pinot.
title: Amalie Robert 2013 iPinot Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A touch of ripe, red cherry on the nose becomes fully expressed on the palate where it is met with freshness and a conifer tone. The tannins are fine and have the slightest crunch, while the body is light and translucent. This is fresh-faced, honest and clean.
title: Joseph Cattin 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: A tart but aromatic tone of cranberry hovers on the nose and then continues to fill the palate with its tart, appetizing purity. This is a very light, slender wine that offers ample freshness. Drink soon.
title: Kuentz-Bas 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Earthy forest and mushroom belie a hearty, dense and velvety expression of rich dark cherry and huckleberry in this full-bodied powerful wine.
title: Pali 2016 Riviera Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This entry-level, simple yet well-made wine offers straightforward cranberry and cherry fruit. It's fresh and bright, with juicy youthful appeal. Drink now while it's at its freshest.
title: Phelps Creek 2016 Le Petit Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: Just a hint of cherry appears on the shy nose. On the fresh, light and translucent palate the fruit tone is pure but tart. This is fresh, honest and still has the slightest tannic grip. A very balanced, fresh-faced wine. Drink soon.
title: Jean Biecher & Fils 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Another barrel selection, this seems quite thin in comparison with the rest of the winery's 2013s. It's tart and acidic, without the supporting detail and overall elegance of the rest. There are simple fruit flavors of citrus and sour berries.
title: Amalie Robert 2013 Estate Selection Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Ripe red fruits combine into a pleasant, though generic style. There's a touch of earth underlying the tannins, and a high-toned edge to the aromatics.
title: Omero 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Crisp raspberry and red cherry flavors are invigorating and fresh on the palate of this easy-drinking, juicy Pinot Noir. It's delicate in concentration and light in body but balanced by soft but pleasantly bitter tannins. A hint of vanilla lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2020.
title: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Undone Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)

description: This wine is fresh and forward, with simple but appealing flavors of raspberry and cherry candies. The flavors don't go any further than that, but for a fruity quaffable wine, it's quite well done.
title: RHEA 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Forward vivid scents of cranberry and raspberry introduce similar fresh fruit flavors, backed by slightly harsh notes of skin and stem. It's a sturdy serviceable effort, which finishes with a hint of chicken broth.
title: Cedar + Salmon 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: You'll find aromas of toast, nut and a whiff of adhesive bandage on this. The aromas carry over the rather lean, somewhat muddled palate along with dried cherry, a hint of lead pencil, powdered sage and a confectionary note alongside steely bubbles.
title: Bèlon du Bèlon 2013 Instinct Brut Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: Slighty muted tones of strawberry and red apple are glazed with caramel in this slightly off-dry blanc de noir, a Pinot Noir vinfied like a white wine. Light bodied and soft in acidity, it's an easy, approachable wine to drink now.
title: Paul Anheuser 2016 Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Nahe)

description: Lush and rich aromas of candied red cherries and vanilla dust show on the nose of this bottling. Rosewater and fruit punch flavors arise on the sip, riding into a vanilla dust finish.
title: Vinum 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Raspberry and currant aromas ride over subtle tones of cedar, licorice and vanilla bean. This is a big wine, with intense oak flavors of vanilla, allspice and cedar that overpower the cranberry and raspberry fruit flavors. Plentiful grippy tannins are balanced by a backbone of acidity. The spicy tannic finish dissipates to a softer cedar note.
title: Cellardoor 2013 Pinot Noir (America)

description: Dusty mineral and saline notes lend savoriness to muted red apple and raspberry in this dry blanc de noirs, a Pinot Noir vinified like a white wine. The palate is broad and soft in acidity, finishing brisk but clean. Drink now.
title: Carl Ehrhard 2016 Rüdesheim Blanc de Noirs Trocken Pinot Noir (Rheingau)

description: Ripe cherry notes on the nose have a conifer edge. The palate has ample freshness but also seems to lack a little focus. This is full-fruited and fresh. Drink soon.
title: Domaine Fernand Engel 2016 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Slightly reductive aromas of wet clay and sour olive meet with dark cranberry fruit and camphor on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tart with raspberry and orange rind and gains complexity from the forest moss and wet wood flavors.
title: Layer Cake 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: You'll find sensations of bread crust, apple, cherry, medicinal herb, citrus and nut on this lively sparkler. Despite being a Pas Dosé, it has a somewhat candied note on the finish.
title: Villa 2013 Boké Noir Pas Dosé  (Franciacorta)

description: The nose suggests truffle around compact cherry fruit. The wine is nicely balanced, relatively high in acid, and fashioned for elegance more than power. A finishing whiff of chocolate adds interest.
title: Meyer Family Vineyards 2013 Reimer Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Okanagan Valley)

description: Reduced and extracted aromas burn off over time to unveil a full-bodied expression of juicy red fruit and cedar that opens in the glass. It finishes in tea and leather.
title: V. Sattui 2013 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

description: Cherry and plum, chocolate and peppery herbs combine here in a well-structured wine with some years of life ahead. Aged in one-third new French oak for 11 months, it will reward decanting or aeration if you are drinking it in the next year or two.
title: Meyer Family Vineyards 2013 McLean Creek Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Okanagan Valley)

description: From a popular vineyard on the eastern edge of the appellation, this wine offers aromas of cherry, cola, slate, orange rind and cinnamon stick. The palate is light but bursting with herbal character and sizzling acidity. It shows fresh oregano and thyme alongside tart pomegranate fruit in the midpalate. A eucalyptus quality extends into the finish.
title: Carlson 2013 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine is still young, tight and on the crisp acid side. That doesn't mean it won't soften and fill out, although it will probably stay ultrafresh and packed with red-currant flavors for some time. Wait to drink until 2018.
title: Au Pied du Mont Chauve 2013 Le Charmois Premier Cru  (Saint-Aubin)

description: Light, clear and focused, this features crisp, citrusy acidity and tethered layers of rhubarb and cranberry, with subtle hints of forest floor in the background. Light bodied and elegant, it finishes with just a tiny bite of tannin.
title: Conarium 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Sweet-tart raspberry and cranberry aromas are lifted and spry on this fresh, aromatic Pinot Noir. The palate is markedly riper and richer, boasting dark cherry and berry flavors and heady spice tones that linger. Tannins are a bit craggy and bitter but finely grained.
title: Tousey 2013 Pinot Noir (Hudson River Region)

description: Earthy truffle stars around a thick, spicy bulwark of cardamom and dark black cherry and plum in this powerhouse of a Pinot Noir. Full bodied and self-assuredly robust, it's for fans of a larger, denser style of the variety, ready to be enjoyed with friends.
title: MacPhail 2013 Vagon Rouge Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Blades of spearmint and cardamom are prominent on the nose of this wine, followed by a palate rich in pine and black cherry. Lithe with a dense ripeness, the finish is prickly in Asian spice.
title: Reaper 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: This wine is perfumed and fruity while also having a rustic edge. Tannins and acidity cut through the red plum and berry fruits. It does need to age, so drink from 2017.
title: Château de Santenay 2013  Mercurey

description: The texture and structure of this wine may be light but the fruitiness is so appealing. Soft and ripe with red-berry fruit flavors and refreshing acidity, it will develop quickly and be ready to drink from 2017.
title: Maurice Ecard 2013 Les Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Heady with aromas of rose petals, this wine has a thin, light-bodied texture and tastes of black licorice and black cherry. With a surprising ripeness of fruit, it ends without tension or nuance.
title: Sonoma Collection 2013 District 3 Growers Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Juicy and ripe, yet briskly composed, this medium-bodied Pinot Noir boasts flavors of red cherry and strawberry preserves offset by crisp cranberry acidity. It's concentrated on the palate but finishes swiftly with just a feathery hint of tannins.
title: Heron Hill 2013 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: This blends grapes from four separate vineyards, matured in older barrels. It's best enjoyed young, with the freshness that brings to the sharp-edged, brambly berry fruit. A whiff of pine resin and ample herbal accents add further complexity.
title: Meyer Family Vineyards 2013 Pinot Noir (Okanagan Valley)

description: Chorey vineyards, on the plain close to Beaune, often produce good-value wines. This attractive wine is a good example from an uneven vintage. It has structure and fruit, maybe not enough, along with a fresh, tangy character. It is developing fast, so drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Maillard 2013  Chorey-lès-Beaune

description: This fruity, light wine is full of red berries. The tannins are there, playing a supporting role to the intense fruitiness and acidity that's typical of the vintage. This wine will develop quickly, so drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Belland 2013 Charmes  (Santenay)

description: Reserved in aromas at first, this shows charred wood, red cherries, pomegranate and graphite on the nose. Quite intriguing texturally, the palate is sticky with tannins but light in body, offering flavors of cola and tart cranberry.
title: Foley 2013 Rancho Santa Rosa Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: An aroma like red-apple skin and modest red cherry and plum flavors make a good combination in this medium-bodied, subtly styled wine. It tastes dry, nicely crisp, yet smooth in texture.
title: Hirsch 2013 The Bohan-Dillon Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Made at a somewhat approachable price point, this blend of coastal vineyard sites holds back on fruit and texture. It provides a tightly closed and still youthful touch of savory herb and tea, finishing lean.
title: Zepaltas 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Produced from old vines grown on the property, this fruity wine is packed full of red berries. It is well balanced between fruitiness and acidity, with just a light touch of tannin to give this ready-to-drink wine its shape.
title: Château de Santenay 2013 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: Lighter in color, this wine packs fruit punch, cola and ripe cranberry into the nose. Flavors mix juicy strawberries with Earl Grey tea, marjoram and orange rind elements.
title: Irony 2013 Small Lot Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Somewhat muted, this estate-grown wine is most exuberant in pine and dusty cherry. Full bodied and robust on the palate, it retains a grip of tannin from start to finish.
title: Balverne 2013 Estate Grown Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Light, clear and unfiltered, this vineyard-designate has elements of Christmas tree pine, spearmint and forest floor. Crisp on the palate and somewhat austere, it finishes clean and quick.
title: Conarium 2013 Bacigalupi Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Rustic and tightly wound in tannin and oak, this shows reduced qualities and a core of big-boned concentration.It offers more tobacco and tea than acidity and fruit.
title: Armanino Family Cellars 2013 The Whitewing Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A bit of an experiment, this wine employs whole-cluster fermentation and carbonic maceration. It is intensely herbal and funky, with a strong presence of stem inclusion and black licorice. It finishes a tad flat.
title: Marimar Estate 2013 Dona Margarita Vineyard Metodo Antiguo Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Oak-driven power shows on the nose of this wine, with aromas of smoked meat and singed chaparral as well as iron, mocha and wild berries. Rose hips and sour cranberries vie for attention on the palate, where graphite and a slight touch of cedar also come into play.
title: Row Eleven 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine tastes rather light and lean. The aromas are like cherry and apple candy, and the flavors resemble not-quite-ripe red cherries and raspberries. It is dry and medium bodied.
title: Sketchbook 2013 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

description: Tannic and earthy, this is defined principally by flavors of stem and bark, with thin red fruits in the background. It might best accompany a rich, oily fish such as salmon.
title: Tinhorn Creek 2013 Pinot Noir (Okanagan Valley)

description: This smooth, soft wine is light and fruity. It has some tannins although fresh berry fruit and perfumed acidity are what characterize this wine. Immediately attractive, it's a light wine from a light year, and is ready to drink now.
title: Maurice Ecard 2013  Bourgogne

description: With a reduced quality wrapped in big tannin and oak, this wine has a touch of black cherry and cranberry, with crisp acidity. However, it's bogged down by stemmy funk.
title: Heintz 2013 Swan Selection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine is quite light in the glass, with scents of cranberry, graphite, wet dirt and a touch of cinnamon. The palate offers a wide range of red fruit, from cherry to berry, but it's driven by Red Hots candy spice and an orange peel acidity. A very clean wine.
title: Lumen 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: From three distinct vineyard sites, including the up-and-coming DeVoto in the Sebastopol Hills area of the Sonoma Coast/Russian River Valley, this saignée of Pinot Noir was given time in 100% French oak barrels, all of them four years or older. Sprightly and refreshing, the wine is a mélange of watermelon and raspberry, just sweet enough to sip on its own without overreaching.
title: La Pitchoune 2013 Vin Gris of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A new, lower-priced cuvée for DDO, this uses both estate and purchased grapes. Chocolaty, soft and fresh, it is a graceful wine with generous raspberry and cherry fruit. Moderate acidity leads into flavors that are elegant and bright, with a gentle, lingering finish. Let it breathe for at least an hour for best results.
title: Domaine Drouhin Oregon 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine comes from the fourth-generation winemaking family behind Los Angeles' San Antonio Winery, which owns vineyards in Santa Lucia Highlands and Arroyo Seco. It offers aromas of smoked pork loin and wild berries and is peppery on the palate, with tart raspberry fruit and the driving sense of smoke throughout. The tannins are a bit firm right now, so wait until 2016 or so.
title: San Simeon 2013 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Can Paso Robles grow Pinot Noir? This wine suggests yes, at least in the cooler Willow Creek and Templeton Gap zones. This offers aromas of graphite, pomegranate and plums, followed by a palate that blends dark purple fruits with eucalyptus-like herbals. This will be even better with some time in bottle.
title: Jack Creek 2013 Kruse Vineyard Estate Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Watermelon, strawberry and pie-cherry fruit flavors showcase a light and quite pretty rosé. Bone-dry despite the very low alcohol, it's backed with crisp acidity, a dash of minerality, and a finishing whiff of cocoa powder.
title: Cubanisimo Vineyards 2013 Rosado de Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Bright, clean, crisply rendered raspberry fruit—nicely spiced—really shines here. This relatively modestly priced cuvée carries itself with style and elegance, still young, tight and tart, with plenty of medium-term aging potential.
title: Patton Valley 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The fourth-generation family behind San Antonio Winery make this top-end bottling from the vineyard they planted. Aromas of dark red fruit, heavy black spice, tar and smoke hit the nose with promising force, but the palate proves quite tannic with sour and bitter cranberry skins. This has all the elements needed for a classic wine, but give till 2016.
title: Windstream 2013 Sarmento Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Light strawberry fruit is heavily cloaked in flavors of butter and toast from eight months in oak. The wood flavors cover but do not entirely mask the bitter herbal notes, and the tannins seem disjointed and not fully integrated.
title: King Estate 2013 Signature Collection Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Ponzi's every day, go-to Pinot is sourced from vineyards in the Dundee Hills, Yamhill-Carlton and Eola Hills AVAs. In this challenging vintage it's light, grapy and pretty, with pale cherry fruit and hints of barrel toast and coffee. It's not a big wine, nor a wine to age, rather to drink on a warm spring day and enjoy it for its simplicity and elegance.
title: Ponzi 2013 Tavola Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A négociant effort, this was done entirely in stainless steel and neutral oak. Tart and light, it has simple strawberry fruit with a touch of spice. It offers no tricks, just straight-ahead Pinot at a modest price for Oregon.
title: Domaine Loubejac 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: A sleek mix of tart berry, stem and herb, along with a hint of oak and chocolate, this is a fair value in a widely available, drink-now Oregon Pinot. The wine oak-aged for six months, whether in neutral or re-staved is not indicated.
title: Acrobat 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Dried raspberry, leather and spiced cherry aromas are basic. This has a bouncy, light mouthfeel and quick-to-dissipate flavors of dried cherry and earth. A simple finish fades fast, leving a mild raisiny aftertaste.
title: Alfredo Roca 2013 Fincas Pinot Noir (Mendoza)

description: This is remarkably true to the variety for a Pinot Noir in this price range. Cherry fruit carries along an herbal note, and crisp acidity gives it a wiry feel in the mouth. Drink now.
title: Fire Road 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Diffuse and herbal, this has a slightly rustic bent, with overall herbaceousness. It smoothes out through the finish, though generally it just seems thin and under-ripe.
title: Wildewood 2013 Hirschy Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Diffuse and generic, this simple quaffer has easy-drinking flavors of strawberry soda.
title: Kudos 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Light and fruity, this does a quick fade once in the mouth. The thin red fruit finishes with a taste of metal and a dash of white pepper.
title: Wildewood 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Despite its single-vineyard designation, this watery effort could be from anywhere. Thin, dilute, barely ripe strawberry fruit vanishes quickly once in the mouth, and there is little trace of any barrel flavors from aging in 20% new French oak.
title: Wildewood 2013 Guadalupe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Underripe fruit seems more sour than anything. Some bitter, stemmy flavors creep into the finish.
title: Wine by Joe 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Rubbery, baked aromas of raspberry come with a minerally note of children's vitamins. This has a creamy mouthfeel but little stuffing or backing. Flavors of vanilla smother herbal red-berry notes, while the finish is lactic and tastes of residual oak.
title: Familia Schroeder 2013 Alto Limay Joven Pinot Noir (Patagonia)

description: This wine offers red berry fruits, the softest tannins and texture and an earthy, rustic aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2013 Harmonie Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Savory, earthy aromas of mushrooms, black pepper, iron and cranberry arise from this blend of nine vineyards, many of which are usually featured in single-vineyard selections. Umami rules the palate, and it's quite full for a lighter-colored wine, with brown spice, light red fruit flavors and expertly balanced acidity.
title: Calera 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Iron oxide, elderberry, oak and red currant combine intriguingly with glints of smoke that arise. The palate is slender and light, with the sonorous, grounding earthiness so typical for the variety. Lively acidity illuminates the red currant fruit while gossamer tannins provide undeniable but almost weightless structure. Ready to drink.
title: Stift Göttweig 2013 Göttweiger Berg Pinot Noir (Kremstal)

description: Globe-trotting Laely Heron's take on roughly 16-year-old vines in Monterey reveals aromas of Coca Cola, black cherry, ripe plum, sweet beet juice and a bit of tree bark. The palate is powered by anise-spiced cherries and pomegranate, fairly straightforward but quite quaffable.
title: Heron 2013 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: This meaty, fully toasted Pinot is dark in color and smoky smelling. A lively, powerful palate boasts a sense of elegance while offering up spicy, oaky black raspberry and currant flavors. A long, spicy finish stays strong while guarding the wine's honest varietal character.
designation: 20 Barrels Limited Edition El Triángulo Estate
title: Cono Sur 2013 20 Barrels Limited Edition El Triángulo Estate Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Fresh aromas of raspberry and cherry are slightly earthy. This shows purity and balance on the palate, while flavors of strawberry, raspberry and red plum come with chocolaty oak and mild spice. A dry finish tastes of oak-driven chocolate and crushed black pepper.
title: Kingston Family 2013 Alazan Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Aromas of raspberry and red currant come with an herbal twist. In the mouth, this holds its own. Flavors of candied raspberry and red plum transition to sweet and slightly sugary on the finish, which is oaky, cocoa-dusted and a touch hot.
title: Kingston Family 2013 CJ's Barrel Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Warm, earthy, dusty aromas of red plum and smoky oak turn toastier the longer this sits. A fresh but balanced palate offers equal amounts of snappy acidity and creamy weight, while tart plum and spice flavors finish toasty and charred, with crisp acidity generating length.
title: Concha y Toro 2013 Marques de Casa Concha Pinot Noir (Limarí Valley)

description: Dry, lightly oaked and mild on the nose, this Pinot from a cold vintage offers modest but honest plum and raspberry scents in front of a crisp, juicy, fresh palate. Flavors of raspberry and red plum come with dusting of spice on a zesty, light-bodied finish.
title: Kingston Family 2013 Tobiano Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Mild citrus and raspberry aromas are appropriate for this light-colored, light-bodied Pinot. A medium-sized palate is balanced and hints at elegance, while true-to-Leyda flavors of pie cherry and red plum are peppery on the finish, which brings hints of vanilla and wood grain.
title: Leyda 2013 Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Loamy earth, black cherry and tomato aromas mingle on a flat, heavy bouquet. This Pinot has a full, resiny, oaky mouthfeel and flavors of spiced berry, dark plum and oak. A mildly bitter, woody-tasting finish is driven almost exclusively by oak.
title: Viña Casablanca 2013 Nimbus Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Tea, spice, tomato and briny aromas control the bouquet on this medium-bodied, slightly soupy-feeling Pinot. Earth, mushroom, tea, tomato and raspberry flavors finish peppery and spicy.
title: William Cole 2013 Columbine Special Reserve Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Jammy plum and raspberry aromas smell little like typical Pinot Noir. This is snappy and medium in body, with light raspberry and cherry flavors that finish mild.
title: Pueblo del Sol 2013 Pinot Noir (Juanico)

description: This wine has some pleasant layers of black cherry and tea yet is marred by its unresolve between being thin and overly oaked. The earthiness on display is on the funky side of things.
title: Chime 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: The producer has chosen to highlight the Petaluma Gap region within the larger Sonoma Coast appellation on this wine, a nod to its recent purchase of the well-regarded Sun Chase Vineyard as well as an endorsement of the Gap becoming an appellation of its own one day. This Pinot might help matters, a beautifully floral mix of rose petal and violet on the nose followed intricately by juicy, subtle red fruit and buoyant acidity.
title: Guarachi Family 2013 Sun Chase Vineyard Petaluma Gap Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The producer has a long history sourcing from this well-respected vineyard in the heart of the Petaluma Gap.
