The winemaker's deft understanding of the area's promise speaks volumes in this lightly colored, lovingly crafted and beguiling Pinot. Soft and subtle, it teases in dried cherries and cinnamon-clove baking spices.
title: Zepaltas 2013 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Classy and classic French oak and red cherry aromas combine with raspberry flavors, lively acidity and firm, textured tannins to make a complete, well-balanced wine. This is a bit more austere than many of its peers, but the taut balance and appetizing texture make it more compelling.
title: Block Nine 2013 Caiden's Vineyards Pinot Noir (California)

description: A kirsch-like liqueur comes to the fore on the palate, before dried rose and herb demand attention of their own. From dry-farmed fruit, this Pinot is light in oak presence and weight, finishing pretty and refined.
title: Zepaltas 2013 Nunes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Aromatic and elegant, generous and supple, this tastes rich while feeling polished and complete. An enticing, light aroma of oaky spice and raspberry mixes with tasty red cherry and black currant flavors on the palate. It is medium bodied, smooth in texture, and has a mild finish.
title: Line 39 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: The winemaker puts a light touch on the oak here, ratcheting it down to 30% new, all French, preserving a freshness of cherry, cranberry and earthy herb. A blend of three vineyard sites, including the single-vineyard designate, Nunes, the wine is well-integrated and balanced, offering an intriguing tartness on the finish.
title: Zepaltas 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A pale copper color, this appealing, 100% Pinot Noir rosé offers notes of wet stone, herbs, smoke and red fruit. It's medium bodied with mouthwatering acids and lightly smoky flavors that linger.
title: Analemma 2013 Atavus Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: Subtle notes of violet and bramble wood, along with a touch of granite minerality, add complexity to this elegant wine. It's silky and round on the palate, and concentrated in red cherry flavor, finishing with a zesty cranberry streak.
title: Hosmer 2013 Pinot Noir (Cayuga Lake)

description: It's a treat to try something as unusual and good as this. Essentially a non-sparkling blanc de noir, this has a very light coral color and aromas of golden cherries and white raspberries. Flavors turn more melony and meaty, supported by a rich texture. It's dry and medium bodied.
title: Angel Camp 2013 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This dark and savory nose blends dried cranberry, orange peels, woody mushrooms and rose-petal potpourri. Flavors are strongly sanguine at first, starting with iron before morphing into dark chocolate. The finish comes on quite bitter and tart, without much overt ripeness.
title: Roblar 2013 Gold Collection Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Light, leafy, earthy aromas of plum and tomato accurately announce a lively, fresh palate with spicy, peppery flavors of earth, red plum and cranberry. Juicy acidity, dry but ripe red fruit and earthy complexity make for a strong finish.
title: Verum 2013 Pinot Noir (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

description: Coffee spice and cran-raspberry juice aromas greet the nose. This is rich on the palate at first, but a decent bitterness and acidity grace the edges, proving both full and bright, though a tad hot.
title: Roblar 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A smoky, oaky aroma leads to meaty flavors with notes of rhubarb and red cherries. The texture is on the soft side and the body is medium. On the finish those oaky notes meld with the fruit for a soft finale. The grapes for this vintage come 84% from Paso Robles.
title: Jamieson Ranch 2013 Light Horse Pinot Noir (California)

description: While forward, plump red-cherry and strawberry notes are buoyant, a deep vein of granite and minerals adds gravitas and complexity to this elegant wine. Fresh cranberry acidity drives a swift finish.
title: Silver Thread 2013 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: Floral berry, earth and tea aromas are friendly. This Pinot is fresh and perky in feel, with red-fruit and tomato-like acidity pushing flavors of dry cherry, mixed spices, herbs and tomato. This finishes spunky, with crisp acidity and peppery overtones.
title: Trapiche 2013 Broquel Pinot Noir (Mendoza)

description: Aromas of spiced strawberry pie and wet slate emerge on this wine from a brand that seeks to offer quality at affordable prices. The palate shows medium-intense cranberry fruit, with a hint of anise spice. It's fairly straightforward and ideal for nightly sipping.
title: Austerity 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Light ruby in color, this offers fresh raspberry and red cherry aromas, slightly softer flavors of ripe plum and a smooth texture. It is medium bodied and easy to enjoy.
title: Backhouse 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: The color is deeper and darker than average. Aromas are like superripe plums, while flavors resemble sweet plums and blackberries. It's a generous and smooth wine that's not deep in flavor, but pleasant and easy to enjoy.
title: Barnett 2013 Savoy Vineyards Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Dark in color, with rooty, leafy aromas of berry fruits that turn flatter with airing, this warm-style Pinot Noir feels wide and grabby, with some flab on its hips. Black plum and toasty flavors simmer on an dull, weighty finish.
title: Luigi Bosca 2013 Pinot Noir (Mendoza)

description: This wine's nose is all about earth and minerality, showing iron, rust, mushrooms and eucalyptus, but in a rather pungent way. The flavors are sanguine, nearly metallic, with Indian spices and cranberry fruit combining for a sip that is lean in body but grippy with tannins.
title: Summerland 2013 Vintner's Select Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: There are dank aromas of tree roots and earth on the nose of this wine, which also leans toward sour fruits. Flavors are clean and easy with spicy berry juice and plum skin tannins, showing good grip.
title: Ventana 2013 Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: This has a traditional garnet color with a light rim. It smells a bit earthy and herbal and tastes rather lean, like rhubarb and sour-cherry candy. It's light to medium bodied, a bit quirky but enjoyable.
title: Cycles Gladiator 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Pie cherries that carry a good snap of puckery tartness are the principal fruit flavor . The wine is already rounded off, fruity and buoyant, with generous acidity and a tasty sprinkle of baking spices. The persistence and detail are impressive.
title: Sineann 2013 Wy'east Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: From a block planted in 1979, this clonal selection has sharp edges, bright cranberry fruit, black pepper and chocolate highlights. The old vines seem to add length and texture, with finishing touches of mineral and breakfast tea.
title: Hyland 2013 Wadenswil Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This wine hails from the southern end of the Santa Cruz Mountains, offering sweetly dank forest floor-like aromas of root beer and mint chocolate chip against broad pomegranate fruit. The flavors are sanguine at first with a strong sense of iron, followed by cola and dark raspberries that provide both decent tannins and a palate-washing tartness.
title: Birichino 2013 Saint Georges Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: This wine overdelivers in terms of flavor and overall quality versus price. It offers vibrant Bing cherry aromas around a coy, lightweight and restrained sense of self, with a supple body and bright acidity. Sourced from several vineyards, oaky tones provide subtle structure without masking the fruit.
title: Schug 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This California appellation Pinot is a debut from Imagery. A natural at the dinner table, this shows a firm structure of fine tannins, bright acidity and ripe black cherry and tea flavors that round out the structure. Good concentration meets a medium body as it gets more complex with each sip.
title: Imagery 2016 Pinot Noir (California)

description: The tannins are strong and firm in this wine. Its dense texture and concentration are balanced by crisp red-currant fruit. There is freshness as well from the acidity, giving a crisp aftertaste to this fruity wine. Drink from 2024.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2016  Vosne-Romanée

description: This perfumed wine, solid and structured, is firm with dark tannins and layers of cherry fruit underneath. It has some concentration as well as the crispness of the vintage, giving an attractive wine that will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Henri Magnien 2016 Champerrier  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Prominent in its wood aging, this tannic wine also shows plenty of juicy red-currant and red-berry fruits. It is spicy and toasty at the moment. Give it time, and drink from 2026.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2016 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Though the name and label suggest a French take on Oregon Pinot Noir, this wine's flavors have more in common with inexpensive California versions. Its jammy, forward and ripe strawberry fruit is hard to resist at this price. Drink it up while it remains young and fresh.
title: Domaine Loubejac 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This young wine offers bright cherry flavors as well as the structure of a proper Gevrey, giving a good combination of fruitiness and tannins. It's juicy, crisp and is likely to age relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2016  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: There's a balsamic fig sauce touch to the nose of this clonal study, along with earthy soil, wild mint, iron and cherry. The flavors are very earthy and somewhat rustic as well, with touches of olive, sandalwood and dark red fruits.
title: La Montagne 2013 Clone 4A Kessler-Haak Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This juicy wine is replete with red-berry and crisper red-currant flavors. Along with its bright character, the tannins and dry structure promise aging potential. Drink from 2021.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A very pleasant example of this red grape made as a white wine, this is lightly fruity, with apple, green berry and lime flavors. Balanced and medium bodied, it should be enjoyed over the next two years.
title: Oak Knoll 2016 Reserve White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This perfumed wine is fruity and crisp, offering red-berry flavors bright with acidity. Tannins are light in this charming wine with a spice and fresh fruit character. Drink from 2020.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2016 Les Fremières  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Tight tannins proclaim the youth of this wine. With those firm tannins and a dry, solid character, the wine is not yet showing its fruit. Just a hint from the weight of the wine suggests red-cherry flavors will develop. Drink from 2023.
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2016 Closerie des Alisiers Vieilles Vignes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This wine is juicy and crisp, with bright red-currant and cherry fruitiness. The fruit dominates, with plenty of acidity and a core of tannins to support it. It should be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2016  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: Fresh black cherry and plum are ripe and forward in this easy drinking Pinot Noir. It's a soft, sunny wine, with delicate acidity and plush tannins but refreshingly fruity. Drink now.
title: Schmitt Söhne 2016 Relax Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)

description: Light although sweet red-cherry-syrup aromas meet with iron and crushed sage on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The sip is simple yet tangy with tart red fruit, proving very easy to enjoy.
title: Castle Rock 2016 Kristy Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: This crisp, fruity wine is lively, with considerable acidity as well as red berry fruits. The tannins are still young, forming a solid core that will soften. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Antonin Guyon 2016 La Justice  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Plummy flavors and a broad, soft texture make this wine taste ripe and plush. It blends lightly smoky and oaky nuances with butter and jam that accentuate an almost sweet character.
title: Beringer 2016 Founders' Estate Pinot Noir (California)

description: This single-vineyard wine is already mature with juicy red fruits now evolving into secondary flavors. An earthy character gives the wine density and weight. The aftertaste has acidity and softness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Maillard 2013 La Chanière  (Pommard)

description: This is a fruit bomb of a rosé, packed with rhubarb, strawberry and cherry flavors. Though made in stainless steel tanks, it has a whiff of white chocolate also. It finishes dry, though rounded off with enough sweetness to smooth out the acids.
title: Oak Knoll 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Tight and crisp, this wine has red-currant fruits and plenty of acidity. It is crunchy, structured and very fresh. It will take time to soften and open up, so drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Belleville 2016 Creux Brouillard  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: From a challenging vintage, this wine is quite light, with barely ripe strawberry fruit. It spent 18 months in French oak, and the barrel character dominates. It tastes mostly of mocha and caramel and should be consumed over the next year.
title: Carlton Cellars 2013 Roads End Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This wine is crisp and perhaps too full of acidity, giving it a red-currant character that is juicy and tightly fruity. It needs to soften over the next few years. Try again from 2020.
title: Domaine Belleville 2016 Les Drazeys  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: A heavy obvious oak component meets good ripe fruit flavors in this full-bodied mouth-filling wine. The aromas are charred and smoky, leading to almost jammy blackberry flavors.
title: Lucky Rock Wine Co. 2016 County Cuvée Pinot Noir (San Benito County-Sonoma County-Monterey County)

description: This smooth wine has a soft texture, candylike fruit flavors and an earthy element that stretches from the first whiff to the lingering finish.
title: Grayson 2016 Lot 5 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Tart berry flavors bordering on sour show in this wine, with unripe cherry notes mixed in. Aged a year in neutral barrels, it offers a faint suggestion of mocha as it fades.
title: Redgate 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Subtle aromas of baked earth and pomegranate are very shy on the nose of this bottling. A slightly tart red-currant flavors pops on the sip, along with a touch of cinnamon.
title: Sean Minor 2016 Four Bears Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Rough and grainy, this is a tannic, earthy wine with a bit of rustic charm. It's not typical of the grape variety but could stand up to a burger and fries. Drink soon.
title: Oak Knoll 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine's stewy, medicinal plum aromas are chunky. In the mouth, it's plump and bouncy, lacking spine. It concludes with tea and stewed berry flavors on a drawing, hefty finish.
title: Domaine Bousquet 2016 Reserve Made With Organic Grapes Pinot Noir (Tupungato)

description: This strawberry-flavored wine offers attractive light fruits and acidity. Forward and fruity, it's a simple Pinot Noir with an easygoing character. Drink from late 2018.
title: Quentin Jeannot 2016  Bourgogne

description: Still tight, this offers pomegranate and not quite ripe raspberry fruit. It's a thin, acidic wine, which may have been overcropped or picked too early. It might have made a nice rosé.
title: Carlton Cellars 2013 Estate Pinot Noir

description: This wine is lean, with acidity and red-currant fruits dominant. It has a tight texture, bright red cherry flavors and a core of firm tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Henri de Villamont 2016  Fixin

description: Light bodied and just ripe, this is a delightfully crisp, refreshing expression of the variety. Stainless steel fermentation preserves its core of candied orange and strawberry flavor.
title: Kenwood 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This bright, light and acid-driven wine is juicy and fresh—a full embrace of tart lemon and tangerine flavors. Its liveliness is long-lived and welcome.
title: Ousterhout 2016 Woods Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There's a lot going on in this wine, and all good things. The nose starts with notes of raw meat, bright red fruit, orange peel, baking spice and tar. The first sip reveals a burst of mouthwatering acidity and juicy fruit followed by more intriguing orange rind. It finishes on the savory side. The tannins are grippy but well integrated and while it falls a little flat on the midpalate, overall this is an interesting example of what Central Otago does best.
title: Nanny Goat 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Rose petals and violet perfume this fragrant, voluptuously textured Spätburgunder. It's ripe and approachable but structured by fine, firm tannins and sprightly acidity. Luscious streaks of blackberry and cherry nectar linger on the finish.
title: Carl Ehrhard 2013 Rüdesheim Berg Roseneck Spätburgunder Trocken Pinot Noir (Rheingau)

description: This rosé is built upon the 777 Pinot Noir clone, grown on the eastern edge of the Willamette Valley in an area known locally as Pete's Mountain. Winemaker Chris Dowsett intends this to be ageable—meaning a drinking window measured in a few years, not decades. A pale orange-copper, it's supple and detailed, with peppery spices around fruit flavors of guava and strawberry. Drink now through 2020.
title: Dowsett Family 2016 Becklin Vineyards Georgia Rose Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This wine needs a few minutes in the glass to reveal its true colors, but when it does, it is a pretty—if broody—Pinot Noir, with notes of chocolate, cherry, and baking spice. The tannins certainly aren't shy but they're well married to lifted fruit. Give this time to come out of its shell. Drink now with a good decant or cellar through 2022.
title: Craggy Range 2016 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: This cool site in the Elkton AVA offers a lighter take on Pinot Noir. Tart strawberry fruit is accented with a dusting of cocoa powder from aging 18 months in 30% new French oak. There's a touch of lemon oil also, and the wine is smooth and balanced throughout.
title: Brandborg 2013 Ferris Wheel Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)

description: Tangy in nature, this wine has heaps of ripe red fruit, cola, Moroccan spices and orange peel, with licorice root and tart cranberry woven into an elegant palate. There's power and ageability to this Marlborough Pinot, but it's also begging to be enjoyed with a tagine. Drink now–2024.
title: Tohu 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Bachelder is a Canadian winery but this wine was grown, produced, bottled and aged in Oregon. It's full bodied, with an earthy, slightly smoky character. Suggestions of root beer and black cherry cola thread into a tannic finish, with plenty of grip.
title: Bachelder 2013 Oregon Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Though not a blush wine, this has a hint of a tawny color, and a whiff of alcohol reflecting the riper, warmer vintage. The fruit flavors range from Key lime to orangeade.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2016 White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This small-production, nouveau-style wine was made without oak or filtering. Simple and juicy, it's festive, with effusive dried cranberry and cola spice notes that are soft and easygoing.
title: Spicy Vines 2016 Nouveau Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A white wine made from a red grape, this barely hints at a tawny straw shade. The fruit tastes principally of golden apple and white peach, and it has a pleasing roundness in the mouth, with a light touch of saltine cracker.
title: Amity 2016 White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Meaty and substantial on the palate, this wine comes from several vineyard sites and was fermented in stainless steel tanks. It has a juicy note of sweet, ripe red fruit that's inviting.
title: Friedeman 2016 Dichotomy Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: NEXT is a new label for King Vintners, a new division of King Estate. This blends grapes from southern Oregon and the Willamette Valley, putting a pleasing toasty character around the light red fruit. A streak of burnt coffee suggests that the barrel influence is still being integrated.
title: King Vintners 2016 NEXT Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This small-production wine is lightly spiced, robust and herbal. Dense and powerful wild strawberry and earth notes give it a sense of place.
title: Beresini Vineyards 2013 Black Dog Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Ripe berries and oak spice dominate on this Pinot Noir from the bottom of New Zealand's North Island. The palate follows with balanced acidity and silky tannins but the oaky characters dominate all the way through, finishing on the bitter side.
title: Urlar 2013 Pinot Noir (Wairarapa)

description: Made by the saignée process, where the juice is bled from the principal ferment to concentrate the Pinot Noir, this rosé is blocky and simple. Light flavors of strawberry and cherry are finished dry and fade quickly. Drink this well chilled before the next vintage appears.
title: Winter's Hill 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The fruit is light and a touch sour, with suggestions of watermelon and berry. It fades into a short finish with a citrusy frame.
title: Lachini 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This shows solid secondary fruity flavors of strawberry compôte and a thin slice of cherry pie. It offers a whiff of leather and some drying tannins, with a finish of black tea. Drink this up soon.
title: Freja 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Vanillan oak notes dominate on this Pinot Noir, originating from Nelson, on the northwest of New Zealand's South Island. Red berry, licorice, and savory olive characters follow, along with chunky tannins and lashings of acidity. Stylistically this is a broody, oaky, powerful expression of Pinot and one that will need food or a few years in bottle for the oak to mellow out. Drink now–2022.
title: Neudorf 2013 Tom's Block Pinot Noir (Nelson)

description: Very light in the glass, this bottling is fruit punch-like, with prominent pomegranate, cranberry and raspberry notes, alongside cola aromas. The palate is reminiscent of cran-raspberry soda: simple, light and easy, with a touch of licorice to spice it up.
title: Toad Hollow 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: A full array of chaparral aromas arise prominently on this bottling, with thyme and sagebrush spicing up the smoke, earth, crushed slate and dark-cherry scents. The palate zings with snappy black-raspberry fruit, a great counterpoint to the savory shrubbiness that reflects the nose, with more wild herbs and eucalyptus notes. Quite a full experience.
title: Flying Goat Cellars 2013 Rio Vista Vineyard Dijon Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This bottling of the 667 and Pommard clones starts with a stewed-cherry note before the sagebrush, forest floor and moss aromas start to dominate. There's an exotic sesame touch to the sip, where cherry and berry flavors are lifted by savory hints of salt, pepper and nori wrap. Really unique and delicious, it leaves the mouth watering and invigorated.
title: Mercy 2013 Cedar Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: This is a beautifully made, elegant wine that combines classic aromas of toasted bread, ripe apples and almonds with mouthfilling flavors of vanilla, lemon and cream while maintaining great balance from fresh acidity. A lingering finish echoes the spices and toast.
designation: Blanc de Noirs Méthode Traditionnelle Brut
title: Schramsberg 2013 Blanc de Noirs Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Pinot Noir (North Coast)

description: Concentrated aromas of cola, Earl Grey tea, black pepper and mulberry jam make for a very spicy potpourri-like nose on this bottling by Norm Yost. Savory flavors of dried strawberry, salt and pepper, dried fig and a touch of leather show on the sip, which is just starting to show some of its age.
title: Flying Goat Cellars 2013 Dierberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Rusty red cherry aromas meet with eucalyptus, sweet bay leaf and lightly toasted pine wood on the nose of this bottling from a coveted vineyard on the western edge of the appellation. It's light and energetic on the palate, with high-toned red-fruit flavors, rustic smoke and a prominent chaparral spice.
title: Flying Goat Cellars 2013 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A bit of bottle age always makes for a more compelling Pinot Noir, in this case showing kirsch, clove, leather and turned earth on the nose. There is a richness to the palate, full of black cherry and fig flavors, as well as an earthy undercurrent of thyme, anise and eucalyptus that rises toward the finish.
title: Flying Goat Cellars 2013 Rio Vista Vineyard Clone 2A Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Baked strawberries and red cherries pair deliciously with shaved nutmeg, vanilla and black tea leaves on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong black plum tang to the sip, which is decorated lavishly with thyme, bay leaf, rust and gravel—a very elegant expression overall.
title: Black Ridge 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: There's a strong menthol, juniper and pine needle kick to the nose of this bottling, alongside intriguing green tea and tart plum-skin aromas. Eucalyptus oil leads the lively herbal kick of the palate, giving intense depth to the hearty black-plum and tobacco flavors, all framed by a fresh acidity.
title: Flying Goat Cellars 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Cooked cherry meets with nutmeg, allspice, white pepper and a strong sandalwood scent on the nose of this red from the south side of the appellation. The woody cedar-driven spice notes show strong on the sip, giving depth to the mulberry and rainbow-peppercorn flavors.
title: Flying Goat Cellars 2013 Rancho Santa Rosa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A bitter green element to this otherwise medium-sized wine detracts from any of its fruit.
title: Taft Street 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is sourced from 1970s-era vines. It's an almost ethereal weave of berry, saffron, mint, cola and tea, all wreathed in light smoke. It shows lovely complexity for such a young wine, and it's got the balance and structure to age nicely. Drink now through 2025.
title: Hyland 2013 Founders' Selection Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Ripe cherries, concentrated strawberries, cherry blossoms and a bit of chipped black slate power an appealing nose on this wine by Debbie and Greg Hammill. The palate shows highly perfumed blackberries and cherries, proving quite ripe but expertly layered with clove-like spices and dried purple flowers.
title: Sant Wines 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Though the 2013 vintage has generally been deemed a challenging one, this astonishing bottling proves that great wine can be made somewhere in almost any year. This warm and fruity, perfectly structured single-vineyard effort opens with a smooth and supple palate offering strawberry and cherry fruit, defining acidity and superb length. Give it a few hours to breathe and it shows depth, finesse and the ability to age and improve through 2025 and beyond.
title: Elk Cove 2013 Clay Court Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This is the vineyard that surrounds the winery on Ribbon Ridge, and it seems always to produce the wines with the greatest concentration and density. The black cherry fruit, with aromatic accents of rose petals and highlights of oregano, digs deep into the midpalate, creating an impression of a bulky, tight, compact wine with miles yet to go. Cellar it for drinking from 2020 through 2030.
title: Trisaetum 2013 Ribbon Ridge Estate Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Wichmann is the smallest of the estate vineyards and holds the oldest vines. That old-vine intensity rings true here, in a low-alcohol wine with splendid aromatics. Musk, chocolate, almond candy and caramel swirls around black raspberry and black cherry fruit. The depth of flavor is striking.
title: Trisaetum 2013 Wichmann Dundee Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Spice and black plums are touched with hints of purple flowers and beet root in this ripe, supple Pinot Noir. Richness is offset by bright acidity and a fine, but firm, frame of tannins. It's an elegant wine with evenhanded grace.
title: Meyer-Näkel 2013 Blauschiefer Spätburgunder (Ahr)

description: Light garnet in color with a tawny rim, this offers earthy, wet stone aromas and then gushing fruit flavors like raspberry and wild blackberry that ride on a wave of lively acidity, making for a fascinating taste adventure. This nails the acid-tannin-alcohol balance in a way that's compelling and delicious.
title: Foursight 2013 Paraboll Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This winery northeast of San Diego sources from up north and experiments heavily with stem inclusion on this bottling, which shows cherry blossoms, crushed cranberries and an earthy line of anise through the nose. Plush purple fruit flavors of olallieberry and boysenberry power the medium-bodied palate, with sage and peppercorn spice throughout.
title: Orfila 2013 Stem Head Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Brewer Cris Carter, who works at Golden Road Brewery in Los Angeles, also makes stunning wines, in this case from John Sebastian Vineyard, showing a lush cherry-vanilla nose that's tightened with iron, iodine and earth. It's soft on the palate, with violet and rose petal florals and plum-skin tartness in the midpalate.
title: Weatherborne 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: From a small dry-farmed vineyard comes this rich and layered wine that shows black olives, ripe cranberries, buttered cherries and red rose petals on the complicated nose. Very savory fruits emerge once sipped, with smoked black plums, mission figs, red cherries and raspberries alongside balsamic vinegar, licorice candy and a Tootsie Roll chocolate element.
title: Boekenoogen 2013 Garret's Vineyard Dryland Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: One of the more fairly priced blends from the appellation on the market, this mix of Bentrock, Radian, Rancho La Vina and Huber vineyards shows black cardamom, chai spice, lemon oil, eucalyptus and concentrated, aromatic black raspberries on the nose. Once sipped, flavors of sour cherry meet with juniper and pine herbals.
title: Pali 2013 Summit Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Refined, detailed and expressive, this mixes red and black berries, cherries and plums, adorning the generous fruit with herbal highlights. Truffle, coffee and clean earth bring more complexity, and the wine has the depth and balance to develop nicely over the next 15 years. Drink now through 2030.
title: Lange 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a barrel selection combining the best lots from all three estate vineyards. Refined, pungent, spicy and persistent, it opens with bright raspberry and cherry fruit, then lays on layers of anise, coconut, vanilla, caramel and a whiff of cannabis herb. It's long and concentrated, with good aging potential.
title: Trisaetum 2013 Estates Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There are judicious hints of turned forest floor and barnyard funk on the nose of this wine from just east of the Sta. Rita Hills, with a licorice and wild berry fruit backbone. A lemon brightness highlights the palate, along with tobacco, black olives and a pronounced bitterness. The strong acidity will drive an evolution, so drink 2018–2030.
title: Pence Ranch 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: The most affordable of Harper Voit's 2013 lineup, this deeply aromatic wine offers up a lush mix of rose petals and other perfumed floral scents, along with hints of rhubarb and cherry. Elegant on the palate, it's a poised and balanced wine that brings to mind the old line about Ginger Rogers doing everything Fred Astaire did, only backwards and in high heels. Here the dance includes ripe strawberries, cherries, flowers and a long, graceful encore.
title: Harper Voit 2013 Strandline Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This clonal study by Clarissa Nagy shows lots of brown spice, pomegranate fruit and wet slate on the nose, which is shy at first until a deeper sniff reveals juiciness. The palate offers an herbal medley of oregano, thyme and marjoram, spicing up the cranberry fruit, graphite and cocoa shavings.
title: Riverbench 2013 Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Aromatic and stylish, this brings the alcohol down a point from the riper 2012 bottling, but rewards the patient sipper with finely rendered raspberry and cherry fruit and hints of orange peel. The supporting acidity brings freshness and length, while promising a substantial life ahead. Drink now through 2022.
title: Trathen Hall 2013 Antiquum Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Swathes of violet and lavender scent this pretty Spätburgunder, or German Pinot Noir, highlighting a rich, sultry black cherry palate. Tart cranberry tones brighten the midpalate. Subtle tones of oak and spice, with a flurry of soft tannins accompany a moderately long finish.
title: Meyer-Näkel 2013 Spätburgunder (Ahr)

description: Bay Area biotech scientist-turned-vintner Kristie Tacey offers a solid wine with sandalwood, pomegranate and a slight bitterness on the nose. The palate also shows pomegranate along with rhubarb, backed up by graphite minerality and brown spice throughout.
title: Tessier Winery 2013 Saveria Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: The winery's largest vineyard, Mount Richmond encompasses 105 acres, and yet just 752 cases of the vineyard-designated version were produced in this vintage. The demanding selection process worked wonders. This is a smoky and seductive wine with aromas of incense and Asian spice. Bright, ripe cherry fruit is highlighted with a dash of dark chocolate. Subtle and elegant, this is an all-star effort from a challenging vintage.
title: Elk Cove 2013 Mount Richmond Pinot Noir

description: A showcase for the dusty, wild berry aromatics of this AVA, this wine delivers a firm, concentrated core of cranberry and raspberry fruit tones. Highlights of cannabis and tobacco come through also, not atypical for some Oregon vineyards, and the depth and length are impressive. Drink now through 2030.
title: Harper Voit 2013 Bieze Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Black sage, wispy black cherry, dried violets, star anise and a woody character combine for a wondrous nose on this wine by regional pioneer Dan Lee. It's rich on the palate, with clove and nutmeg adding complexity to the plum, dried cherry and fennel bulb flavors.
title: Morgan 2013 Garys Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Ripe pomegranate seeds, red cherry juice, chai tea, a touch of iron and a stemmy crushed herb element powers the nose on this bottling from a special part of the estate vineyard. The flavors are sanguine at first, then open up onto red fruits, but are all held together by crushed marjoram and thyme.
title: Riverbench 2013 One Palm Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: One of the better deals for top-quality Pinot, Steve Dooley's entry-level bottling invites the nose with deep and dark black cherry, grape soda and even blueberry aromas, leveled by a hint of ethereal roasted game and dried sage. The purple note holds into the palate, which shows lavender and other potpourri elements.
title: Stephen Ross 2013 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: The nose on this single-vineyard bottling from the top of the appellation above Corralitos entertains the nose with a spicy fruit-punch aroma, lifted by crushed cloves and a bit of juniper. It is both voluptuous and racy on the palate, with lots of rhubarb and pomegranate ripeness, yet pencil shavings and chai tea spice throughout.
title: Sante Arcangeli 2013 Split Rail Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Juicy strawberries and plum are cut with allspice and star anise on the sharply spiced nose of this wine from one of the Golden State's legendary producers. The palate shows the juice of darker berries, from blackberries to black cherries, with an Earl Grey tea bitterness and dried sage complexity.
title: Williams Selyem 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: This barrel selection is sourced from vines planted in 2002. It's young, fresh and delicate, showing a mix of rose water, cranberry and cherry fruit. The purity and depth are striking, and the balance is also just right. There's defining acidity and a finishing tang of orange peel.
title: Hyland 2013 Dijon 115 Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Winemaker: Andries Burger. This Elgin Pinot offers a surprisingly robust character, with assertive notes of juicy red cherry and raspberry that are complemented by seductive accents of sweet spice, Dr. Pepper, sous bois, game and fresh caramel. The silky texture offers soft yet subtly structured tannins and medium acidity, while the finish is laden with pleasant hints of whole clove, star anise and allspice. Drink now–2021.
title: Paul Cluver 2013 Cape Winemakers Guild Auction Selection Pinot Noir (Elgin)

description: This is an outstanding value, offering rich and complex varietal character. Raspberry and cherry fruit comes with a vein of licorice, and the texture and depth emulate Willamette Valley Pinots selling for twice the cost.
title: Lange 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This ripe, structured wine is full of cherry flavors and crisp acidity. Spice and dark chocolate notes make an appearance, but the wine is mainly about perfumed fruit.
title: Maison de la Villette 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Tannins predominate over fruit in this closed and tight wine. It should soften a little with time, so look for its red cherry fruit from the end of 2017.
title: Vinadeis 2016 Le Val Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Stalky aromas of tomato leaf are light on fruit but generous on the oak. A creamy mouthfeel with soft acidity struggles to support flavors of stewed plum and brown sugar. Residual oak and related caramel flavors carry the finish.
title: Verum 2016 Pinot Noir (Alto Valle del Río Negro)

description: Tea, tomato, baking spice and briny red-plum aromas lead to a creamy, almost candied palate. Flavors of plum and dried cherry carry plenty of oak plus pepper and spice notes. Finishing flavors of cocoa, nutmeg and clove are derivative of barrel aging.
title: Altocedro 2016 Año Cero Pinot Noir (La Consulta)

description: Lightweight and lacking in texture, this wine offers fading red-cherry fruit, cola notes and leafy greens. Drink up.
title: Allan Scott 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This tart, silky wine brings together hints of vanilla and cedar with pie cherries and beets. Light in body, it finishes with crisp acids.
title: Stoneburn 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Dilute yet raisiny aromas struggle to stir interest. This wine feels wide and flat on the palate, with no real focal point. Chunky, slightly bitter flavors of apple skins and wood spice finish with a blast of oaky clove.
title: Alfredo Roca 2016 Fincas Pinot Noir (Mendoza)

description: While this is soft and fruity, it lacks all varietal resemblance. Drink it as a ripe red rather than as a Pinot Noir.
title: Bougrier 2016 Alain de la Treille Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Dusty, jumbled aromas of prune, raisin, sugar beet and leather are disparate. Chunky and flabby in feel, this tastes of oak, tomato and stewed berries. A flat finish fails to bring it around.
title: Bodega Chacra 2016 Barda Pinot Noir (Patagonia)

description: This is a thin, fruity, simple wine with some red cherry flavors. Acidity and a touch of tannin completes the picture.
title: Gabriel Meffre 2016 La Châsse Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Spicy with strong toasty flavors, this is a wood-dominated wine. Fleeting glimpses of fruit show behind its barricade of oak-derived flavors. It might soften, but the balance is wrong.
title: Villebois 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: An abundance of chaparral spice adds intrigue to the nose of this bottling by veteran Ken Brown. Dried sage and a eucalyptus-like menthol character decorate the red currant and raspberry core. Pine needles play prominently on the palate, giving depth to the cranberry, pomegranate and white-pepper flavors. It offers tons of flair, but also elegance.
title: Ken Brown 2013 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Beautiful aromas of ripe red cherry and cherry blossoms mix with rose-laced potpourri, dust, cola and vanilla on the nose of this best-barrel bottling by Jim Clendenen, named after his daughter. Bright and zesty acidity grabs the palate's immediate attention, making the mouth water as flavors of tart cherry, rust, marinated olive and fig come forth, finishing in a very earthy way.
title: Au Bon Climat 2013 Isabelle Pinot Noir (California)

description: Promising aromatics include lifted scents of ripe redcurrant, blood-orange peel and a wild streak of elderberry. These fruit notions carry through on the slinky and smooth palate. Elderberry notes are joined by something more resonant and earthy, reminiscent of truffle and autumn. The structure has light feet but is sure-footed, and the purity of the fruit indicates that it will continue developing. It's a subtle, convincing wine.
title: Heinrich Hartl 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this stunning sparkler from Piedmont opens with delicate aromas of wild berry, bread crust and a whiff of cake spice. The vibrant palate is loaded with finesse, doling out red cherry, strawberry, vanilla and cinnamon. Tangy acidity brightens the creamy flavors.
title: Cocchi 2013 Rösa Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)

description: Fresh cranberries and mulberries meet with crushed thyme, peppercorn and chaparral on the elegant and subtle nose of this bottling, from a vineyard on the southwestern edge of the appellation. The palate is dry and redolent of wild mint, sage and bay leaf, spiced by black and white pepper, which all lead into the black plum-flavored finish.
title: Ken Brown 2013 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: An earthy, oakleaf note signals a true expression of Pinot Noir. There is something sleek, fluid and authentic about this. The wine accents cherry and forest berry as much as the autumnal notions of spice, fallen leaves and earth. It's elegant and honest, with a firm yet relenting structure and lasting flavors.
title: Heinrich Hartl 2013 Graf Weingartl Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: Winemaker: Gordon Newton Johnson. This is such a pretty and elegant Pinot, certainly not what most would expect from a "New World" wine region. It expresses the masterful balance that South African Pinot can achieve in the New World style of ripe red-fruit character with the Old World finesse of bright acidity and an earthy, forest-floor dominance. Pressed floral tones are partnered with notes of red cherry, cola spice and sous bois throughout. Silky and smooth, it offers soft, fine tannins that somehow still manage to provide a present structure for overall balance and harmony. Drink now–2023.
title: Newton Johnson 2016 Cape Winemakers Guild Windansea Pinot Noir (Upper Hemel en Aarde Valley)

description: Rusty-red in color, this bottling by Jim Clendenen comes from the vineyard where his winery has sat for decades. Energetic and well balanced, it shows red-cherry juice, rose hips, garrigue and baked ginger spice on the complex nose. Refreshingly light in body, it's packed with flavors of bay leaf and thyme that decorate the light cranberry fruit. .
designation: Bien Nacido Vineyard Santa Barbara Historic Vineyards Collection
title: Au Bon Climat 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Santa Barbara Historic Vineyards Collection Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: The fruit for this lovely wine hails from Sangiacomo Vineyard in Carneros. It offers a wealth of tangy, thirst-quenching lemon, blood orange and strawberry, so good and dry. Floral on the nose, it stands up on the palate in medium-bodied strength, finishing dry.
title: Cosa Obra 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Very light in color and very crisp, clean and light in taste, this wine also delivers vivid raspberry flavors and great acidity. It stands out from the crowd for its elegance, balance and taut texture, while also delivering a mouthwatering finish.
title: Long Meadow Ranch 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This may be the best bottling yet by actress Drew Barrymore and her team. The pale-pink wine offers light pink lemonade, plum, cherry and bubblegum aromas. The palate combines lime juice, pluot flesh and mandarin zest, set against a chalky backbone and laced with bright acidity.
title: Barrymore by Carmel Road 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: Light and ethereal on the nose, this wine develops body and complexity on the palate, a mix of flavors defined by rose petal and strawberry-hull earthiness. Lengthy in acidity, it remains fresh and inviting in the glass and a good accompaniment to a meal.
title: Mira 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Light pink in color with a slight yellowish orange hue, this delicate bottling shows light plum and strawberry on the nose along with a prominent chalky character. The sip's balanced acidity and steely, gunmetal minerality carry flavors of red cherry, berry and plum, and it remains zesty long after opening.
title: Sanford 2016 Rose of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Winemaker: Gottfried Mocke. Spiced fruit cake, pressed carnation, cherry cola and subtle pepper dance on the nose of this layered, complex bottling. The lush, ripe fruit tones carry through to the medium-weight palate, which offers a crushed satin texture thanks to structured yet subtle tannins and ample acidity. There's a mocha decadence to the finish, but it's pleasant and enticing. Drink now–2021.
title: Gottfried Mocke Wine Projects 2016 Cape Winemakers Guild Pinot Noir (Overberg)

description: Dark reddish-orange in color, this medium-bodied rosé offers refreshing acidity against a dramatic backdrop of intensely etched flavors, a mix of dark cherry, strawberry and blood orange that refreshes and rewards.
title: Bruliam 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: An especially vivid coral color is matched by equally expressive peach, white raspberry and hazelnut flavors in this light-bodied and dry wine. A deft touch of fruit acidity matches the richness in texture for great balance.
title: Lazy Creek 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: It's exciting to see what can be done with Pinot Noir in Paso, a region typically considered too warm for the grape. This bottling shows deep blackberry aromas, turned loam and condensed purple flowers on the nose. The palate continues that dark-fruit theme, but tosses in pepper and clove spice to round out the flavors.
title: Cloak & Dagger 2013 Foggy Bottom Reserve Pinot Noir (Templeton Gap District)

description: Bright and refreshing, this sparkler opens with aromas of small red berry and a whiff of cake spice. Made entirely with Pinot Nero, the vibrant palate offers strawberry, raspberry and a cinnamon note alongside crisp acidity.
title: Enrico Serafino 2013 Brut Rosé Metodo Classico Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)

description: A whiff of spring blossoms introduces this lush richly textured Pinot Noir rosé. Its ripe and fruity, full of succulent berry, cherry and watermelon flavors, yet balanced neatly in acidity. Forward and fresh, it make for tempting summer guzzling.
designation: Stony Lonesome Estate Reserve Dry Rosé of
title: Three Brothers 2016 Stony Lonesome Estate Reserve Dry Rosé of Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: This second, affordably minded label from the Center of Effort team shows caramelized cherries and chipped slate on the nose. Candied red fruits arise on the palate, along with bitter orange peels and a nice acidity, though there's a slightly odd film left on the tongue in the finish.
title: Fossil Point 2013 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: The Australian producer tries its hand at California fruit, and this very straightforward bottling showing aromas of cranberries, raspberries and graphite. The palate is clean and familiar, with Bing cherries, oregano and black slate. It's a good-deal wine
title: Wild Oats 2013 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: This comes out of the bottle a little tarry and rubbery, so splash it around a bit while pouring, or opt for a quick decant if that's possible. Once those off aromas dissipate, the wine delivers plenty of herb-tinged cherry fruit, with a medium body and a mouthwatering, fine-grained finish.
title: Wild South 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This pleasant, medium-bodied wine stays 11 months in French oak (30% new), so there's plenty of barrel influence. The cherry and herb notes manage to stand up to the wood treatment, which adds a layer of mocha flavor and a touch of bitterness. Drink now–2017.
title: Grove Mill 2013 Pinot Noir (Wairau Valley)

description: Slightly herbal on the palate, this wine takes red fruit notes of raspberry and pomegranate to a stridently tart level. It's compact and linear, with a crisp finish.
title: Seifried 2013 Old Coach Road Pinot Noir (Nelson)

description: Attractively perfumed, this is a soft, young and fruity wine. Gentle tannins back up the red fruits and fragrant acidity. Coming from vineyards behind the main slope of the Côtes de Beaune, it is a cool wine, fresh with fruit and ready to drink soon, from 2016.
title: Domaine Parigot 2013 Clos de la Perrière  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: This is textbook Marlborough Pinot Noir, featuring aromas that hint at mushroom, beetroot and ripe cherries. The palate is on the light side, with silky tannins and crisp acids that bend the fruit toward pie cherry and cranberry on the tart finish. Drink now.
title: Marlborough Estate Reserve 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This light- to medium-bodied wine has a pleasantly silky texture. The fruit is tart and red, like cranberry or pomegranate, accented by hints of charred root veggies or wood. Drink now–2017.
title: Opawa 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A slightly confusing array of scents emerges off of this bottling, with sour cherries, toasted oak, raspberry syrup and pungent pine needles tripping over each other. The palate is more approachable, with mocha, espresso, dark red fruits and licorice flavors.
title: Bridlewood 2013 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: Straightforward and fruity, this is fresh and light in character. It has plenty of acidity along with red cherry fruit flavors and a slight amount of tannin. It's drinkable now.
title: Domaine Poulleau Père et Fils 2013  Bourgogne

description: This light- to medium-bodied wine features slightly vegetative notes of cherry tomato and tomato leaf, kept focused by tart acids. That crispness could serve it well as a foil to rich salmon dishes.
title: Lake Chalice 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Very perfumed aromas of violets and Hawaiian Punch hit the nose. The palate is effervescent and bouncy, with sour pomegranate and fruit skin bitterness.
title: 10Span 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Floral in bouquet, this wine is flat on the palate, offering a curious mix of mint and earth without much structure or flavor.
title: Scott Family 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There's not much that makes this stand out as a Pinot, except for an unusual sour note atop otherwise blandness and lack of structure.
title: Cambridge California 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Raspberry and cinnamon spice hit the nose first followed by crushed cloves on this supremely balanced wine by Gavin Chanin from a vineyard that's northwest of the Sta. Rita Hills. Dried cranberry fruit leads the palate, but it's mostly powered by a potpourri of brown spices, from peppercorns to nutmeg. It's a study of restrained ripeness that's fresh and tasty.
title: Chanin 2013 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: A lighter shade of ruby red in the glass, this wine by young vintner Gavin Chanin—whose original art adorns the label—shows delicate aromas of whole cranberries, shaved fennel and dried tobacco. Pomegranate and cranberry fruits arise on the palate, but pine sap flavors are more prominent, along with licorice and eucalyptus. A strong tannic backbone for such a light wine indicates it will drink amazingly from 2018–2030.
title: Chanin 2013 Los Alamos Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Beautiful aromas of rose and lavender open this wine, followed by intense mushroom, truffle and earth. Bright in acidity, a wild strawberry flavor sharpens the focus as soft, well-integrated tannins and subtle oak intermingle. The entire package finishes with a bang of crisp red-cherry fruit.
title: Les Belles Collines 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Gavin Chanin's take on this vineyard shows lots of dark but never heavy spice on the nose, with bergamot, white sage and damp eucalyptus forest complementing the raspberry fruit. The palate clings to a line of graphite minerality, with cooked raspberry torte and loamy earth flavors leading into a black-tea finish.
title: Chanin 2013 Zotovich Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Earthy and spicy, this is classic cool-climate, coastal Pinot, with a whole-cluster mentality and depth of complex flavor and texture. Tart pomegranate and cranberry combine for a light-hearted approach to the vintage, with herbal accents that reach far across the soulful finish.
title: Baker Lane 2013 Sonoma Coast Cuvée Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This well-regarded vineyard shines here, ripening the grapes fully in a challenging vintage. Raspberry and cherry flavors are joined with a streak of red licorice. Among the 2013s from Purple Hands, this is likely to be the longest lived.
title: Purple Hands 2013 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This opens immediately into a lush, varied, flavorful wine that's broadly fruity and generously endowed with toasty oak highlights. It's drinking beautifully already, but is also nicely structured for aging through 2022.
title: J. Scott Cellars 2013 Bradshaw Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a structured wine with layers of tannins as well as ripe red plum skin fruit flavors. It is a wine for aging, which would bring out a rich texture as well as intense acidity. It should not be drunk before 2017.
title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2013 Grande Côte de la Vallée  (Sancerre)

description: Bright aromas of crushed strawberry, rose petal and alpine herb waft out of the glass. On the refined, savory palate, green tea, graphite and a mineral note add depth to the red-berry core. Balanced with fresh acidity and supple tannins, this wine is all about sheer elegance and enjoyment.
title: Abbazia di Novacella 2013 Pinot Nero (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)

description: Lovely aromatics introduce this approachable young Pinot. Scents and flavors of strawberries, raspberries and cherries abound, coming into focus in a generous midpalate. The flavors hang on beautifully, set against framing tannins and supporting acidity. The finish brings a pretty touch of baking spices.
title: Colene Clemens 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: It's hard to find a tastier Pinot Noir for this price. Aromas of rose petals, pungent violets and raspberry juice show just a touch of chai tea, and the palate proves juicy and fun, with cranberry, pomegranate and raspberry elements. Black tea and mocha flavors add just enough seriousness.
title: Byron 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Elegantly structured, this offers fragrances of wild berry and pencil shavings. On the palate, notes of oregano, green tea and a hint of cinnamon add depth to the wild strawberry and crushed raspberry core. Silky tannins and fresh acidity provide support and texture.
title: Tiefenbrunner 2013 Turmhof Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)

description: Elegant, yet still brimming in meaty tannins, this wine offers deftness on entry, diving deeper into blueberry cobbler and baked bread as it goes. On the nose, roses and cinnamon entice, while mid-weight oak and licorice pull in more savory directions. Ideal through 2021.
title: Barnett 2013 Tina Marie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Some high-toned fruit comes up quickly from the glass, and gives the palate a welcome lift. Strawberries and chocolate are the first impression, with nuances of fresh herb and pepper, then more chocolate, as the wine plays out across the palate. Good length and structure make this an excellent value in its price range.
title: J. Scott Cellars 2013 Grace Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The value bottling from this producer, this wine bursts with pretty scents and raspberry fruit flavors. It carries a nice hint of citrus tang, and still lighter notes of mocha and caramel. Modest in proportion, but generous in flavor, it's ready for immediate enjoyment.
title: Purple Hands 2013 Oregon Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Stiff at first, the Stoller puts on more interesting layers after an hour or two of breathing time. Pomegranate, peach skin, mineral and smoke components weave together, with slightly bitter phenolics wrapping up the finish.
title: Purple Hands 2013 Stoller Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This cuvée reflects the lean vintage with modest alcohol and slightly dilute fruit flavors. Pretty aromatics suggest rosewater and sandalwood, and the wine fades gracefully with plum and cherry fruit.
title: Winderlea 2013 Dundee Hills Vineyards Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This wine conveys cola, root beer, dried strawberry and graphite aromas, with an intriguing twist of curry spice. It's rich on the palate with decent weight, showing Indian spice, pepper, star anise and tart yet juicy cranberry.
title: Año Verde 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Full-bodied flavors of cherry accented with orange peel are at the center of this wine. There are hints of earth and leather, and tight, dry tannins that resolve into residual flavors of mineral and metal.
title: Coeur de Terre 2013 Héritage Reserve Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This wine is a blend of De Ponte, Schindler and Kalita fruit, smooth and supple, though falling a bit flat in terms of mouthfeel. Leafy herbal components come up soonest, followed with sweet barrel notes, from 15 months in half new French oak.
title: Panther Creek 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine offers clean, slightly dilute raspberry fruit, along with lovely aromatics and a persistent, engaging finish. In spite of the lightness, it holds your interest.
title: Big Table Farm 2013 Cattrall Brothers Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: The aromas of wild strawberries, spice and sarsaparilla are immediate in their appeal. The palate is light bodied and elegant, with mouthwatering acids and flavors that linger. This wine is delicate but brings a lot of enjoyment.
title: Battle Creek 2013 Unconditional Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This Pinot does not shy away from some sharp, slightly bitter herbal flavors, but keeps them in balance against a core of tart cranberry fruit. It's well made and solid, with medium-long persistence.
designation: Five Blocks Wren and Temperance Hill
title: Lumos 2013 Five Blocks Wren and Temperance Hill Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Pine forest and tart, lean drops of cranberry, rhubarb and pomegranate combine for a complex, savory and compelling vineyard-designate. A strong presence of tannin marks the finish.
title: Keller Estate 2013 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The nose on this widely available bottling is vivacious and juicy, with strawberry, strawberry blossoms and raspberries laid across a pencil-lead frame. It tightens on the palate, with lots of graphite and pencil shavings, showing just a bit of pomegranate fruit.
title: Gainey 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Sourced from old-vine Wädenswil clones, this effort carries the new Elkton AVA designation. Pretty raspberry and strawberry fruit is set in lightly toasty tannins. This is a lovely everyday Pinot Noir with some density.
title: Monte Ferro 2013 Bradley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)

description: Floral scents float above a chunky, cherry-fruited, single-vineyard wine. It's quite refreshing, with appealing texture and underlying minerality that compensates for the overall impression of palate lightness. Drink now through 2018, while the freshness remains at its peak.
title: Panther Creek 2013 Kalita Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: The winery's entry-level bottling, this offers turned earth, juniper, cola and ripe red cherries on the nose. The cherries carry to the palate, where they meet with tangy cranberries, oregano-thyme herbs and grippy plum skin tannins that last into a solid finish.
title: Rusack 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: This easy-to-enjoy wine from the family of Silver Oak has lots of vanilla and fruit flavors and a broad but soft mouthfeel. Hints of cinnamon and red cherries come out on the palate and linger on the finish.
title: Twomey 2013 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Notes of cinnamon and peppercorns adds complexity to the cranberry-pomegranate fruit and slate minerality on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's more reserved in its palate, which offers cranberry tang with an herbal sagebrush quality, proving a reliable, straightforward take on the grape.
title: Clos La Chance 2013 Erwin Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This wine is tightly wound yet intense, ripe and tart in cherry, rose and lush earth. Baking spices make their way through the density of fruit, while the texture struggles to find balance. Let this powerfully built wine open in the glass.
title: Della 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Taut, young and laced with accents of bitter greens, the fruit is peppery and sharp, with plenty of backing acidity. Tannins are proportionate and well managed, while the finish is short, showing mostly acid and herbal components.
title: Panther Creek 2013 Winemaker's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Fresh, forward and fruity, this brings light strawberry fruit and streaks of root beer. It's tasty and quaffable, though done in a lighter style.
title: Sweet Cheeks 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine shows smooth red fruit that is light and generic, with modest weight and an earthy flavor. The wine spent a bit of time in 25% new oak, though it doesn't show up in the flavors.
title: Maison L'Envoyé 2013 The Attaché Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This single-vineyard selection brings black cherry and graham cracker flavors, with a background of stem and herb. Somewhat muted, it could benefit holding to 2017–2018 in bottle.
title: Silvan Ridge 2013 Falcon Glen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Sandalwood and a shovelful of fresh earth mark the entry of this wine aromatically. A soft, tart expression of the variety, it offers bittersweet tannin and dark cherry at its core.
title: Keller Estate 2013 El Coro Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Sharp acidity underscores light, quite tart cranberry fruit. This has herbal notes in abundance, and an earthy note to the tannins. But it all comes together with a clean, polished finish.
title: Winderlea 2013 Murto Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Perfumed aromas of cherry, forest floor and cinnamon bring appeal to this light-colored wine. It's delicate and airy in style, with cranberry flavors on the finish.
title: Larkspur 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Black cherry, chipped slate and an earthy nutmeg character show on the nose of this stylishly labeled bottling. Medium in weight, it offers energetic and tart cranberry-cherry flavors as well as a menthol element on the palate, which is tangy throughout and wipes up clean.
title: Liberated 2013 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: Anchored in fig, plum and berry fruit, this is a substantial effort for both the vintage and the price. It will show best with hearty, cold-weather dishes. Hints of cinnamon and chocolate extend the finish.
title: Silvan Ridge 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Scents softly suggest rose petals and milk chocolate, leading into a wine that seems to hit a hard stop midpalate. A clear flavor of cold steel resonates against a counterpoint of tart berry fruit.
title: Coeur de Terre 2013 Oregon Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This verges on dilute flavors with alcohol not quite reaching 12%. Light scents of plum and sassafras continue with accents of lime and mineral. Try this with light fare that won't overwhelm the flavors.
title: Omero 2013 Ribbon Ridge Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Soft and ultra-smooth, this is crafted in a drink-now style that holds considerable appeal. Lightly spiced purple fruits are in place, and a hint of a vegetal note is almost invisible. If there is a drawback, it is that the wine has been smoothed out to the point of being almost generic.
title: Maison L'Envoyé 2013 Two Messengers Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This seems slightly underripe, with tart fruit that has as much apple as berry character. Light hints of cola and earth fade into a lemony finish.
title: Panther Creek 2013 Fir Crest Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Cedar and vanilla notes mark the nose of this wine, which boasts ample weight, modest fruit and a soft, open-knit texture. It's appealing for its oaky charm.
title: Sidewood 2013 Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: Iron, pomegranate and dust aromas show on the nose of this entry-level bottling from the Los Gatos producer. Bright red fruits and solid brown spice show on the palate that proves light, airy and easy as it dances across the tongue with energy.
title: Testarossa 2013 Cuvee Los Gatos Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: So light in color, this Pinot Noir is almost a rosé. The texture and structure, though, are definitely of a red wine. Firm tannins give a backbone to the red cherry fruitiness and fresh acidity. It's still young so keep this wine until 2016.
title: Vignobles Berthier 2013 Domaine des Clairneaux  (Sancerre)

description: This medium-bodied wine has a surprisingly firm texture from crisp acidity and a relative abundance of tannin. It shows tasty, tart cherry and cranberry flavors, and an astringent finish. A little age should smooth it out by late 2015 and beyond.
title: Bonterra 2013 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

description: This is smooth and easy to drink, with a soft texture, almost sweet strawberry jam flavors, and a touch of spicy, nutty oak that firms it up on the finish.
title: Mirassou 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Floral-smelling up front, this lightweight, cool-climate Pinot offers tutti-frutti raspberry aromas in front of a crisp, lean palate. Dry, spicy, oaky flavors dominate a beam of modest red currant and cherry notes, while the finish is light and hollows out quickly.
title: Montes 2013 Alpha Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Costa)

description: Candied aromas of plastic and earthy black cherry lead to a medium-full palate that's creamy in feel. Lightly oaked and resiny cherry and plum flavors finish loamy and with modest acidity. Drink lightly chilled for best results.
title: François Lurton 2013 Hacienda Araucano Reserva Pinot Noir (Central Valley)

description: Made in fairly large quantities for a wide swath of palates, this wine is grippy in tannins and possessed of sizable weight and power.
title: Kirkland Signature 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Pale-colored Pinot Noir that has a jammy character, this is a red fruit flavored wine that is developing fast. It has rounded tannins and a soft texture. Drink from 2015.
title: Dauny Père et Fils 2013  Sancerre

description: With grapes sourced 60% from Sonoma County and 40% from Mendocino County, this is a soft, floral wine with a bright finish. A sister brand made by Martin Ray, it's priced affordably and will offer a pleasant experience for most palates.
title: Angeline 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma-Mendocino)

description: Initially this oozes oak-based milk chocolate aromas, but swirling reveals funky notes of earth, compost and overall roughness. Earthy, leafy raspberry flavors take on a briny, bitter, peppery quality on the back palate and finish.
title: Kalfu 2013 Sumpai Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Grassy cherry and red currant aromas start out raw and turn more muddled and cheesy-smelling with time. A choppy, acidic palate is fresh but unrefined, while sour citrus and raspberry flavors finish with zest.
title: Root:1 2013 Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: A smooth, earthy wine, this smells a bit like tobacco and cedar, tastes mellow and meaty, and has enough tannin and acidity for a firm texture.
title: Drytown 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Sierra Foothills)

description: Tangy, citrusy aromas suggest sour plum and cranberry. In the mouth, this is shearing and high in acid, with sharp, tart flavors of currant and plum that finish with a distant hint of spice.
title: Arboleda 2013 Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Costa)

description: This bottling is Bisquertt's first foray into the world of Pinot Noir. The wine smells like a wet dog, along with some candied, artificial fruit aromas. A chunky, sticky-feeling palate houses medicinal, green berry flavors, while the finish is oaky and remains medicinal and hot.
title: Viña Bisquertt 2013 Crazy Rows Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Picked at 19.6 brix (a sparkling-wine level of ripeness), this bone-dry, high acid rosé is intensely aromatic, with lush scents of rose petals and fresh strawberries. It's spring in a glass, wonderfully expressive and long lasting.
title: Cória 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: WillaKenzie's most affordable estate-grown Pinot, this opens with a truly lovely bouquet of rose petals, raspberries and dusty chocolate. Soft and smooth upon entry, it's a light, detailed and sophisticated vineyard blend that spent 10 months in 20% new oak.
title: WillaKenzie Estate 2013 Gisèle Pinot Noir

description: A new brand from Scott Paul, this relatively value-priced wine is tight and tart, with cranberry and black cherry fruit. The acidity juts out a bit, though that may improve with additional bottle age.
title: WildStock 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Luisa Ponzi crafts this rather delicate wine, with balanced flavors that reward your attention to detail. Watermelon and strawberries come wrapped in smooth tannins. Side flavors of earth, clove and peppery herb add welcome complexity.
title: RouteStock 2013 Route 99W Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A kiss of violet mingles with bright red cherry and strawberry aromas on this elegant yet approachable wine. It's juicy and concentrated with sunny red-berry flavor, but fresh and spry with acidity. The moderately long finish holds just a faint spray of tannins.
title: P.J. Valckenberg 2013 Undone Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)

description: Root beer, sage and pomegranate emerge with coaxing off this vineyard blend from Summerland, whose tasting room is steps from the beach. The palate is tense with slate-driven minerality and high tones of raspberry, relying on acidity rather than ripeness.
title: Summerland 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Cola, upturned earth and wet pine needles emerge off of this entry-level Pinot from the region's first modern winery. The flavors range from scorched raspberry to tart cranberry, with the bitter side of the grape quite prominent. That may mellow over some time.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Strongly herbal, peppery and showing more than a hint of stem, this raspberry and root-beer style of Pinot hits the palate a bit sharp, and does a quick fade.
title: Iris Vineyards 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: There's an earthy funkiness to this inexpensive Pinot, made at an unheard-of price point for the area. Dry tannins greet the entry followed up by burly oak and big brambly blackberry and cherry fruit, a touch of herb on the finish.
title: Taken Wine Co. 2013 Complicated Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Lush, oak-aided aromas of browned butter, cherry-pie crust and sweet Vietnamese coffee come off of this blend of fruit from Monterey, Santa Barbara, and Sonoma counties. The flavors are fruit punchy at first, with cooked cherries, but grow more intriguing with anise, oregano and a tannic, orange peel finish.
title: Cherry Pie 2013 Cherry Tart Pinot Noir (California)

description: A rich coating of oaky, sweet-seeming vanilla and maple notes dominates this medium-bodied, broad and rich wine. The modest cherry and berry flavors can't quite compete with all the oak, but there's no denying that it's tasty.
title: Bread & Butter 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: A solid, light-red wine emerges from this box, showing toasty, oaky aromas, raspberry and plum flavors and a rich texture. While it doesn't have strong Pinot Noir varietal character, it's an enjoyable, mild and easy-to-drink wine.
title: Black Box 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Plum, cherry and cola scents promise more than the wine delivers. In the mouth it hints at rubber and turns thin and rather sour. Give it maximum aeration and drink 2017–2018.
title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2013 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Slightly sour aromas of cooked prunes consume the nose on this very simply presented wine, with just a front label. Stewed plums with ginger and other brown spices characterize the palate.
title: Redwood Ridge Estate 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: The wine is lean, with more acidity than fruit. It does have a tannin edge that gives it structure but the fact the wine wasn't aged in wood means it lacks any depth. Drink now.
title: Charles Sparr 2013 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: As often in Alsace Pinot Noir, the wine has too much wood for its fruit. What fruitiness it has—bitter cherries and red berries—is smothered by high toast giving a dry, edgy aftertaste.
title: Domaine Loew 2013 Westhoffen Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Smoky spice leads to charred tones in the glass. This wood-dominated Pinot is disjointed and clumsy on the palate. Raspberry and plum flavors are crowded by heavy oak spice, while the finish tastes resiny, with forest berry notes.
title: Indomita 2013 Duette Premium Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Pino is a new Oregon entry from the Bronco Wine Company. It delivers the goods, with chunky cherry fruit done in a bold, clean, full-flavored style. It's got small amounts of Syrah and Maréchal Foch in the blend, probably for color and spice, which works quite well. This is a fine everyday mealtime option with versatility to spare.
title: Pino 2013 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: The red berry and pomegranate fruit flavors are set against a background of dry earth, dried leaf and stem. It's balanced and detailed, definitely tilted more toward the herbal side of Oregon Pinot Noir rather than a fruitier style.
title: Torii Mor 2013 Yamhill Carlton Select Pinot Noir

description: A larger-production wine that doesn't hold back on quality, this offers a bittersweet bite of black tea, cranberry and dried herb atop aromas of dried rose petals, remaining varietal while also providing an oomph of body and texture.
title: Etude 2013 Grace Benoist Ranch Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This bottling is an ode to Bill Foley's Texas roots. It shows dried strawberry, rich olallieberry, baked cherry, black-cardamom cream and plum cookies on the deliciously spiced, fruit-forward nose. The palate is refreshing and fresh, with black raspberry and black-pepper flavors.
title: Foley 2013 T Anchor Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The nose on this wine is a bit shy, but offers crisp raspberry, red-cherry pastry and black-pepper notes. The palate is straightforward with oregano, cranberry, crushed slate and earthy iron flavors. It's clean, pure and not overly complex.
title: Albatross Ridge 2013 Cuvée Vivienne Pinot Noir (Carmel Valley)

description: Clear, light and varietal, this wine ping-pongs between subtle cinnamon and Asian spice around dark cherry and earth, with a big, juicy hit of oak and intense tannin. It finishes full-figured and robustly concentrated.
title: Matrix 2013 Boschetti Family Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This three-vineyard blend is still quite tight and tannic. Flavors of green tea and lemon oil abound, with lighter flavors of pie cherries. Drying tannins wrap it up.
title: Torii Mor 2013 Dundee Hills Select Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Dry and spare, this offers stem and herb flavors ahead of a tight core of raspberry fruit. A Pommard and Dijon 114 clone mix, it spent 19 months in 27% new French oak. It seems to need another year or two of bottle age to come together.
title: Torii Mor 2013 La Colina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This wine offers very ripe and vivid fruit in the aromas and the flavors, like blackberries and dark plums picked when they're just beginning to shrivel. The texture is broad and the body full, but the tannins and acidity feel low, so the wine's personality is both big and soft.
title: Domaine Anderson 2013 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This young wine is already softening up around the tannic edges, and showing some early maturation of the plum and berry fruit flavors. A streak of mint and licorice runs into the finish, along with some not-quite-integrated oak tannins.
title: Marshall Davis 2013 Beacon Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This clonal study blends rich black cherry and sassafras notes with cola, savory herbs, strong iron and slight scorched rubber aromas. The palate jumps from a red cherry and cranberry tartness right into a toasted sage and pencil-lead character.
title: Fess Parker 2013 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
