description: Vibrant raspberry and white peach aromas introduce this perfumed Pinot Noir rosé. While dry in style, it's juicy and thirst quenching. Subtle hints of herb and spice lend complexity. Drink now.
title: Von Schleinitz 2016 Dry Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Mosel)

description: This wine has density and richness. With ripe berry fruits and generous tannins it conveys the fruitiness and richness of a Gevrey-Chambertin. It is structured as well, allowing plenty of room for aging. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2016 Vieilles Vignes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Toasty aromas lead to a wine that has obviously had plenty of wood aging. That shows in this cooler vintage and dominates the red fruits. Of course, the fruit will fill out and there is plenty of weight there. It will be worth waiting at least until 2020 to drink.
title: Quentin Jeannot 2016 La Fuissière Premier Cru  (Maranges)

description: This offers fresh fruit flavors of watermelon and strawberry. Delicate and flavorful, it's perfect for sipping on your porch, deck, boat or simply while picnicking.
title: Stoller 2013 Rosé Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Aromas of cherry, raspberry and a whiff of mint lead to flavors of dried cherry, raspberry and strawberry in this easy quaffing Pinot Noir.
title: Cramele Halewood 2013 La Umbra Pinot Noir (Dealurile Munteniei)

description: A pretty strawberry-colored rosé, this shows uniform scents and flavors of strawberry, with a peppery kick in the finish. It was fermented in neutral French oak.
title: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: In this pale rosé, freshly cut orange and papaya mousse aromas are cut with a bit of flintiness. The wine plays to the citrus side of the pink scale, with lemon rind and pink grapefruit flavors. It's a bit more watery than other rosés of the vintage.
title: Tolosa 2013 Estate Rosé of Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Kathleen Inman has gained such a following with her Rosé that she's given it a special designation, a nod to her happy marriage. Made in a direct-press style, the dry, refreshing wine is light salmon in color and marked by aromatic grapefruit and strawberry, mouthfilling and juicy as a slice of watermelon in summer.
title: Inman Family 2013 Endless Crush Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A fascinating wine, it was processed in a carbonic fashion, in which the juice is allowed to ferment inside the mostly intact grape skins, much like what's done in Beaujolais. The result is a transparent, ruby red wine that offers scents of a dust storm mixed with crushed rock and chile pepper herbaciousness. It's warm and soft on the mouth with a presence that suggests something between peppercorns and bell peppers.
title: Alta Maria 2013 Carbonic Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Winemaker: Bruce Jack. There's a lot going on in this rich, complex Pinot. Rich cherry and strawberry fruit aromas are laced with earthy mushroom, forest floor, cinnamon and cocoa powder. The medium-weight palate is framed by dusty tannins and supple ripe fruit flavors. The long finish exhibits beutiful evolution, from cherry to sweet spice and finally woody mushroom notes on the back. Drink now–2017.
designation: Cape Winemakers Guild Mountain Farm The Heartbreak Grape
title: The Drift 2013 Cape Winemakers Guild Mountain Farm The Heartbreak Grape Pinot Noir (Overberg)

description: Peach-blush in color, this is a light, lean wine, gorgeous in citrus and wet stone minerality. Layers of strawberry and watermelon linger on the tongue throughout the crisp finish. Open and enjoy whenever you need a hit of summer.
title: Ousterhout 2013 Woods Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From a dark bottle, this salmon-colored rosé is medium-bodied and made in a bigger style than many others. Fully textured, it discloses flavorful touches of crunchy pear and cranberry. It would go well with a goat cheese salad adorned in dried cranberries and cherries.
title: Ousterhout 2013 800 Vines Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Brightly pink in color, this dry rosé is more flavorful and assertive than it looks. It layers red fruit aromas such as cherry and raspberry on top of equally bright fruit flavors, all carried into the finish with lip-smacking acidity.
title: Naughty Boy 2013 Dry Rosé of Pinot Noir (Potter Valley)

description: Winemaker: Rianie Strydom. This opens with classic aromas of small red berries, cherry, foliage, cola and mocha. The palate is lifted and bright, with soft tannins and tart rhubarb and pomegranate flavors. The finish offers subtle notes of allspice, clove and white pepper. Drink now–2016.
title: Strydom 2013 Cape Winemakers Guild Napier Pinot Noir (Western Cape)

description: Peach-blush in color, this is a pretty, floral and aromatic wine, dry and delicious in peach and strawberry flavors. A hint of herbs marks the finish. Enjoy with a picnic, especially goat cheese and charcuterie.
title: Ousterhout 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Salmon-colored, this subtle, nuanced and dry rosé comes from a reputable producer of Pinot Noir. It's structured in wild strawberry exuberance and plenty of minerality. The finish repeats the burst of strawberry with a cherry chaser and squeeze of lime.
title: Balletto 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Jaw-droppingly delicious, this will surely convince you that Pinot Noir is the absolute best rosé grape in Oregon. From the floral/strawberry bouquet bursting out of the bottle, right on through the delightfully sippable, mouthfilling fruit, it's a joy.
title: Ponzi 2013 Rosé Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There's been a huge jump in production of this wine since the past vintage, which may signal some surge of interest in white Pinot, which has lately become a bit of a trend in Oregon. The wine is simple, neutral and perfectly quaffable, but carries no hint of varietal character.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2013 White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is made via carbonic maceration, much like a Beaujolais, and shows a friendly, forward fruity character. It's smooth and agreeable, with cherry, apple and orange juice flavors that show some sweetness in the mouth.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2013 Whole Cluster Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A delicate salmon pink, this offers light scents and flavors of rose water and strawberries. There's plenty of juicy acidity, and the low alcohol makes it great for sipping chilled in hot weather.
title: Lumos 2013 Chiquita Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Pretty and scented with watermelon and strawberry, this rosé turns tart in the mouth, tasting of rhubarb and sour berry. It's fresh and refreshing, especially drunk cold in hot weather with a picnic spread.
title: Walnut City WineWorks 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: As light as a feather, this delicate rosé carries suggestions of watermelon and rhubarb, with a whiff of onion. 20% was aged briefly in neutral French oak.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Sought-after vineyard grower Charles Heintz has teamed with stellar Sonoma County winemaker Hugh Chappelle (Lynmar, Quivira) to make this divine estate-grown Rosé, pale pink in the glass with hugely inviting floral aromatics. From there is a bolt of electricity, the wine juicy and alive in peach, citrus and strawberry, mouthwatering and light.
title: Charles Heintz 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The intriguing golden-pink color looks like sun shining through a rose petal, and the aromas of honey, buttered popcorn and pecan pie are just as appealing. Once sipped, the flavors of poached salmon somehow show. These continue into a long finish, although the acidity soon wipes the slate clean like a good rosé should. This is one of many wines made by ninth-generation Santa Maria Valleyite James Ontiveros.
title: Alta Maria 2013 Rosé Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is a classically light rosé, fragrant in strawberry and raspberry. Traces of pomegranate on the back palate offers darker, riper fruit in the glass, getting prettier as it goes along. Deliciously dry and dancing in acidity, it has plenty of citrus on the finish. The wine is substantial enough for springtime and summertime meals, but will drink equally well on its own.
title: Lynmar 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe cherry and luscious watermelon aromas waft from this summery, fresh wine. It's dry on the palate but concentrated, with bright cherry and berry flavors. Round and lush yet briskly balanced, it's a great summer quaffer at a fantastic price.
title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2013 Dry Rosé Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: Exuberant on the nose, with aromas of fresh blossoms, luscious melon and peach, this wine is a welcome harbinger of long summer nights to come. It's rich and ripe with red cherry and berry flavor, but refreshingly brisk. A chalky minerality lingers on the finish.
title: Anthony Nappa 2013 Anomaly Pinot Noir (New York)

description: Brambly raspberry aromas are accented with a dusting of minerals on this dry, refreshing rosé. The palate is delicate with subtle red-cherry flavor but finishes elegantly with a lingering cherry blossom perfume.
title: Fox Run 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: The shade of this Kathy Joseph creation is that of rosé-colored sunglasses. Such comfort is furthered with a cherry cola and maraschino cherry nose. A slight effervescent zing on the palate accompanies pomegranate flavors followed by an impressively long finish. Great with a fresh garden salad, but able to handle more substantial fare too, such as  breaded chicken cutlets or a cheeseburger.
title: Fiddlehead 2013 Rosé Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Dry and mouthwateringly tart, it would be versatile at the table. With a translucent pink-orange color, it's delicately structured, showing brisk acidity and complex, subtle orange, strawberry, spearmint and vanilla flavors that finish dry and spicy.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2013 Vin Gris Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Perhaps the palest Central Coast rosé of the year, this Pinot Noir-based wine almost looks like water, but the aromas of marcona almond and delicate lemonade assure that it's perfect for a picnic on a hot day. The strong acidity tantalizes the mouth, and would make excellent pairing for shellfish or simply cooked white fish.
title: Center of Effort 2013 Effort Estate Rosé Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: With a pink color so deep that it borders on mauve, the exotic notes play a leading role, with passionfruit, papaya, and guava hitting the nose first. On the palate, it's full and flavorful, reminiscent of a Mexican agua fresca made from strawberries and watermelon. This is beach wine at its finest.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2013 Estate Vineyards Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara)

description: Bright cherry red in color, it offers aromas of blackberry, cranberry and freshly picked cherries. Flavors include blackberries, red raspberries and sour cherry pie. It's a bit light when it comes to body but it has a refreshing level of acidity in the clean finish.
title: Cramele Recas 2013 Dreambird Pinot Noir (Viile Timisului)

description: On the borderline of exuding overripe fruit aromas and flavors, this wine reins it in to reveal juicy blackberry and raspberry around firm, sizable tannins.
title: Previous 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Having seen 20 months in French oak, the aromas of this wine are dominated by cola and rooibos tones. The light- to medium-bodied palate shows more fruit tones, with juicy red cherry and black currant taking on an almost candied flavor. Sandy tannins and a line of acidity give enough support to keep this Pinot in check.
designation: Katherine & Martha's Vineyard Hill Road Vineyard
title: Nathaniel Rose 2013 Katherine & Martha's Vineyard Hill Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Lake Michigan Shore)

description: A weight of oak and tannin marks this full-blown, bombastic expression of the variety. It has a reduced quality to the fruit and an unexpected twist of mint.
title: Buena Vista 2013 Bela's Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine has a richness that borders on candied, a celebration of ripe raspberry and cherry with medium weight and body around strong streaks of tannin.
title: Miro 2013 Orsi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From great farmers and a great site, this wine somehow never comes fully to life, offering a muted taste of cherry and strawberry around minty dollops of earth and dried herb.
title: Acacia 2013 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Bright red cherry is covered in a blanket of dusty spice on the nose of this pale ruby-colored Pinot Noir. There's a solid amount of tension to the light-bodied palate, with juicy red cherry and currant balanced by soft, sandy tannins.
designation: Estate Grown Artist Series Crain Hill Vineyard
title: Brengman Brothers 2013 Estate Grown Artist Series Crain Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Leelanau Peninsula)

description: A pleasantly smooth texture, mellow fruit flavors and not-too-heavy body give easy drinkability to this very affordable wine. The fruit flavors are quiet but present and the balance is on the soft side.
title: Belle Ambiance 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This is a dry, tannic estate wine that's rich and ripe with a leathery aspect of gun smoke and blackberry. It shows more in the way of black fruit and spicy pepper than fruit that's delicate or crisp.
title: Bouchaine 2013 Bacchus Collection Terraces Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Dark pink in the glass, this bubbly is incredibly foamy throughout the experience. It begins with aromas of strawberry, raspberry, plum and red apple, then explodes with bubbles on the palate, which make it hard to find the sour pomegranate and plum-skin flavors that eventually emerge.
title: Byington 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Gothic is the project of a New York-based restaurateur and sommelier team. This spent 10 months in 15% new French oak. Scents and flavors of rubber tire dominate, and the tannins are hard and harsh. Airing it out helps a bit, but the bitterness does not entirely disappear.
title: Gothic 2013 Nevermore Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Strong aromas and flavors like smoke and bacon seem heavy in this medium-bodied but tannic wine. A dish with bacon might bring it around.
title: Row Eleven 2013 Vinas 3 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Rough, sinewy and oaky, this full-bodied wine is concentrated and thick, a robust expression of bitter black fruit and leather.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros-Napa Valley)

description: Meant to provide value, this wine also offers big oak, smoke and a bittersweet taste of black-tea tannins. Shy in fruit, this has a slightly reduced effect on the finish.
title: JAQK Cellars 2013 High Roller Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: There's something mushroomy and feral about this wine, which finishes with sour cherry.
title: Armanino Family Cellars 2013 The Pintail Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: Earthy and stemmy in dark black fruit, this wine contains 2% Syrah from Dunnigan Hills, though it's unclear how that contributes. Thin on the palate, it has a medicinal, minty flourish on the finish.
title: Mossback 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is subdued, almost invisible, with herbal flavors accented with bitter greens. Barely ripe red fruit leaves a flat taste, with no life in it. Two bottles tasted.
title: Zimri Cellars 2013 Beacon Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: A strong buttery, jammy aroma and flavors like cherry candy make an unusual profile and cover up most varietal flavors in the grapes.
title: Alias 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This wine is a standout in an outstanding portfolio of 2013 vineyard- and block-designated wines from this producer. Five Sisters is big and burly at first, a fistful of leather and Asian baking spices that demands notice. Then subtlety takes over in lithe, sinewy waves of blueberry and blackberry, followed by a touch of licorice on the nearly endless finish.
title: Lynmar 2013 Five Sisters Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A very alluring mix of wintery wood smoke, slight Bourbon vanilla and fallen oak leaves crushed underfoot frames restrained notes of red fruit. There is the most seductive, barely glanced notion of elderberry. The palate is silky and dwells on the autumnal aspects of Pinot but comes with immense elegance, tender white pepper notes and a store of profound fruit. There is a fine-grained density and real structure beneath this smooth surface. Be patient and give this wine its due and drink 2018–2025.
title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2013 Holzspur Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: From mighty Kanzler comes this ripe, densely tannic wine, plush like candy, it's a celebration of black cherry, dried herbs and vanilla oak, rewarding in its nod to hedonism in balance. The minerality is pronounced and persistent, allowing the wine to breathe. Drink now through 2023.
title: Lynmar 2013 Kanzler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Mossy, dank, forest-floor aromas of juniper, chaparral shrub, pencil lead and spiced porcini mushrooms mix with a cooked rhubarb character on the nose of this wine from single-vineyard specialist Bill Brosseau. Cranberry and tart cherry flavors are decorated with rainbow peppercorns, herb-crusted roast beef, bay leaf, eucalyptus and camphor, with layers upon layers of complexity.
title: Testarossa 2013 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is an outright steal for a wine of this quality, a remarkable entry into the producer's wider world of knockout designates. Lush and layered, it combines decadent cherry, vanilla and spicy cinnamon-cola over an elegant, medium-bodied structure.
title: Lynmar 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: For now, very restrained oak dominates the nose. Wafts of soft smokiness create the impression of a cloud within which red fruit slumbers. This is youthful and comes with a smoky backbone of a structure—a beautiful faultline of fresh acidity. To appropriate a well-used metaphor, this is like a firm handshake from a hand gloved in vermilion velvet. With some time, tender notes of morello cherry tantalizingly appear. This should come with an addiction warning for lovers of elegant Pinots. Drink 2017–2025.
title: Markowitsch 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carnuntum)

description: Smoke and dark earth, soft red berry fruit tip-toe onto the nose. Insinuations of wild and garden strawberries tumble forth on the palate as they are framed by the softest hints of vanilla and aromatic clove. This echoes long and draws you in. There is very distinct fruit at the core, alternating from ripe cherry at one moment to smoky plum the other. It scintillates. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2013 Grillenhügel Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: Thick, rich and tightly wound, this cool-climate wine from near the town of the same name is brightly acidic and floral. A mix of rose petal, violet and dried herbes de Provence on the nose echoes on the palate. Bing and dark cherry provide a sultry fruitiness that never dominates over the piquant cardamom spice. Drink now through 2023.
title: Lynmar 2013 Freestone Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine comes from the coolest pocket of the producer's estate, the last part typically picked. It offers a study in savory tannin development and thickness, the skins unable to soften gently in the cold. Earthy clove defines the flavor, along with a leathery meatiness and firm structure. A suggestion of black cherry tries to muddle through. Drink now through 2023.
title: Lynmar 2013 Quail Hill Vineyard Bliss Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From the steepest, east-facing block of the estate vineyard, given 15% whole-cluster fermentation, this is a dense, brooding wine, spicy and concentrated in blueberry and black cherry. It has a tenacity of earthiness that never lets go, lingering on the full-bodied palate for days. Drink now through 2023.
title: Lynmar 2013 Quail Hill Vineyard Block 10 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Flinty notions of (good) reduction still grace the closed nose and bring memories of Burgundian cellars. The palate has a masterfully light touch. The fruit is tart and red, hinting at red currant and crushed cranberries with a pleasant, inviting tartness that exudes aroma and focuses the palate with its preserving freshness. Yet there are notions of fragrant and ripe raspberries. This is a silky babe in arms, so wait for the wine to unfold fully from 2017 to 2020.
title: Loimer 2013 Anning Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)

description: Smoky oak frames red and black cherry and offers hints of intense fruitiness, almost of Kirsch. There's an undertow of wet earth and leaves, of finely ground white pepper, presented with pliable, velvety softness. Yet there is freshness and precision and the well-fused harmoniousness of all these elements that makes Pinot such a compelling, haunting proposition.
title: Anton Bauer 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Wagram)

description: A blend of several vineyards, including Kanzler, Quail Hill and Umino, with some Freestone also in the bottle, this wine was given an almost 50% whole-cluster fermentation. Crisp cherry, strawberry and an inviting squeeze of citrus sit atop darker notes of cinnamon toast, the whole awash in a floral flourish of orange blossom.
title: Lynmar 2013 Monastery Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Made from a selection of heirloom vines, this dense, concentrated wine opens in the glass to take on lighter, more delicate waves of pomegranate and cranberry. The oak is present but never overbearing, providing structure around an ashy finish.
designation: Heirloom Grace Benoist Ranch Estate Grown
title: Etude 2013 Heirloom Grace Benoist Ranch Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Opening with a bouquet of stemmy earth, lavender and the perfume of a rose garden, this supple, meaty wine is rich in red and blue fruit that's full bodied and concentrated. It finds a freshness in its tangy cranberry finish.
title: Levendi 2013 River South Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The Nuages cuvée delicately includes lightly peppery herbal notes in the fruit-filled wine that leans toward blueberries and cherries. There is a streak of brown sugar, and the overall balance is exacting. Despite the relative youth, nothing seems awkward or out of place. Drink now through 2022.
title: J. Christopher 2013 Nuages Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: An inviting mix of rose and nutmeg evolves into tightly woven layers of raspberry and blueberry, with the wine deftly showing its youth and fine-vintage pedigree. Powerful on the palate, it has weight and length, followed by softly lingering allspice.
title: Artesa 2013 Limited Release Pinot Noir (Carneros-Napa Valley)

description: This wine delivers a fresh hit of zesty acidity and earthiness that balance each other well, that liveliness a good match against more brooding aspects of black tea. Light bodied with just enough weight on the palate, it finishes with tastes of wild raspberry and strawberry.
title: Martin Ray 2013 Tina Marie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Lighter in color, this is a great take on the fresh, vibrant and zesty style. It offers a wondrous array of tart yet ripe cranberry, pomegranate and alpine strawberry fruit, as well as touches of white pepper and flint. The palate packs peppery zest and raspberry fruit on a lithe but flavor-packed body, finish with menthol and eucalyptus-leaf elements.
title: Chime 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a lovely, elegant wine from the cool appellation within the larger Russian River Valley. Clear and light, it's stemmy and earthy, unraveling spools of cinnamon-clove, rose petals and forested oak around a soft, silky texture and highlights of strawberry-rhubarb.
title: Camlow 2013 Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Drenched in luxurious, almost sweet fruit flavors, this tempting and delicious wine is full bodied. Ripe in aromas and on the palate, it creates a vivid and warming cherry-pie effect on the senses, and is undeniably tasty.
title: Shane Wines 2013 The Charm Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A full percentage lower in alcohol than the 2012, this nonetheless is amply concentrated, with abundant brambly berry, cherry and blue plum. A wash of chocolate comes over the tannins as the wine finishes with a dusting of cinnamon.
title: Rex Hill 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is bold and full bodied, big enough for a grilled steak, with powerful ripe fruit flavors like black cherry and blackberry. Firm-enough tannins add grip to the texture, with slightly smoky, peppery accents on the finish.
title: Black Kite 2013 Redwood's Edge Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Featuring a unique and intriguingly fresh and floral nose, this shows bright strawberry, fresh-pressed hibiscus flowers, exotic vanilla-cinnamon notes and hints of slate and chaparral. The palate is just a hair less exciting, with raspberry, cranberry, white pepper, white sage and dried mint, all wrapped with tart acidity and tannins.
title: Left Bend 2013 Muns Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A depth of baking spices and cinnamon stick greets the nose and palate with eager abundance, showing off the wine's savory, flirty side. Good acidity helps balance out the powerful concentration and sword's edge of alcohol, before finishing fresh and with length.
title: Matrix 2013 Reserve Bacigalupi Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Fresh fruit flavors weave through a soft, smooth texture in this well-polished and satisfying wine. It has earthy touches in the aroma, a good center of ripe cherry and raspberry flavors, full body and a lingering, rich finish.
title: Saracina 2013 Day Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Cooked cranberry is spiced with anise, peppercorn and roasted beef slices on this bottling from a vineyard planted by three brothers who are longtime Salinas Valley farmers. The palate shows dark cranberry and raspberry, spiced up by chopped sage, thyme and bay leaf.
title: Testarossa 2013 Guidotti Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: From an oceanview vineyard west of the Sta. Rita Hills comes this project led by David Yates of Jaffurs Winery. The bottling shows earthy smashed cherry, mulberry, bloody meat and brawny clove notes on the nose. Sagebrush and iron play loudly on the palate, with tart cranberry and herbal nuance. It finishes smooth and clean after a long tang.
title: Enticer 2013 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Enticing plum and baked-strawberry aromas invite the nose on this bottling, as do sandalwood, cola and nutmeg notes. The palate begins with soft cranberry and then dives into oregano and thyme before moving into more restrained gravel flavors, finishing with juniper and pine needles. This wine's wound-up structure will unfurl nicely with time.
title: Gallegos 2013 Boekenoogen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This sophisticated and compelling wine combines full body and a muscular texture with very tasty, solid fruit flavors. The balance between acidity, tannin and flavor is good, and the finish is tangy and lingering.
title: Black Kite 2013 Kite's Rest Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Pretty and plump, this is bursting with ripe cherry fruit. Highlights include a dusting of cocoa powder, and the wine sits perky on the palate with fine-grained tannins and ample acidity.
title: Andrew Rich 2013 Prelude Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Grown on the higher ground near Anderson Valley, this wine has a rather light color with a transparent, tawny rim. It's a likeable, lean wine with vivid black tea, cranberry and red cherry in both the aromas and the flavor. Tannins are firm but light. It offers good astringency, medium body and a lingering spicy finish.
title: Baxter 2013 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

description: Though a lighter style from Mike Sinor's estate vineyard, this is still meaty, with black cherry, smoked pork, licorice, purple flowers and flashes of pretty cranberry notes on the edges. The tannins are quite firm right now on the palate, where boisterous boysenberry fruit meets with anise, black rocks, a touch of herbs and tar.
title: Sinor-LaVallee 2013 White Label Bassi Ranch Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Light in color and clear, this wine dances with a savory note of tilled earth and forest floor. Lively on the palate, its fruit profile is juicy and fresh as well as long-lasting.
title: Terlato 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This barrel selection evokes the AVA's black-cherry fruit character nicely, keeping it lively and balanced, with excellent depth. Tasting the wine is like gazing into a deep pool; the flavors keep pushing further into the finish. Streaks of coffee and milk chocolate are in the mix, but it's the excellent fruit that captures your attention and holds it.
title: J. Christopher 2013 Dundee Hills Cuvée Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: High and tight aromas of cranberry, anise and thyme characterize the nose of this clonal study by Sabrine Rodems. Chaparral scrub shows at the tip of the sip and then broadens toward strawberry in the midpalate before tightening around pencil lead and herbes de provence flavors.
title: Wrath 2013 Swan 828 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Named after Bill Foley's grandmother, this bottling shows bright hibiscus, fresh-pressed strawberry, graphite, iron and anise on the nose. The lighter-bodied palate is framed by juicy strawberry, but excels due to the dried sage, fresh bay leaf, crushed black pepper and piney turned-earth qualities.
title: Lincourt 2013 Annie Dyer Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This sultry, supple wine exudes aromas and flavors of baking spices and dark cherry pie, remaining brooding atop a full-bodied texture. Despite the oaky density, it retains a floral back note and bright, lengthy finish.
title: Davis Bynum 2013 Jane's Vineyard Dijon Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Verbatim offers a compelling mix of juicy citrus flavors from the potent acidity, along with tangy strawberry, raspberry and cherry fruit. The components are balanced and the flavors pure and well integrated. The length and balance suggest that this should drink well at least through 2022.
title: Andrew Rich 2013 Verbatim Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Fragrant and generously fruity, this is a bowl of raspberries and cherries, with just the right acidity to keep it lively and fresh. Light suggestions of cola and nutmeg add further interest.
title: J. Christopher 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine starts with aromas of bread and butter, a richness that's inviting and unusual, before filling in on the palate with juicy, high-toned layers of red berry and cherry. Young and approachable, the wine is light bodied and delicate.
title: Martin Ray 2013 Dark Star Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a soft, silky and ultimately impressive wine, darkly brooding in mushroomy, forested earth and an undeniable luxuriousness of cherry cola. Medium bodied and easy to enjoy, it's a complete wine that's firm in minerality and tension.
title: Martin Ray 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Arguably the iconic vineyard at Rex Hill, Jacob-Hart brings subtle nuances into play from older vines and biodynamic techniques. There's lots to enjoy here—hints of spice, earth, even hemp, along with the core fruit flavors of blackberry and black cherry. It's just a little thinner than usual in this new vintage.
title: Rex Hill 2013 Jacob-Hart Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Bright and focused raspberry fruit comes buttressed by a firm streak of Mediterranean herbs. Hints of iron thread through the finish. This is a taut substantial wine that will require some breathing time to show its best.
title: De Ponte Cellars 2013 Dundee Hills Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Seven clones contribute to this blend, an aromatic and elegant wine with wild berries, a touch of rhubarb, and some peppery green highlights. It's light but not at all thin, nor does it short the finish. In fact, it's deceptively long, and that is its real strength.
title: Amalie Robert 2013 Dijon Clones Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A lovely coppery hue, this is a full-bodied wine with plentiful flavors of citrus, strawberries and cherries. It broadens out in the mouth, without losing focus, and brings in a streak of sassafras. As with most rosés, it should be consumed with two years of the vintage.
title: Phelps Creek 2016 Fleur de Roy Rosé of Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: This Pinot is forward and fruity, bursting with lush flavors of ripe plum and maraschino cherry. A thin vein of dark chocolate threads through the tannins. The length and structure suggest that this can be aged another half decade or longer.
title: Rock Point 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This is an attractive, easy-going Pinot at an affordable price from winemaker Tim Knappstein. Ripe—very nearly confected—red cherry and strawberry aromas are made more appealing by whispers of tree bark, dried herbs and savory, meaty and smoky components. The medium-bodied palate offers even more bark and medicinal herb characters, finishing on a sappy, black-fruited note.
title: Riposte 2016 The Dagger Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: The nose is a subtle combination of the merest touch of cinnamon and red cherry. The palate is light and firm, with ample freshness and a lovely impression of tart fruit. This is understated and fresh in a savory style.
title: Domaine Bott-Geyl 2013 Galets Oligocène Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The nose is very shy and wants to give little away. The palate slowly opens into a taut, elegant and fresh body adorned with flavors of cranberry and red cherry. All is toned down but comes with disarming purity and freshness, resulting in honesty and utter charm.
title: René Muré 2016 Signature Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Notions of ripe cherry fruit are evident from the start. This is fruity and fresh, full of tart cherry tones and a refreshing conifer edge. The body is slender and the light tannins offer a little crunch. A lovely, easy, authentic and fruit-driven wine.
title: Boeckel 2016 Midelberg Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The ripest of the winery's 2013 Pinots, this rounds out the fruit with pretty raspberry and cherry flavors. Light touches of oranges and chocolate are also evident, and the overall balance, length and elegance are fine. Just two barrels were produced, one new and one neutral.
title: Amalie Robert 2013 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A touch of reduction clouds juicy, ripe cherry notes on the nose but they appear edged by freshness on the light, taut palate. There is a pleasant grip of fine tannin and a slight crunch. A fresh-faced but very authentic and pure wine.
title: Domaine Pfister 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The subdued scent of red and black cherry plays on the nose. On the palate this hints at fruit, with freshness and a fine frame of softly crunching tannins. A light-bodied but balanced wine of understatement and elegance.
title: Dopff Au Moulin 2016 The Furst Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Cherry fruit shines here, balanced against well-managed acids and tannins. Some unspecified barrel aging adds hints of chocolate wafer. Despite its youth, this is already drinking quite well and should be consumed over the next half decade.
title: Duck Pond 2016 Willamette Valley Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A single block of Dijon 114 is the source here. This shows medium concentration in mixed berry flavors and peppery herbs. The balancing acidity brings a pleasing minerality. Drink now through 2020.
title: Holloran 2013 La Colina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The opening scents bring traces of citrus, leather and vanilla, and such flavors are subtly conveyed in the mouth. Compact red berries with dried Italian herbs distinguish the midpalate, and the tannins are substantial and firm up the finish.
title: Hamacher 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Tasted a few months ahead of its official release, this is a bright, fresh mix of cranberry, raspberry and cherry fruit. The flavors are crisp and clear, and the mouthfeel is already supple, with citrus highlights. It should be drinking quite nicely by the back half of this year.
title: Laelaps 2016 Nemarniki Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Aromas of medicinal herb, bread crust and wild cherry follow over to the lively palate along with pink grapefruit, thyme and mineral. Bright acidity and an invigorating perlage accompany the bright flavors while a note of bitter walnut marks the close.
title: Le Marchesine 2013 Blanc de Noir Brut  (Franciacorta)

description: A subtle note of ripe, red cherry plays on the nose, along with the merest hint of conifer that becomes more vivid on the palate. The body is slender, light and unforced. This is a very honest, easy and traditional Pinot, made with an admirably light touch.
title: Allimant-Laugner 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Perfumed aromas of cherry, anise, licorice and dried rose burst from the glass. Light in body and with vibrant acidity, the palate offers tart red-cherry and cranberry flavors broadened by cedar, baking spice and velvety tannins. The medium-length finish is sultry, with notes of brandied cherries and cedar spice.
title: Bel Lago 2013 North Vineyard Pinot Noir (Leelanau Peninsula)

description: The nose is still under a cloud of reduction yet a vivid cherry aroma shines through. The palate offers the freshness of conifer, with fine tannins and a pleasant, youthful crunch. It is savorines that is in the foreground here, bewitching with spice and pervasive freshness. An easy, fresh but authentic Pinot.
title: Cave du Roi Dagobert 2016 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Fleshy red cherry notes are expansive on the nose. These tones are equally expressive on the palate where they have a counterpoint of freshness. The body is textured with fine tannins, keeping the feel light and fluid. A lovely, easy and fruit-driven wine.
title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: A fine value, this widely available Pinot doesn't shy away from its natural herbaceousness, but compensates with plenty of bright berry-cherry fruit. The compact tannins support a firm blackberry and black cherry core, and flavors persist on through a clean crisp finish.
title: Duck Pond 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A savory touch of undergrowth blends in with the tart, fresh cherry scent on the nose. The same savory and fruity combination dominates the palate. This offers tart cherry fruit, a fine crunch tannins and ample, bright acidity on the light body.
title: Preiss-Zimmer 2016 Réserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This is essentially a barrel select winemaker's blend. Mixing oranges, raspberries and cherries in the fruit bowl, it has more palate weight than you might expect given the low alcohol. The tannins have a little extra grip, and leave a light trail of cocoa powder in the aftertaste.
title: Amalie Robert 2013 Amalie's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Red cherry with just a lick of black cherry dominate the nose. The palate tones this exuberant fruit down a little but pairs it with bright freshness. The body remains light throughought and has enticing edges of conifer.
title: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Fleshy red and black cherry aromas set the tone on the nose. The palate adds lots of freshness that is toned down by strucutre. Fine tannins add grip but this is all about hedonistic fruit with a clean, grippy finish. Drink soon.
title: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Les Jardins Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Pretty fruit flavors of raspberry and cherry come together, balanced against juicy acids. It was 30% whole cluster fermented and aged in 15% new oak, which remains well in the background. Another year or two of bottle age might well improve this wine a point or two.
title: Duck Pond 2016 Dundee Hills Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Rounded red-cherry fruit meets with aromas of potpourri and caramelized oak on the nose of this fairly priced bottling. The oak is very prominent on the palate, lending vanilla and hickory flavors to the red currant and clove base. Acidity washes into the finish.
title: Cambiata 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Despite its remarkably low alcohol, this well-made wine broadly displays flavors of nectarine, pie cherry and chocolate. As expected, there is ample acidity, but not too much to turn the whole thing sour. Just two barrels were produced, one new and one neutral.
title: Amalie Robert 2013 Wadenswil Clone Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A rather heady nose of red cherry rises from the glass alongside a note of oak. The palate is fluid and slender, with lovely freshness that frames the heightened tones. The tannins are firm and the finish is refreshing. This needs some time to knit together. Drink 2020–2028.
title: Charles Sparr 2016 Collection Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Tart red cherry freshness and a hint of conifer play gently on the nose. The palate brings both these tones to the fore. This is a light-bodied, elegant Pinot Noir for those who like it on the lighter side.
title: Charles Sparr 2016 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The gentle touch of the winemaker is clearly visible in this soft but substantial effort. Light cherry fruit, a streak of mocha and a hint of hazelnut combine gracefully. The tannins have a pleasant chalkiness. Native yeasts were employed, giving an extra dash of depth and complexity.
title: Willful 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a surprisingly fine reminiscence of Burgundian Pinot Noir, from the perfumed red fruits to the generous tannins. The wine has acidity and, despite its alcohol, has a fresh feel. The wine is at its most fruity stage and will age another year, so drink from 2017.
title: Casa Ermelinda Freitas 2013 Reserva Pinot Noir (Península de Setúbal)

description: This is a light, clear and moderately oaked vineyard-designate from a tremendous Westside Road site. Pomegranate, rhubarb and cherry-orange play on the palate in lithe, ethereal and elegant ways, remaining light bodied and refined throughout.
title: Ousterhout 2013 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The fragrant mix of flowers and fruit introduces a wine already moving into secondary fruit flavors. Strawberry and cherry components are softened with highlights of cola and caramel. There's a hint of orange creeping into the hue around the rim. Drink now through 2018.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2013 Bovine Vineyards Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: High-toned red fruit wraps around jolts of black tea in this savory, structured and nicely made vineyard-designate, a full-bodied, burly wine. Drinking well upon opening, it develops nuance and character in the glass as it goes along.
title: Matrix 2013 R. Buoncristiani Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A mix of Pommard and 667 clones, this spent 16 months in 18% new French oak. By no means oaky in flavor, it balances highlights of chocolate and baking spices with plenty of pretty raspberry and cherry fruit. There's a dusting of dried herbs as it rolls into a palate-pleasing finish.
title: Torii Mor 2013 Alloro Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Candied cherry, strawberry and a bright minerality highlight this wine, with additional accents of herb and earth. Simultaneously fresh and bold, it features a creamy texture that's near velvety but denser, leading up to a powerful finish.
title: Renteria 2013 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

description: Everything in this full-bodied wine comes in big helpings, from the deep garnet color to aromas of rich oak and ripe fruit, to the mouthfilling black-cherry flavors. Yet it doesn't go over the top and achieves a high-level complexity that's delicious.
title: Walt 2013 Savoy Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This blend of Pommard, Coury and Dijon 667 clones shows bright cherry fruit, bedecked with lovely spices. It's round and forward, with medium weight and depth.
title: Torii Mor 2013 Olson Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Spicy strawberry and cherry hover over forest floor and a tangle of tangy acidity that keeps this wine fresh and vibrantly compelling. Full bodied and robust, it maintains a balance in the glass, making it both food-friendly and an option on its own.
title: Bougetz 2013 The Cairn Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: One of Adam Lee's more affordable appellation blends, this delivers a lot of bang for the buck, with aromas of extracted strawberry, rich plum, sandalwood and a slate backbone. Soft red fruit starts the palate, then sharpens into cranberry, with lots of herbal spice and acidic sizzle throughout.
title: Siduri 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The appellation blend from this relatively young but widely regarded property, this offers gravel, wet clay, purple and red fruits and lots of earth tones on the nose. Cranberry and sour-cherry fruit show on the palate, with eucalyptus oil in the midpalate and wet river stones and orange zest on the finish.
title: Presqu'ile 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Meaning “from the vine,” this 100% whole-cluster bottling presents black cherry, tart pomegranate, graphite, baking spice and sage bark on the nose. There's lots of dark herbs and dark fruit on the palate as well as black-olive depth and black-slate minerality. With the density of herbs, it's a bit like chewing on sage and eucalyptus.
title: Wrath 2013 Ex Vite Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: This is a pretty rose hue, and follows in a light, tart style. Despite its apparent simplicity, it shows surprising depth of flavor, highlighted with fresh strawberries and Bing cherries. There's a touch of Juicy Fruit gum also, and the wine should be consumed now through 2020.
title: Carlton Hill 2013 Estate Pinot Noir

description: This big, dense wine is dark in color, with lush, late-picked aromas and flavors and very full body. Its power and oozing fruitiness make quite a contrast with more elegant styles, but there is no denying the appeal of all that jammy blackberry and blackcurrant character.
title: Walt 2013 The Corners Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This unfined and unfiltered wine carries itself lightly, as is appropriate to the vintage and the grape. It's clean and delicate, with light raspberry fruit and hints of leaf and dried herb.
title: R. Stuart & Co. 2013 Vignette Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This pure Pommard-clone bottling offers lighter red fruit with highlights of cocoa and baking spices. The balance is good, and this should age well and develop interesting aromatics if cellared. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Torii Mor 2013 Nysa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Wet slate, cinnamon and allspice notes meet with red cherry, baked black cherry and bramble on the nose of this bottling from a popular single-vineyard source. Clay and chalky earth notes show on the palate, which is very full and rich with tart cherry, black plum and pencil-lead flavors.
title: Krutz 2013 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Blending fruit from four vineyards, this opens with dusty aromatics of rose petals, baking spices and cocoa. The mouthfeel continues in a pleasantly dusty vein, showing tart berry and pie-cherry flavors with a lick of mocha.
title: Vercingetorix VX 2013 Caroline's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Firm but fully ripe, this mixes black cherry and dark chocolate in a tight and chewy style. It's already showing a slight hint of browning, but aerating it aggressively is recommended, or wait until 2017–2018 before drinking.
title: Alchemist 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A light color goes with delicate aromas and subtle fruit and spice flavors in this medium-bodied wine. But it does not lack good balance or interesting nuances, including red cherry, cinnamon and cedar notes, and nice, bracing tannins.
title: Mignanelli 2013 Romas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Bracing and fresh, this crisp, red-berried Pinot Noir boasts an invigorating mineral sheen. It's a spry, slightly lean wine but framed elegantly with fine, feathery tannins. Drink now through 2018.
title: Grafen Neipperg 2013 Trocken Spätburgunder (Württemberg)

description: Complex and dry, this has smoky, woodsy aromas and exotic flavors like black tea, soy and cranberry. The balance is good, due to firm tannins and acidity that combine for a mouthfeel with a little bite. It's very nice in a slightly rustic style.
title: Kendric 2013 Proprietor Grown Pinot Noir (Marin County)

description: This appellation blend is rich and lush with baked black-cherry aromas, touches of black cardamom and clove spice, and earthy rhubarb and beet notes. The palate packs a lot of forest-floor flavors, from loam to pine needles, into dark cranberry and tight raspberry fruit, leveled by pepper and pencil lead.
title: Ken Brown 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine has a deep color, strong fruity aromas and substantial fruit flavors. Full bodied and moderately tannic, it has a good, grippy mouthfeel and honest black-cherry and plum notes. Tasty now it will improve through 2018 or so.
title: Baxter 2013 Run Dog Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Add this bottling to the growing list of worthy Oregon Pinots under $20. Light and balanced, it offers spicy cranberry and rhubarb with a streak of red licorice. It's a good everyday wine for salmon and light poultry dishes.
title: R. Stuart & Co. 2013 Big Fire Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: A good value for the quality, this wine is smooth and velvety. Easy drinking, it offers an integrated texture dotted in dark cherry, allspice and plum. Full bodied, it remains soft and approachable from start to finish.
title: Castle Rock 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Fruity and forward, this is a pretty, approachable wine with bright berry and cherry fruit. There's a strong note of citrus, particularly orange flesh and rind, and it's the sort of no-nonsense, gluggable wine that one rarely finds associated with Pinot Noir. This will be best enjoyed by 2018.
title: Rex Hill 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Cherry compote and a flair of kirsch preside over well-tended acidity in this full-bodied wine. Earthy lavender and herb give the wine an ethereal character atop solid, velvety texture and a big oak finish.
title: Robert Mondavi 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros-Napa Valley)

description: Offering a light-toned taste of raspberry coulis with well-defined acidity, this is a soft, silky vineyard-designate with a lilt of orange peel. A wall of tannins guards the finish.
title: La Pitchoune 2013 Holder Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine speaks to cool-climate with a crispness of rhubarb and strawberry deftly held together by beguiling cinnamon, clove and a bouquet of rose petals. Spicy in acidity, it evolves in the glass to become velvety and seductive in texture, ending in a lingering warmth and depth.
title: Kokomo 2013 Peters Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Gorgeous, deep dark-fruit aromas waft from the glass in this vivid, racy and pure wine. A concentrated but not heavy black-cherry note starts in the aroma, drives through the flavors and on to the lingering finish. Bracing acidity and fine but firm tannins add an elegant, appetizing mouthfeel. It will improve through 2022.
title: E16 2013 The West End Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: From a vineyard within the Santa Rosa Plains, this wine opens in pretty, floral aromas of violet and gentle rose. Seductive, it follows with bursts of blood orange and wild strawberry that remain faint and delicate on the palate, light and clear in color, and elegant in intensity. Still, there's enough backbone to the wine to keep it fresh and alive through the long finish.
title: Gary Farrell 2013 Toboni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From the producer's estate vineyard, adjacent to a successful dairy farm it also runs, this tiny offering comes from four specific blocks across the property, and is a seductive, juicy, well-composed wine. Lush and oaky, it conveys a density of forest floor, complemented by raspberry and strawberry, before finishing robustly in spice and mushroom.
title: Bucher 2013 Three Sixty Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Clear and light in color, this complex vineyard-designate sings in tea and nutmeg spice, allowing for richer, riper flavors of baked cherry. Velvety in texture, it builds to a full-figured finish, echoing that initial savory intrigue of black tea.
title: Lucie 2013 Dutton Ranch Widdoes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine from the Palos Verdes coastline is redolent with sagebrush, crushed anise and alpine strawberries on the herbally aromatic nose. The sage also powers the palate, alongside juniper and pine, all set against a wild berry frame. This is a big Pinot, though it is relatively light in structure and happily reliant on savory herbs rather than overly ripe fruits.
title: Villa Oneiro 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Brawny in flavorful black cherry, this well-crafted wine from a prime vineyard is plush with cinnamon and structured tannins. Floral in aroma, it tastes of strawberry and black cherry, with a seasoning of black pepper on the finish. Drink now through 2023.
title: Lutum 2013 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Light in color this wine features gorgeous acidity and a lining of fresh, vibrant red cherry, adorned completely by a pretty rose-petal bouquet. Though gentle in color and body, the texture moves along, providing plenty of body to keep the wine freshly alive.
title: Kokomo 2013 Peters Vineyard Gopher Hill Block Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A pleasant rose-petal pink in color, this wine by regional sparkling veteran Norm Yost shows red-grapefruit pulp and skin, lime spritz and a shred of bubble gum on the nose, playing both on hedonism and restraint. It's extremely refreshing once sipped, with more lime and pink grapefruit zest.
title: Goat Bubbles 2013 Solomon Hills Vineyard Sparkling Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This tastes complex, mellow and delicious, showing diverse aroma nuances like bay leaf and forest floor in addition to more fruity, black cherry, cinnamon and clove notes. It is full bodied, very ripe and juicy, and feels smooth in texture thanks to subdued acidity and tannins.
title: Masút 2013 Two Barrel Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

description: A small-production wine from a new producer, this impresses in plush red- and black-cherry, tangy minerality and a refreshing cloud of citrus that gives it buoyancy on the palate. This medium-bodied wine is fresh and alive from start to finish and will be delightful at the table.
title: RMH 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Earthy, juicy and leathery, this wine was made from three clones of Pinot Noir. Each was fermented separately with a percentage of whole cluster, then blended together for this age-worthy concoction that's complex and compelling. Pomegranate and fig combine on the palate, along with more savory elements of allspice and coconut, finishing with a crispness of orange. Cellar through 2023.
title: Reuling Vineyard 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This really elegant Pinot Noir has good color as well as a perfumed, aromatic character. The fruit is ripe cherries, supported by a light tannic layer. Acidity gives this wine freshness as well as suggesting that it could age. Drink from 2017.
title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2013  Sancerre

description: From an unusual appellation for the grape, this wine offers a whisper of rose on the nose. A substantial layering and weight of black cherry and raspberry pounce the palate, with a back beat of oak. Savory and smoky, it remains balanced and well structured, keeping up through a lengthy finish.
title: E16 2013 Bowland Ranch Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)

description: This is an impressive wine at the price and production level, a great go-to for multiple occasions. It delivers earthy, candied strawberry around a light, bright core, remaining soft and smooth in texture and intensity, finishing with a tease of milk chocolate.
title: La Crema 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Earth and rocks power the nose of this wine by veteran Dan Lee, with chipped slate, cinnamon, bramble berries and smoked meat aromas. The palate blends black cherries with black rocks, black sage, licorice and herb-crusted beef roast flavors.
title: Morgan 2013 12 Clones Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Fresh ripe raspberry aromas are cut with cranberry-skin tartness in this wine by Josh Baker and Matt Brain. They have also managed to sneak blood, pencil shavings, eucalyptus and vanilla stick into the nose of this appellation blend. It's lively and tasty with ripe, tart red fruits once sipped, juicy yet cut with chaparral scrub elements.
title: Baker & Brain 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: A whiff of smoky campfire opens this wine, followed by an unlikely counterpoint of lavender. Notes of black cherry and strawberry then unfurl, along with plenty of earthy mushroom and forest floor. The wine reveals a tension of weight and body as it evolves in the glass, with a bite of tannin on the finish. Let it open a bit.
title: E16 2013 Trenton 1880 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There's an intensely rustic earthiness to this wine, complemented by white pepper and nutmeg. Medium bodied, it also offers sizzling acidity and tart red cherry. Lithe, it builds toward a robust, ripe end. Cellar through 2017–2020 or give it a few swirls before enjoying.
title: Lucie 2013 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Showing good balance, this wine tastes focused, bright and lively. Firm acidity and tannins back up generous, ripe cherry and black plum flavors. It feels ultrasmooth on the palate and is a pleasure to sip.
title: Pfendler 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This shows a brownish cast to the garnet color, then reveals wonderful aromas of dried cherry and forest floor. These partner with a firm, dry and appetizing texture and lean but bright cranberry, black tea and cardamom flavors.
title: Easton 2013 Duarte-Georgetown Pinot Noir (Sierra Foothills)

description: The Niven family's winemaker, Christian Roguenant, teases smoked meats, blackberry paste, dark slate, aromatic red cherries and concentratied hibiscus from the nose of this wine. The palate shows plenty of ripe, red fruit, but is made interesting by woody herbs, including oregano and marjoram.
title: Baileyana 2013 Firepeak Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: A plush texture and oodles of tasty berry and cherry flavor make this medium-bodied wine hard to resist. Scents of pine forest, wild blackberries and mellow spices like nutmeg and clove give it complexity. The mouthfeel is smooth and supple, and the finish is soft and lingering.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2013 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir (California)

description: The partnership between vintner Bill Price and winemaker Gavin Chanin, Lutum continues to impress, aiming for elegance without giving up flavor or body. Tightly wound, a signature perhaps of the vintage, this wine is still subtle, suggesting rhubarb and cherry atop forest floor. Smooth, it hides elusive power on the significant finish.
title: Lutum 2013 Durell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a full-bodied and full-flavored wine with rich and deep aromas, ripe fruit flavors and a texture that feels substantial but polished. It starts with black cherry and woodsy aromas, then goes to lively but broad cherry, plum and nutmeg notes. The finish stays flavorful and dry.
title: The Withers Winery 2013 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Smoky cinnamon and nutmeg pierce the entry of this wine, a dense, full-bodied expression of place. Layers of rich cherry and strawberry lie over classic varietal earthiness, finishing medium in length.
title: Acacia 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Slate, cola, black cherry, rose petal and violet show strongly on the nose of this wine, a well-priced blend of grapes from Lucas & Lewellen, Bentrock, Radian and Pence vineyards. The palate is earthy and deeply, darkly spiced, showing juniper, black cherry and beet juice.
title: Pali 2013 Huntington Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Cinnamon and other brown spices meet with iron, turned earth and dried cranberry for a slightly funky and sour nose. The palate offers a plush red-cherry flavor at first, followed by an earthy pencil-lead-driven note. Tart raspberry and graphite minerality emerge in the midpalate, followed by loam and coffee grinds toward the finish.
title: E16 2013 Upper Bench Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Earthy strawberry hulls and a candied cherry element make for an inviting entry into this wine. It's an elegant, balanced red, with a landscape of power in the background. Zesty acidity buoys the proceedings, keeping the wine refreshing on the palate and through the lengthy finish.
title: E16 2013 E16 Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This balanced wine manages to retain some heft on the palate. A triple threat of ripe berry, cinnamon and forested notes combine effortlessly around a core of vibrant acidity. Medium bodied and lengthy on the finish, it needs to open to reveal its charms.
title: Amici 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This vintage sparkler is made via méthode Champenoise, though true Champagnes get much more aging prior to release. But here you find the exuberant fruit of Oregon done in a brut style. It's almost explosive, with crisp apple and peppery Asian pear fruit. Clean and bracing, it carries nicely through a lush finish.
title: Sokol Blosser 2013 Sparkling Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The oak peeks through, set against proportionate strawberry and cherry fruit which has been lightly ripened. It's not a big wine, but it is balanced, and was barrel-aged for 18 months in a percentage of French oak. It should drink well now through 2022.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2013 Woodhall Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This mixes darker shades of berry and cherry fruit, with a streak of tobacco and well-managed tannins. It's polished and carries moderate weight through the finish.
title: Rocky Point 2013 La Colina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This wine is spicy in forest floor and sage. Strawberry hull and cranberry notes mark the light-bodied palate, with a tightly-woven tapestry of subtle tannin.
title: Alma Fria 2013 Dona Margarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Herbal and weedy on the nose, this supple yet light-bodied wine is laced with sanguine wisps of cranberry and pomegranate, with an almost carpet-like texture to the tannins. It's varietal and delicate in approach.
title: Fleur de California 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: From estate-grown Pommard clone fruit, this wine shows earthy forest notes against moderate acidity and mellow oak. Medium-bodied, it plays well on the palate with a balance of cranberry and clove flavors.
title: Ancient Oak Cellars 2013 Siebert Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a pleasant bottle, with delicate fruit flavors that suggest watermelon and strawberry—nothing riper. There's a distinct impression of white balsamic vinegar, adding a high-toned lift that's just on the edge of too much, at least for some tasters.
title: Cathedral Ridge 2013 Dampier Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: Temperance Hill grapes are sourced for this Pinot Noir project. Barrel spices dominate, with tart berry fruit in the background. It's a solid effort, though it thins out and feels a bit stripped in the finish.
title: Sparkman 2013 L'Autre Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Ripe, almost-sweet fruit flavors dominate this full-bodied, soft-textured wine. It's a richer, oakier style of Pinot than most but will make a lot of people happy with its easy-going, welcoming personality.
title: Lander-Jenkins 2013 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This is muscular and sturdy for a Pinot Noir, with savory notes of mushrooms, beets and earth that add to that impression. While it lacks precision and elegance, it does offer a chunky mouthful of Pinot with ample length and intensity to the finish.
title: D'Arenberg 2013 The Feral Fox Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: Spritzy and spicy, this wine is ripe with black cherry and baked plum fruit and a strong streak of earthy forest floor. Moderate acidity supports the girth of the fruit.
title: Ancient Oak Cellars 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an earthy, minty, tart and taut wine, worthy of its appellation. It offers light-bodied notions of black tea, cranberry and rhubarb.
title: Carneros Ranch 2013 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Simple and thinly textured, this wine shows a mixture of plum and wild strawberry fruit against a backdrop of fresh earth.
title: Stephen Vincent 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: It's not clear what separates this from some of the other estate-grown cuvées. The thin strawberry fruit accompanies rather stemmy tannins and a green vegetal streak.
title: Montinore 2013 Cataclysm Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a thick, syrupy-rich wine that traffics in candied cherry and oak flavors.It has appeal but lacks varietal character.
title: Merriam 2013 Cuvée Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Cranberries and pie cherries give a crisp, almost citrusy, edge to this wine. The tannins are silky and there's some appealing clove-like spice as well, but the acids are elevated, making the wine come across as tart and ungenerous.
title: Stable Hill 2013 The Little Villager Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: Sometimes high-toned volatile wines can benefit from the added lift to the nose and the fruit, but here it's a bit out of hand. The volatility carries into the flavors, brightening the tart fruit but tasting too close to nail polish in the finish.
title: Cathedral Ridge 2013 Bangsund Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Valley (OR))

description: The oak is rough and rustic and blows away all fruit and nuance. There's a whiff of leathery barnyard also.
title: Bradley 2013 Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)

description: This bottling kicks off with a strikingly distinct aromatic profile recalling an elegant fruit punch, with hibiscus, raspberry sorbet, sour-cherry candy, sandalwood, incense and an underlying anise scent. Plump raspberry shows on the rounded red-fruit palate, with a minty, herbal touches of cedar and tobacco.
title: Thomas Fogarty 2013 Kent Berry Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Herbal and chaparral-driven, this bottling from a specific estate block shows bay leaf, thyme, oregano and menthol notes against a ripe cranberry aromatic base. The earthy palate offers beet, rhubarb, oregano, marjoram and anise. Camphor, juniper and pine needle kick in toward the finish.
title: Wrights Station 2013 Arena Block Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Deep aromas of hibiscus, rose buds, dark red berries and sugar plums are spiced up by cola, crushed pencils and lots of garrigue on this bottling. The palate is clean and crisp, with snappy raspberry, light cranberry and lots more chaparral-like herbs, including wild thyme, bay laurel, lavender and fennel pollen.
title: Kynsi 2013 Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Bright and ready-to-burst flavors of raspberry and just-ripe cranberry show on the nose of this bottling that also features tartness and graphite minerality alongside vanilla and baking spice. More of an underripe character shows on the forest-floor palate, where thyme and marjoram mix with tangy red fruit, pine needle and juniper.
title: Wolff 2013 Dijon Clones Selection Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Turned earth is very apparent on the nose of this bottling from the historic vineyard, with crushed shale and loam dust as well as cinnamon spice and a red-cherry backbone. The sip shows deep pomegranate and black-raspberry fruit with gingerbread, hibiscus and a touch of thyme. It's rich in the midpalate, with extreme spice throughout.
title: Kynsi 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Beet and dark cranberry juice make for a very deep red-fruit entry to this bottling that is lifted by bay leaf, thyme and anise on the nose. It's easy, clean and refreshing in a lighter style on the sip, with dried strawberry and red plum spiced up by star anise and fennel.
title: Wrights Station 2013 Cave Block Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A curious mix of roasted smokiness and red fruits makes for an appetizing autumnal nose. The red fruit underneath these flavors is beautifully pure and speaks of raspberry and wild strawberries. The wonderfully refreshing tartness zips across the palate like a bright streak of light and gives freshness, direction and poise to everything. The flavors are lasting and long.
title: Bründlmayer 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)

description: There's no doubt this estate-grown wine is at first funky on the nose, a mix of forest, mint and farmhouse cheese. It develops in the glass to embrace its quirks, complementing them with vibrant acidity, ripe texture, and hints of orange, rhubarb and spicy clove.
title: Acacia 2013 Winery Lake Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This satisfyingly full-bodied, dense wine offers a wealth of baked strawberry complemented by a fistful of clove, cinnamon and Asian five-spice. The tannins are firm and supported by moderate acidity, while strong elements of forest floor and sautéed mushroom add to the savory nature of it all.
title: Ziata 2013 Chenoweth Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Spicy cardamom adds to the exotic perfume that opens this wine that is juicy in acidity and bright with crisp red cherry. Refreshing, it takes on more weight and substance as it glides effortlessly to the finish.
title: David Bruce 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Clean and classic aromas of dark-red fruit, from cherry to bramble, meet with candied rose petal and clove aromas on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate is led by allspice and dried mint, all packaged in a medium-bodied format.
title: Bernardus 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Peppery herbs lead the nose on this bottling, with sagebrush, bay leaf and rust giving depth to the light cranberry and raspberry fruit. The palate is earthy with juniper and turned-loam flavors, plus more bay leaf, iron cranberry and some rhubarb.
title: Blair 2013 Delfina's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: High-toned acidity provides a backbone of structure amid the otherwise luscious profile of this wine that's delightfully light and bright in pomegranate, black cherry and spicy citrus. Deliciously juicy and textured on the palate, it finishes with a touch of tobacco and black tea.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2013 Fox Den Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: A rugged and feral quality marks the nose of this excellent wine. Black raspberry and plum aromas are laid across savory beef fat, dried sage and scents of mint, pencil lead and Indian spice. The mouthfeel is soft and the palate is meaty, with baked plum, black cherry, black cardamom and raw beef flavors, lifted by a minty quality.
title: Fess Parker 2013 Parker West Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The mighty Hirsch rises to the occasion of a burly, near-perfect vintage, showing off its ability to be brawny and brainy at the same time. Black fruit, tar and tea take center stage, with an intensely tannic underbelly specked in wild herb and smoke. This baby needs time. Drink now after decanting or cellar through 2023.
title: Williams Selyem 2013 Hirsch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Satisfying waves of black cherry and cola combine in force in this rich, seductive and juicy vineyard-designate. Made in a full-bodied, robust style, it integrates the firm tannin into a supporting role, finishing in spicy clove.
title: MacPhail 2013 Lakeview Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: From a cool-climate site farmed by the Dutton family, Manzana is beguilingly floral in dried rose petals. Soft, sublime and tangy, the palate conveys orange and cranberry. Light in color, this wine offers plenty of body and weight, with fresh blackberry compote on the finish. The wine will age well; drink now through 2023.
title: MacRostie 2013 Manzana Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: The nose on this wine is ruggedly rich and aggressive in all the right ways, with stewed plums, meaty blackberry fruit and dense baking spices of clove and black cardamom. The palate shows heavy brambleberry and black-cherry richness, with strong Indian spice of garam masala as well as cinnamon and coriander. It's complex and delicious.
title: Expression 34 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine has rich, almost sweet fruit aromas and vivid fruit flavors generously accented by clove, cinnamon and other spicy oak influences. The wine has full body, firm and supportive tannins and a lingering spiced-fruit finish. Best drink it after 2018 when the flavors will have married together.
title: Williams Selyem 2013 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

description: From a Charlie Chenoweth-farmed site, this wine is vividly marked by earth and mushroom with bolts of cherry and cranberry. Bright acidity complements a firmness of tannin and texture that flirts with being leathery, the finish all about cola spice.
title: MacRostie 2013 Cummings Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From the northernmost appellation of the Côte de Nuits, this firm and solidly tannic wine comes from one of the vineyards on the list to get Premier Cru approval in the near future. Its tannins are well balanced already with the red-berry fruit and bitter-cherry flavors that are shot through with acidity. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Huguenot 2013 Champs-Perdrix  (Marsannay)

description: There's a feral quality to this single-vineyard bottling, with dried rose petals, damp pine needles, dehydrated shiitake mushrooms and touches of violet, potpourri and dried ginger on the nose. The mouthfeel is velvety, with lilac and lavender decorating a base of cranberry and boysenberry fruit.
title: Fess Parker 2013 Ashley's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Still firm and tannic, this dense wine will need some time to develop. It has dark tannins and concentrated red-plum and berry flavors. A smoky background from the wood aging will soften over the next year. However with the tannins, the wine should not be drunk before 2020.
title: Domaine Huguenot 2013 Les Crais  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Great fruit flavors and a lively, fresh texture come together for a very well-balanced and vivid-tasting wine. Just enough tannin and grape acidity provide an agile, appetizing structure to let the fresh red and black cherry notes stand out. Fermented with native yeast and aged in neutral barrels., it will be best after 2018.
title: Red Car 2013 Manchester Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

description: Made in a toasty, richer style, this bottling shows cherry cola, blackberry brioche, oak-smoked plums and roast beef on the action-packed nose. The palate is dense, with black cherry, blackberry and black plum fruit layered across roasted-pork flavors.
title: Walt 2013 Rita's Crown Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This firm wine is solid with tannins while also having the fruitiness of the year. A dry element will allow the wine to age balanced, with bright juicy fruits shining through. It comes from one of the lesser-known premier cru vineyards in Beaune. Drink from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2013 Montée Rouge Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Burly oak and tannin surround black and blue fruit sourced from a vineyard atop a knoll in the cool Green Valley. Earth and herb come into play midpalate, providing a savory underbelly beneath the power. This wine needs time; cellar through 2023.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2013 Dutton Ranch Emerald Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Eucalyptus leaf, black raspberry and black cherry aromas combine for a sultry nose on this bottling, one of this producer's many expressions of individual sites in the region. Herbes du provence show on the sip, then flavors settle into gravel and graphite minerality, all based on dark strawberry and plum fruit.
title: Foley 2013 JA Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The second vintage by this producer from this highly regarded vineyard, this wine shows how racy the site can be, cooled from Petaluma Gap winds and fog and yet also robustly capable of ripe, rich red fruit. Measured acidity buoys a densely concentrated wine chewy and bright in pine, dark cherry, cranberry, strawberry and earth. The finish is lean and citrusy. Drink now through 2023.
title: Three Sticks 2013 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine has gorgeous ripe fruit aromas, mouth-filling flavors and a plush, generous texture. A hint of smoke shades the ripe black-cherry aromas. Layered flavors of clove, cedar, pomegranate and rosemary intermingle on the palate. Despite the ripeness and full body, a fine coat of tannins and supportive acidity keep the mouthfeel fresh and appetizing.
title: V. Sattui 2013 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This likable wine has juicy and bright core, a mix of spicy cola-cherry and forest floor nested in firm, integrated tannins that works seamlessly on the palate. A full-bodied wine, it has power and grace.
