title: Row Eleven 2013 Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: This distinctive wine has a light to medium color, with complex and somewhat earthy aromas. Very tasty and diverse flavors suggest black tea and rhubarb. It has medium body, a soothing, smooth texture and lingering finish.
title: Freeman 2013 Gloria Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Dark fruit shows on the palate in this exotically spiced and floral blend from several vineyards, including Sangiacomo Roberts Road. Soft and medium in weight, it has high-toned acidity underneath the brooding spice and forest floor.
title: Eric Kent 2013 Sascha Marie Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Big flavors, full body and assertive tannins balance each other to make this out-sized wine a winner. It has ripe black cherry and dried fig aromas, gushing fruit flavors and a broad texture, but the firm tannins keep it from tasting fat. It's hardly delicate, but definitely delicious.
title: Expression 39 2013 Anderson Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Dark cranberry and cola scents mesh with sage and roasted fennel on the nose of this bottling, an ode to Bill Foley's Texas rancher ancestors. Cranberry and black cherry greet the palate while roasting spices of marjoram and thyme add complexity, before bright tannins and brisk tartness carry into the finish.
title: Foley 2013 Bar Lazy S Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a smooth, ripe and fruity wine. A strong spicy character just avoids too much wood toastiness, but points up the red-cherry flavors, young acidity and tannins. From vineyards next to Gevrey-Chambertin, this will develop well into a perfumed, fruity wine. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Huguenot 2013 Petits Crais  (Fixin)

description: From the producer best known for its own Anderson Valley estate wines, this Pinot is varietally rustic in pine needle, dark, baked plum and smoky oak, the oak stylistically reminiscent of many of its other wines. Mellowed acidity complements the burliness and ripeness of the fruit before a lengthy, Asian-spiced finish.
title: Black Kite 2013 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The winery's larger production offering, this is made from a handful of vineyards, including many used in vineyard-designates. Blending prowess shows in this wine that explodes in plum and clove. Tight, bright acid buoys flavors of strawberry, cranberry and orange, with a twisted funk of earth on the finish.
title: MacRostie 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Black-cherry compote rises on the entry of this wine that's medium in acidity and use of oak, with a punchy sense of sleek, savory fruit and baking spices. Friendly and fleshy, it's a meatier exploration of the variety by the producer, with a rounded, lengthy finish.
title: Zepaltas 2013 W.E. Bottoms Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This native fermentation, unfiltered wine employs 25% whole-cluster and a low amount of new French oak. It's light and clear in color with a concentrated hit of mint, eucalyptus and pine around a strength of strawberry and vanilla, gently nested in oak. It opens slowly in the glass.
title: Wait Cellars 2013 Devoto Garden Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Sourced from two vineyards, including Sangiacomo Amaral Ranch, a cool site near the bay, this is a tremendous offering for the price. The wine is light, bright and brambly in raspberry and cherry kirsch, with a mischievous streak of cola. Pretty and fresh, it finishes in a tease of black tea.
title: Bench 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Full-figured tannins wrap luxuriously around textured layers of cranberry and black cherry in this blockbuster wine. A subtle minerality forms in the background, represented best by the taste of orange peel, before it finishes densely concentrated. Drink now through 2021.
title: Corner 103 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The recent vintages from this Santa Maria-based winery of actress Challen Cates and winemaker Kevin Law are some of the most impressive wines out there. This is dark in the glass, with a rich bouquet of cinnamon-clove foam, black plum pudding and hot pastry. It hits the palate with panache and power, showing allspice, dried ginger and sharp cola notes atop rich black cherry fruit.
title: Challen 2013 Bentrock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Earthy and gamy aromas of rust and blood meet with red cherry juice and cola on the nose of this bottling by Trey Fletcher from the region's most coastal property. It's soft on the palate, with light strawberry, tangy cranberry and red plum fruit, but it's the garrigue components of thyme and eucalyptus that take it to the next level. Add lively energy and it soars.
title: Solomon Hills 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Soft, and dancing in strong, present acidity, this wine honors the vineyard site in its bright, fresh components of rhubarb and pomegranate. Within the freshness and savory seasonings of sage and black tea, it remains boldly robust and ripe, with plenty of density.
title: Argot 2013 Saralee's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This comes from a dry-farmed site, all the better to coax out its stony minerality and delicate aromas of rose garden an d geranium. Fully expressive, it's voluptuous and lushly balanced, offering wild strawberry and tons of forest floor.
title: Joseph Jewell 2013 Hallberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Sourced from a hillside block of the vineyard, Floodgate is about juicy, velvety texture with a side of grip, offering a fully decadent mouthfeel and sense of luxury. Floral on the nose, its flavors are nuanced, a touch of strawberry and cherry dotted in cola spice.
title: Joseph Jewell 2013 Floodgate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Funky in spearmint and a carbonic notion of freshness, this wine offers cranberry and barely ripe strawberry, adding to its sense of delicacy. Mild shakes of white pepper play on the palate, as the finish finds a bolder weight of tannin.
title: Argot 2013 Madras Steiner Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

description: A plump nose full of fruit and spice shows black raspberry and mace. The palate is well fleshed out, with a range of fruit-forward flavors, including mulberry and exotic plum. Graphite minerality binds it together, surrounding tangy acidity.
title: Challen 2013 Scarlett Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Spicy cola and strawberry form around a moderate body of ripeness and dense texture in this vineyard designate from a cool-climate appellation. Vanilla and smoke contribute additional flavor and complexity, while a sharpness of acidity finds its way on the finish.
title: Talisman 2013 Jamison Valley Vineyard Destein Estate Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)

description: Form one block of the vineyard, this wine offers a substantial cradling of oak, pushing the envelope on tart, savory aspects of flavor, from pine to cranberry, orange and rhubarb. With a gravelly texture, it has weight and depth.
title: Talisman 2013 Red Dog Vineyard Dijon Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Candied cherry and tangerine are welcome flavors in this crisp, dry and exceptionally light and easy-drinking wine. It's bright and long-lasting in refreshment.
designation: Eye of the Toad Dry Rosé of
title: Toad Hollow 2016 Eye of the Toad Dry Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Good grip is immediately apparent, along with a burst of tangy citrus and cherry fruit. Sour plum comes up as well, and it's clearly the fruit, not the barrels, that are in the center ring. A high-acid finish keeps it fresh and lively.
title: Clay Pigeon 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Moderately bodied and spiced, this is a straightforward expression of the variety, a mix of pomegranate, red cherry and cassis, that has a deceptive richness on the finish, wrapped in oak.
title: Ampelos 2013 Rho Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Concentrated berry aromas meet with bubblegum and hibiscus on the simple and pleasant nose of this pink bottling from the winery's Los Alamos Ranch, which Louis Lucas planted decades ago. The palate shows tart pink grapefruit juice, but is rounded out by a soft texture.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2016 Rose of Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Dark red cherry and raspberry blend with the slightest hints of thyme and slate on the nose of this bottling, which is made in a urban facility in the coastal city of Marina. There is a tangy cran-raspberry element to the sip, enhanced by licorice spice.
title: Cima Collina 2013 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is clearly aimed at consumers who seek maximum power, aggressive tannins and the dark end of the flavor spectrum. Though down a bit from the 15.5% alcohol in 2012, it's still substantial. Dry roasted dark fruits are covered in brawnier flavors of coffee grounds, chocolate and graphite. Tannins are granular and carry some heat through the finish.
title: Treos 2013 Founders Choice Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a medium-bodied, densely packed estate wine, smoky and herbal in sage, tobacco and tea. The fruit finds its way in the form of bing cherry and strawberry, brighter, focused flavors that give it a lift on the palate.
title: Viszlay Vineyards 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Pale pink in color, this wine brings aromas of strawberry Jolly Rancher and watermelon that are followed by a broad off-dry drinking palate. It delivers easy-drinking appeal.
title: Vino La Monarcha 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Ancient Lakes)

description: Pretty strawberry fruit, definitely on the tart side, provides a delicate but flavorful core to this wine. It's light, fresh and clean, with the appealing simplicity of springtime rosés.
title: Apolloni 2016 Rosé Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Light in color, this is a somewhat murky, reduced and bittersweet wine, earthy in fresh compost, mushroom and pine. Its fruit flavors tend toward rhubarb and cranberry, as the finish ends in black tea.
title: Ampelos 2013 Lambda Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Reduced initially, this wine shows a feral herbal side, a sign of its cool-climate sourcing, which provides a funky personality. Mushroom, clove and a thickness of earth all make a play to be center of attention.
title: Argot 2013 Hawk Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The dark fruits are all but buried by flavors of roasted coffee, charred wood and black licorice. Two bottles tasted, the second showed a bit more cherry, but again, the longer the wine remained open, the more the fruit disappeared. This is not the usual expression of Oregon Pinot Noir—here it's built for power above all else.
title: Treos 2013 Elegant Reserve Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The nose of this bottling from actress Challen Cates impresses with its spicy cherry, mulberry, juniper and mace notes. The palate is silky in texture and extremely well integrated, long-lasting and layered, with shiitake mushroom, forest floor, red cherry and earthy loam flavors.
title: Challen 2013 Zotovich Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The spicy and earthy nose on this sprightly bottling from the iconic vineyard is superb: pressed mulberry, beet and rhubarb aromas lifted by thyme, star anise and bay leaf. The palate is slightly mellower, with rounded pomegranate and cherry notes cut by pine needle-like spice.
title: Bien Nacido 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Velvety, rich and intense upon first sip, this is a lively, well-built wine, held back in bottle and offering layers of blackberry, black cherry, anise and sage flavor. Fruity and feral, it delivers a lot of nuance within its powerful presentation.
title: Eric Kent 2013 Stiling Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this opens with aromas of red cherry, underbrush and pomegranate. The palate is both concentrated and elegant, delivering raspberry, strawberry jam and notes of chopped mint. Velvety tannins provide support and finesse. Enjoy through 2021.
title: Andriano 2013 Anrar Riserva Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)

description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, violet and baking spice lead the way on this. The bright medium-bodied palate offers raspberry, red cherry and white pepper while firm fine-grained tannins provide support.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2013 Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)

description: Old vines in a walled vineyard are responsible for this ripely structured wine. It has dense tannins and equally concentrated black fruit and acidity, needing more time to develop and yield its full fruitiness. Drink from 2018.
designation: Clos du Chapitre Monopole Premier Cru
title: Domaine Guy & Yan Dufouleur 2013 Clos du Chapitre Monopole Premier Cru  (Fixin)

description: This bottling comes from the best blocks and barrels from this single vineyard, co-owned by a number of Edna Valley luminaries. The result is stunning, with baked raspberry, strawberry, maple, and peppery bacon aromas comprising a spicy, exotic nose. Black plum fruit melds with white pepper and crushed herbs, diving into tangy strawberry and sandalwood incense notes on the finish.
title: Kynsi 2013 Precious Stone Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Plump strawberry and black cherry fruit provide power, but elegance is what carries this bottling, thanks to its well-integrated rose and hibiscus aromas. Cooked raspberry and ripe pomegranate notes make for a rich palate, but floral rosewater touches complete the picture. This packs punch while still being approachable in style.
title: Baker & Brain 2013 Origin Reserve Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: A darker take on the grape for the estate, this bottling shows black tea, violet, dark cherry, bay and a touch of tar on the nose. Deep boysenberry fruit pops on the palate, lifted by brighter notes of dill, eucalyptus and menthol.
title: Kessler-Haak 2013 Ohana Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Medium cherry in color, this wine offers aromas of blackberry, cassis and smoked meat. Flavors of black cherry, flint and game never quite coalesce, dropping off into a soft sage-tinged finish.
title: Golan Heights Winery 2016 Gilgal Pinot Noir (Galilee)

description: Bold and spicy, this firmly built wine is the first Morning Dew Ranch vineyard-designate from the new owners of the estate. It starts with exotic and enticing aromas of fresh mint, basil and clove, then delivers pure, focused black fruits and a generous dose of new-oak spice on the palate. Healthy, lip-smacking tannins and firm acidity give it great structure, yet there's no hurry to enjoy this wine. Best after 2020.
title: Castello di Amorosa 2016 Morning Dew Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Big and ripe black fruit is bolstered by sweet thyme, bay leaf and mint on the nose of this powerful bottling by Rachel Silkowski. The wine lands with power and aplomb on the palate, blending star anise, nutmeg and licorice flavors with tangy black plum fruit and a strong acidity to carry it all.
title: Rasi 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A stellar example of freshness from a richer region, this bottling offers buoyant and snappy raspberry fruit on the nose alongside dewy forest floor, tangy juniper, soft rose petals and a hint of nutmeg. Fresh and invigorating on the palate, the sip shows tart raspberry, crushed thyme, green peppercorn and tapenade flavors.
title: Theopolis 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a beautiful Pinot from one of New Zealand's most acclaimed biodynamic producers. Plummy fruit, florals, dried leaves, white pepper and a hint of cinnamon lead into a light- to medium-bodied palate that is crisp and elegant yet powerful too, with grainy, almost chewy tannins, a warm stone character, and a long, tangy finish. Still youthful, this should go for another 7–9 years. Drink through 2027.
title: Rippon 2013 Mature Vine Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This is a great and extremely fairly priced taste of what the Pence team is up to on the eastern edge of the appellation. Sweet sandalwood, red plum, mulberry, black tea, juniper and a hint of maple show on the nose. The palate combines tart black-plum skins with cherry tomato and dewy garden-herb flavors.
title: Pence Ranch 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Rachel Silkowski works for winemaker Brian Loring, and his ripe and rich style is certainly apparent in this bottling with an incredibly long name. Dried alpine strawberry meets with mace and allspice on the nose, while the palate packs tarragon-laced boysenberry flavors alongside shaved licorice and allspice.
designation: It Was One of Those Rare LA Days Where There Happened to Be a Thunder Storm.
title: Rasi 2016 It Was One of Those Rare LA Days Where There Happened to Be a Thunder Storm. Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Substantial fruit flavors and good structure highlight this medium- to full-bodied, concentrated wine. It has a straightforward, no-nonsense approach and offers great value. Enticing black cherry and raspberry flavors are supported by fine-grained tannins and crisp acidity. The fruit notes are pure, clean and linger nicely on the finish.
title: Angeline 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

description: This is a great taste of the freshness of Sonoma without the sticker shock, showing freshly pressed red berries, vanilla and wet slate on the nose. It's light in density on the sip, so the flavors of cranberry, carnation, wet earth and brown spice sail effortlessly across the palate.
title: Alma de Cattleya 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Plum and raspberry aromas are on the spot and inviting, with a touch of smoky darkness. A firm, slightly clamping palate is lively and extended, while this tastes of savory, saucy plum and berry fruits. A note of ocean salt pokes through on a solid finish.
title: Kingston Family 2016 Alazan Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: This wine might be the best value available in California Pinot Noir. It has great varietal character in the aroma and follows through with tempting spice, red fruit and savory nuances on the palate. Black tea, red cherry and clove waft from the glass while cherry and cranberry spread across the palate, braced by moderate tannins and fresh acidity. It's a beautifully balanced medium-bodied wine.
title: Tortoise Creek 2016 Mission Grove Pinot Noir (California)

description: A gentle vanilla note wraps itself around ripe, red cherry on the nose, with a slight touch of smoky mocha. The palate combines these flavors and presents them on a juicy palate held firm by a fine mesh of tannins. This has bite and ample freshness.
title: Heinrich Hartl 2016 Classic Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: Earthy aromas and a smooth texture drive this unorthodox but attention-getting wine, which is the entry-level wine from Phillips Hill and named for the local dialect in Anderson Valley. It has funky reduced aromas at first, then meaty stemmy spicy flavors and a mouth-filling texture that's very smooth.
title: Phillips Hill 2016 Boontling Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Very light in the glass, this bottling from an old vineyard shows candied pomegranate, sage and thyme on the delicate nose. There is solid grip to the sip, with tangy cranberry and a pinch of white pepper. It is a great red wine for a sunny day.
title: Birichino 2016 Saint Georges Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Generous flavors and full body give this wonderful and affordable wine a warm feel on the palate. Rich black cherry, black tea and cranberry notes offer a lot of complexity. The texture is broad and full, but infused with moderate tannins and subtle acidity that keep it fresh.
title: Angeline 2016 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This is a soft and round Pinot with no sharp edges. Flower stalks mingle with almost confect cherry and watermelon notes on the nose, while the palate is plush and juicy with a satiny texture, a nice gentle grip of tannins and a raspberry tang to finish things off.
title: Jules Taylor 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a savory, smoky Pinot, reminiscent of charred greens along with red currents and dried flowers. It's medium-bodied, with a soft grip of salty tannins and bright red fruits.
title: Yealands 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is a silky Pinot cloaked in fine, savory tannins and fresh acidity with stalky, cherry cola, red fruit and floral notes. There's a lovely tension in this wine that keeps you going back for more.
title: Ana 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Cherry aromas dominate the nose on this medium-bodied Pinot with medicinal leanings. A bright youthful palate is more fresh and easy than complex, while this tastes of lightly spiced raspberry, plum and cherry. A juicy appealing finish includes touches of oak and cocoa.
title: Kingston Family 2016 Tobiano Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Enjoy this pretty, light-bodied wine chilling down on a warm day. Bright, ripe strawberry and red cherry notes dominate, with a hint of florals and cracked pepper at the back. This is well-structured by lively acidity and a savory finish.
title: Eradus 2016 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Awatere Valley)

description: Aromas of wild herbs and sage are spicy and earthy, with red-fruit notes. A standard palate belies this wine's high price tag, while lightly herbal plum and currant flavors are minty and suggest a touch of eucalyptus. Moderate oak rises up on a lasting finish.
title: Miguel Torres 2013 Escaleras de Empedrado Pinot Noir (Chile)

description: A perfumed nose of rose, lavender and forest floor gives way to velvety texture and light-bodied notions of red cherry, strawberry, rhubarb and dried herb. The acidity is wrapped in citrus tones.
title: Rolling Plains 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Dusty red in color, the nose is a medley of red currant, cranberry, raw meat and cola spice. On the palate, cranberry and raspberry combine with appealing savory, smokey characters but as a whole it's a little lean and mean and showing prominent oak on the finish.
title: Rubus 2013 The Terraces Collection Pinot Noir (Waipara Valley)

description: Fruity smelling, smooth and mouth-filling on the palate and full of ripe plums flavors, this full-bodied wine sourced from multiple northern California counties emphasizes richness.
title: Auburn 2016 Pinot Noir (North Coast)

description: Savory plum and latex aromas are roasted, spicy and show some burn. This is a dark full-bodied Pinot that's chewy in feel; overall it's more like Syrah than your average Pinot Noir. Oaky, medicinal flavors of cherry and plum are round and beefy prior to a burnt tasting finish.
title: Bodega Montsecano 2016 Montsecano Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Red-fruit aromas with a touch of herbs carry the nose on this drawn-in Pinot. Medicinal raspberry and creamy oak flavors are missing some harmony, while this tastes woody and like cherry cough drop on the finish.
title: Concha y Toro 2016 Marques de Casa Concha Pinot Noir (Limarí Valley)

description: Ripe red fruits dominate in this juicy, easy-going glugger. There's an earthy funk and a meaty savoriness hiding well behind all that plush fruit. The palate is round and satiny while the acidity is on the lower end. Drink now.
title: Villa Maria 2016 Private Bin Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Ripe cherries and red currants combine with oak-derived flavors of Dr. Pepper, herbs and toast. The palate is on the tart, lean side and the oak is rather prominent, particularly on the finish.
title: Wither Hills 2013 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Cool-climate aromas of herbs and latex contain raspberry and mint notes. A full yet abrasive palate displays coastal rawness, while this tastes slightly green as well as minty and oaky. A plump finish remains oaky and herbal.
designation: Single Vineyard Coastal Cool Climate Wine
title: Lomas del Valle 2016 Single Vineyard Coastal Cool Climate Wine Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Earthy cherry coulis and a strong scent of menthol dominate in this value-priced wine—a hard find in this varietal category. Thin on the palate, it's an easygoing quaff, light and fairly nondescript in oak and fruit, dusted in forest pine.
title: Castle Rock 2013 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

description: From one of the rare south-facing vineyards in Beaune, this warm, rich and ripe wine is generous with its spice, smokiness and rounded red fruits. Acidity cuts through, bringing raspberry in its wake. The sense of structure really gives this wine its power and density. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Jadot 2013 Clos des Couchereaux Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Cinnamon spice and pomegranate fruit give a soft touch to minerally driven aromas of black slate and wet cement on the nose of this block-designated (and trademarked!) wine. The wine's tannic grip and tartness are apparent on the texturally distinct palate before raspberry, hibiscus and rose petal flavors settle into a long, rich finish.
title: Foxen 2013 Block 8 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine blends all 12 clones of Pinot Noir grown on the property, to tremendous effect. Sanguine, it traffics in pretty pomegranate and cranberry, with a quenching taste of kirsch-like cherry. Lightly spiced, it delivers an end note of milk chocolate on the lengthy finish, a stellar, drinkable wine from start to finish.
title: Wayfarer 2013 Wayfarer Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: This wine comes from a vineyard planted in the early 2000s in the Sebastopol Hills by Charlie Chenoweth for the Jenkins family, a country music trio consisting of Nancy Jenkins and her two daughters. It is inviting and seductive in black cherry and baking spices. Tightly wound, it has nuance and a lingering afterthought of savory pepper and meat.
title: Patz & Hall 2013 Jenkins Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Dried strawberry, black raspberry, cola, salted licorice and turned earth show on the nose of this wine from a vineyard in the Corralitos area near Watsonville. The palate is quite earthy and herbal, with dried mint, thyme, rosemary and graphite adding nuance to the cranberry fruit.
title: Cinnabar 2013 Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: From another vintage of Billy Wathen home runs comes this bottling from friend Rick Longoria's vineyard. It shows bramble berries, elderberries, sagebrush juniper and roasting herbs on the nose. Layers of thyme and dried oregano decorate the raspberry juice and pencil-lead palate.
title: Foxen 2013 Fe Ciega Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Elegant, exotic spice decorates the nose on this wine by Michael Mooney, with leathery clove, elderflowers, hard cinnamon spice and a blackberry fruit core. There is tremendous tension once sipped between graphite, tight elderberries and even some woody blueberries. Bay leaf, pencil lead and purple flower elements pepper the edges.
title: El Pistolero 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Zesty raspberry meets warm cherry notes on the nose of this elegantly presented wine, which also shows aromas of beet juice, sandalwood, clove, mace and bergamot. The palate is a texturally driven, evolving experience, with flavors of earth, iron and pencil lead melding with sage scrub, wild berries and elderberry.
title: Cinnabar 2013 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This wine already has great balance, with its dry structure setting off the concentrated cherry and red-berry fruits. The acidity, tense while also fragrant, gives a background of freshness to the wine. It is still young, firm tannins still prominent. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Méo-Camuzet 2013 Aux Murgers Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Wonderful spice and ripe red fruits shoot through this rich while structured wine. Dark cherries, strawberries and a ripe texture have given a wine that will be beautiful, smooth and generous. The acidity and the core of tannins will allow it to age well. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Jadot 2013 Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A generous wine, this features intense dark fruits, ripe strawberry and an almost -weet character. It's packed with spice, richness and beautiful concentration. Great acidity gives a wine that is developing freshness and weight. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Jadot 2013 Les Boucherottes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From one of the winery's two estate vineyards, Harper's is dense and oaky, with bittersweet chocolate, dark cherry and black tea twisted around a layer of thick, dense tannins. Dried herbs and a subtle squeeze of tangerine provide savory and exotic character, while the finish is velvety and sublime.
title: Arista 2013 Harper's Rest Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is dark and dense, very closed at this young stage. But wait for that rich fruit to burst out to give its intense acidity and ripeness to the wine. It's a powerhouse of flavors, spice and dark minerality. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Jadot 2013 Les Estournelles Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This wine is dark, with a strong sense of structure. Dense black fruits are cut with strawberry acidity and a dark tension between fruit and firm tannins. The coiled power will allow this beautiful wine age for many years. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Jadot 2013 Theurons Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Rich and thick, this is an opulent offering of dark cherry and Asian spice, the spice popping on the palate throughout the long finish. Full bodied, it nonetheless features crisp, balanced acidity and a taste of rosemary and lavender, the perfect companion to a butterflied lamb seasoned the same.
title: Patz & Hall 2013 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Tart, plump cherries show first on the nose of this great wine, with pressed violet petals, smashed eucalyptus, crushed menthol and fresh tea aromas playing background. The tip of the palate is soft with red fruit before a zesty kola-nut character invades on a wave of sharp, even ferocious acidity, finishing up on wild mint herbals.
title: Pali 2013 Huber VIneyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Longtime Claiborne & Churchill winemaker Coby Parker-Garcia releases his own project with exemplary results. This bottling shows aromas of cherry leather with dried sage, black slate, Earl Grey tea and elderflower. There's amazing herbal and floral intricacy to the palate, with concentrated cranberry skins, lavender and purple fruit flavors.
title: El Lugar 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Crystalline cranberry, concentrated violets and rose petals and a shred of cola show on the nose of this upper-level bottling from one of the appellation's longtime stars. The palate shows graphite and dried strawberry fruit amped up with woody coyote scrub elements, reflective of the chaparral that surrounds the property.
title: Hahn 2013 SLH Estate Grown & Produced Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: From one of the top Premier Cru vineyards in Beaune, this structured wine shows concentration and richness. Packed with tannins in its center, it is cushioned by the generous red berry and cherry fruits. The wine has a finely perfumed aftertaste. Drink from 2018.
title: Alex Gambal 2013 Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From vines close to the Sachets Premier Cru vineyard, this wine is powerful, structured and dense, despite the relatively low alcohol that gives it a lift of red fruits, acidity and perfume. It is still developing, a wine in progress, as its backbone of tannins softens. Drink from 2018.
title: Alex Gambal 2013  Vosne-Romanée

description: This delicious, compelling, full-bodied wine blends luscious fruit flavors like red cherry and boysenberry with stylish, spicy oak accents and a firm backing of acidity and tannins to keep the mouthfeel vital. The fruit and softly spicy nuances mingle beautifully and seem to melt in the mouth. It's great to drink through 2020.
title: Arista 2013 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Subtle and shy at first, exhibiting light aromas of rose petal, this wine unveils slowly to reveal complex elements of cinnamon, red and black cherry—a curious commingling that comes together nicely. From several vineyards, including Martinelli, it's medium bodied and lengthy, with plenty of earthiness to the finish.
title: Benovia 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Silky in texture, with a tannic bite, this lovely wine is spicy in cinnamon and clove, buoyed by ripe plum and wild strawberry. Medium in weight, it's complex and measured, balanced by a leathery, smooth finish and lively acidity.
title: Trombetta 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The fruit from this marquee site is elusive at first, offering light wisps of rose petal and bay, earthy and spicy in equal waves. Around its richness of tart cherry are elements of pomegranate, orange zest and tea. It's a wine of great complexity and counterbalance, with a lengthy, leathery finish.
title: Gary Farrell 2013 Hallberg Vineyard Dijon Clones Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Smooth and supple, this wine has structure and tannin so well cushioned by the ripe fruits and fine acidity. The structure and tannins are integrated into the rich red fruits and dark plum juiciness. The aftertaste, with an elegant freshness, brings the balance together. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Jean Grivot 2013 Roncières Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: A brooding, savory and smoothly textured wine, velvety more than silky, this offers black tea, truffle and high-toned cherry. The wine is named for sandstone, “mother rock” of the Goldridge soils that are so prominent where these vines dig down. Soft, it's also lengthy, a substantial and substantive bottling.
title: Wayfarer 2013 Estate Grown Mother Rock Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: Dense purple flavors of blueberry, boysenberry, lilacs and teriyaki-pepper beef make for luscious concentration on the nose of this wine from Stephen Russell's Quinta Santa Rosa Vineyard. The palate shows black pepper, dried oregano, camphor, rustic elderberry and a strong raspberry-cranberry fruit character.
title: Prodigal 2013 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The winery's larger offering from several vineyard sites, this wine is designed entirely to please, offering a seductively juicy abundance in black cherry, raspberry and cinnamon. Approachable and full bodied, the tannins are soft and the oak well integrated, allowing the earthy aromas and spicy brown-sugar elements to roam free.
title: Arista 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Iron, black slate. raspberries and snapped sagebrush show on this wine from the Dierberg family's property along Highway 246. There are ample layers of fruit and spice to the palate, with raspberry, pomegranate and hibiscus evolving into dried rose petals and a bright florality, proving both quite flavorful and yet refreshingly light.
title: Dierberg 2013 Drum Canyon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Designed by Delicato winemaker James Ewart as a Pinot with power that can handle a steak, this wine features a dense, dark nose, with blackberry, olallieberry and red currant cut by allspice, clove and licorice-vanilla cookies. The palate is rich and luxurious, with ripe cranberry and red-cherry elements spiced up with mocha, cappuccino and long-lingering vanilla bean. It's boisterous and fresh, so drink now with a juicy rib-eye.
title: Diora 2013 La Petite Grace Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: This wine starts off a bit shy and reserved, but with time reveals deep aromas of black cherry, raspberry and plum, touched by hints of licorice root and minty herbs in the background. The texture is soft and accessible, like crushed satin, with a pleasant hint of cocoa powder dusting the finish. Drink now.
title: Laroche 2016 La Chevalière Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Scents of black plum and cherry skins open the nose of this tight, dark wine, with subtle accents of fresh mint and menthol in the background. Medium in weight, it's surprisingly tannic and gripping, with a pronounced black tea-like astringency on the close alongside flavors of black fruit and licorice.
title: La Forge Estate 2016 Pinot Noir (Languedoc)

description: This is a good weekday wine that smells and tastes fresh, uncomplicated and quite fruity, feels smooth on the palate and has a clean finish.
title: Seven Daughters 2016 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Black cherry, boysenberry and blueberry aromas set the stage for this attractive, fruit-forward wine, carrying through from the bouquet to the lightweight palate. The fruit is hit by a touch of baking spice through the close, and framed by soft tannins that lend a subtle structure. Drink now.
title: Arrogant Frog 2016 Lily Pad Noir Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Red currant and cherry fruit lead the bouquet of this fresh and inviting wine, with pleasant hints of fresh mint and tree bark for subtle depth. The palate is light but fruit-forward, with soft tannins and ample acidity that result in a harmonious package. Drink now.
title: Les Jamelles 2016 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: This young wine feels hard and thin. Flavors of herbs and not quite ripe berries finish with an odd touch of butter.
title: Cave Spring 2016 Pinot Noir (Niagara Escarpment)

description: This is light in character, with soft aromas and flavors of strawberry-rhubarb pie dusted in cocoa powder. It's smooth and easy in feel, with a light palate and straightforward but attractive fruit flavors that finish clean and juicy. Drink now.
region_1: Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne
title: Pierre Tailleur de Vins 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne)

description: This is quite concentrated and herbal upfront, with pronounced minty and spicy licorice tones that sit atop the core of ripe blackberry, plum and cherry. It's a touch angular, with surprising grip to the medium-weight palate, and a mocha-tinged finish. Drink now.
title: Domaine de la Motte 2016 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Aromas of red currants and strawberries unfold on the nose of this straightforward, easy-drinking wine. It's bright and juicy, with touches of sweet oak and vanilla on the close. Drink now.
title: Domaine Roman 2016 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Faint hints of talc and carnation sit atop the fruity tones of strawberry and cranberry on the nose and mouth of this wine. It's light and easy in nature, with low tannins and a quick close. Drink now.
title: Luc Pirlet 2016 Classique Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Straightforward and direct, this offers clean and just-ripe notes of cherry, strawberry and banana on the nose and mouth. The lightweight palate is easy and short, with little tannic structure. Drink up.
region_1: Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne
title: Laroque 2016 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne)

description: The best bottle in a stellar lineup of the winery's first 2016 releases, this marries old-vine elegance to lush aromatics, with entwined notes of walnuts, raspberries, thyme, rosewater and citrus. It's a long-lasting, beautifully integrated wine, made with grapes from some of the oldest blocks in the vineyard.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Medici Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This particular block selection is focused upon old-vine Pommard grapes, and the result is a layered and deeply focused wine that continually evolves once poured. It's a delicate explosion of textures and flavors, berry and cherry, wet stone, cola and caramel. Though it will surely age beautifully over a decade or longer, if you give it ample aeration and attention, it drinks quite nicely already.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Durant Vineyard Bishop Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The vineyard cannot be disclosed, but there's nothing mysterious about the flavor, which pins the meter on the yum factor. Juicy huckleberry flavors come wrapped in mineral-drenched acids. Made from 100% Pommard grapes, this marries Old World complexity to pretty purple fruits. As with many Patricia Green wines, the oak aging is a minor player, while the ripe fruits and individual terroirs are expressed in riveting fashion.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Mysterious Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A closed nose offers a hint of cherry. The palate follows with a balance of pure cherry, firm tannin and bright freshness graced with a touch of dark peony. This is understated, light-bodied but wonderfully elegant and has a habit of growing on you slowly and stealthily. This has a long and lovely resonance.
title: Domaine Ostertag 2016 Fronholz Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The Weber vineyard, originally planted in 1978, shows well with bold bright black-cherry fruit, amplified with lemony acids and flavors of lemon meringue. The lingering midpalate leads gracefully into a smooth, lusciously fruity finish.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Weber Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A beautifully pure topnote of black cherry sings on the nose, followed by peony and cinnamon. The palate is luminous in a dark cherry flavor. This wine is profound and concentrated but nothing weighs it down. Drink 2018–2028.
title: René Muré 2016 Clos St Landelin Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Derived from an assortment of Dundee Hills vineyards, this pays tribute to the Jory soils of the AVA. Strong mineral accents keep a tight focus on brambly cherry flavors. The barrel aging, which was minimal given the wine's early release, adds just a touch of caramel.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Volcanic Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Pomegranate, carnation, dried cranberry, potpourri, baked earth and vanilla cookie all come to the fore on the nose of this light but expressive wine from the historic vineyard. Stewed red cherry and cranberry arise on the palate alongside thyme, peppercorn and the slightest hint of game.
title: Dolin 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine is already showing characteristics of age, but in all the best ways. This offers heady aromas of dried flowers, cinnamon bark, beef stir fry and sumac yet the palate is full of savory, sinewy tannins and a tonic character, ending on a long, dried cherry finish. It's easy to fall under this wine's spell.
title: Wicks 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: This is based upon a single Dijon 115 clone, and delivers potent ripe black-cherry flavors. It's a full-throttle bottle, textural and lightly touched with dried seaweed. The barrel aging adds a welcome touch of chocolate to the powerful tannic finish.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Durant Vineyard Madrone Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This is fresh, aromatic and primary in cherry aromas. The same luscious, generous fruit also dominates the juicy palate. There is freshness to balance this abundance but this is hedonistic and fruit driven to the core, with a cinnamon undertone. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2016 Strangenberg Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Utilizing Pommard clones planted in 1990, this exceptional wine has a nose-tickling funky note, providing a rich composty accent to juice loaded with raspberry and cherry fruit. It's detailed and textural, a truly engaging wine which goes well beyond the fruit to add the sort of complexity not often found in this price range.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Balcombe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The nose is very shy but gives the slightest promise of ripe, red fruit. Red cherry appears in full splendor on the palate, edged by racy, exciting freshness and superfine but crunchy tannins. The body remains slender but there is a sensuous, warm core of ripe fruit. Lovely now but will develop over the coming five years. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2016 Réserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Dense aromas of strawberry, mace and vanilla combine for an alluringly rich experience on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Notes of clove, allspice and gingerbread rise on the palate, where the background tones of mulberry and elderberry jam prove elegant and interesting.
title: Velvet Bee 2013 Bentrock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine sees 40% French oak and is a reserve-level barrel selection. Soft and smooth, the pretty berry and plum fruit has a touch of mocha, but not too much. It's had ample bottle time to be ready to enjoy immediately.
title: De Ponte Cellars 2013 Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Savory and vibrant, this bright polished sparkler delivers aromas and flavors of red cherry, crushed raspberry, Rennet apple, tangy nectarine and bread crust. Refreshing acidity and a lively, refined perlage lift the finish.
title: Ferghettina 2013 Brut Rosé  (Franciacorta)

description: Black fruits dominate this full-bodied block selection. The alcohol is pulled back a half step from the previous vintage, and there's a pleasing minerality to the foundation. A hint of caraway comes up as it winds down through the chocolatey finish.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2016 Balcombe Vineyard Block 1B Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Sourced from a vineyard on the western edge of the valley, this sports lovely aromatics introducing matching flavors of black cherry and a dash of pepper. There's a pleasing minerality, like a lick of granite, and a whiff of dried thyme also.
title: De Ponte Cellars 2013 Lonesome Rock Ranch Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A gentle mix of red berry, red plum and cherry carries some of the lightly earthy tones of the AVA. Soft and accessible, there's a hint of Dr. Pepper running through the flavors also. It's drinking right about at its prime and should hold through the early 2020s.
title: Holloran 2013 La Chenaie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: From grapes grown on a higher spot on the estate vineyard with Altamont soils, where the dirt is thin and the vines struggle, this wine delivers a depth of structure and incredible flavor. It finds a way to coax sage and wild forested earth from a robustness of cranberry and bright, citrusy acidity.
title: Dehlinger 2013 High Plains Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Deep and hearty mulberry aromas meet with condensed rose petals, cinnamon, clove and hot gingerbread on the earthy, spicy nose of this clonal bottling by longtime winemaker Denise Shurtleff. The sip is thick and full of chaparral herbs at first, then opens toward rounded red cherry, cranberry and cinnamon before diving into fennel and peppercorn. It's amazing for one clone to be so complex.
title: Cambria 2013 Barbara's Clone 667 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Exotic yet classic aromas and generous, complex flavors make this medium-bodied wine very compelling. Black-tea leaves, black cherry, clove and mint are a few of the nuances that flood the palate, and the lush viscosity allows them to linger on the finish.
title: La Follette 2013 Manchester Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

description: This producer, based in Ladoix-Serrigny in the Côte de Beaune also has a small parcel in this Grand Cru in Vosne-Romanée. Like all this producer's wines it was fermented in open tanks before barrel aging. That gives an extra concentration to the ripe fruits and firm tannins. It is an opulent wine, juicy with black fruits and acidity. With its structure, it will certainly age further, so drink from 2019.
title: Capitain-Gagnerot 2013  Echézeaux

description: Smashed black plums, mulberry and alpine strawberry show through the crushed rocks on the nose of this bottling that is lifted by a tarragon spice. Tangy blackberry and elderberry show on the palate, where wild thyme, oregano and peppercorns contribute to an intriguing sense of depth.
title: Chalone Vineyard 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Chalone)

description: This new wine from the family that founded Navarro Vineyards takes a fascinating twist on Anderson Valley style, combining very concentrated, dark-fruit and black-pepper flavors on a relatively light body. It's easy to enjoy the black cherry, clove and wood-smoke notes, while feeling the lithe, moderately tannic texture lifting the mouthfeel.
title: Pennyroyal Farm 2013 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Light strawberry and wild berry aromas mesh with fennel, graphite and rain on the fresh nose of this bottling from Ed Kurtzman's personal label. Raspberry, cranberry and baked-plum flavors show on the palate alongside anise and a touch of olive.
title: Sandler 2013 Boer Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)

description: This is a very full and deep wine, with aromas of black plum, mulberry, Dr Pepper, mint-chocolate chip and purple flowers. It's hearty on the palate as well, with black tea and rose petals showing alongside thick, rich mulberry, clove and baking spice galore. It's not dainty at all.
title: Windemere 2013 Aubaine Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: This comes from one of the Premier Crus that line the lower slopes of the hill of Corton. It has weight, richness and a densely tannic character that promises aging. Its packed red fruits are cut with juicy acidity as well as a firmer structure and dark-berry flavors. This finely perfumed wine needs to age, so drink from 2018.
title: Capitain-Gagnerot 2013 Les Moutottes Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: Tart red-cherry aromas meet with purple flowers, cinnamon and a touch of rust on the nose of this bottling. Baked plum and underripe mulberry fruit play off each other on the palate, with a tart plum-skin element cutting through herbal touches of wild thyme, bay leaf and oregano.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2013 Morrito Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Floral like a bouquet of roses, this pretty wine is lined in a tight structure of sinewy earthiness. Orange, cranberry and rhubarb define a crisp, tart profile, while oak makes a sneak, welcome appearance that doesn't overstay its welcome.
title: WesMar 2013 Salzgeber Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: With gentle tannins and juicy red fruits this is a ripe wine that is developing fast. It is beginning to get secondary flavors: mushrooms with undergrowth aromas. The fruit is still there, of course, giving red berry and acidity. Drink this wine soon, certainly from late 2017.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2013 Collection  (Corton)

description: This high-end offering is a blend of New Zealand's own Abel clone with Dijon clone 777. Mocha, toast and charred wood notes fame pristine black cherry and plum fruit in this medium- to full-bodied wine. A dusty, lingering finish wraps things up nicely, suggesting up to 10 years of aging potential.
title: Marisco Vineyards 2013 Craft Series The Journey Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: While ethereal in structure, there's a seductively penetrating appeal to this light-footed Pinot Noir. Initially pronounced notes of smoke, dried herb and cedar fade into a dusty rose and cherry perfume. Blossom and sage aromas extend into the palate, lending a sultry flair to brisk Maraschino cherry and raspberry flavors. The finish extends on a pleasant bite of bitter almond.
title: N. Kendall Wines 2013 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: In the prestigious village of Vosne-Romanée, there is little room for anything but Grand and Premier Cru vineyards. This wine, from the flatter ground at the bottom of the slope, shows something of the structure that makes the great wines. To balance that it also has bright fruit and plenty of acidity. It will be ready to drink from early 2018.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2013 Collection  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Winemaker Kim Crawford has crafted a dark, full-bodied Pinot Noir that could use another year or two of bottle age. The nose is slightly meaty and bacony, while the palate delivers dark flavors of black cherries, plums, cola and baking spices before turning firm on the finish. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Loveblock 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Attractive scents of baking spices and ripe cherries mark the nose and palate of this medium-bodied wine. It's silky from start to finish, offering enough complex floral and spice notes to make it worthy of repeated sips. Drink now–2020.
title: Prophet's Rock 2013 Rocky Point Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: A light, clear and bright wine from the heart of the appellation, this bottling exudes juicy layers of earthy cardamom spice and dark black cherry. It's well integrated and varietally consistent, offering jolts of minerality that buoy the texture.
title: WesMar 2013 Balletto Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This barrel selection is bright and clean on the nose, then shows heat and ripeness on the palate. Balanced acidity uplifts a richness of black cherry, resin and cooked mushroom, with dried sage and rosemary peaking on the finish.
title: Acacia 2013 Lone Tree Vineyard Barrel Select Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: A jubilant nose kicks off with fruit punch before diving a tad darker into pomegranate, candied cherry, anise and cinnamon on this bottling by the Foley family of wines. Raspberry and cherry pop on the mellow and restrained palate, where pencil shavings and garrigue flavorings make for a quality sip.
title: Lincourt 2013 Willie Mae Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is VM's big single-vineyard Pinot, but it's already very approachable. Savory overtones of damp earth, outline modest pie-cherry notes that seem somewhat delicate. Enjoy this medium-bodied wine over the next few years for its silky texture.
title: Villa Maria 2013 Taylor's Pass Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Crisp red cherry and a taste of grenadine characterize this light, bright wine, with accents of orange and rhubarb. Fruity and straightforward in structure and body, it retains nicely interwoven acidity through the finish.
title: WesMar 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: At the northern end of the Ladoix appellation, this small Premier Cru has produced a red-fruited wine shot through with acidity and spicy flavors. It is juicy, showing red cherries, raspberries bolstered with a layer of tannins. The wine is ready to drink, although it will age at least until 2023.
title: Capitain-Gagnerot 2013 La Micaude Premier Cru  (Ladoix)

description: Fresh-pressed blackberries and graphite comprise the aromatic entry to this bottling from a vineyard about 2,000 feet high in the hills west of Paso Robles. It features plenty of wild thyme, black licorice and other garrigue-like herbals on the nose as well. The palate is minty, with a strong tannic tension and rising acidity.
title: Asuncion Ridge 2013 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: This is a fairly muscular rendering of Central Otago Pinot Noir. Plum, herb, espresso and charred oak notes mark the nose and palate, while the finish shows some gritty tannins. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Kim Crawford 2013 Small Parcels Rise and Shine Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This medium- to full-bodied Pinot Noir has strong savory overtones. Leather and mushroom notes take charge early on and never let up, dominating the modest plum fruit and lingering on the finish. Drink up.
title: Giesen 2013 Ridge Block Single Vineyard Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Citrusy bright, with a core of red and black cherry, this simply structured, light-bodied wine shows well-defined acidity and a touch of forest floor.
title: WesMar 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Light bodied, this vineyard-designate shows a bit of carbonic expression, bubbly and brightly high in acidity. The intriguing texture offers waves of rose petals, strawberry and clove.
title: WesMar 2013 Oehlman Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Coming from a slightly warmer part of the Central Coast, this bottling plays to the dried fruit and earthy side of the grape, with cranberry, hibiscus, turned loam and pencil shavings on the nose. Dense black-plum flavors show on the palate alongside crushed lava rocks, turned soil, juniper and dried pine needles.
title: Martin Ranch 2013 J.D. Hurley R.E.D. Vineyard Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: The black cherry, plum and cola notes of this wine are carried across the palate by ample weight and supple tannins. It lacks a bit of complexity, but offers plenty of easy charm for drinking over the next few years.
title: Amisfield 2013 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This is a relatively thick and dense wine, grippy in tannin and oak at first, youthful and desiring of time and air. Beyond its strength, its shows the beginnings of delicacy and grace, commingling raspberry with clove and tea.
title: Davis Family 2014 Soul Patch Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a soft, smooth and earthy wine, still unraveling from its youth, that's crisp and fresh in acidity. Chewy still in texture, it offers a glorious celebration of red cherry, rhubarb, tea and clove.
title: Davis Family 2014 Starr Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From one of the region's most dramatically perched vineyards, this bottling shows baked red cherry, thyme, chipped slate and the slightest touch of game on the nose. Tangy acidity and a grippy texture frame the sip, where cranberry, black loam and wet clay minerality lead into a long sizzling finish.
title: Dragonette 2014 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Though labeled simply Willamette Valley, this single vineyard wine is sourced from the McMinnville AVA. It's got that AVA's subtle hint of metal, and a firm base infused with minerality. The purple-fruit flavors are well-defined and punch through with concise power. This is a wine to cellar for a couple more years, then drink 2020 through 2028.
title: Origin 2014 Meredith Mitchell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Fermented in concrete and aged for 14 months in one-quarter new French oak, this wine sneaks up on you. Anyone who has tasted wines direct from concrete will note that they often have a certain flavor of concrete, or mineral if you will, and a nice texture to the mouthfeel. That's here, along with tight pomegranate fruit and plenty of acid. But the barrel aging shows also, coming up in the finish as a ring of butterscotch around the fruit.
title: Paul O'Brien 2014 Susan's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)

description: Lovely strawberry and cherry fruit comes with light touches of sweet spice. It's a pretty wine, yet does not sacrifice power. A toasty note graces the finish. Drink now and into the early 2020s.
title: Phelps Creek 2014 Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: Light red cherry, marjoram and allspice aromas mark this bottling from a winery in the Central Valley that has sourced fruit from coastal regions for many years. The flavors are even more interesting, as cherry is enhanced by bay leaf, thyme, peppercorns and Indian spices.
title: Cru 2014 Appellation Series Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine needs time to open, offering a dense and reduced imprint at the beginning which blows off to reveal a succulent core of smoky maraschino cherry. It's medium in body, well integrated and moderate in oak.
title: Parmeson 2014 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Gravelly texture and crunchy fruit combine for an intriguing experience in this wine, which offers pomegranate and cranberry tartness accented by forest floor and bay leaf. A bright streak of citrus is interwoven within.
title: Thomas George 2014 Starr Ridge Vineyard Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Tight-grained tannins wrap around full-bodied earthiness and fruit, while a mixture of strawberry and cherry is met by bay and a hint of mint. Bright, lively acidity adds to the experience, which succeeds in length and depth.
title: Gloria Ferrer 2014 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This The wine from a monopole vineyard shows the intense acidity of the vintage yet also bursts with red berry fruit, underlined with firm tannins. Drink now, or better yet, from 2018.
designation: Clos les Grands Voyens Premier Cru
title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2014 Clos les Grands Voyens Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Juicy, this has an exotic twist of burnt cherry and orange to it, accented in Asian spice. Soft, with moderate acidity, it retains an earthy underlay of roses that add to the full-bodied length and density.
title: Acacia 2014 Thornton Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This cuvée is principally from the estate (Appassionata) vineyard. Lush, spicy and spread broadly across the palate, it pleases with strawberry-raspberry fruit, milk chocolate and a dusting of cocoa powder. The wine does seem to lighten up rather quickly at the finish, but further bottle age may fix that.
title: J. Christopher 2014 Nuages Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Feral earth and forest highlight a plush, lush texture of full-bodied ripeness and voluptuous personality in this wine from the famous site. Baked strawberry, raspberry and cherry meet cola and cardamom as buzzing acidity cuts through on the finish.
title: Expression 38 2014 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A moderate level of earthiness is found in this approachable wine, which is friendly and rounded in baked cherry, plum, cola and velvety smooth layers of texture. It pleases for its brisk acidity and integrated oak.
title: Thomas George 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Smoky and seductive in black cherry and a healthy dose of Asian spice, this wine is full-bodied and well concentrated in a thicket of blueberry and gamy meat.
title: Sanglier Cellars 2014 River Tusque Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Smoky and soft, this full-bodied, rounded wine tastes of baked raspberry and vanilla, its texture velvety and likably smooth. Concentrated, it retains only moderate acidity, peaking in freshness on the finish.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Smoky and minty, this full-bodied effort shows grit and oak, with tannin on the back of the palate. That grittiness continues in a gravelly way in texture, rounded by strawberry and black tea.
title: Pure Cru 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: A nutty undertow finds its way in this wine, which is marked by an earthiness of sage, clove and sous bois. Funky and desirable, it leans medium-bodied in weight and tone, with an undeniable affront of blood orange and crisp red cherry.
title: Buena Vista 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Smoky, funky earth opens this appellation wine, richly oaked and possessed of youthful tannin. Succulent blackberry and blueberry mix on the medium-bodied, velvety palate.
title: Davis Family 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Light and delicate, this wine also offers a lushness to the texture, finding a balance between the two spectrums. Cranberry and strawberry dot a landscape of earthy tobacco and cola-laced oak, finishing with a bold taste of dark chocolate.
title: MacRostie 2014 Goldrock Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Chewy and packed with flavors of dark chocolate, espresso and a bit of cracker, this retains focus as it punches through to a tasty finish. The black-cherry fruit is cloaked in the dark accents listed above, and has the muscle to stand up to blackened seafood and smoked meats.
title: Rex Hill 2014 Sunny Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This astringent mineral-soaked wine gathers itself around tart raspberry fruit. Youthful and compact, it shows little trace of the 18% new oak in which it was aged. This seems likely to show further improvement with additional bottle age and softening.
title: Tumwater 2014 Hirschy Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir

description: Light in color and delicate in texture, this wine is bright in pomegranate and raspberry, with a spritzy, carbonic edge that brings freshness to a deep, rich finish of strawberry and tea.
title: Cardinal Rule 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The Nicholas reserve sees one-third new French oak. It's a mixed-clone vineyard-row selection, with pie-cherry fruit and a dusting of cocoa. It drinks well already, with a smooth well-integrated finish.
title: Anam Cara 2014 Reserve Nicholas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This is a medium-bodied vineyard-specific wine, offering warm aromas of baked bread, cola and clove. The warmer elements are complemented by fresh raspberry, rhubarb and wild vanilla, making for a varietally satisfying experience on the nose and palate.
title: Manross 2014 Lone Oak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is showing a bit of muscle, and some still-integrating barrel flavors, but it's already a wine that delivers plenty of pleasure. Forgive the flaky faux-wax topping (not thick enough to be called a real capsule) and enjoy the well-ripened blackberry fruit, the nicely-layered creamy chocolate, the touch of underbrush and the appealing length. Drink now through 2022.
title: Origin 2014 Johan Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Aged in 100% once-filled barrels, this is a selection from barrels set aside for the reserve programs. Without the influence of new oak, a streak of citrus comes into play, giving this apple and berry-flavored wine a crisp tart edge.
title: Anam Cara 2014 Heather's Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Tight-grained tannin and texture signal a youthful vigor in this medium-bodied wine that presents itself as thick and dense in wild red fruit. The richer, lusher components are met by bright acidity and a mouthwatering freshness.
title: Sanglier Cellars 2014 Old Camp Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From three different sites, all within Green Valley, this is a block and barrel selection, a showcase of rich, ripe, robust baked black cherry and full-bodied gusto. The oak is tenacious and in support of the more delicate nuances of compost and rose.
title: Migration 2014 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This juicy wine has attractive red fruits, perfumed tannins and lots of spicy wood flavors. Those characteristics make it already balanced and indicate a bright and fruity future. The wood gives the right density to the wine and the aftertaste adds freshness.
title: Domaine Bruno Clair 2014 Vaudenelles  (Marsannay)

description: Young, spicy and forward, this immediately accessible wine is a bowl of cherry candy, backed with pineapple highlights from natural acidity. It's full in the mouth, still with primary fruit flavors, but the structure to age gracefully over the next five to eight years.
title: Soléna 2014 Hyland Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Fresh and juicy, this wine delivers round, ripe strawberry flavors. Solid tannins don't lose sight of the freshness of the year and balance the rich, jammy aftertaste. The wine, with its attractive fruits, will develop quickly. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Sylvain Pataille 2014 Les Longeroies  (Marsannay)

description: Sourced from the oldest vines in the vineyard, this lovely wine is scented with rose petals, cranberries and sour cherries. Those flavors continue in a light, elegant framework, that gains power and focus as it works its way through the palate. Don't quit on this; it won't quit on you, finishing with a lick of sea salt caramel chocolate.
title: Hyland 2014 Coury Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Deeply brooding notes of crushed violets, rose petals, black cherries, thyme and sagebrush make for a manly take on this often feminine grape. Elderberry fruit shows on the palate, as do more violets and lilacs, dried mint, sagebrush, menthol and pine-needle flavors.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is the first time this recently purchased vineyard has been featured as an Elk Cove designate. Planted in 2007, it's just coming into its own. The young fruit is tight and tangy—a mix of raspberry and black cherry. Forward, bright and lightly spicy, it's nicely focused effort with some high acid snap to the finish.
title: Elk Cove 2014 Goodrich Pinot Noir

description: Structured and solid, this is a dense wine, rich in tannins and a dark structure. Under this firm shell, there are plenty of fragrant red berries touched by cherries. The intense fruitiness will develop, as will the weight of the wine.
title: Domaine des Croix 2014  Aloxe-Corton

description: With structure and some firm tannins, this wine is on the dry side. It has black fruits that will develop over time, and certainly show now with a juicy background. The acidity is refreshing even through the solid tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Les Evocelles  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This wine is rich and ripe with sweet tannins and layers of red-berry fruits. It is a soft wine, rounded and with plenty of freshness in the background. The smoky tannins come through slowly as the fruit blends into the structure. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Bart 2014 Champ Salomon  (Marsannay)

description: This rich, almost jammy wine is given structure by the darkly tannic character. The dry, firm, toasty structure is pulled forward by the red-berry acidity that indicates a good future for the wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine René Bouvier 2014 Les Longeroies  (Marsannay)

description: This wine is soft and rounded with attractive red-cherry fruits, ripe strawberries and touches of wood and tannin. Acidity comes along behind this richness. It is going to develop quickly and will give great pleasure. Drink from 2018.
title: Faiveley 2014 Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This very limited production wine is Foursight's most expensive offering. It smells like red cherries and cinnamon, tastes warm and spicy, and feels broad and velvety. While not quite as impressive as the 2013, it has a plush and welcoming personality that's difficult to forget.
title: Foursight 2014 Paraboll Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: From a 30-year-old vineyard in the heart of the Dundee Hills, this toasty and forward wine shows excellent definition throughout. Tight cranberry/raspberry fruit flavors expand with airing, adding citrus and cherry components and a juicy underpinning of fresh acids.
title: Soléna 2014 Prince Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Here's reserve-level quality in a widely available, moderately priced bottle. It's entirely estate grown, ripe with bright cherry fruit, and a finish that resonates with granite and earth.
title: Stoller 2014 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This wine is quite firm, but with plenty of black fruits under the severe exterior. Heavy losses from hail don't seem to have affected the ripeness and the structure of what will develop into a very fine wine. It offers spice and a touch of chocolate at the end.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2014 Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: Gentle spice and redcurrant notes promise a subtle wine. The palate does not disappoint and sings with translucent, light-footed elegance. This is all about charm and ease, about chiffon rather than velvet. Crisp freshness brightens and lightens everything. It's a mere whiff of a wine but a delicious one.
title: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Emblematic of the emerging trend of pushing finished alcohol levels down and aromatics up, this puts the flavor emphasis on subtle complexity. It offers a full range of tart red fruits, along with seams of dried leaf and milk chocolate. It was entirely whole-cluster fermented, and aged 16 months in 15% new oak.
title: Swick 2014 Cancilla Vineyard Ken's POM Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Very pure notes of cherry and strawberry pervade this wine. They are perfumed with a slight conifer scent that spells freshness and lifted ease. The palate has an unforced, elegant concentration. This is charming and fresh, with convincing depth, purity and a lasting, fresh finish.
title: René Muré 2014 Signature Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: With some firm structure, this wine also has great fruitiness. It offers plenty of raspberry fruits, good acidity and a solid texture of tannins. The acidity keeps the wine perfumed and fresh. Drink the wine from 2019.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Ursulines
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Ursulines  (Pommard)

description: The debut release for this producer is a bright garnet shade. Exhuberant and broad, the palate is bursting with cranberry, blue plum and Bing cherry flavors. Drink over the next year or two, while it is at its freshest.
title: BKB 2014 Makena Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: What jumps out immediately is a bright spicy scent. The forward fruit is a zesty mix of cranberry, guava and citrus, and the flavors just punch up the palate in a most delicious way. Drink this over the next couple of years while it retains its freshness.
title: Vidon Vineyard 2014 3 Clones Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: A perfumed village wine, this is made from four different parcels. The wine offers an attractive touch of tannin and spice to go with the forward red fruits. It should develop relatively quickly, and will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Domaine des Croix 2014  Beaune

description: Quite a steal of a deal for a widely available wine, this shows cinnamon, red cherry, ripe cranberry, light tobacco and a touch of leather on the rustic nose. Once sipped, the mouthfeel is soft, offering flavors of cranberry and red cherry that are spiced by thyme, bay leaf and more cinnamon.
title: MacMurray Ranch 2014 Estate Vineyards Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: This is a blend from most parts of the village, with fruit from 14 different parcels. It is solid and firm while also having great swathes of raspberries and red plums laced together with acidity. The aftertaste is perfumed with a fresh lift. Drink from 2018
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: With intense acidity, this wine has both good structure and red currant and raspberry fruits. It is bright, fresh and almost crisp in character. In the background, the tannins show the dense texture of the wine. It will need to age, so don't drink before 2019.
title: Domaine René Bouvier 2014 Champ Salomon  (Marsannay)

description: This wine comes from one of the best vineyard sites in Savigny-lès-Beaune, on the slope closest to Beaune. It is a smooth, perfumed and ripe wine that has a balanced structure under the bright red-cherry flavor. Still bursting with young fruit, the wine will age, so wait to drink until 2019.
title: Nicolas Potel 2014 Les Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Deceptively light and tight when first opened, this wine has flavors and character more in line with Gamay than most Pinots. Tart cranberry and raspberry fruit carries into a tangy finish, with citrus, mineral and herbal highlights.
title: Adelsheim 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: With tannins and new-wood flavors, this rich wine is also structured. A smoky character from the wood is shot through by perfumed red fruits. The aftertaste shows more of the wood flavors that need to integrate. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Collotte 2014 Clos de Jeu  (Marsannay)

description: This new sister label from Elk Cove offers 100% Willamette Valley Pinot Noir at an everyday price. Fresh cranberry and raspberry fruit is framed by herb-tinged tannins. The immaculate craftsmanship and clean direct flavors are light years beyond budget Pinot Noir from most other regions. This is your perfect salmon wine.
title: Pike Road 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is well poised between structure and fresh red fruits. A dark side of firm tannins gives a dry core to the wine, while the bright red-berry fruit is perfumed and fresh. The two elements are integrating well. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Bart 2014 Grandes Vignes  (Marsannay)

description: A soft and fruity wine that brings out attractive red berries and ripe plum flavors. There is the lightest touch of structure in a wine that is totally ready to drink.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Les Enfants Terribles Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Light strawberry, tart cherry and fruit-punch aromas arise on the nose of this widely available bottling. It's quite soft and weak on the palate, with red cherries, strawberries and a touch of thyme.
title: William Hill Estate 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Cherry fruits dominate this fresh wine. It has an attractive perfumed character with spice and acidity adding to the light texture and fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.
title: Labouré-Roi 2014 Vieilli en Fût de Chêne  (Bourgogne)

description: Rubbery plum, tomato and spice aromas are modest. This has a standard but healthy mouthfeel and flavors of raspberry, herbs and spice. On the finish, this doesn't offer anything different than what's on the palate.
title: Undurraga 2014 U Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Maipo Valley)

description: Aromas of black cherry and smoked meats lead to tastes of black cherry and vanilla. It is soft both on entry and finish.
title: Avia 2014 Hand Harvested Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Primorska)

description: Some flint hovers above the glass and leads to a simple but pepper-spicy body that is light and very crisp. Drink this simple wine soon.
title: Domaine Pfister 2014 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This is a pretty, perfumed wine. It is all jammy, with only light tannins. Bright and fragrant, it is sure to develop quickly. so drink from 2018.
title: Domaine René Bouvier 2014 En Ouzeloy  (Marsannay)

description: This wine is soft and rather shapeless. It has red fruits and a gentle texture while lacking in depth. It's a simple wine that will develop quickly.
title: Labouré-Roi 2014  Chambolle-Musigny

description: Cherry and lactic aromas give this a forced, pushy nose. Reasonable freshness and flavors of cherry, plum and minty oak are adequate, while the finish is scratchy and hot, with peppery spice and leftover oak.
title: Montes 2014 Limited Selection Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Costa)

description: Slight touches of smoked meat, iron, slate, cranberry, raspberry and dried sage show on the nose of this wine. The palate is a bit weak, with tangy strawberry and rust flavors.
title: Silver Palm 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
