title: Marshall Davis 2014 Beacon Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Dusty plum flavors meet baked bread aromas in this tightly-wound, tense vineyard-designated wine. It's marked by an undercurrent of pomegranate and rhubarb, the texture taking on more savory tones of forest and black tea as it finishes.
title: Siduri 2014 Betty Ann Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A waft of freshly baked baguette unfurls on the nose of this wine, followed by sautéed mushroom scents, giving it earthy character. Soft and round on the palate, the fruit tends toward darker, lusher notes of blueberry and plum.
title: Siduri 2014 Ewald Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: One of the lighter-bodied wines from the producer and the first to designate this Westside Road vineyard, this wine shows expansive strawberry, raspberry and blueberry flavors, with a hearty texture, moderate acidity moderate and almost creamy finish.
title: Williams Selyem 2014 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Earthy and inviting with wild raspberry, cherry and strawberry flavors, this fruity, light-bodied wine also allows room for rose petal and forest notes. Tart and peppery, it finishes with rhubarb accents.
title: Kenwood 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Just a single barrel of this designate was bottled—too bad, as it's a tasty wine with bold fruit flavors of cranberry and cherry. Baking spices and a streak of cola come through also, and this should drink nicely into the mid-2020s.
title: Love & Squalor 2014 Temperance Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A tart orange-and-cranberry freshness meets baked bread and brambly black-cherry aromas in this vineyard designate. It's a lusciously ripe wine that's high in acidity and memorably fruity. The oak is marked by a tease of vanilla.
title: Ousterhout 2014 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Complex aromatics link notes of pine needle, chocolate cherry bark and pepper. In the mouth it's smooth and supple, graceful and polished. It finishes slightly chalky and citrusy. Drink up by 2020.
title: The Four Graces 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Cranberry fruit and hibiscus lead the nose of this bottling, bolstered by wild thyme and fennel scents. There is a pleasant sandalwood entry to the palate, where a rounded, smoky quality enwraps the tart raspberry fruit.
title: Scott Family 2014 Dijon Clone Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: Made in a full-bodied style with a density of firm tannins, this wine offers a mix of ripe black cherry and black licorice notes, the core succulent and strong.
title: Screen Door Cellars 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is restrained on the nose and initially on the palate, showing a touch of reduction and tightly-held flavor. As it opens, it unleashes juicy dark cherry, berry and huckleberry notes, its core dense with tannin and oak.
title: Belden Barns 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

description: A block-designated, 100% whole cluster-fermented wine, this shows a slightly carbonic mouthfeel and vibrant acidity. The flavors lean toward wild strawberry, pomegranate and cranberry, with a depth of forest compost lurking underneath.
title: Belden Barns 2014 Serendipity Block Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

description: This blend of seven clones, all estate grown, comes together with well-integrated berry and cherry fruit. There's a pleasantly dusty note, a touch of brown spices, and just a hint of heat in the finish.
title: Carabella 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Crisp and robust in pine-forest aromas, ripe cranberry and savory black tea, this coastal wine is feral yet velvety in texture. Concentrated and full bodied, it has underbelly that's undeniably mineral.
title: Castello di Amorosa 2014 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Floral and earthy in tone, this vineyard-designated wine has an undercurrent of spice to it that complements its baked plum, orange and cranberry fruit. Medium bodied, ripe and concentrated, it offers breadth and softness of texture.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2014 J Nicole's Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a big, meaty wine that wears its youthfulness on its sleeve, showing a touch of reduction and assertive oak. Beneath its wall of ripeness, black licorice, cherry and pomegranate characteristics are buoyed by a depth of thick tannin.
title: MacRostie 2014 Manzana Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: This wine is bright and crisp in strawberry and red licorice flavors, with a depth of juicy plum that adds softness and velvety texture. Tawdry earth complements the exuberant fruit.
title: Siduri 2014 Lingenfelder Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A strongly herbal take on the grape, this clonal combo shows bay leaf, eucalyptus and tarry earth notes on the nose. The palate kicks off with a red plum tang, settling into cranberry -inflected fruit before pine needle-laced forest floor flavors emerge with herbaceous power.
title: Wrath 2014 Swan/828 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Dijon and Pommard clones blend gracefully here, pushing sweet cherry fruit and baking spices into the flavor center. A touch of fresh-baked pie crust lingers also, and this easy-drinking cuvée should be enjoyed now through 2020.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2014 Tualatin Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Just three barrels were made of this rather unusual wine. It's a seemingly disparate mix of raspberries, gun metal, dried seaweed and carpaccio, yet somehow it all comes together. The length is impressive. This is one of those wines that will thrill some tasters and puzzle others.
title: Brooks 2014 La Chenaie Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is a broad-shouldered, full-bodied wine that shows true varietal character in its mix of earthy, spicy strawberry and cherry notes.
title: David Bruce 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Full figured but soft in texture, this wine is otherwise light in approach and weight, with spicy acidity framing cardamom and black tea accents.
designation: Year of the Horse Ten Oaks Single Vineyard
title: Donum 2014 Year of the Horse Ten Oaks Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There almost is a touch of red apple amidst all of the aromatic red and black cherries. The palate is juicy and concentrated—the finely-woven tannins crunch just a little and everything is brightened by freshness. This is a very harmonious, fruit-driven and juicy Pinot Noir that is full of ready joy. The finish is aromatic, long and moreish.
title: Domaine Mersiol 2014 Elevé en Muid Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Earthy cherry and cardamom seize the palate at first, before a tang of pomegranate and cranberry sneaks in to provide freshness and minerality. Tannic in its youth, this medium-bodied red also offers a minty note of black tea.
title: MacRostie 2014 Hellenthal Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: A fairly priced varietal wine, this shows currant, cranberry, raisin and a flurry of allspice on the nose. It takes on rose petal and lavender aromas as it opens, making it all the more pleasant and memorable.
title: Friedeman 2014 Dichotomy Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There's a noticeable tilt of barrel reduction in this wine that keeps it more closed-off than desired. Otherwise, the experience is full bodied in baked bread and black cherry, with a tangy freshness to the finish.
title: Krutz 2014 Magnolia Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Plump red cherry and red cranberry meet with touches of anise, sagebrush, cola and purple flowers on the nose of this smartly priced bottling. Strawberry candy, smashed herbs and more anise show once sipped, framed by lots of acidity.
title: Chloe 2014 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: Fairly light in aromas, this bottling shows red cherry and raspberry fruit lifted with an herbal edge of crushed thyme. The palate is also dainty in flavors, clinging to wet slate and cement minerality more so than fruit, although touches of cranberry and hibiscus notes do arise.
title: Nielson by Byron 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Whiffs of nuts and smoke mingle into blackberry and bramble in this dry, slightly herbal wine. Light bodied, it has a refreshingly brisk, cutting mouthfeel that's pleasant.
title: The Old Field 2014 Blush de Noir Pinot Noir (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Three appellations are called into service for this red, the majority from Sonoma and Monterey counties, with the remainder from tiny San Benito County. Together the fruit feels somewhat unformed while savory, a hodgepodge of red berry with a high-toned finish.
title: Landmark 2014 Overlook Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County)

description: The wine turns around red fruits and acidity. Aged in tanks rather than wood, it has red-berry and red-cherry flavors edged by tannins, with a crisp burst of acidity. With its light final texture, the wine is made to be drunk young.
title: Domaine Michel Thomas et Fils 2014  Sancerre

description: Smashed wild red berries and redcurrants are pumped up with a strong oak smoke and struck-match character that is alluring though distracting. Tart cherry and cranberry fruit show along with hibiscus and sandalwood on the light, woody palate that also offers some juniper.
title: Formation 2014 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Jaw-dropping on all fronts, this wine by the pioneering Franscioni family approaches regional perfection. Black plum fruit meets with dried violet and lavender on the extremely well-integrated nose, while a mineral tension frames the palate. Flavors of black plum and blackberry jam are cut by rocky earth and wild mint, and the acidity is vibrant but not overpowering.
title: Roar 2014 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is such a perfumed wine with deceptively soft tannins and great fruit. The acidity is classic for the vintage, with raspberries and intense freshness at the end. It has a fine line of tannins and a life that will go far. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine des Lambrays 2014  Clos de Lambrays

description: This wine is dense, although you hardly notice the tannins for the weight of concentrated fruit. The tannins are there, though, a power to thrust this immense wine well into the future. It is well formed, firm while rich. Drink from 2024.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Chambertin)

description: Vines planted in the 1960s give this wine its great concentration. With its powerful fruits and dense tannins, it is well structured, with the hallmark bright fruits of the vintage along with acidity. The tannins are very present at the moment, and the wine will need long aging. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2014  Chambertin

description: This massive wine is powered by dark, concentrated and smoky tannins that are masking the fruit. Dry and dense, it will take many years for the black fruits behind the facade to develop. Drink this intense wine from 2025.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Grands-Echezeaux)

description: This wine has a smoky character that gives an exotic touch to the red fruits. It comes from 60-year old vines that give concentration and dark tannins. As it ages, the wine will broaden and expand to convey opulence and richness. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine des Croix 2014 Grèves  (Corton)

description: This wine is concentrated and dense. Big tannins flow up through this wine, giving shape to the ripe black fruit. In the back, acidity dominates bright red berries and the potential for a rich, generous future. The wine will age over many years. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014  Mazis-Chambertin

description: This dense and complex wine comes from one of the magnificent Grand Cru vineyards in Morey Saint-Denis. It is a powerful wine with its rich, generous fruit and dense tannins. It has everything larger than life: big fruit, big tannins and a big future. Drink this exceptional wine from 2024.
title: Albert Bichot 2014  Clos de la Roche

description: Big, ripe and smoky, this wine is generous while having great freshness. It's packed with fresh strawberries and raspberries along with powerful tannins. The combination of structure and great fruit will allow this wine to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014  Chambertin Clos de Bèze

description: Produced from vines mainly planted in the 1970s, this is a concentrated dark wine. Rich and ripe, it has powerful tannins mingled with beautifully perfumed fruits. The wine is dense and packed with floral fruitiness as well as fine, sweet tannins. Drink from 2025.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2014  Musigny

description: There's a rugged earthiness and delicious meaty character to this fantastic bottling, which shows dried cranberries, dried olallieberry, smoked pork and hummingbird sage on the brawny nose. A similar power infects the palate, where red and black cherry meet with plum, mulberry, cola, shaved chocolate and a deepening sage character, finishing on crushed mint.
title: Martin Ray 2014 Coast Grade Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A stunning bottling from the Franscioni family, this shows exotic cinnamon, crystallized black-cherry juice, fresh black raspberry and graphite on the extremely elegant, soft and inviting nose. There's a tension between ripe black raspberry and everything else on the palate, from fennel and black pepper to black slate minerality. It's a seamless wine.
title: Roar 2014 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Firmly structured, this dark wine has smoky tannins and intense acidity combined in a texture that is dusty, almost dry at the core. Over this the ripe red fruits are spread thickly, giving a powerful concentrated wine that will age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014  Echézeaux

description: Dark fruit backs up the dense, dark and firm character of this wine. There is sweetness from the ripe fruits into which the tannins fall, leaving a trace of dryness at the end. A fine wine with a great future; drink from 2022.
title: Domaine des Croix 2014 La Vigne au Saint  (Corton)

description: Just next door to the Corton Grand Cru vines, this vineyard can produce wines of equal quality. This wine certainly has something of the richness and structure, giving it concentration and longevity. Ripe red fruits are cut by dark tannins and equal acidity, allowing the wine to mature slowly and well. Drink from 2020.
title: Nicolas Potel 2014 Les Petites Lolières Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: This wine by retired baseball stars Rich Aurilia and Dave Roberts shows both ripeness and restraint in all corners. On the nose, that means star anise and slate layered across black cherry and blackberry fruit. On the palate, the very full mouthfeel packs thyme, crushed herbs and elderberry flavors into an earthy package.
title: Red Stitch 2014 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Bright and clear, this young wine is powered by racy cranberry and raspberry fruit. It's a wine that will appeal to those who love primary, juicy, tangy red fruit, but will carry a long way in the cellar for those who value the extra dimensions that well-aged Pinot can convey. Tuck a few bottles away and watch as they blossom into complex wines with dusty elegance. Drink now through 2030.
title: Elizabeth Chambers 2014 Lazy River Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This rich wine is dense with dark tannins and concentrated structure. The vineyard, with cool winds from the valley behind, gives wines that demand aging with their tannins and fragrant fruit. The aftertaste is full of promise. Drink after 2022.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Lavaux Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: A flagship of the Faiveley range, this is a structured wine with great acidity and beautiful perfumes. The wine is dense, already balanced with the red fruits shining through the tannins. It will develop slowly and will not be ready to drink before 2023.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Clos des Cortons Faiveley  (Corton)

description: This is a beautiful, ripe and floral wine. It does have structure although the main focus is on the rich, juicy fruit. Berries and red plums push through the rounded tannins. It will age magnificently, with great richness.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014  Latricières-Chambertin

description: Big, juicy and smoky, this powerful wine comes from vines in the center of the vineyard. Black fruits and firm tannins dominate the richness of the wine with its dark structure and concentration. A touch of chocolate and licorice partners with the generous fruits. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2014  Clos de Vougeot

description: This wine is perfumed with cherries and red berries. Its structure, which is certainly there, is almost secondary to this brilliant fruit. Balanced with a mineral dryness, the wine is certainly going to age into a ripe, pure-fruited wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine des Croix 2014 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: The slightest touch of wildfire kicks off the nose, followed by aromas of hibiscus, light cranberry, dried rose petal, roasted pork shank and white pepper. It's quite light upon first sip, then a peppery intensity builds as flavors of underripe raspberry, fresh thyme and dewy oregano arise. For a lighter style of the grape, it's a classic, and stays fresh for days.
title: Chanin 2014 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Ripe and sweet, this wine is full of generous red plums and berries. It is immediately attractive with its spice, structure and tannins playing a supporting role to the almost jammy fruit. Acidity at the end adds some attractive freshness to this ripe wine. Drink from 2020
title: Domaine Huguenot 2014 La Montagne  (Marsannay)

description: Perfumed and juicy, this is an opulent wine. With its red-cherry flavors it also has freshness that makes it rich and generous while keeping a line of tight acidity and powerful tannins. Drink from 2024.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Echézeaux)

description: The inviting shade of ruby red is quite light in the glass, but this wine offers a full experience, starting with a nose that combines tart cranberry with orange rind, Kalamata olive and eucalyptus. It's bright, fresh and tart on the palate, with green olive, crushed herbs, underripe raspberry, cranberry-orange juice and sea salt flavors.
title: Betwixt 2014 Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Cherry tomatoes, black olives, Kalamata olives, green olives, black pepper and dried herbs show on the nose of this zesty wine, done in a lavish not sparse manner. A rainbow of peppercorns pop on the palate, touching on the grape's herbaceous tendencies and showing tagine and tapenade flavors, but with tons of vibrancy and freshness. A well-done version of this flavor profile.
title: Waxwing 2014 Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This wine is firm, dense and spicy. From a vineyard that received hail for three years running, the wine is missing fruit at the moment. It has good acidity though and hints of red fruits. It needs time and will be ready to drink after 2020.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Frémiets Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This ripe, juicy wine offers attractive red fruits. The tannins are firm and dry at the core of this perfumed wine, while a layer of acidity gives freshness. It is beginning to balance well, full of fruit as well as structure. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Huguenot 2014 Charmes aux Prêtres  (Marsannay)

description: This is the second release this year from Maison Louis Jadot's Oregon project—both wines are labeled Résonance, but this is the Willamette Valley cuvée, not the Résonance vineyard bottling. Some estate fruit is included, and it is a subtle and detailed wine, with pretty mulberry and pie-cherry fruit. Thirteen months in 20% new French oak adds light mocha highlights, and it is as smooth and refined as one might expect from master winemaker Jacques Lardière.
title: Résonance 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Fresh-pressed alpine strawberries and blackberries are lifted by touches of cola and fresh lilac on this wine by retired baseball pros Rich Aurilia and Dave Roberts, today the Dodgers' manager. Turned earth, juniper, pine needle, thyme and bay leaf form a very earthy core to the sip, where dark-red and even purple fruit carry the ripeness torch.
title: Red Stitch 2014 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This has both a rich structure and rich fruit. The tannins comes first, dark and concentrated with spice and a dry core. After it, the ripe and juicy black fruit is layered with dense acidity. Together these two elements make for a concentrated wine that will age. Drink from 2020.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Ripe and juicy, this is a wine with structure and fine, dusty tannins that give it density. The red fruit is juicy, perfumed and has the freshness of the vintage, bright and forward. The underlying tannins are concentrated and will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2020.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: This austere wine offers some firm tannins over the red fruit. It has acidity, red-currant fruit and a core of dryness, typical of young Pommard, that suggests it will age well. Drink from 2020.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Les Rugiens Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Pavillon Les Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This wine is smoky with hints of wood. The red-plum fruits are a little suppressed at the moment although the acidity and freshness hint at a good future. It has a cool character with plenty of acidity under the tannins. It will develop, but slowly. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Aux Chaignots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Perhaps the greatest way to taste this legendary winery in an affordable way, this appellation-blend bottling shows baked bramble pie, dried chaparral scrub, licorice, roasted beef and allspice on the palate. The plump blackberry and black-cherry fruit is leveled by rocky minerality and clove spice, all boosted by long lasting acidity.
title: Williams Selyem 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: This wine has firm tannins and a dry, structured core. From vines that are close to Beaune, it is dense and concentrated, although with the pure fruit that marks out the vintage. It is going to develop well and with great style.
title: Domaine des Croix 2014 Les Peuillets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Lively, spicy and warm, this full-bodied wine wraps firm tannins around flavors like mulled berries and preserved cherries, though it's also surprisingly fresh and vibrant. After baking spices, mellow fruit comes through on the palate, while the firm texture really keeps it going on the finish.
title: Boeger 2014 Pinot Grande Pinot Noir (El Dorado)

description: This deeply flavored wine bursts forth with ripe blueberry, plum and cherry fruit. The mouthfeel is silky and succulent, wrapping the forward fruit into darker flavors laced with minty cacao, licorice and espresso. Drink now through 2026.
title: Elk Cove 2014 Mount Richmond Pinot Noir

description: Coconut scents convene around ripe purple fruits—blueberry and plum—which abound here. Lovely and seductive, this has the potential for long-term aging, which should bring additional layers of complexity. Drink now through 2028.
title: WildAire 2014 Beacon Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This limited block selection comes from own-rooted vines planted in 1979. Full-fruited flavors combine into a fresh and lush mix of berries and cherries with a citrusy kick. There's a tropical punch sensibility combined with the texture and depth of a very fine Pinot. The tannins are polished and in perfect proportion.
title: Bethel Heights 2014 Flat Block Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Rich and textural, this gloriously mixes raspberries, cherries, baking spices, cola, cocoa and coconut components, all woven together seamlessly. It's forward and juicy, yet built for medium-term aging. Drink now through 2026.
title: Domaine Drouhin Oregon 2014 Dundee Hills Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This is produced from 25-year-old vines in the Chambertin Grand Cru vineyard. It is a smoky, structured wine with layers of dark fruits and ripe tannins, with the fresh acidity of the year. Lots of attractive fruit is surrounded by the firm tannins and dry aftertaste. It should not be drunk before 2020.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2014 Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This balanced wine is full of dusty, dry tannins as well as ripe red fruits. A smokiness gives a dense, toasty character to the wine. With good acidity, typical of the vintage, the wine is well placed to develop. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Jean Fournier 2014 Les Longeroies  (Marsannay)

description: This is a big, crowd-pleasing take on Pinot Noir, with fresh and ripe red berries enhanced by barrel smoked toasted teriyaki pork and a pinch of violet on the nose. Ripe raspberry juice shows on the juicy palate, but so does wet slate minerality, dried sage and thyme and even nice pine needle and eucalyptus astringency.
title: El Pistolero 2014 Bin 7 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: The richness and structure of the appellation are well represented in this firm wine. It has dark tannins and hints of wood aging as well as ripe black cherry and berry fruits. With its structure and intense acidity, the wine will age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Nicolas Potel 2014  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: This young, precocious wine is still knitting together, but is already quite tasty. Vanilla custard and tart red-berry flavors combine in the core, then smooth out through a silky, chocolatey finish.
title: Hyland 2014 Pommard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Planted in 1979, the Wädenswil block brings raspberry, cherry and cola flavors together into a nicely textured wine with a wide streak of vanilla. Round and forward, it gently resolves into a balanced finish with light highlights of herb, nutmeg and coffee.
title: Hyland 2014 Wädenswil Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This conveys pure strawberry fruit with just the right amount of tannin, making for a beautiful, perfumed wine. The dry core is still juicy with acidity and raspberry fruits, while acidity shoots through at the end. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Bruno Clair 2014 Les Longeroies  (Marsannay)

description: Firm black cherry fruit opens with a slightly liquorous, Bourbon barrel accent. This young wine is still knitting together, but with ample breathing time it smoothes out, delivering a robust mix of ripe fruit, highlights of sassafras, and a hint of charcoal. Drink now or tuck it away another few years.
title: Bethel Heights 2014 Justice Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This clonal selection is sourced from vines planted in 2002. Fresh and precise, it's tinged with slightly bitter herbs. The cranberry and raspberry fruits set up with ample acidity. There's excellent definition and pull through on the flavors, with a lick of milk chocolate from limited time in once-used barrels.
title: Hyland 2014 Dijon 115 Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Another stunning deal on this annual bottling, this wine is jammy and fruity on the nose with buttered cherries and berry jam, yet layered with baking spice and wet clay minerality. Dried strawberries, black cherries and plums show on the palate, enhanced by a toasted clove, graphite, juniper and forest floor mintiness.
title: Pali 2014 Huntington Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: This medium-bodied wine has a compelling blend of restraint and power. It offers modest, fruity aromas at first, then nice tart fruit flavors that start off lean and soon expand exponentially in the mouth before tapering off elegantly on the finish. With little oak flavor in the way, it gives pure Pinot sophistication.
title: Navarro 2014 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Always a top cuvée for Sineann, this refined and detailed effort shows distinct mineral notes in both its nose and its finish. Concentrated raspberry and plum fruit is lightly dusted with cocoa powder, and the extended finish has highlights of baking spices.
title: Sineann 2014 Yates Conwill Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This deservedly popular value bottle gets the star Pinot treatment—nine months in French oak, 27% new. It's spicy and full-flavored, with resonant blue plum fruit, buttery toast and a tannic frame.
title: Owen Roe 2014 Sharecropper's Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Wonderfully aromatic and packed with flavor, this outstanding value opens lightly spicy with zingy raspberry fruit. It's like a tart jam, with citrus-peel highlights peeking through in the sappy finish.
title: Sineann 2014 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Who puts their lowest-priced Pinot Noir in 20% new French oak, and includes fruit from their best vineyards in the blend? Ponzi does, and the result is a terrific vintage for Tavola. Bright, compact, aromatic and lushly fruited with plum and black cherry, this is a stunning value. Cola, caramel and cinnamon spice add further details and highlights.
title: Ponzi 2014 Tavola Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Wild berries, from elderberry to salmonberry to mountain strawberries, are in play in this wine. The underpinning scents suggest earth and wet cement, while in the finish a strong flavor of breakfast tea lingers. This is an interesting addition to the Sineann lineup.
title: Sineann 2014 Russell-Grooters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This low-alcohol rosé spent five months in neutral oak, yielding additional complexity and an appealing creaminess to the finish. Strawberry and cherry flavors are accompanied by lighter hints of peaches and sweet spices. It's a thoroughly modern, delicious rosé.
title: Trinity Vineyards 2014 Rosé Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Silky succulent raspberry and cherry flavors are a luscious counterpoint to the razor's edge of acidity that frames this impeccably balanced wine. It's ripe, fruity and forward, yet offers surprising elegance and length. Drink now through 2017.
title: Dr. Nägler 2014 Estate Bottled Trocken Pinot Noir (Rheingau)

description: Tim Knappstein's decision to focus on the Adelaide Hills bears fruit in this terrific-value Pinot Noir. The aromas and flavors are a colorful mélange of beets, black cherries and purple heirloom tomatoes, backed by a rich texture and a long velvety finish. Drink now until 2020.
title: Riposte 2014 The Dagger Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: All Pinot Noir, fermented in neutral oak and put through partial malolactic, this belongs in the rosé category. A pretty, pale-copper color, it offers a pleasing toasted-cracker frame around stone fruit and supple acids. Drink this chilled to white wine temperature.
title: Swick 2014 Cancilla Vineyard Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A light mauve in color, this Pinot Noir-based wine shows boisterous plum fruit, macerated strawberries and a hint of clove on the ripe nose, making it more entrée-ready than apéritif-aimed. The palate offers strawberry and bubble-gum notes deftly hidden behind a veil of sour cherry and plum-skin tartness.
title: Scratch 2014 Rosé Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: Brisk and bright, this delicately framed Pinot Noir offers both elegance and thirst-quenching quaffability. It's fresh and primary, bursting of raspberry and blossom, but finishes suprisingly long with a murmur of feathery tannin. Drink now.
title: Thomas Schmitt 2014 Private Collection Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)

description: Slightly muted aromatically and on the palate, this sports clean and fresh cherry fruit, with a pleasing suggestion of minerality. The midpalate feels a bit hollow.
title: Sineann 2014 Zenith Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Raspberry flavors are front and center in this young, light wine. It keeps the tart acids in proportion, and the palate is focused and well defined. The finish turns hard and tannic, but further bottle age should soften it up a bit.
title: Swick 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: It's difficult to find $20 Pinot Noir this good from anywhere in the world. Floral notes on the nose yield to ripe black-cherry fruit on the palate, which finish finishes with crisp acids and soft, dusty tannins. Drink now–2020.
title: Innocent Bystander 2014 Pinot Noir (Victoria)

description: Ripe red cherry and raspberry penetrate deeply throughout this sunny, yet briskly composed Pinot Noir. It's approachable and uncomplicated in style, but pristine juicy flavors make it quite quaffable. Drink now.
title: Schäfer 2014 Mettenheimer Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)

description: This is a toasty oaky version of Pinot Noir, loaded with cedar, vanilla and wood-derived tannins. Yet there's enough cherry fruit to provide ample support, and delicate herbal shadings peer through on the bright, concentrated finish. Drink now through 2020.
title: Wakefield 2014 Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: Pretty scents and flavors of bright cherry fruit come up quickly, with enough concentration to batten down a medium-long finish. A light hint of sweat or animal comes up also.
title: Day 2014 Cancilla Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Pretty in pink and orange hues, this stainless-steel-fermented charmer has a candied orange flavor that's delicious, followed by fresh, crisp strawberry and tangerine-laced acidity. Medium bodied, it ends with a burst of peach.
title: Rodney Strong 2014 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: An effusive wine, this shows potent, almost sweet aromas and opulent flavors with hints of mint and rosemary. It has a medium body, fine tannins that add nicely to the texture and a lingering finish.
title: Donkey & Goat 2014 Helluva Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: The grapes were farmed biodynamically, fermented with wild yeasts, and just two barrels were aged in new oak. The stiff berry fruit is cloaked in details of stem and earth, tart acids and a whiff of compost.
title: Day 2014 Johan Vineyards Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Blended from Yarra Valley and King Valley fruit, this light-bodied Pinot Noir is silky in texture, with a lingering finish. Modest red fruit combines with earthier notes of parsnip. Drink now.
title: Shoofly 2014 Pinot Noir (Victoria)

description: Blossomy and perfumed, this white wine made from red Pinot Noir grapes exudes much of the variety's smoky floral flair against the backdrop of a crisp, refreshing white wine. The palate is concentrated in pressed apple and pear notes that finish briskly. Drink now.
title: Carl Ehrhard 2014 Blanc de Noirs Rüdesheim Trocken Spätburgunder (Rheingau)

description: This agreeable and affordable wine has cinnamon and cherry jelly aromas, fresh and light fruit flavors, medium body, and a soft texture.
title: Grayson 2014 Lot 5 Pinot Noir (California)

description: There's a hint of a sweaty, earthy undertone in the nose, and this wine shows a fair amount of stem and earth flavors. Sour cherry fruit adds a lighter layer, with notes of cement and bark. It spent time in 11% new oak.
title: Day 2014 Crowley Station Vineyards Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Renowned winemaking consultant Larry Cherubino lent his deft touch to this reasonably priced offering. It's a very ripe style for Pinot Noir, combining ample weight with plush tannins and superripe dark cherry-berry fruit. Drink now.
title: Ad Lib 2014 Cruel Mistress Pinot Noir (Pemberton)

description: Cooked plums, ripe strawberries, cola and a bit of clove make for an interesting nose on this bottling from a reliable and widely accessible producer. The palate shows slate, rust and pencil shavings as well as nutmeg and sour cranberries.
title: Vinum 2014 V Series Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Somewhat disjointed, this watery effort hints at berry flavors, with a bit of road tar and cola.
title: Henry Estate 2014 Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)

description: This wine is soft and fruity, with a smoky touch that adds interest. Red-cherry flavors and balanced acidity allow easy accessibility. The wine, with its gentle texture, is ready to drink.
title: Nicolas Idiart 2014 Pinot Noir (Val de Loire)

description: An exceptionally young wine that tastes like bacon and cherry syrup, this offers an overripe, concentrated and thick drink experience.
title: Ashokawna 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A deliciously light, bright wine that hits the mark year after year, this cool-climate offering is fresh in zingy acidity and juicy flavors of grapefruit, strawberry and lime. The acidity buoys the experience from first sip to last, backed by enough body to remain in balance. This wine is fermented like a white wine without skin or seed contact.
title: Red Car 2014 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Just one barrel was produced from this nine-acre site in the heart of the AVA. This is picture perfect, refined and textural, with flavors that roll from rose petals to strawberries to Bing cherries. A well-framed touch of oak (noted as neutral, yet detectable) contributes to an elongated finish that begs for the next glass. Still young and compact, this should drink its best from 2018 through 2028.
title: Elizabeth Chambers 2014 Lone Madrone Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Light, clear and softly crafted to highlight dried herb and cranberry tea, this is a rounded, approachably complex wine, a nice representative of the vintage, warm and easy. Peppery cola closes things out with length and grace.
title: Lucie 2014 Dutton Ranch Widdoes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Not only is this a great bottling at a judicious price, but it also shows a great deal of nuance from the appellation that often brings mostly power. Blackberry, beef, smoked game and pencil shavings show on the nose. The palate brings bright hibiscus and tart elderberry as well as graphite, thyme and bay-leaf flavors.
title: Stephen Ross 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This wine has smoky wood and rich fruit already well in balance. It offers ripe acidity from its strawberry and red-currant fruits along with a rich texture. The wine is already delicious although it will develop much further. Drink from 2019.
title: Yves Giradin 2014 Les Vignes Franches Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Sensuous beyond words, this beguiling bottle absolutely seduces from the first sniff to the last sip. The amazing bouquet is a dense jumble of raspberry jam, cranberry compôte, orange peel and candied citrus. The flavors bore down deeply into a finish that can only lead you in one direction—to the next glass.
title: Archery Summit 2014 Whole Cluster Cuvée Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This dark wine is still full of young tannins from a cool, east-facing vineyard. The red-berry fruit is beginning to show through, crisp and tight with considerable acidity. The wine will take time to develop and will not be ready before 2019.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2014 En Sazenay Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Some winemakers have a special feel for Pinot Noir, and Michael Stevenson, winemaker for Elizabeth Chambers, has earned a place among those select few. Previously known as Panther Creek, the winery has been re-branded and re-imagined under the current owners. This deliberate, controlled single vineyard effort punches through with a concentrated mix of plum, rhubarb and cherry fruit, showing exceptional grip, balance and length.
title: Elizabeth Chambers 2014 Menefee Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This wine comes from a one-acre parcel on the Corton hill. It is dense and dark both in color and in black-fruit flavors. Concentrated from the 50-year-old vines, it is firm with tannins and solid with rich fruitiness. The wine needs time; drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2014 Le Rognet  (Corton)

description: This is a big, ripe and bold wine full of red fruits and fine tannins. Crisp red currant outlines the ripe wild-strawberry flavors. It shows good balance between young tannins and the generous texture. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Coquard Loisson-Fleurot 2014  Echézeaux

description: This is full and fruity with great swathes of smoky tannins. Structured and concentrated, it promises a good future. Strawberry and red-plum flavors are there, along with the darker tannic element. Drink from 2019.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Les Peuilletes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is a ripe and fruity wine. Soft, generous tannins are embedded in the developing red-fruit flavors. With spice, hints of the wood aging and a rich texture, the wine will develop relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Echézeaux

description: Zenith is the winery's estate vineyard, and represents a particularly fine value in a splendid lineup. The ripe, plummy fruit is swathed in rich brown spices, a sweet streak of molasses, and notes of tobacco and black tea. Decant and enjoy immediately, or cellar for another couple of years to let the flavors continue melding.
title: St. Innocent 2014 Zenith Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Still quite closed, this is a firm wine with all its tight tannins still in place. It's dry at this stage, although the fruit is going to develop well. Acidity and a hint of perfumed red-berry flavors promise a good future. Drink from 2020.
title: Maison Champy 2014 Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A family operation, now run by Jean-Pierre and Philippe, Guillernot's flagship wine is generous and ripe. It has plenty of warm structure, while the red fruits are juicy and perfumed. This is developing into a full, rich wine that will be full of fruit. Drink from 2019 (this wine may age well beyond).
title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2014 Aux Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: The tannins are linear and direct in this otherwise fruity wine. Along with dark tannins, it is also rich with warm red fruits. The acidity still shows strongly and suggests that the wine needs time. Drink from 2020.
title: Henri de Villamont 2014 Feusselottes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This is a real cherry bomb, showing terrific concentration and purity of fruit. Those vibrant flavors come in a swath of cola, then dive into a compact finish that leaves a residual hint of chocolate seltzer. This wine seems to be slightly bottle shocked (though it was rested for some weeks after being shipped) and may well deserve a higher score with more bottle age.
title: Archery Summit 2014 Arcus Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: At first this seems sculpted in a feminine style, meaning elegant, graceful and light on its feet. It's a complete and satisfying wine, with strawberry, raspberry and cola flavors intertwined. Some tougher tannins show up in the finish, suggesting that a few more years of bottle age may add both length and further complexity.
title: Archery Summit 2014 Renegade Ridge Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Made with a minimal-intervention mind-set, this marries classic French winemaking to tight, almost steely Willamette Valley fruit. It's a taut, tense wine, focused on raspberry/cherry fruit, with firm, chocolate-tinged tannins. Highlights of malted milk and tobacco sneak into the extended finish.
title: Domaine Divio 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Named after the red soil of the vineyard, this wine is rich and full of generous red fruits. They are cut with the acidity of the vintage to give a crisp edge to this full-bodied wine. Spice and hedgerow fruits finish a wine that still needs to develop. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Santenay 2014 Montée Rouge Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From Quinta Santa Rosa Vineyard, this blend of clones 115, 667 and 777 shows deep pomegranate, dried violets, roiboos tea, baked plum and sarsaparilla notes on the nose. Cooked plum fruit also shows on the sip, which is dusted with clove, nutmeg, dried roses and earthy tannins. This plush wine is a mouthful.
title: Prodigal 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There are dark tannins here, although they are embedded in the ripe black fruits. This wine is solid and firm, the acidity giving the essential freshness. The fruitiness and the plush texture are taking their time to show. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2014 En Chevret Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: Soft, juicy acidity and texture buoy this wine in wonderful ways, providing a lithe foundation to punches of sassafras and truffled earth. Sourced from the famous vineyard on Westside Road in the northern reaches of the appellation, it shows off a flair of pine along with dark cherry.
title: Lucie 2014 Bacigalupi Vinyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Perfumed and juicy, this is already an attractive wine. Fine tannins and plenty of red fruits give a fresh and structured character. With a firmer background, it will develop well. Drink from 2020.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2014 Les Bressandes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Here is a bold, striking wine from the estate vineyard. Black cherries capture the core flavor of the Dundee Hills AVA, with substantial, somewhat grainy tannins. Highlights of coffee grounds add another dark note. Pair this with a thick, wild-caught salmon steak.
title: Winderlea 2014 Winderlea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Grown on rocky subsoil, this ripe and fruity wine has good acidity and plenty of black-cherry fruit. A darker core of tannins gives the wine a rich texture. With open fruits and plenty of acidity, the wine is developing well. Drink from 2019.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2014 Les Lavières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This wine is well balanced, with red-berry and plum-fruit flavors giving richness. A ripe, juicy character comes with the tight acidity. The smoky wood is just right. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine d'Ardhuy 2014 Aux Clous Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This rich wine has spice and red fruits backed by a dry texture. The smoky wood is still right up front, giving the wine a firm character. Wait for the fruit to develop further and drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2014 Les Cent Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Still firm and with dry tannins, this is a structured wine, with red fruits and acidity behind the concentrated texture. It suggests the succulent ripe fruitiness that will develop as the wine ages. Drink this generous wine from 2021.
title: Henri de Villamont 2014 Les Chatelots Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This wine is rich, firmly structured while also full of dense black fruits. It comes from one of the top premier-cru vineyards in the appellation, well situated halfway up the slope, facing east. The wine will develop slowly as the ripe fruit comes through the structure. Drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Les Rugiens Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This is a smoky and ripe wine from Beaune's top premier cru. Structured, dusty tannins support the red fruits and acidity. The combination is already rich, but holds good potential as well. It will be best from 2020.
designation: Sur les Grèves Clos Sainte-Anne Premier Cru Monopole
title: Jaffelin 2014 Sur les Grèves Clos Sainte-Anne Premier Cru Monopole  (Beaune)

description: A very pretty wine, in scent and flavor, this estate-grown effort offers aromas of rose petals and cherry blossoms. Those floral notes continue into the palate, with light cherry fruit and citrusy acids.
title: White Rose 2014 White Rose Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Young and tightly wound, this compact cuvée marries cranberry and raspberry fruit to proportionate tannins and a touch of acidity. There is a hint of clean earth as well.
title: Cristom 2014 Louise Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Tangy cranberry fruit carries light impressions of stem, in a compact frame. This single vineyard offering gains depth as it breathes, and shows enough stuffing for some mid-length cellar potential. Drink 2018–2024.
title: Big Table Farm 2014 Cattrall Brothers Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Tart black-cherry fruit carries a load of earth and stem flavors, along with notes of bitter chocolate shavings and espresso grounds. It's tannic and tart, with a dash of sassafras threaded through the finish.
title: Panther Creek 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Pretty cherry blossom perfume wafts midst dusty granite and crushed mineral tones in this approachable Spätburgunder. While a touch more nuanced than the producer's basic-label Pinot, it shares its juicy, easy black cherry and plum flavors. Sunny acidity and fine, yielding tannins add to its easy drinking feel. Drink now through 2020.
title: Grafen Neipperg 2014 Neipperger Trocken Spätburgunder (Württemberg)

description: This Pinot is a full, fragrant, fetching wine with spongy citrus and cherry fruit, underscored with leesy minerality. It's ready for immediate enjoyment, and should be consumed now through 2020.
title: Big Table Farm 2014 Pinot Noir

description: This is a solid wine from a new appellation, offering much promise for vintages to come. Baked red cherry, smashed pomegranate, cinnamon and bay leaf play on the nose, while anise, light clove, strawberry, red plum and red apple vie for attention on the palate.
title: Malibu Rocky Oaks 2014 Block Four Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Malibu Coast)

description: The Sullivan designate mixes Pommard, Wädenswil and Dijon 777 clones, which were aged 10 months in 30% new French oak. It's similar to the winery's Dardis bottling in terms of the balance between fruit and herbs, though here there is a bit of a hole in the midpalate. Otherwise, it's a friendly mix of black cherry, cola and chocolate: forward and open.
title: Fairsing 2014 Sullivan Pinot Noir

description: This smooth and detailed wine mixes tart red fruits with earthy, lightly charred flavors. The robust tannins carry notes of espresso beans and dark chocolate. It will need decanting and/or aeration to bring it all into proper balance.
title: Silvan Ridge 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The house style seems to favor wines with plenty of stem flavors, high acids and moderate alcohol—all of which are evident here. Flavors of rhubarb and sour cherry pull together in midpalate, with medium concentration and tangy highlights of citrus.
title: White Rose 2014 Winemaker's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This tart, sleek, pretty wine shows bright strawberry and raspberry fruit. Quite young and fresh, it's still rather tight and stubbornly closed, even after breathing for a full 24 hours.
title: Cristom 2014 Eileen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A haze of smoked nut and toasted cedar envelop ripe, fleshy black cherry and raspberry in this rich, but elegantly balanced, Spätburgunder. Crisp, tart cranberry and cassis notes brighten the midpalate easing into a finish marked b fine but slightly bitter tannins. Drinks well now but should meld nicely from 2020.
title: Baron Knyphausen 2014 Spätburgunder (Rheingau)

description: This wine, which features Gina Gallo's signature and hails from the family's Olson Ranch, shows rose petals, hibiscus, pomegranate and licorice candy on the nose. The palate blends strawberry with thyme, white pepper and bay leaf.
title: E & J Gallo 2014 Signature Series Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is well-made in a classic Oregon mold, which is to say, putting plenty of herbal highlights into the mix. There are light red fruits in abundance as well, and the flavors meld well through a medium-long finish.
title: Lange 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This well-priced effort is loaded with flavors, in a forward, fruit-powered style. Streaks of root beer, cola, earth and citrus create a nicely layered mouthfeel, but it's the ripe, sweet fruit that really shines here. It's perfect for drinking now through 2020.
title: Raptor Ridge 2014 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The Stalker is made by drying the stalks before embarking on whole berry fermentation. It's good to go, with bright cherry-candy flavors, light spices and a tart cranberry kick to the finish.
title: Roco 2014 The Stalker Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: In a ripe and forward vintage, this is an anomaly—a low alcohol, rather gravelly wine with an emphasis on non-fruit flavors. Which is not to say it's faulty—au contraire, it's fascinating, with a well-mixed potpourri of forest floor, moist leaves, gravel and spice. Drink now and over the next couple of years.
title: Vinum Ferus 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine breaks on the palate like a slider crossing the corner of the plate, just out of reach. A forward, fruit-driven entry drops into a tart midpalate, with plum and berry fruit. It fades away into a finish with strong acids, light chocolate and a hint of bitterness in the tannins.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2014 Heritage Clones Pinot Noir

description: Fresh-pressed raspberry, plums, dried sagebrush, wild thyme and a touch of mustard plant show on the nose of this wine, recalling a hike through the chaparral. Light but ripe cranberry fruit shows on the easygoing sip, alongside oregano, vanilla and rhubarb.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)

description: This is smooth as silk—supple and soft, with pretty cherry fruit and highlights of cocoa powder and coffee grounds. It's a professionally built wine all the way, made for easy enjoyment, with satiny tannins and a touch of anise.
title: La Crema 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Compact and battened down tightly, this tart, challenging wine is striated with layers of rhubarb, stem, earth and stone. The complexity is appealing, though some tasters will be looking for more robust fruit in a wine in this price range.
title: White Rose 2014 Anderson Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Fresh, cutting cassis and cranberry acidity lend vitality to this bright, perky Spätburgunder. The palate boasts crisp, primary black chery and berry flavors marked by a pleasant touch of nuttiness. Fine-grained tannins are easy and approachable on the finish. Drink now through 2021.
title: Castell 2014 Casteller Reitsteig Spätburgunder (Franken)

description: Bright, forward fruit flavors of cherry lollipop are backed with refreshing minerality. The mouthfeel and lively fruit flavors suggest popping this one soon, while the pretty primary fruit remains in full bloom.
title: Big Table Farm 2014 Wirtz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Dark shades of smoked nuts, char and dried, savory herbs mingle amidst ruddy black cherry and cranberry flavors in this bold, intensely structured Pinot Noir. It's a big, richly textured wine enveloping the palate in folds of dense black fruit. Fine but slightly bitter tannins mark the finish.
title: Pflüger 2014 Dürkheimer Trocken Pinot Noir (Pfalz)

description: Light strawberry fruit with tart acidity carries a wine of modest proportions. It's drinking well, and might be a good choice for a simple salmon preparation, as it would not overwhelm the fish. The finishing tannins have a definite herbal flavor.
title: Argyle 2014 Nuthouse Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This cuvée seems to be holding back, perhaps needing more time in the bottle. The raspberry/cherry fruit is clean and tart, though it gives the impression of soda pop rather than showing the density to age. It's well made in a light style, and may profit from a quick decanting.
title: Big Table Farm 2014 Sunnyside Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This Pinot is lightly peppery with fruit flavors of watermelon and strawberry. They're expanded with generous skin phenolic flavors from 50% whole cluster fermentation, then softened with aging in neutral oak. Though a light wine overall, it's complex and holds your attention.
title: Jasper Sisco 2014 Zenith Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Aromatics of rose and mint give this wine prettiness on the nose before getting into darker, richer components on the palate. Medium in build, it retains a sizable tannin presence in its youth, complemented by dark cherry and a char on the oak.
title: Robert Mondavi 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: A mix of clones and vineyard sources, this is a bit rough and tumble, as the name might suggest. Hard cherry candy carries a touch of rubber, and some rugged tannins. That said, it's got plenty of punch and power.
title: Roco 2014 Gravel Road Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Pinot Noir is a relative rarity in Washington, this one coming from the highlands above the town of Husum. It brings aromas of earth, game, dried mushroom and strawberry that lead to plump elegantly styled fruit and savory flavors, with a finish that lingers.
title: Analemma 2014 Oak Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (WA))

description: Winemaker Isabelle Meunier (ex-Evening Land) has carefully selected a handful of sites for her first release of single-vineyard wines under this new label. This is perhaps the most elegant, with exceptional texture, color and overall finesse. Fruits are delicate and detailed, showing watermelon, salmonberry, strawberry and a bit of spice. The 30% new French oak aging adds a gentle kiss of cocoa. Drink now to 2030 and beyond.
title: Lavinea 2014 Tualatin Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Delicate in flavor and firm in texture, this wine is savory and complex, with a slightly lean but very appetizing mouthfeel. Cranberry and black tea aromas are followed by tangy red cherry and cinnamon spice flavors supported by a light layer of fine-grained tannins.
title: Phillips Hill 2014 Roma's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Deep black plum and black cherry flavors lend fruit concentration to this full-bodied and mouth-filling wine from a tiny hilltop appellation in Mendocino County. Its dark fruit flavors are quite ripe but not sweet, and a good wrapping of fine-grained tannins supports the richness very well.
title: Talisman 2014 Weir Vineyard Méthode Ancienne Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

description: This rich, mouth-filling wine starts with almost-sweet floral, plummy, oaky aromas, building toward ripe cherry, strawberry and black plum flavors and a smooth texture. Everything, from its deep color to its lingering finish, suggests a bold personality.
title: Jackson Estate 2014 Outland Ridge Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: With just over a half-ton harvested per acre due to the drought, this is a potent wine, with nose-tickling dark boysenberry, asphalt and wet stone aromas and brighter lifts of dried sage and raspberry. The soft palate combines vibrant acidity with raspberry and mulberry flavors and a hint of dried herbs.
title: Calera 2014 Selleck Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)

description: At first austere, even severe in its tight, herbal focus, this wine nonetheless intrigues. The unique aromatics deftly touch on fennel, bitter herbs and wet rock. Tart cranberry and pomegranate fruits lurk below, and the wine takes a full 24 hours to open up, adding broader flavors suggesting craisins.
title: Brittan Vineyards 2014 Basalt Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Wafting baked bread aromas create a warm, inviting entry in this wine, which reveals medium-bodied layers of tart, tangy citrus, cranberry and pomegranate as it opens. High-toned yet deep, it offers balance and complexity and lingers on the finish.
title: Lost Canyon 2014 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a fruity mix of sweet berries, with a streak of ripe orange. In both nose and mouth an almost delicate earthiness can be noticed, with suggestions of dried leaves.
title: Lachini 2014 Lachini Family Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This is the winery's reserve, made just twice previously, in 2010 and 2012. Production is up sharply, and it's a ripe, round fruit pie of a wine, best enjoyed while still young. Red fruits and citrus are in the mix, with a touch of papaya. It was aged 14 months in French oak, two-thirds of it new.
title: Lachini 2014 Prima Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Piquant black raspberry, sweet anise, thyme and game notes show on the nose of this bottling from a new brand that took over the Addamo Vineyards property. On the palate, there's a nice interplay between snappy cranberry fruit and the garrigue.
title: Ca' Del Grevino 2014 Estate Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: From a consistently top-notch estate, this single vineyard Pinot offers lifted red fruits, florals, as well as cinnamon and star anise thanks to the use of some whole bunch fermentation in the winemaking process. The lightness and brightness carries through onto the palate, with an added earthy core, well balanced acidity, and silky tannins. Drink now.
title: Nautilus 2014 Awatere River Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Cola spice dominates the nose of this thick, concentrated wine from the heart of Westside Road. Stemmy earth notes accompany its ripe red fruit, as toasted oak and vanilla flavors extend long into the finish.
title: EnRoute 2014 Hop Kiln Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Elegant and polished, this brings raspberry pastry flavors, a touch of crème brûlée and scents of light toast to a wine with impressive length. It was fermented with wild yeasts and aged 18 months in 25% new French oak.
title: Bachelder 2014 Lowrey Vineyard Old Vines Pinot Noir (St. David's Bench)

description: This wine is made from estate-grown grapes and a selection of clones, offering robust dark cherry and berry fruit spiked with cardamom, cola and black tea. Smooth and silky on the palate, it finishes with a trace of tart pomegranate and smoke.
title: Domaine Carneros 2014 The Famous Gate Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: The producer's first-ever single-vineyard wine, this is tart and tangy, with integrated acidity and tannin. Just ripe, it offers fleshy red cherry, pomegranate, black tea and cola spice flavors, finishing juicy and with length.
title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Peters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Light in color, this wine has an exotic nose of dried herb, forest floor and wild mushroom scents. Tart, nervy acidity accents its rhubarb and cranberry flavors as a sprinkling of white pepper teases.
title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Plum, dark berries and a slick streak of almond paste combine in this supple wine. It has a touch of dried herb and soft leather, with light tannins wrapping up the finish.
title: Lange 2014 Lange Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This tight, focused wine offers strawberry and raspberry fruit, aged in one-third new French oak. The oak is barely evident, but the fruit-centric wine shows good structure and medium concentration.
title: Lange 2014 Yamhill-Carlton Assemblage Pinot Noir

description: This is 100% Pommard clone, bright and spicy in the nose. The fruit flavors are sharp and penetrating, with brambly berries and a touch of pine sap.
title: Van Duzer 2014 Homestead Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Perfumed with rose and lavender, this wine has robust tannins and dominant oak notes, both in support of its ripe, concentrated red fruit. Woody, herbal components complement the lushness, framed by gravelly texture.
title: Trione 2014 River Road Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This high-wire wine skirts along tart red fruits with a stiff herbal spine. Sourced from Lange Estate, Freedom Hill and Yamhill vineyards, it was aged in 40% new French oak. A nice streak of espresso, licorice and char completes the finish.
title: Lange 2014 Three Hills Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Pretty raspberry fruit coalesces in midpalate with a bright, spicy, flavor-boosting kick. It's young, fresh and nicely balanced. Drink now–2020.
title: Colene Clemens 2014 Adriane Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: A step up from the Willamette Valley cuvée, this is a barrel selection from the same eight vineyards. One-third was new French oak, adding a hint of toast around wild raspberry fruit with a peppery note.
title: Lange 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Scents of clover, stem, green herb and red currant lead into a complex wine that adds sassafras highlights as it glides into a gentle finish. Fermented with wild yeasts and aged 18 months in one-quarter new French oak, this is a well-made, though subtle expression of the variety.
title: Bachelder 2014 Wismer-Parke Vineyard Pinot Noir (Twenty Mile Bench)

description: Ripe and toasty, this limited offering hints at slightly raisined fruit. Figs, dried plums and cherry leather all combine, with a rich milk-chocolate finish.
title: Van Duzer 2014 Westside Blocks Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Generous Bing cherry and black plum flavors saturate this smooth and full-bodied wine, supplemented by subtle nutmeg, cinnamon and clove notes. It has a suave, mouth-filling texture, soft acidity and a warm spicy finish. Winemaker Greg Graziano blended in 14% Pinotage.
title: Saint Gregory 2014 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

description: Delicate in style, this Pinot offers pretty aromas of flowers, currant, black olive and smoke. The palate is a little lean but the tannins are silky, and the finish is long and elegant. Drink slightly chilled on a warm fall evening.
title: Dashwood 2014 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Aromas have a pleasing toastiness, built around pretty strawberry fruit. The mouthfeel is a bit granular, balanced and highlighted with flavors of cocoa and coffee. It offers a relatively good value in Willamette Valley Pinot Noir.
title: David Hill 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a three-barrel reserve, principally Pommard clone, and vinified with minimal handling. Cherry/berry fruit comes with ample acidity. The alcohol, though just at the high end of moderate, seems to mute some of the details. Notes indicate that no additions were made, but the finish remains a bit chalky.
title: Franchere 2014 Zenith Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Forward with pretty raspberry and cherry fruit, this delightful, easy-drinking wine has a pleasantly earthy underpinning. It's young and tart, immediately enjoyable but can cellar through 2021.
title: Lachini 2014 The Grape Republic Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Tart and racy, this brings juicy lip-licking berry flavors front and center. The high acidity may be over the top for some tasters, but set it up with a buttery poultry dish or a creamy sauce over pork or lamb and you're in the comfort zone.
title: Foris 2014 Maple Ranch Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)

description: This biodynamic grower and producer makes distinctive wines that require a bit of a palate adjustment for some tasters. Here, there are some funky earthy aromas suggesting compost and barnyard, with flavors following. There is little of the fresh bright fruit flavors one might associate more commonly with Oregon Pinots, but plenty of complexity, length and a light touch of new French oak.
title: Maysara 2014 Jamsheed Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This is a clonal mix—Pommard, Wädenswil, Dijon 115 and 777—with leathery aromas around candied-fruit flavors. Ginger cookies and intense baking spices dominate, although the leathery character somewhat diminishes the fruit and dampens down the finish.
title: Cardwell Hill 2014 Monet Blocks Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Sticking closely with the winery's style of forward fruity spicy wines, this has a burst of strawberry and raspberry flavors, backed with juicy acids and baking spices. There's a slightly chalky quality to the finish.
title: Cardwell Hill 2014 Pommard Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: For this white Pinot Noir, the grapes were quickly pressed and barrel fermented, yielding a wine whose scent, color and flavor are virtually indistinguishable from a young Pino Blanc. It's tart and light, with Meyer lemon, grapefruit and a dot of butter.
title: Phelps Creek 2014 Corduroy Blanc Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: Pinot Noir is most often done in a rounder fruitier style in Southern Oregon, and this pins the tail on that characteristic. It's a sturdy, blocky and tasty wine—a bit tannic, with flavors of black cherry, dried herbs and a lick of espresso.
title: Schmidt 2014 Pinot Noir (Applegate Valley)

description: This wine is made from three barrels were chosen for their particular aroma and flavor characteristics. It carries aggressive, spicy cranberry flavors and searing acidity that cuts the palate short. Drink now.
title: Johan 2014 Three Barrel Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: From Dijon clones, this shows dried cranberries and a touch of leather. The finish seems a bit attenuated also. Two bottles were tasted; the second a little less leathery, but with comparable fruit.
title: Merriman 2014 Cummins Road Pinot Noir

description: The least expensive of the winery's Pinots, this has a light and fruity style that makes it instantly approachable. Simple red-berry flavors, crisp acids and a little crunch to the tannins give it some extra depth.
title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 Jill Marie Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Despite the extra years in bottle, this wine has not really come together. Somewhat awkward and astringent, it pushes stiff berry fruits against drying tannins. Sometimes blending is a better approach than focusing too specifically on a single block and clone.
title: Phelps Creek 2014 Upper East Slope Dijon 115 Clone Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: This seems to be quickly drying out, with fruit-leather flavors more than fresh berries and cherries. There's ample acidity and stiff tannins. Best to consume this as soon as possible.
title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 Stinger Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Rock manager turned winemaker Sheri Hood honors some old-school rockers (the band MC5) with this affordable Pinot. Boysenberry and plum fruits come along with stiff earthy tannins. For the modest price it has plenty of flavor and some muscle as well.
title: The Pressing Plant 2014 Kick Out The Jams Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This bottling is very mellow and shy on many fronts, though it emerges from its shell with patience. Light aromas of red fruit and dark spice lead into a palate with a full mouthfeel, carrying flavors of raspberry, rose petal, loam and eventually sharp baking spice.
title: Windrun 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This winemaker's selection is from a warm ripe vintage, yet it remains rather light. The fruit touches on pomegranate and raspberry, and a whiff of ground coffee suggests some time in a percentage of new or once-used oak. It's light on the palate and stiffly herbal through the finish.
title: Winter's Hill 2014 Cuvée du Vigneron Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Intriguing aromas of dark pomegranate, white pepper, crushed gravel and herb meet with a touch of tar on the nose of this appellation blend. The mouthfeel is heavy and the density impresses, but the flavors of rich cranberry and tart orange rind are a bit muddled and sour.
title: Mignanelli 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: This seems somewhat disjointed and angular, with tart, almost sour berry and cherry fruit. There are acetic scents and chewy tannins. Though labeled reserve, it's a wine that fails to deliver the more subtle pleasures of the grape. Perhaps this would best be served along with a hearty stew.
title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Dried black cherries, baked earth, rust and a hint of feral aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers an interesting line of tart red fruit along with dried thyme and a meaty touch.
title: Press Run 2014 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: An entry-level effort, this has thinly-ripened berry flavors, stiff tannins and acids like a squeeze of fresh lemon juice. But it is the aggressive earthy and herbal components that dominate and continue to resonate through the finish.
title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 Citizen's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Despite the excellent vintage this is just barely ripe, with green notes among generic red fruits. Tannins are stiff, and a hint of butter runs through the finish. Nothing really jells.
title: Airlie 2014 Vintner's Blend Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Apparently a reserve-level offering, this has the same overripe raisined character as the regular 2015 Pinot. The fruit may have been harvested late, or in a rain window—whatever the cause, this is well past optimal ripeness, drying out, and should be consumed in the near term.
title: Cória 2014 Don Simón Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Despite the landmark vintage, this wine seems thin, under-ripe, and rife with green stem and herb flavors. The tannins are substantial, hard and bitter, effectively blocking out the finish.
title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 House Block Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Volatile aromas get things off to a difficult start, with a burning sensation and a touch of vinegar. Thin berry fruit and a hint of vanilla wafer come across in the mouth. Two bottles tasted. Drink up.
title: The Pines 1852 2014 Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: This wine seems awkward—there is no other way to put it. Unintegrated, lumbery oak flavors jut out in front of brambly berry fruit. Nothing hangs together and the oak treatment is rough and outsized.
title: Airlie 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: As most Methven Pinots are estate grown, it's not entirely clear what distinguishes this from the others. What it does show, rather agressively, are aromas of leather. Those same flavors render the wine thin, astringent and bitter, amplifying the drying tannins.
title: Methven Family Vineyards 2014 Estate Cuvée Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This wine is memorable and impressive—a ripe exploration of earthy goodness that's rich and velvety smooth. Spicy red fruit seduces amidst a well-developed core of complex orange peel and cardamom highlights, the oak well-integrated and supportive.
title: Martinelli 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Very pretty and precise on the nose, this bottling, which is quite delicate for the rich-leaning region, shows candied pomegranate, cinnamon spice, hibiscus and wet gravel on the nose. Wild strawberry and rhubarb flavors pop on the sip, alongside watermelon rind and a very rocky and tense minerality. There is tons of tannic and acidic depth.
title: Furthermore 2014 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Made for the long haul from one of Otago's most highly respected winemakers, Rudi Bauer, this is drinking well now, offering up a heady mix of raisiny red currants, florals, soy sauce, mushrooms and tree sap. It's medium to full bodied, with a line of focused acidity amidst dusty tannins and a long, cumin and herbal finish. Drink now–2027.
title: Quartz Reef 2014 Bendigo Estate Hielo y Fuego Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: There's a fascinating and lovable rustic quality to this single-vineyard bottling, which is slightly cloudy in the glass and shows aromas of red cherry, hickory smoke, dust and a feral gaminess. That foxy element is prevalent on the sip, with hints of animal hide and dried chaparral set against pomegranate and wild strawberry flavors.
title: Birichino 2014 Lilo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: The aromatic allure of tiny, dark elderberries captures the nose. They also appear on the palate, embraced by vanilla and polished notes of new oak. The structure is firm but the body is sinuous and marked by vivid freshness. Made in an international style, this will integrate over the coming months to present a sumptuous and elegant Pinot Noir.
title: Heinrich Hartl 2014 Graf Weingartl Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: Pioneering winemaker Ken Brown is still making excellent wine 40 years on, including this bottling that's full of deep red cherry, scarlet red rose petals and dark hibiscus on a nose that's veiled by loamy soil and slate. The palate is tightly wound, with crushed herbs, sandy soils, cranberry and fresh purple-flower flavors that sail across the palate into a vanilla-kissed finish.
title: Ken Brown 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Dark fruits carry a streak of gunmetal down the spine of this wine, which remains solidly anchored in its most youthful phase. Blueberry and raspberry flavors come with a crisp tart acid edge, and develop with lip-smacking precision as the wine lingers through a lengthy finish. Drink now and over the next 12–15 years, through 2030.
title: Panther Creek 2014 Carter Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This wine astounds in big, juicy waves of jammy cherry, strawberry and forest floor, its fruit sourced from Gap's Crown, Dutton Ranch, Goldrock Ridge and Jenkins vineyards, among other sites. Textured and layered, with powerful force, it shows richness and concentration but also fresh acidity.
title: Patz & Hall 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The dense nose of this bottling intrigues as it unleashes dense blackberries, graphite, slate and a touch of licorice. The palate is tightly wound, with pomegranate, elderberry and tart plum enhanced by fennel, bay leaf and an aromatic lift on the finish. Bottle age will improve this wine immensely.
title: Tantara 2014 Lindsay's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Earthy baked cherry and a strong streak of cardamom make for an impressive entry to this wine, flavors that persist on the palate. Beautifully rich without being ridiculous, it finds balance in complex, layered textures and nuanced characteristics, with a length of rose petals on the finish.
title: Landmark 2014 Rayhill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
