description: This provides a strong argument that delicate yet flavorful Pinot Noir can indeed come from the Santa Clara Valley. Intriguing and elegant aromas of lavender and violet meet with Earl Grey tea and bergamot on the nose. The palate's light black-plum and black-raspberry fruit are enlivened by purple flowers and a dusting of dried sage.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)

description: This richer expression of Pinot Noir kicks off with vanilla and warm cherry sauce on the nose, along with a bit of caramel, enabling it to appeal to lovers of darker red wines. The sip delivers a great depth of berry fruit as well as elegant purple flowers. A chipped-slate minerality is further lifted by dried thyme and bay leaf, making for a hearty but balanced sip.
title: Sea Smoke 2014 Ten Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Light in color, Q is the winery's second vintage of a single-vineyard, single-clone expression of the variety. Concentrated in dark-cherry flavor, it's soft and silky on the palate, with an undercurrent of smoky oak and cedar.
title: Iron Horse 2014 Q Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Juicy in red fruit, orange and rhubarb, this wine offers sizable body against a backbone of impressively balanced oak. Dry, firm tannins add to the strength and resonance of the palate, while subtle floral aromas lend intrigue to the bouquet.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2014 Annapolis Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Red plum, dark cranberry, composting rose petals, dried ginger and earthy mushrooms show on the slightly funky, slightly sweet nose of this bottling. The palate begins with a sour plum skin and tart raspberry kick, then leads into a core with hints of pine needle, juniper and turned loam.
title: Lincourt 2014 Annie Dyer Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Restrained mulberry aromas interweave with scents of turned soil, white pepper and clove on the earthy nose of this bottling. The sip starts with a pleasing softness but quickly grows deeper and more weighty with luxurious tannins, showing hearty red cherry and dried fennel flavors.
title: Lincourt 2014 Lindsay's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is the first vintage of this designated wine, grown on a high-elevation vineyard called William Wesley, near Annapolis. Cherry, raspberry and a touch of smoke create synergy around a medium-bodied core of soft, velvety texture and a crisp seasoning of white pepper.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2014 Redwood Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This ripe, boldly made wine offers a rich tease of Dr Pepper that pleases the palate, before complex characteristics takes over. Black tea, forest floor, currant and spicy acidity are memorably interwoven with dense black fruit.
title: Peter Paul Wines 2014 Mill Station Road Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe-tasting spiced-plum flavors and a generous texture make this full-bodied wine easy to enjoy at first sip, and it offers even more payoff with continued tasting. It delivers plenty of fruit character, accented by complex cinnamon, clove and nutmeg spices and a grand feeling of breadth on the palate.
title: FEL 2014 Donnelly Creek Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Earthy aromas of juniper and forest floor give depth to the rusty cherry, tart cranberry, dried hibiscus and pepper-dust scents on the nose of this bottling from the historic vineyard. Soft in structure at first, it then delivers a firmer tannic edge in the midpalate, all the while delivering vivacious red fruit and pine-forest flavors. It will age very well.
title: Sanford 2014 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This well-balanced Pinot Noir shows red-cherry fruit, with complex hints of anise, star anise, thyme and even tarragon on the nose. Both the acidity and tannic structure are lively but not aggressive, carrying tart cherry flavors deep into the finish.
title: Foley 2014 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a bright, acid-driven wine, citrus-laden alongside crisp, tart red fruit and a light-bodied approach to ripeness. The nose is exotic in rose petal and lavender, with streaks of cardamom and cola spice that persist for a long time on the finish.
title: La Pitchoune 2014 Holder Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The nose on this bottling is both juicy and serious, with cherry, pomegranate, dewy morning sagebrush, muddy sand and star anise aromas. There is solid textural tension to the sip, where red currant and lavender flavors mesh. Strong acidity soars into the finish.
title: Cutruzzola 2014 Gloria Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: This winery is packaging the freshness and restraint that's possible in this region, with this bottling offering aromas of pomegranate, red currant and star anise on the nose. The palate is vibrant with red fruit, yet it is the bay leaf, wild mint and fennel pollen flavors that impress most and carry deep into the finish.
title: Furthermore 2014 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: There's a lot of wild thyme, dusty creek bed and rainy cement on the nose of this bottling, with only the slightest hint of cranberry fruit. The palate's tension is tremendous, which is common for the appellation, with crushed sandstone and rugged earthiness cloaking the cran-hibiscus flavors. It's lightly bodied but firm with upright tannins.
title: Birichino 2014 Antle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)

description: A brightness of cherry and cranberry shines in this medium-bodied well-integrated wine, that has a complexity of texture that offers a slight grittiness. Cardamom, clove and white pepper successfully season the fruit.
title: La Pitchoune 2014 VDK Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

description: This wine is alluring in aromas of black olive, raw meat, wet earth and stewed raspberry. The palate is satiny in feel, with well-balanced acidity and savory, olivey tannins. Drink now–2020.
title: Mt. Difficulty 2014 Bannockburn Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Ripe red berries, cola, chocolate, florals and a meaty baseline shine through on both the nose and the palate. This is juicy and fruity, with silky smooth tannins, a savory backbone and and an easy-going elegance. Simultaneously glug worthy and serious.
title: Craggy Range 2014 Te Muna Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: This is a solidly medium-bodied style bursting with a complex mix of red and black fruits, warm pavement, green herbs and dusting polish. The palate is well-structured and grainy-textured, with a herbal, graphite finish. Drink now–2024.
title: Amisfield 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Thick blackberries, wet slate, sweet anise and a touch of purple flowers show on the rich nose of this reserve wine from a vineyard tucked into a seaside canyon above Cambria. It's quite dry on the tip of sip, with tons of rose petals and lavender, and then the black cherry and vanilla flavors arise. Chalky tannins and refreshing acidity complete the picture.
title: Cutruzzola 2014 Giacomino Reserve Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Inviting in warm aromas and flavors of baked cherry cobbler, this medium-bodied wine offers firm focused acidity built around well-developed highlights of cardamom, cinnamon, orange peel and cola. It's lengthy and complex.
title: Furthermore 2014 Gioia Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is brooding on the nose with the allure of an elderberry aroma. The same note dominates the palate which has a smooth, sensuous body, still held tight by brisk, fine tannin and lively acidity. There is almost stealthy, surprising grip. With its ample fruit this is already enticing, but structure and freshness promise more pleasure to come. Drink 2018–2028.
title: Heinrich Hartl 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: Baked red currants and cherries are lifted by vanilla, dewy sagebrush and hint of peppercorns on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is bright and energized with tart red fruits, but it's approachably rich and spiced with jasmine and Earl Grey tea flavors.
title: Ken Brown 2014 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A dark color and leathery, spicy, musky aromas lead to a medium to full palate with boldness and balance. Spiced cherry and black-plum flavors are lasting on a finish in which moderately complex fruit and spice flavors fade away with grace.
title: Undurraga 2014 T.H.Terroir Hunter Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Smooth on entry, with a gravelly texture that develops in the glass, this wine welcomes with a strong perfume of rose petal and strawberry. High-toned, it integrates healthy portions of oak into the savory fruit, with a persistence of acidity on the finish.
title: Furthermore 2014 Gloria Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a full-bodied, well-balanced and mouth-filling wine that offers ripe berry and cherry flavors enhanced by subtle baking spices. It has a good framework of fine-grained tannins and supportive acidity to keep it lively on the palate.
title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Soft red rose petals, cranberry, wet slate and dust show on the nose of this bottling, one of the first new-block designates released by this producer. The palate's plush texture carries strong soil flavors of crushed gravel and turned earth, which give depth to the background of ripe raspberry and pomegranate fruit.
title: Carmel Road 2014 South Crest Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: A bright bouquet of red currants, strawberries, back pepper, olives and medicinal bitters show this Pinot to be approachable when young, particularly by Martinborough standards. The palate is silky, savory, earthy and red-fruited, finishing salty yet refreshing.
title: Discovery Point 2014 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Rose garden and lavender aromas make for an inviting entry into this mountain-grown wine, as stiff, bristling acidity keeps it bright and lively in the glass. The texture is broadly soft and seductive, developing a silkiness on the finish.
title: La Pitchoune 2014 Van der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Forested tree pine, soy and cardamom greet the nose in this intriguing, inviting wine, which is brooding in baked cherry and concentrated strawberry flavors. Velvety and luscious, it's made in a fuller, lusher style that works within its balance of supportive acidity.
title: Geyser Peak 2014 Pluto's Fury Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There's a great amount of minerality on the nose of this bottling, with crushed slate and muddy soil aromas overcoming the mint herb and red-fruit scents. There's minty lift right away on the sip, with bay leaf, fennel pollen and dusty leather flavors decorating the boysenberry fruit.
title: Carmel Road 2014 North Crest Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: Cooked red cherries, sharp cranberries and butter pastries meet with a touch of campfire on the nose of this bottling. There's a tannic firmness to the palate, where sticky tannins carry flavors of tart red fruit and baking spice.
title: Lloyd 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There's a strong density of dark fruits on the nose of this clonal selection, along with muddy clay, crushed slate and fennel pollen. The palate is thick with boysenberry jam, star anise and vanilla, though the strong flavors are competing rather than collaborating.
title: Lafond 2014 Pommard Clone Lafond Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There's quite a lot of whole bunch stalkiness in this wine, combined with a good lick of new oak. Aromas of cherry, cinnamon and stems lead the pack along with spiced cedar. The palate offers more juicy red fruits and stalky qualities, and while this has some potential to age, it's also drinking just fine now. Drink now–2025.
title: Giesen 2014 Clayvin Single Vineyard Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Bright but wild on the nose, this bottling, which is overseen by actress Drew Barrymore, shows raspberry, thyme, sagebrush, rhubarb and smoke aromas on the inviting nose. The palate offers light berry flavors alongside hickory smoke, proving refreshing if not too complex.
title: Carmel Road 2014 Drew's Blend Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Dried red currants and cranberries meet with loamy soils on the nose of this block-designate bottling. Tangy red fruits and a hint of olive show on the palate, where the earthy minerality shines through the energetic acidity.
title: Carmel Road 2014 First Row Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: Big oak-based aromas are cheesy and feral. This has a full flush mouthfeel with tannic rub. Heavy spicy plum and berry flavors finish with raw scraping tannins. If an elegant, smooth Pinot is what you're after, keep looking.
title: Rafael Tirado Wines 2014 Laberinto Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: Quite reserved on the nose, this bottling from a vineyard seven miles behind Cambria, shows light berries and sweet wood on the nose. The palate combines dried berries with fennel fronds, but is still quite wound up and needs more time to emerge.
title: Cutruzzola 2014 Riven Rock Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Mild berry aromas are somewhat flat and rubbery. This medium-bodied Pinot is low on acidity and thus not that bright or vital on the palate. Woody, savory berry flavors are oaky on the finish.
title: Lucatoni 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: Pomegranate and fennel frond aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate has cranberry and more pomegranate, with a crushed slate and gunmetal minerality.
title: Carmel Road 2014 Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: This is one of the more odd-smelling Pinots you'll come across. Aromas of milk chocolate, cherry and mint are candied as a whole. In the mouth, however, this smacks with cool-climate acidity. Flavors of cherry, plum and oak-based chocolate finish with raw tannins.
title: Viña Aquitania 2014 Sol de Sol Pinot Noir (Malleco)

description: This dry wine has an appealing fruit character, light spiciness and a firm grip of tannin. It will pair well with roast birds or grilled sausages.
title: Sketchbook 2014 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

description: Solid Pinot Noir at this price isn't something you find every day. Plum, cherry and earthy spice notes are varietally on target. This feels round, but with adequate acidity and good balance. Light oak flavors accent cherry and red-plum notes, while this tastes slightly green on the finish.
title: Aresti 2014 Special Release Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Woodsy, savory, plummy aromas and rather light cherry and black-tea flavors give this wine complexity. It's medium bodied, easy to drink and enjoy, especially at such a reasonable price.
title: Lucky Star 2014 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Somewhat restrained aromas of dried cranberry and pomegarante mix with light herbs and spices on the nose of this bottling. It's vibrant, fun and easy-to-drink on the palate, where the simple red-fruit flavors make it perfect for the beach or poolside.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2014 Diamond Collection Silver Label Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: Briny, cool-coast aromas of pinched plum and berry lead to a full-bodied palate bolstered by high acidity. Tart plum, cherry and herbal flavors finish crisp, short and basic. This is a good, standard Pinot Noir, nothing more or less.
title: Santa Carolina 2014 Reserva de Familia Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Slightly overripe cherry, prune and raisin aromas lead to a full plump palate. This is dark, dense in body and moderate in terms of acidity and structure. Ripe berry flavors end loamy but short. Drink now. Tasted twice with inconsistent results—this note mostly reflects the better of the two wines tasted.
title: Viña Casablanca 2014 Pinot del Cerro Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Very light and reserved on the nose at first whiff, this wine eventually allows aromas of smoked pork, red cherry and a light dusting to dried herbs to emerge. The palate is also delicate with cranberry and peppery herbs, making for an easy, engaging if not overly complex sipper.
title: Poiema 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Modest red-fruit aromas are edgy, spicy and a touch horsey. Lean and juicy in the mouth, this new Pinot Noir from Santa Ema tastes of plum and herbal raspberry. Dry, spicy and peppery tasting on the finish; true to the variety.
title: Aila 2014 Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Reduced oak makes for an intense beginning. Then spicy acidity and plenty of earthy loam provide varietal character in this medium-bodied, textured wine.
title: Director's Cut 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Tar, baked blackberry and dusty, smoked oak define this full-bodied, 100% varietal wine that was aged in French oak, 85% of it new. The wood provides depth and breadth around velvety layers of juicy black-cherry pie and vanilla.
title: Don & Sons 2014 Signature Series Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a thick, concentrated wine, full bodied in its toasty oak and bursts of cherry-vanilla. Oaky and soft, it possesses a funk of earthiness.
title: River Road 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Light and clear in color this wine is somewhat simple on the palate and marked by the presence of oak. Light bodied, it has flavors of baked bread and strawberry jam that get along well before a wave of vanilla lingers on the finish.
title: River Road 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Sturdy in texture and a bit earthy in flavor, this medium-bodied wine has aromas like raspberries, core flavors like red cherries and a sense of good maturity for drinking now.
title: Josh Cellars 2014 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Herbal aromas of cherry and currant are a touch grassy. This feels lean, racy and fresh, with spicy plum, berry and tomato flavors. Toasty oak notes rise up on the finish, which shows a note of chocolate as well as some heat.
title: Aresti 2014 Special Release Reserva Pinot Noir (Curicó Valley)

description: This wine blends an earthy aroma with plenty of soft, almost sweet fruit character and a gentle, easy-drinking texture.
title: Prophecy 2014 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This is a tank-fermented wine from the King's Ridge Vineyard overlooking the Pacific Ocean. A big, intense expression of the variety, it's burly in black fruit and proffers a taste of coconut macaroon.
title: Malk 2014 Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: A pretty label created by film production designer Dean Tavoularis graces the bottle of this wine. It offers a mix of tight-grained tannin, cherry cola and smoky oak.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2014 Dutton Ranch Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This over-the-top wine has an unusually deep color and a potent, charred-wood aroma, followed by sweet-seeming oak and dried-fruit flavors. It's medium bodied and a touch tannic in texture.
title: Old Soul 2014 Pinot Noir (Lodi)

description: Dark in color, with grassy aromas of sugar beet and raisin, this doesn't smell much like typical Pinot Noir. A heavy palate that pinches shows flavors of cherry and medicinal black plum, while a sweet finish tastes of prune.
title: Root:1 2014 Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Simple cherry aromas with notes of cinnamon and chlorinated pool open this light-colored but blocky Pinot Noir. It tastes salty and sweet, with generic plum and red-fruit flavors. Very little flavor stands out on a bland finish.
title: Finca Patagonia 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: Earth and spice make for a nice entry and flavor profile into this wine. However it becomes thin and somewhat diluted on the palate.
title: Director's Cut 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: For 2014, the Weber is the star of a very fine Winderlea lineup. Dark and deeply concentrated, it's jammed with black cherry fruit, annotated with anise and showing a hint of gunmetal. The tannins are ripe and taste of clean earth. This is a fine candidate for aging. Drink now through 2030.
title: Winderlea 2014 Weber Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This is a blend from several Grand Crus on the Corton hill. It is rich and spicy, with great black fruits and solid tannins. A powerful wine, it's shot through with acidity and black-plum fruits throughout the structure. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Château Corton Grancey  (Corton)

description: Powerful and complex, this dark wine comes from vines at the heart of appellation, rich and dense. It offers the potential of great fruit, rich acidity and considerable structure, and will develop giving richness and long aging. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Cuvée Héritiers Latour  (Chambertin)

description: Wood aged for 12 months, this dense and structured wine comes from a small parcel of vines in the Clos de Vougeot. It is perfumed, ripe with a solid series of tannins as well as red-berry fruits. The acidity is typical of the vintage, and, along with the tannins, will allow this powerful wine to age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014  Clos de Vougeot

description: The immense walled vineyard of the Clos de Vougeot gives so many styles of wine from its 80 growers. This version is already relatively soft with as much generous fruit as tannins. Some high-toast oak flavor needs to integrate, while showing great density and concentration. With power behind it, the wine will age seriously. Drink from 2023.
title: Château de Santenay 2014  Clos de Vougeot

description: From three different parcels in this large Grand Cru vineyard, this wine is dense and concentrated. Powerful tannins will develop into rich fruits with great intensity. This wine, with its weight, needs time. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Clos de Vougeot

description: Brooding and dark, this softly structured wine is juicy and brimming in tension, its acidity focused and supportive. Black cherry, a subtle touch of cinnamon spice and toasted oak find balance and equal more than the sum of their parts, providing for a luxurious experience in the glass.
title: Walt 2014 Brown Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: A ripe, juicy and fruity wine, this is rich while shot through with fresh acidity. A dusty smoky structure awaits behind the fruit. It will become a well-balanced wine, packed with fruit and supple tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2014 Les Cent Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Shea is one of the Willamette Valley's most revered sites, and an all-star list of wineries compete for the fruit. Here the bright flavors of ripe raspberries are elevated with tangy acids, putting a tight frame of citrus around the core. A whiff of sea breeze comes up as well, enticing the taster to explore a bit more deeply. Already irresistible, this evocative wine will cellar well for at least a decade. Drink now through 2028.
title: St. Innocent 2014 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This block selection strikes a good balance between forward fruit, spicy barrel, tangy acids and a textural, lingering finish. It's medium bodied and well balanced, with a finish that leaves an impression of astringent tannins.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2014 Hannah Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This jumps up and grabs you by the nose immediately, with bright scents of fresh raspberries and highlights of coffee grounds. A lively wine, with immaculate fruit, the concentrated flavors blend strawberries and raspberries, with supporting acids and just a nice touch of barrel flavors.
title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2014 Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: One of the winery's single-clone bottlings, this brings tart strawberry and cranberry fruit into focus. It's a young bright stylish effort, with a touch of chocolate and fine tannins.
title: Lenné Estate 2014 Jill's 115 Pinot Noir

description: A restrained nose leads to spicy brown sugar, baked plum and cherry notes in this voluptuously crafted, tangy wine. It shows the warmth and depth of the appellation while retaining measured acidity and freshness.
title: E16 2014 E16 Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is built for both immediate appeal and graceful aging. It's toasty and chocolatey, smooth as silk, but with the depth and balance for further development. Not a big wine, but quite pretty, textural and detailed.
title: Owen Roe 2014 Durant Vineyards Clonmacnois Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This is quite pretty, with a soft initial entry into strawberry fruit. There's a touch of resin, a whisper of chocolate, and overall a delicate sensibility, that gains strength and length with ample aeration. It exits smoothly with a finishing lick of caramel.
title: Owen Roe 2014 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Toil spearheads an ambitious Oregon project for Chris Figgins (Leonetti Cellar and the Figgins Family). A new vineyard is being developed in the Chehalem Mountains; meanwhile grapes are sourced from Ribbon Ridge and the Eola-Amity Hills. This svelte generous wine still has some baby fat from barrel aging in 30% new French oak. Cherry, cola and toasty oak flavors come together with a touch of underbrush. It's best to give this another year or two of bottle age. Drink it 2020 to 2026.
title: Toil Oregon 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Tight and precisely hewn, this is crystal clear and medium weight while pushing strawberry and cherry fruit into the core. Its 14 months in one-quarter new French oak added hints of vanilla custard.
title: Zenith 2014 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: The nose on this bottling is very familiar and approachable, with tons of baking spices like clove, star anise and vanilla alongside red cherries. The same red fruit upholds the palate, which is nuanced by eucalyptus and bay leaf as well as a graphite minerality.
title: Baileyana 2014 La Entrada Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: A lovely plum shade, this blends scents and flavors of pomegranate, cherry cola, Asian spice, black licorice and a dash of cacao. It's dense and penetrating, yet drinking well already. It spent nine months in 40% new French oak.
title: Bryn Mawr Vineyards 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This fruit-forward, entry level release is nonetheless all estate grown and spent just under a year in French oak. It's a supple flavorful mix of plum and cherry fruit, accented with iron filings, lead pencil and dark chocolate.
title: Lenné Estate 2014 LeNez Pinot Noir

description: This is most interesting, layered with strawberry fruit, sweet straw and light tannins. It's deceptively light, yet elegant and able to sustain itself on through a compelling, structured finish.
title: Lenné Estate 2014 Pinot Noir

description: Ken Wright produces as many as a dozen or more single-vineyard Pinots in any given vintage. This wine is blended from many of those same sites, whose vines were often planted back in the 1980s. It's light and elegant, yet powerfully flavorful, with strawberry, raspberry and cherry fruit pushing deep into the palate. It's clean and fresh, with crisp defining acidity, perfect balance, refined tannins and a long finish. Best of all, it's widely available.
title: Ken Wright 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Smoky cranberry and pomegranate feature prominently in this medium-bodied, delicately crafted wine. It shows a hint of burnt orange spiked with clove.
title: Kobler 2014 Moore Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From two blocks of a vineyard above Freestone that's strongly influenced by the ocean, this wine is marked by leathery pepper, baked cherry and an exotic mix of savory spice. Medium-bodied, it has a density that's both plush and lush.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2014 Dutton Ranch Freestone Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a barrel selection from vines approaching 20 years of age. It's still quite tight, yet showing deeper riper fruit flavors than the Lylee. A judicious mix of cranberry, raspberry and black cherry, streaked with cola, contributes length, polish and texture to the finish. Drink 2018 through 2025.
title: Brigadoon 2014 Taproot Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Baked red plum and mulberry flavors are doused with charred sagebrush and hickory smoke aromas in this bottling from Jonathan Nagy. The palate also shows barbecue-like character, which dominates the energetic raspberry fruit and is appealing in a fall-off-the-bone pork rib way.
title: Byron 2014 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine's distinctive nose lays a foundation of underripe raspberry fruit and tops it with sesame, sandalwood and wild thyme aromas. There is significant woody character to the palate, including pine, oak and juniper, all set against bright red fruit.
title: Byron 2014 Sierra Madre Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This affordable wine is a testament to skilled sourcing and blending, using choice grapes from up and down the coast. Spicy cherry, forest and black tea aromas provide plenty varietal character, while medium-bodied weight and juiciness are lifted by bright acidity.
title: Contour 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County-Napa County)

description: Earthy in anise and blue fruit, this wine is inexplicably crisp and plush at the same time, showing the allure of the variety in its rose petal aromas. Medium bodied and velvety, it follows through in cassis and pomegranate flavors.
title: MacRostie 2014 Wildcat Mountain Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Light and earthy, this wine glows in spicy citrus, with a rhubarb-and-strawberry tartness and black tea accents. Medium-bodied, it shows an underlying crispness that belies its weight and depth, the oak subtle yet supportive.
title: K Squared Cellars 2014 Ketcham Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: In 2014 this vineyard designate was further subdivided by clone. The Pommard bottling pushes big fruit front and center—a juicy mix of blood orange, red berries and cherries. There's a certain stiffness to the tannins still, but overall it's finely proportioned and should be enjoyable through the mid-2020s.
title: Owen Roe 2014 Sojourner Vineyard Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Its prime location near Archery Summit and Domaine Drouhin marks Nysa as one of Oregon's most sought-after fruit sources. Mark McNeilly (of Mark Ryan Winery) has chosen it for one of two vineyard designates for this new project. Sweet baking spices and raspberry jam are the hallmarks here, offering immediate appeal, while retaining the structure to age for another decade. Aim for an optimal drinking window from 2019 through 2024.
title: Megan Anne 2014 Nysa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Light in color, this bottling from a famous vineyard shows red cherry, crushed clove and woody herb notes on a nose that's both sanguine and sharp with anise spice. The palate is lively and spicy, with energetic white sage and bright red fruit leading into a long-lasting, menthol-laced finish.
title: Miner 2014 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A pretty soft-focus wine, this opens gracefully with cherry lollipop fruit, accented with chocolate-coated orange peel. It's smooth, almost silky, showing just a hint of the granitic minerality that typifies this AVA. The wine spent 10 months in 42% new oak.
title: Sokol Blosser 2014 Hyland Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: From a site near Annapolis, this wine shows a preponderance of dark grape and cherry flavor interwoven with cinnamon and black peppercorn. Light-bodied and ethereally layered, it has touches of rustic earthiness and leather.
title: Alma Fria 2014 Holtermann Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine opens with the fresh liveliness of stemmy earth and black tea notes, growing funkier and more herbal on the midpalate. Brightly layered and deeply flavored, it's a full-bodied rendition that remains true to its variety.
title: Davis Bynum 2014 Jane's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This bottling, which used 40% whole clusters and 20% new French oak, shows delicate red cherry and dark cranberry fruit, with gingerbread spice and hibiscus on the layered nose. The palate is full of tangy red plum and cranberry flavors, with touches of licorice, sage and thyme.
title: Mignanelli 2014 Highlands Ranch Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Planted in 1983, this is the original Willamette Valley Vineyards estate vineyard. The wine remains stiff and wrapped up tight, with a mix of wild strawberry, raspberry and cherry fruit. There's a light dusting of baking spices, the result of aging 14 months in one-quarter new French oak.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2014 Bernau Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There is a rich black plum darkness to the nose of this bottling, which transitions to muddy loam and wet clay, lifted by aromatic sagebrush. The palate shows dried black cherry, star anise and more soil-driven minerality.
title: Williams Selyem 2014 Vista Verde Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Benito County)

description: Lengthy and soft, this Petaluma Gap-influenced red shows lilting waves of strawberry-rhubarb compote and an undeniable layering of earthy anise and perceptible salinity. Currant, black tea and rose petals give it additional edge, buoyed by a strength of silky body and earthy elegance.
title: Three Sticks 2014 Gap's Crown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Dried fennel, wet black clay and loam, minty tobacco, exotic cinnamon, pressed hibiscus and rich raspberry show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard planted in 1998. The palate offers lots of fruit, with more raspberry, tart strawberry, candied red apple and pomegranate. Tons of graphite minerality and herbal backbone keep it savory and elegant.
title: Pali 2014 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This outstanding vineyard, matching mature vines to biodynamic farming, really shines in 2014. A toasty nose sends up coconut and vanilla notes, leading into a full-bodied full-flavored wine with the structure to age another decade or more. It's the perfect balancing act between immediate accessibility and long-term cellaring potential. Drink now through 2030.
title: Rex Hill 2014 Jacob-Hart Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Tart Montmorency cherry, cranberry and pomegranate show first on the nose of this bottling, yet the black tea, cinnamon and ginger spice touches add richness as well. The palate intrigues deeply with Earl Grey tea, potpourri, dried rose petals and licorice enhancing the mulberry and other exotic red fruits.
title: Gallegos 2014 Boekenoogen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A shy nose demands further time in the glass to open this medium-bodied and truly compelling offering from this far-flung coastal site. A depth of black cherry, cranberry and black tea awaits, marked by tart acidity and silky-smooth waves of flavor and body.
title: Gary Farrell 2014 Fort Ross Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: It's hard not to jump up and down about the outstanding value represented here, a wine made from Dutton Ranch fruit that's juicy and generous in baked strawberry, earth and rose petals. A grippy structure provides weight around nuanced, spicy cherry-pie flavor and plenty of body to satisfy.
title: Jax 2014 Y3 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Light raspberry-sorbet notes meet with fresh fennel fronds, pepper and cinnamon on the nose of this bottling from Chad Melville and family. It's tight and tart on the palate, with dried cranberry, pine needle and eucalyptus flavors that juxtapose with the more fruit-driven nose.
title: Melville 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Robust in body yet squarely structured, the Franz Anton shows more ripeness and concentration than the producer's standard-label bottling. Fleshy black cherry and berry flavors are ripe, but are offset by crisp acidity and a shroud of smoke and toast that accents without overwhelming. It's bold and penetrating, with a long finish marked by fine, persistent tannins. Delicious already, but bold enough to improve through at least 2030.
title: Franz Keller 2014 Franz Anton Schwarzer Adler Pinot Noir (Baden)

description: There's a very appealing sense of hickory smoke to this wine, which comes from a block planted in 1973 on this historic vineyard. Red cherry, mulberry, sweet sage and cola also play into the nose. Rich sandalwood flavors show on the palate, as does cedar, thyme, smoke and tart berry elements.
designation: Bien Nacido Vineyard Block Q Old Vine
title: Scar of the Sea 2014 Bien Nacido Vineyard Block Q Old Vine Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Clove, red cherry, eucalyptus and anise show on the classic nose of this single-vineyard bottling that is both minty and fruity. The palate is light and lithe but with grippy tension and loads of acidic energy, producing flavors from cherry and cranberry to bay leaf and eucalyptus.
title: Mansfield-Dunne 2014 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: From one of the most impressive vineyards located at the region's far-western edge, this bottling offers rounded and ripe red-cherry aromas with sharper pomegranate elements, dried fennel, mint, light tobacco, sesame and thyme on the nose. The palate combines wild sagebrush and a minty eucalyptus flavor with candied cherries, leaning more toward herbal depth than ripe fruit.
title: Pali 2014 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a bold, brawny red from a famous site, velvety in texture and all power and concentration. Forest floor and a touch of smoke complement juicy dark cherry, caramelized oak and licorice, while bright acidity supports the layers of flavor and strong tannins.
title: Walt 2014 Gap's Crown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: There's a very intriguing character to the nose of this bottling, with aromas of dried scarlet roses, hibiscus, strawberry, cola and anise. It's lighter than expected and soft on the palate, with dried fennel and ripe cranberry flavors, and tons of tannic grip on the finish. It will be interesting to watch these components age together. Drink 2017–2034.
title: Foxen 2014 Block 43 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: The top drop from Bethel Heights in this vintage, this is a dark, dense evocation of Pinot Noir at its most authoritative and engaging. It's a muscular mix of mulberry, blueberry and blue plum, with a dash of sassafras for good measure. The length and sense of throttled power suggest that this is a fine cellar candidate. Drink now through 2028.
title: Bethel Heights 2014 West Block Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is a beautifully bold wine, tannic and brimming in supportive oak that speaks to an age-worthy potential for cellaring. Crisp wisps of orange and red cherry meet a touch of smoked meat and wild sage to memorable affect, a taste of the sauvage that's hard to beat.
title: Couloir 2014 Campbell Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This estate beauty offers a depth of cola spice and lovely acidity, with just a hint of underlying richness. From a site that's slightly more coastal than the vineyards around the producer's winery, it shows savory characteristics of rhubarb and wild strawberry amid a plushness of forest, all within supportive, integrated oak.
title: Lynmar 2014 Susanna's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a spicy, fully plush and complete wine, integrated in oak and tannin with a strength of black-cherry compote that gives an extra edge. The length and texture are impressive, showcasing the power of the vineyard in a ripe, even vintage, and some deft winemaking as well.
title: Fulcrum 2014 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Impressively juicy waves of cranberry and black tea underlie a light, earthy and ethereal wine from a well-known vineyard known for its meticulous farming. Dried herbs and roses add to the complexity and savory nature of this beauty.
title: Gary Farrell 2014 Hallberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: A gorgeous Shea bottling, this is lushly aromatic and fruited with strawberry jam, blueberry and cherry. The fruit is set against clean acids and supple tannins, and flavors remain full and focused with details of baking spices all through the long finish. This is a thoroughly delicious example of the power and pleasure of the 2014 vintage in the Willamette Valley.
title: Raptor Ridge 2014 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This is a layered and complex estate-driven wine. Its firm, sizable tannin foundation promises longevity and enviable structure, while allowing for a plush, lush exuberance of cherry clafoutis, cardamom and salted caramel. Enjoy best 2022 through 2029.
title: Reuling Vineyard 2014 Reuling Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: From the oldest part of the estate, planted in 1992, this excellent effort seems to have entered the phase where more aromatic complexity appears. It has lovely delineation of both scents and flavors, a matrix of fruit, soil and Pommard clone. Strong streaks of tobacco and chocolate annotate the core of raspberry puree. The concentration and length are impressive.
title: WillaKenzie Estate 2014 Aliette Pinot Noir

description: Named after the winemaker's daughter, this bottling shows thyme-laced pomegranate-punch aromas on the nose that smells like the chaparral that surrounds the vineyard. Potpourri and sachet flavors arise on the palate, giving nuance to the tart red fruits of cranberry and pomegranate. Strong oregano, thyme and marjoram herbs add depth.
title: Albatross Ridge 2014 Cuvée Vivienne Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carmel Valley)

description: This is the producer's first vintage from Hudson, one of the most sought-after sites in the appellation, and one not widely planted to the variety. Light and lush with a velvety ripeness, this special wine shines in pomegranate, earthy truffle and a turn of smoked meat. Robust, it maintains balance amidst its brawn.
title: Davies 2014 Hudson Vineyards Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Lush and vibrantly balanced, this wine is marked by juicy layers of blueberry, huckleberry and spicy cola and clove. Velvety-smooth on the palate, it's a satisfying, medium-bodied effort that effectively shows the beauty of the site and the vintage.
title: Siduri 2014 Pratt Vineyard Sexton Road Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Distinctive and precise, this well-priced wine should have a place in your cellar. It captures the specific characteristics—terroir if you will—that distinguish the best Willamette Valley Pinot Noirs: highlights of cola and herb, refreshing minerality, a perfect balance of fruit, acid and tannin, and a riveting liveliness in the mouth. All this without any hint of new oak makes this a winemaking tour de force.
title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This crisp and lengthy vineyard-designate shows a depth of earth and rose petals against baked plum, orange zest and rhubarb. Mouthfilling acidity provides a freshness on the palate that persists through a long, spicy finish.
title: Siduri 2014 Keefer Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From estate-grown fruit dotted around the appellation, this wine shines in a fresh approach to tannin and savory-laced black cherry, seasoning it with clove, earth and black tea. Its length impresses, with the finish vibrantly spiked with cardamom and cola spice.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2014 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a robust, full-bodied wine, balanced and complex, with a lush, plush mouthfeel that's seductive and velvety. Black pepper, clove and characteristics of earthy forest floor define it most, while dark cherry nips at its sides.
title: Lynmar 2014 Quail Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Very light in the glass, this bottling is also delicate on the nose in terms of power. But it offers tons of action nonetheless, with fresh and dried herbs, flint and a tiny bit of smoke adding to the red-fruit aromas. The palate is tense with energy, showing thyme, oregano and eucalyptus spice, placing more emphasis on the herbal backbone than the red-fruit ripeness.
title: Melville 2014 Terraces Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: From a site on the edges of Santa Rosa, this vineyard-designate shows a wealth of baked strawberry and is noteworthy for its vibrantly fruity aromatics. Ripe, velvety and lush on the palate, it delivers sensually and deliciously, with a lasting imprint of cola spice on the finish.
title: Siduri 2014 Parsons' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There's a smoky oak tinge to this bottling from actress Challen Cates and winemaker Kevin Law, with black raspberry and sandalwood notes as well. The palate intrigues with salty dark cranberry and penetrating Mediterranean herb flavors.
title: Challen 2014 Lindsay's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Unconventional but outstanding, this wine is an earthy throwback to an earlier era, from its light, brownish color to its dried leaf, rhubarb and wet earth aromas to its lean but complex red cherry, rhubarb and cranberry flavors. Wild yeast and wild bacteria were used for the primary and malolactic fermentations, respectively.
title: Foursight 2014 Clone 05 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: A chocolaty frame wraps around the tightly wound cherry-fruit core. There are delicious seams of coffee, vanilla and caramel, along with notes of tea and tobacco. It's fully accessible and intriguingly complex.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2014 Suzanne's Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is sourced from a longstanding, well-respected vineyard, and it does the windswept, foggy site justice. Tightly woven and youthful, it shows broad, juicy black cherry, wild strawberry, baking spice, compost and brawny oak flavors.
title: Anaba 2014 Las Brisas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This limited cuvée is made from the smallest block at the estate vineyard. It's entirely hand-farmed, with stem-driven savory notes around strawberry fruit. There's a sense of a slightly metallic minerality threading through, with drying tannins.
title: Bergström 2014 Winery Block Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: From the seven-acre site surrounding the producer's farmhouse in the heart of the appellation, this wine is tart with red fruit and vibrant, spicy acidity. Perfumed rose petal notes fill the glass, revealing a silky texture as it opens.
title: Blue Farm 2014 Anne Katherina Vineyard Estate Farmed Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Rich and concentrated, this big, brawny bruiser tastes as advertised: layered with baked strawberry and cherry pie flavor and ripeness. Earthy soy, anise and cinnamon keep those elements in check, as does the wine's velvety texture.
title: Cherry Pie 2014 Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

description: Light in color, this wine brings aromas of peppermint, herb, sarsaparilla and spice. The flavors are light and transparent, showing a very pretty sense of styling.
title: Marion-Field 2014 The Harrison Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Green Valley vineyards figure prominently in this appellation wine, providing delicate, layered acidity and crisp, savory, succulent fruit. Cranberry, cherry and black tea flavors ripple through its bright texture, accented with clove, cola and cedar.
title: Anaba 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Woodsmoke, bramble and sharp raspberry sorbet aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend from winemaker Kevin Law and actress Challen Cates. Sour cranberry and tart plum skin flavors show on the palate, along with darker nutmeg-like spices.
title: Challen 2014 Scarlett Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Light pretty red fruits mingle here, supported with tart citrus. It's an elegant, rather steely style, and one that needs aeration and a bit of patience. The best drinking window should be 2020 through 2025.
title: Native Flora 2014 Next Time Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Tart raspberry fruit limned with orange peel provides excellent definition across the palate. It's bright and tangy, with the balance and construction to develop nicely over the next five to eight years. Drink now through 2025.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2014 Right Bank Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The best effort to date from Peregrine's second label, this is a chunky but velvety-textured wine. Ground spices and earth notes add nuance to the plummy fruit, which manages to finish bright and fresh. Drink now–2022.
title: Peregrine 2014 Mohua Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Foursight has taken a new stylistic direction with Pinot Noir that involves wild yeast fermentation and no fining or filtration. This medium-bodied, garnet-colored wine is appealing for its firm mouthfeel and lean fruit flavors that are neither overripe nor over-extracted. Its tart cherry and rhubarb aromas and great acidity have a palate-cleansing effect.
title: Foursight 2014 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: All the Lemelson Pinots in 2014 are strikingly similar—rather light, tart, clean and simple. Cranberry and raspberry fruit, bright and tangy, tells the whole story here. Drink it over the next few years while that freshness remains.
title: Lemelson 2014 Jerome Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Cedar, smoke and clove mark the nose of this medium- to full-bodied wine. It's oaky and muscular, but not to excess, showing ample cherry fruit and ripe tannins before an abbreviated finish.
title: Martinborough Vineyard 2014 Home Block Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Plum and cherry fruit flavors are dressed in malted milk chocolate. It's smooth and instantly accessible. The wine spent 18 months in 40% new French oak. It's ready right now, and does not require further cellaring.
title: Panther Creek 2014 De Ponte Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Delicate whiffs of black cherry and berry intensify on the palate of this vibrant, delicately concentrated Pinot Noir. It's fresh and fruity yet elegantly structured offering fine lingering tannins and bright cranberry acidity. Extensive aging in new French oak lends a lavish spicy character that reverberates through the finish.
title: Inspire Moore 2014 Lust Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: Blended from several Central Otago subregions, this is a supple, immediately drinkable wine. Oak spice and vanilla notes mark the nose, while the midpalate fills in with crisp red fruit reminiscent of cranberries. It's medium bodied, with a silky texture that lingers on the finish. Drink now–2022.
title: Invivo 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: The year 2014 was a fine vintage for reserve-level wines, and this one brings concentrated cherry-berry fruit into a generous midpalate. Those big forward fruit flavors wrap through the finish, which is lightly touched, though not seriously impacted, with a glue-like note.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: It's somewhat odd to find a reserve-level Pinot Noir done entirely in neutral oak, but here it is. Pretty cherry fruit comes wrapped in tart acids. The tannins are light and suggest drinking this now rather than aging it further.
title: Vista Hills 2014 Heritage Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This cuvée has more complexity than its companion releases, perhaps owing to the inclusion of 10% whole clusters and/or the use of native (wild) yeast. Citrus, orange flesh and peel, and tart raspberry fruits are finished with a tannic burst.
title: Vista Hills 2014 Piedmont Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Almost entirely whole cluster fermented, this reserve saw just 5% new oak; the rest was neutral. It's clean and sharp-edged, with tangy raspberry fruit. Put it away for a couple more years, and drink from 2020 on.
title: Vista Hills 2014 Skyraider Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Sourced from a top vineyard in the Eola Hills, this offers ripe strawberry fruit set with ample acidity and proportionate tannins. It's plump, forward and nicely finished with a streak of mocha.
title: Broadley 2014 Zenith Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Scents of stem and earth accompany rhubarb and beet-root flavors. The acids and tannins combine into a lemon-tea note, and the wine overall seems relatively thin compared with past vintages.
title: Lemelson 2014 Stermer Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: It's fairly rare to find estate-grown Willamette Valley Pinot Noir in this price range. This one is all about forward black-raspberry fruit, perfectly ripened, with a palate-pleasing candied character. It thins out in the middle, but for near term consumption, that shouldn't dampen your pleasure.
title: Broadley 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Estate-grown and aged for 18 months in neutral oak, this is a lightly toasty wine that puts highlights of cracker and almond paste around tasty raspberry puree. It shows the pretty ripe character of this admirable vintage.
title: Vista Hills 2014 Marylhurst Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Raspberry fruit shines through with ample backing acidity. The flavors are true and fresh, though the wine seems to thin out midpalate. It was fermented with wild yeast and aged for 15 months in the barrel.
title: Lundeen 2014 La Cantera Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Plump red cherry and star anise aromas meet sagebrush and rust on the nose of this appellation blend. It's light bodied on the palate, where tangy acidity presents cranberry, mace and dried meat flavors.
title: Fess Parker 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This big, oaky and tannic red is robustly laced with cranberry, cherry and cola notes. Moderate acidity keeps it fresh in the glass, with dried herb, mint and tea accents.
title: Calla Lily 2014 Ultimate Red Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: A true-grit nose smells like you're trailing a road crew laying down asphalt. The palate is rather chunky and beefy, with grilled flavors of meat, pepper and burnt leaves. Fresh fruit is just not part of the package, and that's a problem.
title: Garces Silva 2014 Amayna Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: A rusty color and lean, almost grassy aromas set up a tannic but solid palate. Consistency of fruit flavor is lacking as this tastes like leafy plum and pepper prior to a slightly oxidized finish.
title: Aresti 2014 Bellavista Reserva Pinot Noir (Curicó Valley)

description: Earthy cranberry and an herbaceous underbelly ride along this somewhat thin yet ripe wine, which finishes in a bitter twinge of cardamom and oak.
title: Uptick Vineyards 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Rusty in color, with tomato, herb and raw-currant aromas, this is shear on the palate and raging with acidity. Flavors of hard spices, lamb fat and herbal red plum just make it to the level of good, while this is tangy and sharp on the finish.
title: Apaltagua 2014 Coleccion Limited Edition Pinot Noir (San Antonio)

description: This is the winery's only non-Dundee Hills bottling, and it brings aromatic notes of earthy stem, leaf and barrel. It's richly layered in red and black fruit, with plum, cherry, pipe tobacco and black tea notes accenting the complex, dark and deep palate. Even in the extraordinary Domaine Serene lineup, this wine overdelivers.
title: Domaine Serene 2014 Abbey Oaks Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: An expansively juicy and soft velvety wine, this delivers coastal influence in droves, balancing earthy cardamom, cola and forest floor with tastes of tea leaf and bright cherry. Light-bodied and silky, it rewards in flavor, texture and complexity.
title: Furthermore 2014 Eden Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: From a vineyard in the Middle Reach area of the appellation, which is relatively warm, this shows an intensity of earthy forest and black tea as well as cardamom. Velvety thick, it has a freshness of acidity that buzzes along on the palate, prompted by flavors of cranberry, cherry and tangerine.
title: MacRostie 2014 Thale's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Lorna Marie is the winery's reserve-level offering—a barrel selection that mixes lively cranberry, raspberry and cherry flavors with tart suggestions of orange and orange peel. There's a touch of chocolate on the finish from aging 16 months in 30% new oak.
title: Patton Valley 2014 Lorna Marie Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is one of the latest releases of soil-designated wines from Andrew Rich, which aim to express the impact of soil type on the finished wine. It shows a penetrating minerality, driving its black currant and black cherry fruit deep into the finish. Hints of smoke and earth add further depth.
title: Andrew Rich 2014 Marine Sedimentary Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Deliciously well-integrated, this is a rich, vibrant and intense wine that is lengthy and broadly expansive in baked strawberry, rhubarb and dark cherry. Cardamom and black tea make appearances within the fruit and brawny oak.
title: En Garde 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This new offering from purchased grapes is a doozy. Loaded with dried cherry, orange peel, almond paste and sea salt chocolate notes, it offers nonstop pleasure, with a toasty finish.
title: Domaine Serene 2014 Triple S Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Bold and ripe, this wine traffics in earthy wild raspberry, strawberry, mushroom and nutmeg. Ethereal despite its weight and breadth, it's made in a classic style and is deliciously varietal, a showcase of a great site in a great vintage.
title: MacRostie 2014 Klopp Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This substantive, well-structured wine has a classy, light French oak aroma and plenty of Bing cherry on the palate as well as firm tannins and good fruit acidity to make it feel lively. Its concentration and grip bode well for pairing with roast birds or beef.
title: Briceland 2014 Phelps Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)

description: This wine is vibrantly bright and coiled in acidity. Leather, cola spice and dark cherry mingle effortlessly on a light, smooth and silky palate, ending in balanced nuance.
title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Nunes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Intriguing aromas of rust, kirsch, dusty leather, crushed star anise, white pepper and li hing mui spice make for an earthy spicy nose on this reserve bottling. It's light in body and delicate in structure on the sip, combining baked earth, red fruit and a strong oregano touch on the finish.
title: Summerland 2014 Theresa Noelle Estate Proprietors Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine is well structured and nicely balanced. It feels elegant on the palate and has an enticing array of complex aromas and flavors. Raspberry, wood smoke and tea scents are followed by nuances of plum, cedar and cinnamon, while fine-grained tannins and good acidity keep the mouthfeel fresh.
title: Zina Hyde Cunningham 2014 Julia's Estate Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Ripe strawberry, raspberry, cranberry and red plum flavors, all bright and balanced, impress in this snappy, vibrant wine. The impact of minerally acids outweighs the 25% new oak, at least for now.
title: Patton Valley 2014 The Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The fruit from this biodynamic vineyard has a grippy, earthy character that underscores the complexity in this wine. It's tannic and muscular, with black cherry fruit and subtle tanned leather, licorice, black pepper, coffee grounds and dark chocolate highlights that persist through its long, captivating finish.
title: Portlandia 2015 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: More delicate than many of the winery's 2014 Pinots, this displays subtle tobacco notes around fragrant strawberry and red fruit flavors. Dried straw and chocolate highlights add welcome complexity. This cellar-worthy effort may be consumed immediately or tucked away for up to a decade.
title: Van Duzer 2014 Saffron Fields Pinot Noir

description: This very pretty wine is scented with rose petals and powdered fruit. It has a lovely cherry core with distinctive and unusual cumin and saffron accents. It seems to gain intensity in the glass, continuing through an elegant, extended finish.
title: Iris Vineyards 2014 Chalice Estate Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: A careful hand is clearly at work here. A blend of Coury and 777 clones, it spent 18 months in half new oak, but it's the minerality and overall austerity that impress the most. Precise veins of stem, mineral and caramel flavors inflect its mysterious palate, which is marked by stiff, tight red berry fruit. Though labeled Willamette Valley, it would be surprising if this were not McMinnville AVA fruit.
title: NagyBrown 2014 Argument Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A classic light color and complex aromas like rhubarb, forest floor and raspberry precede lively red cherry, pomegranate and mushroom flavors on a lean and appetizing texture. This outstanding wine makes a great change of pace from the ponderous fruit-and-oak bombs.
title: Terragena 2014 Wiley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This robust young wine is slightly smoky, with concentrated black cherry and juicy purple and black fruit flavors. A streak of clean earth underscores the tannins, and there's a residual grape soda flavor that accentuates its youth.
title: Andrew Rich 2014 Eola Amity Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Rich fruit flavors are accented by brown sugar and vanilla in this seductive and easy-drinking wine. It has a smooth soft texture, lots of ripeness and low acidity for a melting mouthfeel and sweet-seeming finish.
title: Shane Wines 2014 La Reine Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: One in a pair of soil-designated wines from Andrew Rich, this is the more fruity and forward of the two. Its tangy orange and raspberry fruit is aromatic and fresh. There's a touch of cherry lollipop on the finish, along with clean tannins.
title: Andrew Rich 2014 Volcanic Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Savory cardamom and cola ride along a bright fresh core of fruity cherry in this well-made and balanced wine. Forest floor and a dash of white pepper contribute additional complexity and spice. This is a lighter take on coastal fruit.
title: Furthermore 2014 Nevina's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Toasty and supple, this melds ripe strawberry fruit with ample streaks of mocha and sea salt chocolate. The barrel flavors are big and forward but undeniably delicious, making for a thick, full-bodied and appealing wine.
title: Van Duzer 2014 Dijon Blocks Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Ken Wright oversees production for Angela Estate, bringing his 30-plus years of Oregon experience to the task. This lovely bottle is smooth and supple, the fruit a mix of ripe raspberry, red plum and cherry jam, with a gentle touch of chocolate. It's seamless and delicious now but should age nicely though 2026.
title: Angela Estate 2014 Angela Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Half of this wine was fermented with whole clusters and native yeasts then aged for 18 months in 41% new French oak. Its dusty raspberry aromas lead to a midpalate rich with crushed red fruit flavors. It finishes with a savory suggestion of chicken stock, along with well-modulated, drying tannins.
title: Cristom 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A bit dark in color for the variety, this wine brings fruit-forward aromas of cherry, forest floor and assorted spices. The fruit flavors are ripe and bold yet show a delicious sense of purity. There's no mistaking the warmth of the vintage with its 13.8% alcohol, but there's still a lot enjoy here.
title: Battle Creek 2014 Roe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This is the winery's reserve-level cuvée. It's bright and high-toned, offering woody notes around lush cherry and mocha flavors. Delicious already, though more bottle age should further pull the barrel flavors into proper balance. Toasted marshmallow and caramel latté highlights adorn the buttery finish.
title: Bethel Heights 2014 Casteel Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a rich, smoky and structured wine. Black fruit and dark tannins form a dense texture with touches of licorice, spice and dark concentration. The acidity hints at the vintage giving a touch of freshness and lift. Drink this powerful wine from 2024
designation: Domaine du Clos Frantin Les Malconsorts Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Clos Frantin Les Malconsorts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: This wine pulls everything together for great enjoyment: vivid, fresh fruit aromas and a dash of oak spice, deep and layered fruit flavors like ripe but tangy black cherries, and a powerful but soothing texture that carries along all those flavor impressions through a long finish. Best now through 2020.
title: Lazy Creek 2014 Five Barrel Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This wine comes from a vineyard surrounded by Grand Crus. It delivers a huge, smoky palate that is firm with tannins and dense with structure and fruit. The wine is rich, still shot through with the freshness of the vintage. Black fruits are balanced by the dry core of the wine. It will age well, and should not be drunk before 2022.
title: Nicolas Potel 2014 Aux Combottes Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This vineyard, often featured in the Sineann lineup, moves over to WildAire for this sensational debut. The blend is a two-clone mix of 777 and Pommard, and it captures a range of delicate, well-defined flavors. Raspberry, cherry, light char, smoke, pepper, bitter herb, vanilla and camomile tea come rolling through. The prime location, which borders on Jadot's Résonance vineyard, contributes a great deal, but the winemaking brings it on home.
title: WildAire 2014 Yates Conwill Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Ripe and generous, this floral wine is dense with fruit as much as tannins. It is full of blackberry and plum flavors, ripe while also cut with acidity. The spice that comes from the wood aging shows well, adding a further element. Drink the wine from 2022.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Les Amoureuses Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Quite light in color, there is a red-cherry and strawberry base to the aroma of this bottling, which is laser-focused and redolent with scents of a morning hike through the chaparral, fresh with wild mint and sage. The palate starts round with strawberry, then tightens on cranberry and winds up on tart plum skins, all peppered with a grippy white sage spice and structure.
title: Chanin 2014 La Rinconada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine is already well balanced. Ripe strawberries and red cherries are shot through with the acidity of the vintage. The tannins are present, complementing the already attractive fruits. The aftertaste shows the considerable potential with its tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Les Cazetiers Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Balance, depth, detail and elegance are the hallmarks here. Pretty raspberry/cherry fruit comes up quickly, framed in proportionate acids and tannins. Streaks of malt powder, caramel and mocha weave through a long, subtle finish. Drink now through 2025.
title: Stoller 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A dark color and lots of fresh-fruit aromas lead to deep, ripe black-cherry and red-cherry flavors that taste clear and delicious. With more sipping, light spicy oak nuances emerge, including a touch of cinnamon and vanilla, but nothing gets in the way of the grapes' expression. Although full bodied, the wine is gentle in texture with just enough crispness and light tannin for good balance.
title: Lazy Creek 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This is a rich wine from several parcels of vines in the Clos de Vougeot. It has great intensity, powered both by tannins and by the dark black fruits. Serious and concentrated, the wine will age magnificently. Drink from 2024.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Clos Frantin  (Clos de Vougeot)

description: One-quarter of the Clos des Maréchaudes is classified Grand Cru, as the soil and the slope change. This shows in the power of the wine with its smoky tannins and dark character. Black fruits and a dense texture signify a wine with power and longevity. Drink from 2022.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Maréchaudes  (Corton)

description: A standout among the winery's single-vineyard selections, this big-boned effort brings flavors of chewy cherry alongside a citrus highlight and a definite underpinning of wet stone and clay. Texturally compelling, it should age gracefully through 2024.
title: Elk Cove 2014 Clay Court Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Scented with crushed raspberries, this exceptional value carries that same intensity and freshness etched deeply into the palate. Some darker fruits hang around the perimeter, as the wine lingers through a graceful, slightly warm finish. Residual hints of sea-salt caramel wrap it up nicely.
title: WildAire 2014 Timothy Pinot Noir

description: From one of the top Beaune premier-cru vineyards, this wine is dark and dense with hints of wood as well as chocolate. To balance this, the ripe berry fruit is right there, deliciously fresh and with a tight line of acidity. A wine with a future, it is not ready to drink before 2020.
title: Domaine des Croix 2014 Les Bressandes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Badly damaged by hail in 2014, this vineyard gave tiny yields. The wine though is delicious and concentrated. It has a pure line of acidity and attractive, perfumed fruits. It will develop into a wine that is fragrant, ripe and beautifully fruity as well as structured.
title: Domaine des Croix 2014 Les Pertuisots Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Good old Navarro is outdoing itself with the 2013 and 2014 Pinot Noirs. In this one, vivid black-cherry aromas, tangy but deep cherry and cranberry flavors, and a nice, firm and appropriately tannic texture add up to a concentrated and nicely proportioned wine. It has the flavor oomph to pair with something as big as a roast, and the tangy texture to dissolve the richest salmon.
title: Navarro 2014 Methode a l'Ancienne Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Firm and structured, this wine offers dark tannins and concentration. It has the acidity of the year but with a solid texture. There are hints of the perfume and the delicious fruit to come, but they will take time to show. Don't drink this wine with its potential before 2022.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2014 Les Porêts-Saint-Georges Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Polished but concentrated, fruity but complex, this beautifully shaped wine is simply delicious. While fairly full-bodied, it has an elegant texture, focused black-cherry flavors, harmonious and moderate oak notes. This is so tempting to drink now, but will be best after 2019.
title: Lazy Creek 2014 Middleridge Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This family-owned estate winery tosses three top clones into the mix to produce a plush wine full of red cherry, red currant, sweet sage and black tea on the nose. The red cherries lead into black cherries on the palate, where a woody herbal component of sage, thyme and pine needle keeps the sip interesting.
title: Boekenoogen 2014 3 Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a premier cru with a single owner, described as a Monopole in French. It has ripe tannins backed with hints of smokiness. The fruit lies behind the structure, with its powerful, dense character. Hints of the juicy, black-fruit future of this wine come through the texture. Drink from 2022.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Château Gris Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a bold, ripe wine, full of both tannins and rich black fruits. Spice from the wood has given the wine an extra dimension while the ripe fruitiness gives it an almost jammy character. As it develops it will broaden into an impressive, concentrated wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Jacques Prieur 2014  Corton-Bressandes

description: This is the annual release of a small, isolated vineyard block that's dry-farmed and named for the winemaker. The unctuous bottling shows luxurious aromas of baked black cherries, cinnamon, clove, cream and a touch of iron. The rich dark red-fruit flavors show on the sip, where the surrounding chaparral herbs invade the palate, offering dried sagebrush, eucalyptus and a wild mint sensation that last deep into the finish.
title: Boekenoogen 2014 Garrett's Vineyard Dryland Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Rich, ripe and fruity, this wine wears its tannins easily. With layers of acidity, red-berry fruit and a dark, dry core, the wine is impressive and set to age. The aftertaste is both sweet with the generous fruit and dry with tannins, finishing firmly. Drink from 2020.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Les Sorbets Premier Cru  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: This tiny-production wine continues to impress vintage after vintage, a small project of the Nunes family, who otherwise farm Nunes Vineyard. Aged in a selection of new and once and twice-used French oak, it impresses in wound-up kirsch, baked bread and cardamom spice, remaining both high toned and smoothly complex on the palate. Rose petals and citrus flirt into the body of the wine as well as the finish.
title: St. Rose 2014 Nunes Vineyard Ten Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From the southern part of Nuits-St-Georges, this ripe while structured wine has considerable potential. With its acidity, intense red-berry flavors and a firm background of tannins, it is poised for long aging. The toasty character needs to integrate with the fruit. Drink this impressive wine from 2020.
title: Nicolas Potel 2014 Les Vaucrains Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: While this wine is firm, with some fine tannins, it also has a pure line in fresh strawberry fruits that will develop as the tannins soften. This perfumed wine will develop slowly. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine des Croix 2014 Les Cent-Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From the southern part of Nuits-Saint-Georges, this small premier cru has produced a dark and structured wine with plenty of dry tannins that need to age. It is concentrated and firm, the tannins backed up by generous black-plum fruits. Drink this wine from 2022.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Chaînes Carteaux Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: While this wine has generous swathes of ripe fruit, it also has plenty of the dark tannins that are found in the northern part of the appellation. It is dense in character, packed equally with concentrated tannins and with red-berry fruits. The wine will age well; drink from 2022.
title: Albert Bichot 2014 Les Chabiots Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Tasted alongside the 2013, this is bigger, bolder, fruitier and more powerful, yet a touch less refined. The strawberry and cherry fruit is underscored with a pleasing minerality. The tannins are substantial and in proportion. A hint of chicken stock runs through the finish.
title: Elizabeth Chambers 2014 Winemaker's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Pressed cranberry, underripe raspberry and white pepper form the alluring aromatic base for this bottling that dives into Kalamata olive and cardamom notes on the nose. There is great energy on the sip, with anise, buzzy Sichuan peppercorn and Indian spice enlivening the tomato leaf and cherry-tomato fruit.
title: Michaud 2014 Pinot Noir (Chalone)

description: The waves of aromas on this bottling are quite intriguing, starting with meat then moving to black olive and tobacco. It finally settles into dense rose petals, purple flowers, cinnamon, dark hibiscus and black plum. The sip focuses on minerality, with chipped slate showing first, then goes toward juniper and pine, all against a black raspberry and pomegranate backdrop.
title: Morgan 2014 Double L Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: In an impressive line up of Premier Crus from Mercurey, this is the most structured. With dark dry tannins and a firm structure it has considerable potential for aging. The rich black fruits are still developing, filling the wine with fine perfumes and juicy acidity. The wine needs to wait, drink from 2020.
designation: Château de Chamirey Champs Martin Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Château de Chamirey Champs Martin Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This is a small Premier Cru of two acres higher up the slope from the main line of Premier Cru vineyards. That gives it a cool mineral character as well as crisp red fruits. The tannins are solid, concentrated and are still driving the fruits. The wine needs to fill out, so don't drink before 2022.
designation: Domaine des Perdrix Les Terres Blanches Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Domaine des Perdrix Les Terres Blanches Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Vivacious on the nose, with hibiscus flowers, pomegranate, strawberry, rose petal and cola aromas, this bottling from a historic vineyard is both juicy and delicate at the same time. Vibrant flavors of cranberry, pomegranate, hibiscus and even red melon show on the palate, enhanced by dried fennel, sage and purple flowers.
title: Gary Farrell 2014 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Crushed slate, plush rose petals, red cherry, smoked beef, vanilla and a slightly feral quality arise on the nose of this bottling from the region's most iconic vineyard. There is great tension on the sip, with tart plum skin, bright raspberry and dark cranberry fruit meeting with black spice, sandalwood and incense flavors. Acidity binds it all together.
title: Testarossa 2014 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Fresh, light and zesty on the nose, this bottling by South African winemaker Ernst Storm shows crushed raspberries, wild thyme and a touch of smoke on the nose. A tantalizingly vibrant energy excites the tongue once sipped, with flavors of tangy red fruit, smoked oregano and shaved pork roast showing on the palate.
