title: Storm 2014 John Sebastiano VIneyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The wine comes from what many consider to be the Grand Cru of Nuits Saint-Georges. It is firm and structured with solid tannins over black-cherry fruits. There is a tight streak of acidity that cuts through the wine giving a crisp center to the fine fruit. Drink this wine from 2019.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2014 Les Saint-Georges Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a rounded full-bodied wine that has red-fruit fleshiness as well as fine tannins for the future. It comes from 70-year-old vines on the southeast facing slopes that make up Volnay's Premier Cru vineyards. Rich in black fruits and dark smoky tannins, the wine also has intense young acidity. Drink this impressive wine from 2020.
title: Domaine Henri Delagrange 2014 Champans Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: Plummy yet cool, with a greenish, floral note that adds lift and interest to the dark-fruit aromas and flavors. This is a bit austere and dusty, but long on the finish, so drink 2018–2030.
title: Escarpment 2014 Pahi Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: This bottling from a vineyard on the extreme west end of the appellation is dense and dark on the nose with concentrated black cherries, sandalwood, sweet anise, allspice and strong garrigue notes. Tart cranberries and crushed oregano, thyme and marjoram herbs show on the sip, which is brightened with zesty acidity. It leaves a menthol-like sensation in the mouth on the finish.
title: Foxen 2014 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: There's lovely vibrancy to the nose of this bottling, with tangy cranberry, hibiscus and strawberry aromas, yet those are deftly cut by peppercorns, brown spice and turned earth. The mouthfeel is engagingly peppery, with spicy bay leaf and thyme herbs, a touch of cured Kalamata olives and an underlying, underripe raspberry and cranberry fruit base.
title: Comartin 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This Premier Cru is situated in the southern half of Savigny, close to Beaune proper. Here it has produced a ripe generous wine full of spicy smoky red fruits and balanced acidity. The wine is still showing its baby fruit and needs time. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2014 Les Hauts Jarrons Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: From a two-acre parcel of vines planted in 1950, this is a finely perfumed, rich wine. It has generous red fruits and an equally opulent ripe character. The tannins are there—a dry layer that is supporting the spice—as is a firm solid texture. Drink this wine (which is still developing) from 2019.
title: Roche de Bellene 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Negociant Nicolas Potel has made a specialty of sourcing old vines. In this wine, they are between 44 and 54-years-old. The wine is rich and concentrated—dark with tannins and generous with black fruits. It is firm and obviously needs to age. Drink this sold wine from 2020.
title: Roche de Bellene 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Vines planted in 1934 are behind this smooth and concentrated wine. It has red-berry crispness as well as a cool crisp texture from acidity and tannins. With aging potential, the wine is perfumed and still firm. Drink from 2019.
title: Roche de Bellene 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Volnay)

description: Tart cranberry, wild thyme, olive and Indian spices show on the nose of this appellation blend, a great representation of the cool-climate styles this winery is known for. Kalamata olive and Mediterranean spices arise on the palate, with baked fig, orange rinds, preserved lemon and chaparral combining for a tagine-like expression.
title: Presqu'ile 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Rich fruit flavors and aromatic complexity make this full-bodied wine tempting and satisfying. Aromas suggest ripe, seemingly sweet cherry plus whiffs of cedar, and the flavors are expressive and layered, carried on a velvety texture that melts in the mouth.
title: MacPhail 2014 Wightman House Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This appellation blend provides a great representation of the region, with lavish and rich aromas of vanilla bean, clove, dried blueberry paste and zesty chaparral herbs. A fine line of wet gravel and cement minerality centers the palate, with lilac, lavender, clay and turned-earth components alongside richer black-cherry fruit.
title: Testarossa 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: From a vineyard that's actually west of the Sta. Rita Hills, this bottling offers fresh-pressed lavender, violets and rose petals against a black raspberry, white pepper and crushed thyme base. The palate is tightly focused on black peppercorn, though dark cherry and cranberry fruit emerge along with a compost of wild herbs, tar and eucalyptus.
title: Storm 2014 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: This is a standout of the vintage from the producer, earthy and stemmy in complex cherry, strawberry, forest and plum. Within the context of fruit and pine, it supports lively acidity and a lushness that shows its full-bodied fervor.
title: Saintsbury 2014 Toyon Farm Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Black-plum extract and rust make for a intriguing nose from a rugged region, with wet-cement minerality and a deep allspice element emerging in the background. Dark cranberry and pomegranate fruit is lifted by dried sagebrush and woody cedar flavors on the palate.
title: Sandler 2014 Boer Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)

description: With a fine balance between some rigorous tannins and a more generous black-fruit character, this is a wine both to appreciate now and to age. The wine is perfumed, with spice from the wood aging and mint and thyme aromas. This serious wine is just ready to drink, but that would be a shame, so wait until 2018.
title: Domaine Henri Delagrange 2014 Clos de Chênes Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: Black-plum fruit is woven through smoke, slight juniper and eucalyptus on the nose of this bottling by Steve McIntyre, one of Monterey County's most respected growers. Black raspberry and tangy cherry flavors are warmed by vanilla and clove on the palate, complete with a tannic tension.
title: McIntyre Vineyards 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Bright raspberry and fresh-pressed bramble make for a nicely snappy nose that also conveys a touch of rust, graphite and earthiness. Tart cranberry and plum skin mesh into mineral tones of slate and pencil lead, all lifted by bay leaf and dried sage. It needs time to reach full potential.
title: Foxen 2014 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Of Larry McKenna's 2014 Pinots, this full-bodied offering is the most approachable right now. A rich, velvety texture underscores elegant notes of brown sugar, tea, cherries and cinnamon. Drink now–2030.
title: Escarpment 2014 Kiwa Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: A vineyard-designate since 2007, this wine shows vigor and volatility in the glass, a mix of white pepper, heightened acidity and an underlay of black tea and forest floor. Brooding in dark berry, it never lets the fruit become entirely ripe, opting instead for savory complexity.
title: Balletto 2014 Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The wine comes from vines some planted in 1954, others in the 1980s. That gives the extra concentration that is so apparent. It is a dark firm wine, structured and dense both with black fruits and with tannins. The aftertaste brings in perfumed acidity as well as emphasizing the concentration. Drink from 2019.
designation: Château de Chamirey Les Ruelles Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2014 Château de Chamirey Les Ruelles Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This full-bodied wine is complex and detailed from the spicy perfume to the finish, and rich and satisfying in the middle. Aromas like black tea and rhubarb lead to ripe and deep cherry and slightly tangy raspberry flavors that are lifted by moderate tannins and linger on the finish.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir (California)

description: Welcoming on the nose, this top-end bottling offers aromas of baked red cherry, clove and black plum before diving into crushed graphite, wet slate and loamy mud aromas. Soft on the palate but immediately vibrant with acidity, flavors of dark cranberry and tart cherry are lifted by anise-like spice.
title: Testarossa 2014 Niclaire Pinot Noir (California)

description: This good-value wine done in a light and lovely style offers flavors of red berries and cherry cola highlighted by toasted hazelnuts. A touch of café crème leads into a softly focused finish.
title: Brandborg 2014 Bench Lands Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)

description: This still-young crisp wine is full of apple and citrus acidity. The mousse is lively, giving a bright character to this fruity wine. Because it is so dry, it needs another few months before drinking, so wait until 2018.
title: Piollot Père et Fils 2014 Come des Tallants Zéro Dosage Pinot Noir (Champagne)

description: This is an herbal, earthy, delicately layered and silky wine with red cherry and pomegranate characteristics. Medium-bodied, it stays true to its varietal nature by being light on its feet.
title: Lost Canyon 2014 Morelli Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A streak of coffee runs dramatically down a tight, snappy core of citrus and berry fruit. Flavors are lightly dusted with pepper, remaining bright and precise through the finish.
title: Colene Clemens 2014 Dopp Creek Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Expansive, long and tannic, this wine is robust and powerfully concentrated, the flavors a mixture of tart cranberry, raspberry and black tea.
title: Fritz 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Thoughts of Black Forest cake, cherry chocolate brownies, and baked plums are immediately conjured upon smelling this Pinot Noir from one of New Zealand's largest producers. Violets, dusty books, and cola are in the mix too. The palate promises more of the same, with silky tannins and balanced acidity. It's on the rich side, but is an undeniable crowd pleaser.
title: Villa Maria 2014 Cellar Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This wine starts off with a broad blend of berries and cherries, and well-integrated, smooth tannins. But in the finish and aftertaste, a chemical bitterness emerges and persists.
title: Colene Clemens 2014 Victoria Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This has a noticeable scent of tackroom leather that carries into the flavors, somewhat muting the black-cherry fruit. For such a young wine it is already on the way to drying out. Some interesting accents of pipe tobacco, smoke and coffee run through the finish. It's now at its best, so drink up.
title: Yamhill Valley 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This wine has a light scent of animal funk and saddle leather around black-cherry fruit. Tannins are showing early signs of drying out, and it is probably best to enjoy by 2020.
title: Freja 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Light in color, this wine offers fresh but concentrated dark berry and cherry flavors and strong black tea and rose petal aspects. The acidity is moderate and supportive.
title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Mukaida Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Firm and lightly herbal, this has light strawberry-fruit flavors balanced against proportionate tannins and acids. There's nothing wrong here, it's just a light, almost innocuous wine.
title: Colene Clemens 2014 Margo Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This wine is a relatively dense, chewy version of Marlborough Pinot, with dark cherry, black currant, Dr. Pepper, and earth throughout. The grippy tannins on the palate are balanced by juicy dark fruit and coffee notes. The oak certainly isn't hiding in this wine but for those who like a more powerful style of Pinot, this is good option.
title: Marisco Vineyards 2014 The Ned Southern Valleys Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This simple style of Marlborough Pinot delivers notes of bramble berry, licorice and cola on the nose, with a slightly more complex palate of dark cherry, mocha spice and dried leaves. The oak is a little prevalent throughout and texturally it's on the lean and mean side, but the fruit carries through until the end, keeping the gluggability factor up.
title: Hillersden 2014 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: There's red fruit and spice to be found in this Marlborough Pinot Noir, but unfortunately they're overpowered by a chemical, menthol quality, along with vanilla from the oak influence. The palate is medium bodied with lightly grippy tannins and a bitterness on the finish.
title: Opawa 2014 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Thickly concentrated at first, this wine settles in the glass to share a wealth of juicy black-cherry flavor that's impressively accented in black tea and cola spice. Medium bodied, it feels sublime on the palate and holds its ripeness in check, allowing a simmering acidity to speak.
title: Benovia 2014 Bella Una Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This special waxed-top reserve bottling shows deep aromas of cedar and sandalwood along with black plum and allspice on the nose. Black cherry pops on the sip with lots of nutmeg spice, but it's the evenly distributed acidity and firm tannins that ensure a long life. Drink now through 2029.
title: Flying Goat Cellars 2014 Rita's Reserve Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This clonal selection shows powerful aromas of cinnamon, mace, sandalwood and plump boysenberry on the attention-grabbing nose. There is a refreshing black-plum-skin tartness to the sip, which is decorated with potpourri, sagebrush, bay leaf and eucalyptus flavors. The mouthfeel is soft, yet zesty acidity and firm structure hold it all together.
title: JCR 2014 Pommard 5 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Concentrated aromas of pomegranate, cranberry and mulberry meet with broodingly spiced notes of cola, pencil shavings, dried mint and mossy earth on the nose of this bottling. Juniper, pine needle tea and redwood flavors show on the sip, giving depth to a clean line of dark-red fruit and woody, black-pepper-flecked spice.
title: JCR 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: The wines from this remote ranch off of Jalama Road combine mossy forest-floor touches with dark hearty aromas, in this case showing pine, rust, juniper, thyme and purple fruit on the nose. The texture is grippy, and there is cranberry fruit in the background, but the palate's attention turns mostly to eucalyptus, dark spice and even tobacco toward the finish.
title: JCR 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: This winery is making one of the best cases for Pinot Noir in the Paso Robles area. This bottling, which is quite dark in color, starts with black plum, mulberry, wet loam and a strong sense of umami on the nose, with hints of nori and teriyaki. The palate shows tart black-plum-skin flavors alongside juniper and more moist, turned-earth flavors. The acidity is persistent and tannins firm enough.
title: Asuncion Ridge 2014 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: There's a sultry aromatic combination of stewed strawberry and bright raspberry as well as subtle thyme, tarragon, rosewater and French toast on the nose of this bottling from the iconic vineyard. The baked red fruits and hard woody spices are cut by pungent acidity and firm tannins on the sip. Hold off a bit on this one, but then enjoy for decades. Drink 2019–2034.
title: Patz & Hall 2014 Pisoni VIneyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Showy, dramatic but sophisticated oak nuances merge beautifully with red and black-cherry flavors and a just-lively-enough texture in this medium-bodied, concentrated and well-focused wine. It has both breadth of mouthfeel and depth of flavor, and will make a classy addition to your dinner party.
title: Arista 2014 Perli Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

description: Dusty mineral, violet and anise notes lend a seductive tone to deep Morello cherry and plum flavors. It's concentrated in black fruit but maintains an amaro-like herbaceousness that's savory and meandering. Showing hints of maturity already but should drink well through 2020.
title: Bellwether 2014 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: Primary, concentrated raspberry and cherry flavors pierce through the core of this rich, fruity Pinot. Subtle oak aging lends delicate vanilla, spice and nut tones, but it's an elegant, finely structured wine with crisp acidity and fine, persistent tannins. Drinks well now but should improve through 2021.
title: Anthony Nappa 2014 Shared Table Farm Pinot Noir (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Dense and distinctively earthy, this wine offers ample tannin and oak, that are balanced by full-bodied ripeness. The core of its flavor profile is etched in baked strawberry, forest floor and a meaty tease that's unexpected, but welcome.
designation: Doña Margarita Vineyard Chico's Run Unfiltered
title: Marimar Estate 2014 Doña Margarita Vineyard Chico's Run Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This bottling isn't perfect, but it shows the potential for exploring a less ripe style of Pinot Noir in the Paso Robles area. Snappy sagebrush aromas meet with olive, wet bay leaf, myrrh and plum skins on the nose. The palate is driven by pine-sap, with lots of eucalyptus and juniper as well as dark elderberry, and a hint of elderflower.
title: Asuncion Ridge 2014 Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Cola, root beer and Red Hots candy play against strawberry, pomegranate and damson on the nose of this playful Pinot Noir. Rusty cranberry, tart red plums and a bit of garrigue spice play on the palate.
title: Stasis 2014 Murmur Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Light cherry, turned earth, rust and potpourri aromas show on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling, which is exploring the lower end of the alcohol scale. The sip is very light and pleasant although a bit simple, with light cherry juice and tangy red plum most prominent.
title: Kitá 2014 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine combines fruit from several notable vineyards, including Goldrock Ridge, Thale's Estate and Wildcat Mountain. Together, they drive a focused expression of smoky dark fruit and tart, moderate acidity. The fruit shows a depth of ripeness that's intense, with a finish of spicy black tea.
title: MacRostie 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This clean if somewhat simple bottling starts with an extremely light and delicate nose of red cherry, rust, sagebrush, thyme and anise. The texture is light on the sip but the tannins prove somewhat grippy, with flavors of pomegranate and cracked pepper.
title: Black Ridge 2014 Barn Block Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is labeled reserve, but it's a tart austere wine with little charm. The diluted raspberry fruit carries a metallic note through the finish. Note that the front label correctly says it's a 2014, while the side (back) label mistakenly reads 2013.
title: Montinore 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Tight and herbal, this budget bottle brings a taste of wild strawberries, along with chewy tea-infused tannins. The finish conveys an impression of chicken broth more than fruit.
title: 60 Souls 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This basic, fairly priced offering is bright in acidity with crisp, clean cherry and cola flavors.
title: Steelhead Vineyards 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Past vintages of this cuvée have been delightful, but this one hits a speed bump. Diluted fruit flavors conjure up memories of cherry Kool-Aid, with a spare hint of chocolate. The wine has no depth, and not much flavor.
title: Vercingetorix VX 2014 Caroline's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is solidly built with tannin and oak, a searing earthiness dulling the fruit. Tar, earth and spicy cardamom aromas domainate its full-bodied concentration and youthful ripeness.
title: Armida 2014 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This brings off-putting aromas of barnyard, compost and rubber, without the fruit to compensate. Thin dilute berry flavors are buried in the mix, and it feels flat in the mouth.
title: Montinore 2014 Red Cap Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Traces of light cherry fruit give way quickly to a thin dilute finish. This is marginally riper than the non-reserve 2014 Pinot Noir.
title: Harry & David 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Feral in rustic compost and funk, this wine is flat and green in tone, with dried herb and sage notes forming the core of the palate.
title: Cosa Obra 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: This spent 16 months in neutral oak, and it shows some muted scents that may be attributed to those barrels. Earthy unripe fruit, tasting mainly of apple skins, also sends up light whiffs of fish oil. Drink up.
title: Vercingetorix VX 2014 Auzriel Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Despite a good track record producing California Pinot Noir, Tangley Oaks' foray north into the Willamette Valley does not impress. It tastes and smells of mushroom compost, with no hint of any definitive fruit, no suggestion of varietal character. Two bottles tasted, same results.
title: Tangley Oaks 2014 Lot #25 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Dilute and slightly bitter, this does not reflect the warm near-perfect 2014 vintage. Thin generic red fruit comes and goes quickly, with earthy, stemmy tannins left to finish.
title: Harry & David 2014 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Despite its relative youth and tongue-crushing alcohol, this is already dried out, and oaky to a fault. It's a rough go all around, especially for a Pinot Noir.
title: Bradley 2014 Pinot Noir (Elkton Oregon)

description: The new oak is dialed down a bit to 33% in this memorable red from the producer's estate Quail Hill Vineyard. Lovely in every way, it opens in rose petals and a subtlety of Asian five-spice, before a succulence of cranberry, rhubarb and orange unleash a fullness of fruit and lush texture on the palate.
title: Lynmar 2014 Monastery Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The most gentle strawberry fruit appears unobtrusively on the nose. The palate reveals incredibly pure and honest wild strawberry fruit and is slender but totally concentrated—there is depth to the wine and something ethereal and utterly seductive. This is not about power but about arresting allure. The true nature of Pinot Noir has been captured here, without force, without guile. This is honest and all the more disarming for that.
title: Anton Bauer 2014 Reserve Limited Edition Pinot Noir (Wagram)

description: Another knockout of this vintage from this site, a portion within the larger estate Quail Hill Vineyard, Summit is perfumed and pretty, full bodied without ever seeming heavy. Crisp punches of strawberry, cherry and a streak of lemon tartness please the palate in an endless loop of complex, velvety texture.
title: Lynmar 2014 Summit Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Hailing from a precipitously perched vineyard above Carmel Valley on the coastal end of the region, this bottling offers baked red cherries, beets, rhubarb pie, cinnamon spice and a touch of iron-rich soil on the nose. There's a powerful chalky grip to the sip, with rising oregano and marjoram herbs laid across an earthy core of deep red fruit and peppercorns. The finish shows dried mint.
title: Talbott 2014 Diamond T Vineyard Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Pretty aromas of rose petal, raspberry, hibiscus and slate make for a lovely entry to this wine from a historic vineyard in southern San Luis Obispo County. Made from just the 2A clone, it has refined cranberry-fruit flavors laced with eucalyptus oil and Earl Grey tea.
title: El Lugar 2014 Rincon Vineyards Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Baked black plum, gingerbread, dried mint, clove-laden cherry pie and a touch of light licorice show on the nose of this rich style of Pinot from the Santa Ynez-based, family-owned winery. The palate starts with rich black-cherry fruit, but then dives into an intriguing wash of thyme, sagebrush and anise, finishing on dried cranberry and pomegranate.
title: Gainey 2014 Limited Selection Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This smoky, earthy, soft and delicate wine comes from an estate vineyard planted in 1999 in the Occidental Hills. Rose petals and cranberry mingle effortlessly on the silky palate, while a bite of black tea and tannin tease on the finish.
title: Small Vines 2014 MK Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The eponymous winemaker of this brand is based in San Francisco, from which, in this bottling, he turns out a stunner. Focused, intense, energetic and yet delicate, the nose is full of just-ripe raspberries, bay leaf, thyme, eucalyptus and chipped slate. A sip reveals crushed herbs galore, from oregano to anise, set against tart pomegranate and red plums. Menthol shows on the finish.
title: Ryan Cochrane 2014 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Smoke and vanilla spice hover above appetizing notions of tart red-berry fruit. The body is light and spicy and has a touch of fragrant conifer and an abundance of lovely unforced cranberry and red cherry. There is a pervasive freshness and elegance to this wine, which lifts it well above the ordinary. Pinot lovers will rejoice in the spice and light-footedness, but there is a serious beautiful core of fruit and a lasting peppery finish.
title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2014 Grillenhügel Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: This wine is both incredibly pretty and wild, a tenacious quality of feral forest and ocean at its core. Honeysuckle and rose provide the beauty first, followed by a depth of gorgeous cherry, strawberry and rhubarb, the fruit alive and fresh atop a gravelly texture of complexity.
title: La Follette 2014 Hawk's Roost Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A beautiful waft of rose-petal perfume makes for an thrilling entry into this bold, voluptuous wine. Full bodied and exuberant from start to finish, it's marked by well-defined offerings of spicy cardamom and wild strawberry, finishing lush and round.
title: Macauley 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Lots of red flowers, from roses to hibiscus, show alongside plump candied red cherries, exotic Asian spice, black tea and hearty chaparral herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate is heavy with bay leaf, thyme and eucalyptus served atop a strawberry-cherry base. It's earthy and herbal, yet redolent with ripeness.
title: Melville 2014 Block M Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Red plum, white sage, graphite and iron combine for a well-defined nose on this bottling from an iconic vineyard in the region. Winemaker Aaron Walker walks the line between depth and lightness on the palate, where light cranberry fruit pairs with smoked meat, oregano and marjoram seasonings.
title: Pali 2014 Rancho la Vina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Comprised solely of old-school Swan and Calera clones, this bottling offers red cherry-cinnamon-mocha foam on the well-integrated, multilayered nose, along with some heartier plum and vanilla. It tightens on the sip to reveal strawberry fruit but also oregano, raw beef and lots of florality.
title: Nielson by Byron 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Baked black cherry and black plum meet with lots of crushed gravel and light fennel on the nose of this bottling that is all about fruit and earth, rather than herb and spice. Tart red plum and sour raspberry show upon the palate's gravelly texture, but darker red fruit awaits in the midpalate along with char and a touch of soy.
title: Couloir 2014 John Sebastiano VIneyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Hearty sagebrush, rust and dust meet with dried Montgomery cherry and tart pomegranate aromas on the nose of this bottling from a Healdsburg-based producer. It's luscious on the palate with ripe plum fruit and tons of baking spice, from cinnamon to clove cream, nutmeg and vanilla.
title: Bruliam 2014 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A first-release from this site, this is a balanced, lightly textured wine, pretty in rose and lavender, with an intriguing shock of white pepper. Baked cherry and plum find companionship in savory clove and cinnamon on the delicate palate.
title: Small Vines 2014 TBH Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: From one of the more popular vineyards in the appellation, this bottling shows strawberry fruit, allspice, black pepper, candied cherry and cinnamon on the nose. A strong sizzle of acidity marks the sip, with intriguingly deep raspberry, tangy cranberry, white pepper and crushed-slate flavors. Though light in body, it is heavy in flavors.
title: Rideau 2014 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This complex wine neatly weaves blue and purple fruit flavors, with soft leather, dried herb, cannabis and smoke accents. It's drinking quite well and should remain in peak condition for another half decade. Drink now through 2025.
title: Et Fille 2014 Heredity Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Tightly wound in its youth, this is a spicy integrated wine that offers black tea and baked strawberry-rhubarb flavors alongside bold aromas of rose petal and forest floor. Moderate structure supports the moderate ripeness and expansiveness on the palate.
title: Furthermore 2014 Graton Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There is a strong floral character to the nose of this single vineyard bottling, with pungent carnation and violet as well as red currant, black raspberry and incense. The sip is energetic with tart acidity, yet the mouthfeel is soft, creamy and nearly chalky, showing cranberry and cherry tomato flavors.
title: Lumen 2014 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine has a fresh carbonic liveliness on the palate—a burst of bubbly cherry and pomegranate flavor that is supported by sturdy tannins. Toasted oak is complemented by Asian five-spice and pretty aromas of rose.
title: Papapietro Perry 2014 777 Clones Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is juicy and broad in tannin, with a gritty layered texture of black cherry, blackberry and minty menthol. Cola spice rides along the palate with ease, providing a savory touch within a light-bodied weight.
title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Campbell Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This blends together the grapes of several vineyards within the appellation, including single-vineyard sites like Leras, Peters and Nunes. Brightly layered, it shines in strawberry and pomegranate tanginess, complemented by fresh acidity and a persistence of rose.
title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Dark and toasty barrel flavors frame tight black cherry fruit in this wine. It has herbal highlights that bring cannabis to mind and dark chocolate notes that wrap up the finish. It's a blocky, substantial wine best consumed now through 2022.
title: Van Duzer 2014 Bieze Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: A new project from the owners of Spindrift Cellars, this features old vines and French oak-aging. It's lightly musky, with animal hints and plenty of ripe raspberry fruit. The full-flavored midpalate glides into a pretty, chocolaty finish.
title: Compton Family 2014 Llewellyn Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A wonderful combination of spices, fruits and good structure make this an outstanding wine. It has a spicy, lightly smoky aroma that also includes black cherries, leading to deep cherry and berry flavors accented by cinnamon and clove. The texture is silky, supported by mild fine-grained tannins.
title: Shane Wines 2014 The Charm Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an extracted, lightly woven together wine that's ethereal in style. Candied orange peel and strawberry-rhubarb mingle softly on the palate, as seasonings of Asian five spice and cola wander by.
title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Leras Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Thyme-laced pomegranate juice aromas, enhanced with baked earth, white pepper and tarragon, makes for an intriguing entry to this bottling. The texture is light and delicate, combining dried garden herbs and buoyant red-fruit flavors, and finishing on clove. This is an easy afternoon sipper.
title: Scheid Vineyards 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: This is a blend of two well-regarded vineyards, Lucky Well and Silver Eagle, both farmed by Ulises Valdez. It casts a considerable shadow of brawn and beauty, balancing strawberry-puree flavors with an earthy undertone of forest pine. Big-boned, it alternates between richness and freshness.
title: Dowdell 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Tart, sappy raspberry fruit defines this focused, young-tasting wine that's structured for medium term aging. There's a touch of truffle in its phenolic notes of stem and herb. Well-modulated, it lingers through a graceful, balanced finish.
title: Et Fille 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Brawny red fruit savory in pomegranate and cranberry highlight an earthy core of light-bodied ripeness and quiet richness in this clone-specific wine. The texture is crisp and velvety on the palate. The vineyards involved include Bucher, Peters and Leras.
title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Pommard Clones Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A mix of clones is at work here, giving a dark, smoky wine with brambly berry fruit. Its tobacco, burnt toast, stem and slate scents and flavors are textured and detailed. It's a solid Oregon Pinot that can stand up to blackened salmon, roast pork or lamb.
title: Keeler 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: From one of the most familiar of the Santenay premier crus, this wine still has its structure and a dry core. Around that are red cherry fruits, juicy acidity and a light touch of wood. The wine is developing well and should be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Julie Belland 2014 Beauregard Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: From the lower slope of Pommard, this richly fruity wine is smooth and generous. It has a layer of tannin as well as full black fruits and a solid character. The wine is still young and needs aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Julie Belland 2014 Les Cras  (Pommard)

description: After 18 months in barrel (75% new), this was the last of the winery's 2014 Pinot Noirs to be released. The color is dark and vibrant, and it opens with orange peel, berry, spiced cherry and smoke notes. The expected barrel flavors are hiding, and the wine seems to dissipate rather quickly. It warrants another couple of years in bottle before drinking.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2014 Expressionism Pinot Noir

description: Light in the glass, this bottling is a decent example of a more restrained Santa Lucia Highlands wine, with aromas of crisp raspberry, hibiscus and cranberry notes alongside warming hints of vanilla and thyme. Fresh and lively flavors of tart red fruits are dusted by herbs and spice cake on the palate.
title: Scheid Vineyards 2014 Doctor's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This pleasant wine is aging rather quickly, already a light rose hue with early bricking. It's in its prime drinking window, with sour cherry and plum flavors and hints of stem and bitter herb, all in proportion. Drink now through 2022.
title: Bells Up 2014 Titan Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Firm acidity and a sour cherry flavor make this medium-bodied wine very palate-cleansing. It emphasizes liveliness and a light tannic grip over pure fruitiness, but it still delivers complex and attractive cherry and rhubarb flavors.
title: Briceland 2014 Alderpoint Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)

description: Smoky, toasty aromas introduce this wine before progressing into an interesting mix of flavors based around raspberry jam. Streaks of bitter herb, tarragon and citrus wind through, with a butterscotch hint that brightens the finish.
title: Youngberg Hill Vineyards 2014 Natasha Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: A light color and equally light cinnamon and spiced raspberry aromas set this wine up for a racy, acid-driven palate. Its spicy, juicy plum and currant flavors finish tight and fresh, for an elegant, food-friendly package.
title: Montesco 2014 Punta Negra Pinot Noir (Tupungato)

description: This Swiss Pinot Noir has aromas of smoked meats, blueberries and black plums. In the mouth there are flavors of black cherry and plum. It is well balanced on the palate and the finish is smooth with a persistent aftertaste of fresh fruit.
title: Gantenbein 2014 Pinot Noir (Graubünden)

description: This wine's aromas aren't quite ready to reveal their charms, its spice, red fruit and tangerine peel notes locked up for now. It's full and weighty, with flavors that seem muddy on the midpalate but come together on the finish.
title: Battle Creek 2014 Yamhela Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This lively, rather lean wine has enticing spicy aromas and exotic fruit flavors on a frame of good acidity and firm tannins. Light touches of spicy oak add some complexity, and the texture is robust enough to pair with very rich proteins.
title: Briceland 2014 Ronda's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)

description: This wine's stem, ash and herb aromas are at the fore, needing more time in bottle to settle. The palate is light on its feet, with interesting grapefruit accents. It comes up a bit short on the finish.
title: Battle Creek 2014 Battle Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine proffers a bouquet of raspberry and plum with a hint of bell pepper. Bright flavors of cranberry and cherry fill the mouth and are then joined by notes of roasted tomato and bell pepper. Tannins that are not immediately apparent slide up on you and coat the gums and tongue. The bright finish is marked with a brief hint of smoke.
title: Golan Heights Winery 2014 Yarden Pinot Noir (Galilee)

description: Red-cherry aromas lead to a ripe, fruity and spicy wine. With red-berry fruits, juicy acidity and a crisp texture, this wine is almost ready to drink but the acidity needs to soften for a few more months. Drink from late 2018.
title: Vincent Lumpp 2014 Clos Saint-Paul Premier Cru  (Givry)

description: This is a light tart wine, cradled in herbaceousness and well-defined flavors of strawberry, cranberry and rhubarb. High in acidity and subtle in oak, it has a grainy texture piquant in cardamom spice.
title: Bouchaine 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This well-made, well-priced wine over-delivers in terms of quality. Smoky cherry and plum accentuate the toasted oak, as a sturdy foundation of tannin gives it power and strength. The savory finish mixes forest and tea.
title: Starmont 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Tannic and spicy, this wine settles in the glass to offer a glorious spectrum of medium-bodied black cherry, blackberry and rhubarb. Along the way it threads a savory undertone of forest floor and chamomile tea.
title: Chasseur 2014 Freestone Station Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Earthy and smooth, this is a light, crisply ripe wine. It offers a delicate layering of baked raspberry, citrus and cardamom spice.
title: Joseph Swan Vineyards 2014 Trenton Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This latest bottling from the Jackson Family Wines' “Seeds of Empowerment” fundraising series shows woody, somewhat gamy aromas of animal hide alongside black cherry and sandalwood spice. The gamy quality extends to the sip, where dried meat meets red currant, cherries and a hint of fennel.
title: Cambria 2014 Clone 4 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Medium in build and lengthy with layers of flavor, this vineyard-designate offers a wealth of rhubarb, pomegranate, cherry and black tea, the background built around strong notions of forest floor.
title: Peter Paul Wines 2014 Frere Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Luscious aromas of red-cherry pie, vanilla, concentrated rose petals, juniper and cocoa show on the complex nose of this wine, of which 75% comes from the Finley Vineyard and 25% from George's Vineyard. The palate's core of dark cranberry and plum is lifted by pepper spice, oregano and marjoram, extending into the finish thanks to a strong tannic frame and well-integrated acidity.
title: Cooper-Garrod 2014 Two Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This incredibly zesty and fruity bottling shows raspberry, lavender and white pepper on the nose. It's fun to sip, with snappy red fruits and hibiscus most prominent. Complexity comes from touches of rooibos tea and potpourri. It's still extremely youthful.
title: Silvertip 2014 Unfiltered Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Tight-grained tannin wraps around a firmness of oak and high acidity in this brawny, full-bodied wine. The fruit comes baked, like a strawberry-rhubarb pie, seasoned in cinnamon.
title: WindRacer 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Grilled mushroom and a gamy note define this wine, from the highest point of the winery's estate. It's velvety thick, smoky, concentrated and forested in flavor, with strong accents of dried herb.
title: Iron Horse 2014 Thomas Road Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Hedonistic aromas of hot red-cherry pie with buttery crust show on the nose of this bottling along with more intellectual touches of thyme and graphite. There's a strong herbal front to the palate, with bay leaf, mint and more thyme sprinkled atop boysenberry fruit. It finishes with a bit of earthy dust.
title: Fog Theory 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The restrained nose of this bottling shows red cherry, dusty earth, sagebrush and a bit of rosebud. The palate blends the sour and sweet tones of candied cranberry with thyme and bay leaf, proving quite clean and tasty.
title: Foley 2014 Bar Lazy S Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Spicy, dense and thick, this wine settles into bright, lifted acidity and tart flavors of rhubarb and cranberry. The underbelly remains earthy in clove and black tea.
title: August Briggs 2014 Dijon Clones Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Black plum, boysenberry, nutmeg and cinnamon show on the nose of this appellation blend. A ripe boysenberry flavor pops at the tip of the sip, with sagebrush and savory meat flavors arising midpalate. The tannic structure is squeaky and clean.
title: Cinnabar 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Tart and peppery, this is a spicy, earthy wine with medium weight and length. Flavors tend toward the crisp red end of the spectrum, from watermelon to pomegranate, dipped in forest floor, rosemary and tea.
title: Chasseur 2014 Umino Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Lean fruit and herb flavors plus a tight, unpolished texture make this wine an acquired taste. But tart cherry, black tea and rhubarb components also make it complex and interesting. A very firm texture shows plenty of acidity and a healthy coating of tannin.
title: Donkey & Goat 2014 Broken Leg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Juicy and slightly reduced, this tightly woven wine shows layers of cranberry, citrus and tea, all wrapped within a cocoon of forested earth and medium-weight body.
title: Fog Crest 2014 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Clean aromas of black cherry, dried thyme and white pepper show that this bottling isn't just all about creative packaging, with its Grim Reaper theme. The flavors are also cohesive and well integrated, with nutmeg, clove and stewed red cherry working together.
title: Reaper 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Carbonic freshness lurks on the palate of this appellation wine, dotted in strawberry jam, lavender and rose characteristics. Lightly textured and built, it finishes soft and smooth.
title: WesMar 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Red raspberry and cherry offer a depth of fruit flavor in this full-bodied, robust wine that's buoyed by moderate acidity. The cherry is seasoned in baking spice and black tea, as accents of toasted oak lean into rich vanilla.
title: Rodney Strong 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is tannic and slightly carbonic on the palate, offering a fresh, spritzy taste. Stemmy, it shows a distinct presence of forest floor, black tea and cranberry flavor.
title: WesMar 2014 Hellenthal Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Thinly textured and lightly spiced, this wine shows an earthy forest-floor character with spikes of baking spice and black tea. The subtext is defined by juicy huckleberry.
title: Chasseur 2014 Soft Asylum Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Light black raspberry and purple-flower aromas show on the somewhat shy nose of this bottling from the Jackson Family's longtime Santa Maria Valley winery. Well-woven flavors of black raspberry, dark cranberry, thyme and bay leaf appear on the sip, which is light and easy albeit not very complex.
title: Cambria 2014 Benchbreak Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This medium-bodied wine is straightforward and appetizing, coming off as lighter than the other 2016 bottlings from Maggy Hawk. It combines bright cherry and raspberry aromas with nicely crisp fruit flavors and a moderately tannic texture.
title: Maggy Hawk 2014 Afleet Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: It's not easy making balanced Pinot Noir in Paso Robles, but this is a solid attempt. Baked strawberry and cherry meet with vanilla and cinnamon on the lush nose. The palate shows candied red fruits, even touches of watermelon, with the slightest dusting of herbs.
title: Sculpterra 2014 Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)

description: Minty, with a strong menthol character, this wine is high in acidity and overtly earthy. It offers a smoky after-note of leather and clove.
title: Chasseur 2014 Sexton Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Concentrated and slightly dried red cherry meets with cola on the nose of this densely packed, heavy-bodied bottling. The palate shows very dried red fruit with a touch of nutmeg spice.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Grand Reserve Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: This is a thin, light-bodied wine, showy in deep, dark berry and cherry. Around its fruity edges, robust oak and tree bark are softened in black tea.
title: Glenwood Cellars 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Baked black-plum aromas meet with star anise on the nose of this bottling. The texture is easy and light on the sip, where somewhat muddled flavors of mulberry and dried earth ride a decent acidity that rises toward the finish.
title: Bridlewood 2014 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: Robust in oak, this full-bodied expression of the variety is reduced on the palate, showing sizable tannin weight and length. Plum, dark cherry and dried herb combine to offer swirls of flavor.
title: Foppiano 2014 River's Edge Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A strong smoky aroma, spicy oak flavors and a blast of ripe fruit make this a boisterous wine. It's full bodied, with heat on the palate. A little berry and cherry concentration comes through on the finish.
title: WindRacer 2014 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This is a decadently juicy, succulent and satisfyingly delicious vineyard-designate. It shows defined layers of blueberry and sassafras, the body rich yet balanced.
title: Bruliam 2014 Torrey Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a lot of heady wine for a relatively affordable price. Aromas of black-cherry syrup, baked black plum, nutmeg, clove and gingerbread make for an attention-grabbing nose. The hearty palate shows similar elements, along with black peppercorn, Christmas spice, dense blackberry paste, chaparral scrub and pine-forest notes.
title: Hahn 2014 SLH Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This big, ripe wine features red fruits, acidity and a touch of young tannins. It is structured, with chocolate and some licorice flavors that are balanced with the strawberry and ripe tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Henri de Villamont 2014 Les Renardes  (Corton)

description: Grown in Green Valley, this medium-bodied wine offers heady Asian spices seasoned over tart, tangy orange and cherry. Pretty aromatics ride shotgun over a depth of earth and soft tannin and smoky oak, the wine ultimately plush and lush.
title: Sonoma-Loeb 2014 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Opulent and ripe, this wine has fine tannins that support the rich red fruit and smoky acidity. The weight and concentration of the wine make it so attractive and indicate it will develop well. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Max 2014 Aux Fourneaux Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: As you'd expect from this pioneering Oregon winery, this is a smooth, sophisticated, accessible yet ageable wine. Polished berry and cherry fruit is swathed in cola and cocoa highlights, running through silky tannins. Drink now through 2020.
title: Adelsheim 2014 Breaking Ground Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: There is a definite juicy red-fruit Pinot Noir character in this warm wine. It has spice, fine acidity and layers of red-berry fruits. The light tannic structure holds this fine wine properly together. Drink now.
title: Cortes de Cima 2014 Pinot Noir (Alentejano)

description: From the famous vineyard site along Westside Road, equally known for its Chardonnay, this big, bold red is not for the faint of heart. It delivers a powerful punch of voluptuously jammy blueberry around soft, earthy wisps of forest and black tea.
title: Venge 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This delicious bottle sings out with a burst of bright raspberry fruit. As with all the Winderlea designates, the exposure to new oak is fairly minimal—just 10 months in one-sixth new barrels. Juicy acidity keeps flavors buoyant, and the barrels add light notes of caramel and nougat. Drink this with great enjoyment over the next two or three years.
title: Winderlea 2014 Crawford Beck Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Sizable tannins and oak make for a full-bodied experience that comes off closed and tight at first, the wine needing some time in the glass to unwind. With patience, it unpeels layers of soft, floral aromas and quiet notions of raspberry and strawberry.
title: Trombetta 2014 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Estate grown and fermented with native yeasts, the Select cuvée is the entry level offering from Brick House. In this hot vintage the picking, sorting and fermentation have been carefully managed to produce a balanced and textural wine. The fruit shines through with apple, cranberry and cherry, underscored by a refreshing minerality. The acids have a subtle citrus/orange peel flavor.
title: Brick House 2014 Select Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This wine is firm and structured, with dark tannins and a dense texture that is still dry. It offers ripe fruit as well as acidity, currently overshadowed by the tannins but will come to the fore with some time. The wine will age well, thanks to the solid structure and dry core of tannins. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Les Chaillots Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: This vineyard, which dates back to 1978, ripened well in 2014. Scents and flavors emphasize fresh red berries, with a touch of stone. There's a firm grip to the tannins, a touch of black pepper, and everything is well-integrated, flavorful and ready to drink.
title: Winderlea 2014 Murto Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This wine is big and ripe with layers of tannins and attractive fruitiness. Bright acidity comes from the strawberry and red-cherry fruit. The drier structure is integrating well, with plenty of richness behind. The wine will develop well; drink from 2019.
title: Albert Morot 2014 Bataillière Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: If you've ever had a Momtazi wine, you know that there is a strong earthy aspect to the flavors that sets the vineyard apart from most others. In the scents and tastes here you'll find composted earth, chalk, dried leaves and black tea ahead of black cherry fruit, but those funk-soaked flavors add up to a complex and intriguing wine.
title: Portlandia 2014 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This opens with a pleasing toasty aroma, following through on the palate. That deft touch of French oak (33% new) frames a solid core of strawberry preserves and Bing cherry fruit. It resonates on through a stylish, textural finish. Enjoy this immediately, and tuck away a few bottles to drink in five years.
title: Fullerton 2014 Five Faces Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Rather lean and austere, this is a tight, structured wine. Its future lies in the firm tannins and the juicy red-currant fruit. Wait for this wine and don't drink before 2020.
title: Michel et Joana Ecard 2014 Aux Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This wine is initially lean, taking time to disclose the smoky fruits. It has structure as well as red-currant fruitiness. Still reticent, the wine needs time to show its full potential. Drink from 2020.
title: Albert Morot 2014 Les Bressandes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A ripe combination of red fruits and powerful tannins gives this wine its density and also potential. It is full of acidity as well as berry fruits, layered with tannins and touches of wood aging. With this concentration, the wine will certainly age. Drink from 2020.
title: Château de Santenay 2014  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: This wine is soft, with attractive, aromatic red fruits. It has the round, ripe feel typical of the village, with just a tannic touch to keep it together. At the moment, the wine is all fruit and acidity, and it needs to develop further to bring out its secondary flavors. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Coquard Loisson-Fleurot 2014  Chambolle-Musigny

description: The wood is still showing in this ripe, fruity wine. That's fine because the fruit and the perfumed acidity will fill out the wine and give it richness. Drink from 2018.
title: Tollot Beaut et Fils 2014 Les Lavières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Opening with a strong streak of herb, bitter root and pepper, this carries those flavors on into a palate of cherry fruit, highlighted with orange peel. It's an intriguing wine, still a bit austere, and not as fruit-forward as many in this highly-regarded vintage.
title: Winderlea 2014 Bryan Creek Vineyards Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Biodynamically grown grapes give pure red fruits, with fresh berry flavors that are shot through with acidity. It has a generous feel, with a crisp texture that gives the necessary lift. Drink from 2017.
title: Alex Gambal 2014 Picotins  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This Bulgarian Pinot Noir has aromas of black cherry, red raspberry and cinnamon. In the mouth, there are flavors of dried black cherry, fresh cherry juice and brown baking spices before the pleasant, persistent finish.
title: Chateau Burgozone 2014 Pinot Noir (Danube River Plains)

description: Earthy sassafras and cola mark the aroma and flavor profile of this wine, made from multiple vineyards along the appellation's River Road. Juicy in red cherry, it lingers in fleshy acidity and shows a heady ripeness that overflows on the palate.
title: Roadhouse Winery 2014 Yellow Label Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine has structure, typical of this appellation, as well as dark black fruits and rich tannins. Acidity cuts through this ripeness, bringing in freshness. Spice and an attractive perfume come along at the end. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Latour 2014  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: Tense and structured, this is a firm, concentrated wine from the top vineyard in the appellation. It has tight acidity as well as red-currant flavors. The structure is still firm and condensed, and the wine will need time. It has potential; drink from 2019.
title: Louis Latour 2014 Ile de Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: This young wine seems to be just coming out of bottle shock, and initially the flavors pull up short. It's showing strawberry and red plum with a bit of milk chocolate, sourced from Whistling Ridge, Durant and Bishop Creek vineyards. Just 10% saw new French oak. Give this elegant wine another year or so to smooth out, and drink 2017 through 2020.
title: Goodfellow 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Though bearing the Willamette Valley label, this is principally Pommard clone fruit from Northridge vineyard in the Eola-Amity Hills AVA. It's a barrel selection, tough and chewy at this point. The muscular structure pushes pomegranate and black cherry fruit to the center. Ripe tannins provide an undercoating of chewy earth. It's big-boned and generous.
title: Willful 2014 Winemaker Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Round and full-bodied, this block selection reflects the warmth of the Pommard and Dijon clones. The acids have a juicy, citrus character, and there is a streak of cola along with bright cherry fruit.
title: DanCin 2014 Élevé Pinot Noir (Southern Oregon)

description: Very light and shy on the nose, this wine with patience shows pomegranate punch and rain-slicked slate. The palate offers tart cranberry, a touch of Earl Grey tea and pencil-lead flavors.
title: Consilience 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Pinot Noir in this appellation produces light, gently fruity wines such as this. With bright cherry flavors and a modicum of tannins, it is fresh, soft and ready to drink.
title: Jean-Michel Sorbe 2014 Pinot Noir (Reuilly)

description: This wine is lean, with tannins that are not quite ripe. That gives a tight character to this wine that also has acidity and red-currant fruits. Give the wine until mid-2016 for it to soften a little.
title: Louis Chevallier 2014  Bourgogne

description: This lean wine focuses more on its stalky texture rather than fruit. It has some attractive perfumes and hints of red fruits that are subdued by the austere structure. Drink from 2017.
title: Roland Tissier et Fils 2014 Tradition  (Sancerre)

description: While the wine is ripe, it does have a barnyard aroma that needs to blow away before it is ready to drink. The aroma comes with firm, dry tannins and a ripe berry fruits that are just beginning to develop. Drink from 2017.
title: Clement et Florian Berthier 2014 Pinot Noir (Coteaux du Giennois)

description: An earthy tasting wine, this has tannins and hints of soft, perfumed red fruits. Acidity gives the wine freshness although the dry, rustic character is off-putting.
title: Philippe Girard 2014  Sancerre

description: This earthy wine presents barnyard flavors over the riper red fruit and licorice flavors. Drink now when the fruit is at its best.
title: Thibault 2014 Fernand & Sons Pinot Noir (Coteaux du Giennois)

description: Bright raspberry and strawberry flavors kick off this well-balanced effort. It's buoyed by ample natural acidity and adorned with highlights of pastry and baking spices. It expands gracefully as it breathes, adding volume and density. Give this extra cellar time. It should drink best from 2018–2030.
title: Ayoub 2014 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: As with all Ayoub wines, the immaculate fruit and impeccable structure impress the most. Deep flavors of strawberry and raspberry are set in a toasty frame, with underlying minerality. The finish is drying and extends for well over a minute.
title: Ayoub 2014 Estate Whole Cluster Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: No, that's not a typo. The ??? Vineyard bottling conceals (intentionally) the fruit sources for these grapes, which come from one of Oregon's most expensive and highly-reviewed producers. It's crystal-clear in both appearance and flavor, building upon a cranberry/raspberry base into a potent young wine with expressive purity. A streak of gun metal, often found in consulting winemaker Robert Brittan's own wines, adds a stylish note to the finish.
title: Ayoub 2014 ??? Vineyards Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Stone, mineral and metal highlights combine around tight cranberry and raspberry fruit. Concentrated and compact, this distinctive bottling is bone-dry. Drink 2020–2030.
title: Ayoub 2014 Brittan Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Made for the first time in this vintage, this young wine is tight and brambly, with tart, peppery berry fruit. Chewy tannins denote its youth, and the finish delivers outstanding depth. If it follows the path of other Ayoub Pinots, this will benefit greatly from further bottle age.
title: Ayoub 2014 Overlook Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The entry-level Pinot in the Ayoub lineup would be the top cuvée for any number of wineries. Full and fruity, with rich cherry flavors backed with defining minerality, it's powerful, deep and immaculately clear.
title: Ayoub 2014 Memoirs Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The steep, stony slope of the Cul de Beaujeu has produced this firmly structured wine that has rich plum and berry fruits. It is an impressive wine, ripe and juicy. With plenty of youthful crisp freshness the wine needs to age to plumb the depths that are there for the future. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Delaporte 2014 Cul de Beaujeu  (Sancerre)

description: Prime grapes from this outstanding vineyard offer full-bodied plum and cherry fruit, highlights of iron filings and lighter hints of funk. This is a powerful effort, with the depth to age through 2024.
title: Purple Hands 2014 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: While the wine is very young, the potential is there. It has rich tannins and berry fruits that are packed with youthful acidity. The structure and the depth of flavor are there with a hint of the juicy fruits as well as the minerality that are both developing. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Delaporte 2014 Maxime Cuvée Silex  (Sancerre)

description: Pommard and Wädenswil clones are combined here, yielding a stylish, well-defined wine with spicy berry fruit. Flavors punch through into a deep and detailed finish, with streaks of cola and caramel. The balance is spot-on.
title: Purple Hands 2014 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Purple plums and tangy pie cherries are the fruit focus, in a well-balanced wine that pushes through with precise, acid-backed cut and drive. This leans to the elegant side in terms of style, with excellent balance and proportion.
title: Purple Hands 2014 Barron-Wahl Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Unfined, unfiltered and fermented with native yeasts, this is a solid effort with medium concentration that expands with ample aeration. Blackberry and black-cherry fruit is matched to notes of cola and chocolate, with fresh acidity and a pleasing, textural mouthfeel.
title: Purple Hands 2014 Holstein Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Forward and open, this has chocolaty, brambly raspberry fruit, along with pleasant hints of tobacco, vanilla and caramel. It glides through the palate smoothly, finishing with an elegant touch of stem, from 15% whole cluster fermentation.
title: Purple Hands 2014 Latchkey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Among an extensive single-vineyard lineup from Purple Hand, this wine has fruit flavors centered around strawberries, with a slightly dilute sense of minerality. The wine expands and impresses as it continues into a lengthy, elegant finish, adding strength in the back palate.
title: Purple Hands 2014 Stoller Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The wine is young and still firm with dry tannins. It has really fresh red-berry fruits that are going to need time to broaden out. For now, the wine shows the fruitiness of the vintage and with a solid texture for aging. Drink from 2017.
title: Domaine Delaporte 2014  Sancerre

description: This opens with a full and succulent burst of fruit, notably cherries and plums. The rich and juicy flavors are highlighted with a streak of cola and buoyed with ample acids. This is just flat-out delicious.
title: Purple Hands 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A tasty vein of cranberry and raspberry runs from the nose to the palate, and lingers on the finish, giving this value-priced wine focus and vibrance. It has plenty of fresh acidity, fine tannins and good depth of flavor.
title: Line 39 2014 Pinot Noir (California)

description: A solid effort in 2014, this bottling has aromatics of rhubarb, cranberry, pine needle, cocoa and vanilla. All those elements can be tracked across the palate as well in a well-defined, though fairly light style.
title: King Estate 2014 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Fresh, vibrant fruit aromas, a lively, appetizing texture, and cherry and raspberry flavors make this wine a crowd-pleaser. It's medium bodied, well balanced and tasty.
title: Tortoise Creek 2014 Mission Grove Pinot Noir (California)

description: Crisp and juicy flavors of cranberries and raspberries cut through, riding a wave of sharp acidity. This wine is young and vivid, fruit-driven and relatively simple, but delicious nonetheless.
title: WildStock 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Tart strawberry fruit holds down the center of this young wine, with just a hint of coffee from aging in 30% new French oak. That fresh and juicy fruit is the main attraction, and suggests good drinking now through 2020.
title: Monte Ferro 2014 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Rustic on the nose, this is an earthy, herb-filled wine made in a robust style, juicy and exhibiting glassfuls of rhubarb and black tea. Integrated in terms of oak and tannin, it's youthful and may need some time to grow.
title: Apriori 2014 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: While big and brawny in style, this Pinot still maintains good balance. The aromas resemble toasty, spicy oak, with cranberry and dark cherry notes. The flavors echo the nose and are vivid due to lively acidity and a firm layer of tannins.
title: Replica 2014 Pinot Noir (California)

description: More of a mauve color than pink, this wine shows strong cherry notes on the nose as well as seared orange rinds and a slightly boozy rum and coconut element. Mashed cherry pulp and grilled red fruit show on the nose.
title: Kessler-Haak 2014 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a supple, medium-bodied Pinot Noir that exemplifies much of what is coming out of Marlborough. Hints of mushroom and soy sauce accent bright cherry fruit, finishing on a silky note. Drink now.
title: Framingham 2014 Ribbonwood Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This good, sturdy wine has ripe, broad fruit flavors, medium to full body, and a relaxed mouthfeel.
title: Cambridge & Sunset 2014 California Series Pinot Noir (California)

description: Direct aromas of tart cherry, rhubarb and red currant are laced with spicy hints of cocoa and pepper, while the palate offers lush berry and cherry fruit flavors. The mouthfeel is soft and approachable, with delicate tannins and ample acidity. Drink now.
title: Le Val 2014 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Already showing hints of age-related decay, this is a bit mushroomy and earthy, with attenuated strawberry fruit. It does still have a decently silky texture, so enjoy it over the next year or so.
title: Sileni 2014 Cellar Selection Pinot Noir (Hawke's Bay)

description: Clean and fruit-forward, this relatively light-bodied wine doesn't show the richness or complexity that made Martinborough famous. It's a pleasant mix of tart cherries and vanilla-tinged oak with a trace of dustiness on the finish.
title: Murdoch James 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Appealing notes of cedar and vanilla mark the nose, but unfortunately this wine lacks the richness of fruit to fully support them. Tart cherry fruit fades quickly on the finish.
title: Seven Terraces 2014 Pinot Noir (Canterbury)

description: When vintages are difficult, as 2014 was, it's often most apparent in a region's entry level wines. This wine is simply lacking in concentration, offering little more than tart cherries and delicate herbal notes. Drink now.
title: Fire Road 2014 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Hints of menthol and cherry cough drop are upfront on the nose. Flavors of red currant, rhubarb and sour raspberry appear on the crisp, tart palate, finishing clean yet short.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This lively wine is fresh and bright on the nose, but not simple at all, with aromas of plump raspberry, pomegranate, rose petals, hibiscus and a hint of eucalyptus on the edge. It has tons of verve and pin-pricking acidity on the palate, where just-cut pomegranate, alpine strawberry and chopped thyme thrive.
designation: Rebel Rebel Quinta del Mar Vineyard
title: La Voix 2014 Rebel Rebel Quinta del Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Rose, lavender and forest provide the opening notes of a lovely, concentrated, still-evolving wine, its density and concentration offset by a beguiling brightness of acidity. Strawberry, cranberry and nuanced suggestions of cinnamon and clove play off each other until a toasty finish.
title: Sojourn 2014 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The Rocheux has never been better than this new vintage. Crisp cranberry and raspberry fruit carries an underlying, wet-rock minerality. Flavors are dense and detailed, and seem to extend almost indefinitely. Drink now through 2030.
title: Le Cadeau 2014 Rocheux Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Light in color but bursting with aromas of candied cherry, pencil lead, sauteed porcini mushrooms and rain-soaked gravel, this is a fabulous wine from an oceanview vineyard above Corralitos. Italian spices of oregano and bay leaf combine with a sesame-oil warmth and bright raspberry fruit on the zesty palate.
title: Sante Arcangeli 2014 Split Rail Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: A lovely bouquet of dusty rose petals marks the entry of this delightful wine. Softly textured, it's subtle in tannin and oak, with interweaving swathes of black tea and grenadine-intense cherry. Medium bodied, it remains silky and fresh through the lengthy finish.
title: Westwood 2014 Annadel Gap Vineyard Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Valley)

description: This is a gentle giant of a wine, subtle and sublime in earthy rose petals, allspice and black tea that maintain a spiky, lively acidity throughout. Blueberry and black cherry compete for attention, balancing the grapes' more savory intentions, before a smoothly intense finish rides things out.
title: Sojourn 2014 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: With a small percentage of whole-cluster fermentation, this is a prized, sultry and cohesive wine, nutty in aromas and a sizable pinch of oak that speaks to its youthfulness. Raspberry jam and bitter tea ride over soft waves of integrated tannin and a fierce earthiness. Drink now through 2024.
title: Sojourn 2014 Rodgers Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling shows blackberry jam, crushed slate, turned black loam and hot baking spice on the nose. There is prominent structure to the palate, where olallieberry meets with smashed clove, bay leaf, black pepper and vanilla. The acid is seamlessly integrated, so drink 2018–2030.
title: Loring Wine Company 2014 Russell Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Graphite, rose petals, vanilla and a strong yet not over-exuberant black cherry quality pump up the nose of this decadent bottling by Brian Loring. There's great tactile texture once sipped, with chalky tannins unveiling ripe cranberry, red cherry, clay, cinnamon and baking-spice elements.
title: Loring Wine Company 2014 Rancho La Vina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Scott Shull (Raptor Ridge) makes this cuvée for Le Cadeau, and it's a triumph in this vintage. Cherry fruit ripe to the point of syrup hogs the flavor spotlight, but there's cranberry and raspberry too, putting a tangy note into the mix. Root beer and sweet cola elements combine, and there is little doubt that, good as it is already, this is a wine to cellar. Drink now–2028.
title: Le Cadeau 2014 Diversité Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Subtle fruit flavors mingle mountain berries, plums and cherries with enticing baking spices. There's a touch of herb, earth and tanned leather also, bringing complexity and texture into a lingering finish. Drink now through 2020.
title: Le Cadeau 2014 Merci Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: A layered, savory and rich nose from this extremely coastal vineyard shows brawny strawberry and bramble notes as well as gingerbread, fresh purple, red and pink flowers, and a salty soy character. Lush olallieberry and blackberry fruit consumes the palate, lifted by black pepper and graphite-laced earth notes.
title: Last Light 2014 Derbyshire Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Ripe red cherries and red currants provide the fruit scents for the savory smoked pork and sanguine raw-beef qualities that power the nose on this single-vineyard bottling. Those bloody meats mix with elderberry, ripe red plum, lavender and allspice once sipped, proving complex and tangy but with lingering dark-fruit flavors.
title: Loring Wine Company 2014 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Sultry, silky and sexy on the nose with rich baking and red-spice notes, this appellation blend by Brian Loring also shows ripe but acidic raspberry fruit, rose buds and cooked berries. The palate is bursting with cranberry and black raspberries, enhanced by graphite, nutmeg and black peppercorns. It finishes tight and clean, with a camphor lift.
title: Loring Wine Company 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This soft, fresh and rose-laden wine spent less than a year in French oak, 40% of it new. Juicy and medium bodied, it builds complexity and texture on the palate, becoming more voluptuous and velvety as it heads into a cinnamon-kissed finish.
title: Les Belles Collines 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There's an inherent minerality to this bottling. Slate and wet concrete aromas are laid atop baked strawberry, stewed bay leaf and crushed oregano notes. A peppery acidity comes in the sip, which boasts a dark cranberry and stewed raspberry fruit backbone, touches of pine needle and more bay leaf.
title: Sante Arcangeli 2014 Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a silky, concentrated wine with sizable structure and darker spice undertones. Sourced from a range of vineyards, including Gap's Crown, Rodgers Creek and Riddle, mostly within the Petaluma Gap's cool corridor, it is a mix of black cherry and cinnamon, and boldly expansive on the palate.
title: Sojourn 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Chipped slate and wet-clay minerality give depth to the baked strawberry, black plum and rose-petal aromas on the nose of this single-vineyard study by Brian Loring. Similar earthiness descends on the palate, with a slow-simmering acidity allowing the juicy black fruit to steadily emerge.
title: Loring Wine Company 2014 Clos Pepe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is certainly a wine to drink immediately, as its hibiscus, green cardamom and smoky pork notes can't get any better. It's a little leaner than many Loring wines, but the clove, nutmeg and mace spice up the cherry compote and blackberry-vinaigrette reduction qualities, with just a touch of soy for more umami fun.
title: Loring Wine Company 2014 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Rocky gravel meets plum blossoms, strawberry jam, cola and nutmeg on the nose of this single-vineyard expression by winemaker Brian Loring. Once sipped, dark and rich pomegranate and olallieberry fruit takes hold, with graphite minerality making a splash midpalate.
title: Loring Wine Company 2014 Kessler-Haak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Mulberry and cherry fruit are highlighted with a nose-tweaking mix of scents, from cinnamon to chocolate to truffled earth. Flavors are well integrated and show a touch of funk in the finish, with grippy tannins.
title: Le Cadeau 2014 Serendipity Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is an intensely earthy wine, showing a rich bouquet of rose garden, geranium and wild pine. Soft on the palate and supple in tannin, it retains a savory edge throughout, spicy in Asian five spice, nutmeg and orange peel.
title: Keller 2014 El Coro Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This luxurious wine revolves around a velvety texture of pure decadence and full-bodied pleasure. Earthy in clove and mushroom, the fruit dives deep into rich aspects of dark cherry and huckleberry.
title: Eleven Eleven 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a funky expansive wine, varietally satisfying in its earthy embrace of forest and aspects of black tea. The fruit is tart and tangy, a mix of pomegranate and rhubarb laced in fresh vibrant citrus.
title: Pellegrini 2014 Toboni Oakwild Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Thick tannins wrap around this spicy, earthy red that's brooding in black cherry, cola and black tea. Slim acidity and a dash of coconut add to its overall appeal.
title: Ampelos 2014 Ampelos Vineyard Rho Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a bright, fully realized wine from the distinctive appellation: soft with an integrated approach to its use of oak. Wild strawberry, cranberry and a threading of dried herb combine effortlessly into a pleasurable whole.
title: En Garde 2014 Gold Ridge Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Lavish black-cherry candy and concentrated rose-petal aromas combine with candied-licorice notes on the lush nose of this bottling. There's a Concord grape ripeness to the slightly sweet sip, with a touch of woody spice, framed by chalky tannins.
title: Clos LaChance 2014 Murphy's Choice Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
