description: Muted on the nose, this light-bodied effort is velvety in texture, with a bite of tannin met by equal parts acidity and freshness. Cranberry and black tea highlight the appealing flavor profile.
title: Cuvaison 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This is a very intriguing wine, a departure from many from the region, with aromas of crushed slate, wet gravel, dewy black sage, underripe plum and gin-like juniper botanicals. The palate is full of woody shrubby flavors, with a menthol-like sensation that cuts through the dark but restrained fruits.
title: Mansfield-Dunne 2015 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Overlooking and very much influenced by the Petaluma Gap, this vineyard site is at 900 to 1,200-feet in elevation, above the fog. This wine captures its intensity of gravelly texture, grip and serious red cherry, as well as a streak of black-licorice wildness.
title: Tamber Bey 2015 Sun Chase Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Dark cherry, vanilla and a quiet streak of smoke permeate the personality of this well-made light-bodied wine that's soft and supple on the palate. Raspberry and cherry flavors further define its bright fruit-forwardness and sense of freshness, with a touch of grip on the finish.
title: Longboard 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Bright red-fruit tones of hibiscus and pomegranate meet with dried fennel on the complex nose of this bottling from the winery owned by pioneering vintner Louis Lucas and his friend, Judge Royce Lewellen. It's light bodied, but with a grippy texture, showing candied rose petal, thyme and roasted red-fruit flavors.
title: Lucas & Lewellen 2015 Estate Vineyards Goodchild High 9 Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Aromas of tea, tomato and Chinese spices accent lightweight cherry and currant notes. This is elegant and fresh, with good balance and more than enough oak character. Spicy flavors of nutmeg accent plum and red-berry flavors prior to a long dry finish. This is classy and complex; drink through 2018.
title: Garzón 2015 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Uruguay)

description: A tiny production wine from a vineyard long farmed by the winemaker's parents, this is herbal, tannic and oaky at first, with waves of rose petal nipping on the nose. Integrated flavors of cherry and strawberry provide a bright overlay in balance with the moderate acidity and weight.
title: Grey Stack 2015 Four Brothers Vineyard Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)

description: Reduced on the nose, youthfully, the reduction blows away to reveal a fruity landscape of blueberry and blackberry that's ripe yet light. Spritzy acidity freshens a hearty body and supportive oak.
title: Westwood 2015 Annadel Gap Vineyard Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: This is a powerhouse of a wine, from a tremendous coastal site, situated within a blanket of forest at 1,200-feet elevation. Reductive notes of diesel oak give way to juicy, stemmy and grippy characteristics, marked most pronounced by flavors of black cherry, raspberry and black tea.
title: Tamber Bey 2015 Walala Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This bottling explores the more concentrated side of Pinot Noir, with hearty aromas of balsamic fig sauce, cooked berries, clove and rum cake. Roasted blackberry clusters and charred figs show on the sip alongside potent baking spices, making for a rich and heavy expression, although leveling acidity pounds into the finish.
title: Tantara 2015 Tondre Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Light and fresh aromas of strawberry and raspberry meet with licorice and vanilla on the bright, fruit-punch-like nose of this bottling. There is snappy energy to the palate, with pomegranate and tannin-laced cranberry flavors as well as a light dusting of baking spice.
title: Rancho Sisquoc 2015 Flood Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Familiar aromas of plum, mulberry, clove and slate show on the nose of this appellation blend by the Paso Robles-based winery. There is decent tension on the sip, where cooked cranberry and strawberry meet with a backbone of allspice and nutmeg as well as bittersweet chocolate.
title: Sextant 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Forest and pine give this wine an edgy, earthy and ethereal core that's dotted in notions of baked strawberry. Sizable oak and tannin structure add weight and power from a concentrated year.
title: Belden Barns 2015 Serendipity Block Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Ample helpings of allspice, clove and orange peel add dimensions to the hearty cherry and hibiscus on the nose of this entry-level wine made by the Talley family. Rich red cherry, vanilla, cinnamon and clove show on the sip. While it's not very complex, it is quite tasty for a midweek sipper.
title: Bishop's Peak 2015 Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Give this value-priced Pinot Noir its due given that production is nearly 300,000 cases. Aromas of baked cherry, cocoa and baking spices lead to a fresh palate with wiry acidity. Earthy, slightly salty flavors of plum and currant finish steady.
title: Cono Sur 2015 Bicicleta Pinot Noir (Central Valley)

description: The producer sources from multiple sites across the appellation, including its own estate, in this value-driven red. Minty bay leaf provides an undeniable sense of earthiness, as medium weight and acidity pierce through. It's silky in spice.
title: Schug 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Sour cherry, cranberry, iron, dust and a touch of game appear on the nose of this always-reliable appellation blend from the late actor's family winery, which is still run by his descendants. The flavors are mellow in presentation, with cranberry, fennel and a touch of Early Grey tea.
title: Fess Parker 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling from a vineyard often known for subtlety packs in a ton of power and darkness, starting with hefty blackberry, tree bark and sarsaparilla on the nose. Tart black-plum-skin flavors kick off the big palate, which grabs attention but is a little clumsy at this stage of life. Patience may bring cohesion.
title: Tantara 2015 Talley Rincon Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Woody lightly spicy aromas of red fruits are tame and suggestive of fresh mushroom. This is linear and wiry in structure, not deep. Snappy tomato, herb and spiced-plum flavors finish lively, with a salty afertaste.
title: Pisano 2015 Río de los Pájaros Reserve Pinot Noir (Progreso)

description: Dusty, earthy plum and berry aromas are a touch leafy and suggestive of sea shells. A fresh palate features enough body to handle racy acidity, while this tastes of plum, brown sugar and spicy oak. A steady finish turns over no new stones.
title: Undurraga 2015 U Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: This soft simple wine offers rounded red fruit and a subtle nose of earth. Thin and somewhat nondescript, it's pungent in oak.
title: Director's Cut 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A ruby color and gamy, roasted aromas of plum and raspberry are the opposite of light and elegant. The palate follows suit, meaning it's full but also acidic. Chunky, slightly burnt berry and currant flavors hollow out on a lightly spiced finish.
title: Apaltagua 2015 Reserva Pinot Noir (San Antonio)

description: This wine has a strong herbal component of bay laurel and eucalyptus, girded in fully realized tannin and a juicy underbelly of cherry cola.
title: David Bruce 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Nutty, woody and tannic, this is a broadly etched wine. It is ripe and extracted, with simple layers of black cherry, cinnamon and cola.
title: Karah Estate 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A rusty minerality shows on the nose of this bottling alongside dried cranberry, hibiscus and an earthy streak of crushed slate. It's lightly bodied on the sip, with somewhat sweet cranberry and pomegranate-fruit flavors, lifted by clove dust.
title: La Crema 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Sourced from a pair of Yamhill-Carlton vineyards, this steely effort opens with herbal beet-root aromatics. It's tight and a bit attenuated, with streaks of anise, tart berry and a touch of rhubarb. It slowly fleshes out with ample aeration.
title: The Forager 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The ripe black-cherry fruit brings immediate appeal, in an unapologetically fruity, forward style. The acids are in perfect harmony, and the overall balance is just right, with a juicy, tangy snap to the finish.
title: Amity 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine has thick, ripe fruit and texture, making it robust and intense. Forest floor, black tea and tobacco notes give it memorable savoriness.
title: Artesa 2015 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)

description: Dried mint, dessicated red currant, rose bud and wet slate aromas show on the fairly shy nose of this appellation blend. Game, red berry and sharper allspice notes arise on the palate. Persistent acidity makes it a good match for a variety of foods.
title: Decroux 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A little shy at first, and smelling slightly synthetic, this wine needs a little time in glass. Eventually it opens to reveal notes of cherry cola and coffee spice. With chewy, dusty tannins and fairly pronounced oak, this wine is on the bigger side for a Pinot.
title: Murdoch James 2015 High Block Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: This pale-copper bubbly is half whole cluster, half saignée, and finished off dry. Lightly sweet and toasty, it marries strawberry and chocolate flavors to mouth-tickling effervescence. It's simple, tasty, fresh and ready to go.
title: Lachini 2015 Sparkling Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There's a tiny bit of effervescence in this twist-top bottling, which shows light cola, red cherry and pencil shaving notes on the nose. The entry to the palate is soft, bringing tart cranberry and thyme flavors, with a light vanilla note on the finish.
title: Talbott 2015 Kali Hart Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: A plush, fairly flashy style, this wine starts with ripe, bright red fruit, licorice, raspberry leaf and some savory undertones. The palate bumps the style up a notch, with powerful tannins and plenty of acidity. Perhaps the more intriguing element to this Pinot is the finish: Tart cranberry and floral tones are long and lingering.
title: Manu 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This is still pretty stiff and tight through the midpalate, with fruit ranging from cranberry to raspberry and sour cherry. Tannins leave a slightly green impression; the wine doesn't seem ripe and full flavored. Some extra bottle age might improve it. Drink 2020 to 2024.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2015 Cali's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This stiffens up with streaks of stem and herb, underscoring compact blueberry and blue-plum fruits. It's an eight vineyard mix, aged in 20% new French oak.
title: Lange 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Cinnamon is prominent on the nose of this wine, while bright berry, cherry, black olive and floral notes linger in the background. The acidity is a little slow to arrive on the palate but when it does it mingles seamlessly with fine grained tannins. The midpalate is a little flat but the fruit creeps back in at the end.
title: Innocent Bystander 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Although it starts on the oaky side, the ripe red fruit, olive and baking spice notes soon come into play. The palate integrates silky tannins with plush fruit, making this a straightforward example of Marlborough Pinot Noir.
title: Catalina Sounds 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A softly unfussy wine with moderate acidity, this is rounded and light-bodied, with rose petal and red cherry aromas. The oak is subtle and supportive.
title: Balletto 2015 Cider Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Rose aromas emerge on the nose of this block-designated, light-bodied wine. It's full of crisp red fruit and bright acidity.
title: Balletto 2015 Emerson Block Burnside Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Rose and turned earth notes mark the entry of this concentrated, tannic wine. Robust strawberry and black cherry flavors fill it out, wrapped in toasted oak.
title: Concannon 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A straightforward example of Central Otago Pinot Noir, this shows notes of dark cherry, brambly fruit and mocha, accompany powerful yet fine grained tannins and balanced acidity. Oak spice and a slightly savory quality meet on the finish. Drink now.
title: Sineann 2015 Pisa Terrace Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This Pinot takes a few minutes to open up, yet when it does it smells like dusting polish and Dr. Pepper. The palate is more subtle with a good lick of acidity and chewy tannins finishing on dark cherry fruit. It's not the most typical example of this region or grape variety, but it has its charms nonetheless.
title: Kim Crawford 2015 Small Parcels Rise & Shine Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: A bitter herbal edge frames this young wine that remains tight and unexpressive, even after many hours. Aged in 28% new French oak for 16 months, it may be showing significant bottle shock at this time. The finish is short, hard and slightly bitter.
title: St. Innocent 2015 Justice Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Unmistakably a Kiwi Pinot Noir, with notes of Dr. Pepper, ripe bramble fruit, oaky spices and tree bark, it loses it's way a little on the palate, lacking the juicy fruit to stand up to all the oak.
title: Nga Waka 2015 Three Paddles Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Chocolate and mint notes combine effortlessly in this straightforward appellation wine, accented with rose, cherry and rhubarb. It features moderate acidity, thick tannins and weight.
title: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This big-production Pinot pierces through with smoke, char and stiff, earthy tannins. It's a chewy, rough wine, more herbal than fruity. It's got enough punch and power to hook up with grilled burgers or flank steak.
title: Argyle 2015 Grower Series Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Concentrated candied cherry, sugar beet, rhubarb, cinnamon and clove aromas make for a sweet-smelling nose in this bottling. The palate proves much drier, showing complex vanilla, cranberry, eucalyptus and juniper flavors.
title: Austerity 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This includes 13% Gamay in the blend and spent 13 months in 15% new French oak. It's a modest wine, with cranberry and tart raspberry fruit. It has good focus, a dash of pepper and more substance to the finish than you might expect. Two-hundred cases were exported to the U.S.
title: Cave Spring 2015 Pinot Noir (Niagara Escarpment)

description: This wine is forward and high-toned, with bright strawberry/raspberry fruit. It's front-loaded for flavor, drinking nicely, though on balance a bit simple, with a quick fade.
title: Maison L'Envoyé 2015 Two Messengers Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Plump red cherry notes meet clove, allspice and dried ginger on the nose of this bottling. Though light in body, there's decent grip on the palate, where candied cherry and cranberry flavors are spiced with anise.
title: Noble Vines 2015 667 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: This cuvée is a barrel selection, fermented with whole berries and aged in 35% new oak. Simple strawberry and raspberry fruit seems almost weightless, and the quick finish carries a strong streak of bouillon.
title: Maison L'Envoyé 2015 The Attaché Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Now separated from the Firesteed brand, which recently sold, Citation offers both recent and bottle-aged Pinots. This young release has sharp edges, brambly berries, a whiff of smoke and a thick flavor of root beer. The fruit thins out quickly, finishing with a chalky texture and some alcoholic heat.
title: Citation 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: An aromatic mix of floral notes and marionberry show on the nose. The palate follows suit, yet turns astringent with herbal tannins and an earthy, chalky finish.
title: Day 2015 Cancilla Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This young wine has tart, rather thin fruit flavors of pomegranate and wild berry. There's ample acidity—maybe too ample for some tasters. Flavors seems to fall off and fade quickly.
title: King Estate 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine starts off well with an aromatic mix of red fruit, citrus and toasted grain. The palate shows thick tannins and a stemmy finish which cut the flavors short.
title: Day 2015 Johan Vineyards Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Explosive floral and fruit aromas leap from the glass in this brilliant bottling, which is bursting with plump red cherry, bundles of rose petals and just a touch of green peppercorn to keep it herbally intriguing. Lively and fresh on the palate, that deep pomegranate and Montmorency cherry picks up an herbally laced line of thyme, oregano, white sage, green cardamom and white pepper.
title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Acin Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine is tight, closed and firm, which shows its youth because it also has great richness and a dense fruitiness that will develop well in the future. The wine is concentrated, as is proper for Gevrey-Chambertin, and densely packed. It will be ready to drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Heresztyn-Mazzini 2015 Les Goulots Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This spicy, toasty wine is showing its wood aging as well as plenty of fruit. It is rich and generous, with the natural opulence of Volnay. The red-berry fruits are full of juiciness, backed up by fine tannins. Drink this potentially delicious wine from 2022.
title: Domaine Julie Belland 2015 Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: From the site high atop the Petaluma Gap part of the coast, above Gap's Crown, this is inviting in every way. Black raspberry is seasoned in cardamom and forest pine as a tannic backbone provides structure and strength. A hit of citrus highlights the fresh persistent acidity.
title: Flanagan 2015 Sun Chase Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This appellation wine exudes beauty and grace, offering strongly etched characteristics of bacon meat, black cherry, blueberry and spicy cardamom. Succulent and silky, it has a thickness on entry that settles to reveal bright, integrated acidity.
title: La Follette 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: With so many grand cru vineyards in this small village, even the premier crus make excellent wines. This is a case in point, a powerful wine packed with tannins, dense black fruit and a solid structure. The future looks good, with opulent fruit about to come through the framework. Drink this wine from 2023.
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Entirely destemmed, this is a cool coastal wine, gracefully restrained and excitingly bright. Tart rhubarb and strawberry join exotic citrus tones and notes of rose petal as spicy acidity lurks within a construct of robust integrated tannin.
title: Lutum 2015 Durell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A perennial knockout, this wine is juicy and fresh yet somewhat brooding in structured flavors of red cherry, strawberry and plum. With intriguing layers of earth and forest floor framed by tight-grained tannins, it's a sophisticated and complex experience. A deep boysenberry note adds richness on the finish.
title: Lynmar 2015 Five Sisters Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Earthy forest and twig support a medium build of integrated acidity and balanced fruit in this blend named for the proprietor. Aged in 55% new oak, blackberry and black licorice dominate the profile against a fine-grained texture of toasty wood and depth.
title: Lynmar 2015 Lynn's Blend Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This spicy wine is rich and full bodied, with a solid, firm structure. From one of the most attractively named of vineyards, the wine has juicy red fruits that contrast with the tannins, giving a ripe balance. This wine needs to age to give space to its great fruit, dry core and acidity that are still coming together. Drink from 2025.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2015 Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This comes from a small vineyard that lies between Echézeaux Grand Cru and Clos de Vougeot Grand Cru. It has the structure of both, perhaps without quite the intensity. However, its richness and density is very obvious, giving a wine that is solid, dark, ripe and full of black-cherry fruits and tannins. Drink this wine from 2024.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2015 Les Quartiers de Nuits  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Tart in cassis, cranberry and pomegranate on the entry, this wine develops a depth of richer rewarding flavor as it goes, leaning more into dark cherry and blueberry. Juicy, layered and delicious, it's well integrated and voluptuously silky on the palate, offering impressive length and breadth.
title: Bruliam 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This intensely perfumed wine has great ripe fruits and delicious acidity. It is richly endowed both with tannins and spicy wood flavors that give extra body and density. This will be a very fine wine as it ages, but wait until 2024.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2015 Lavaut Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Rich, full and packed with juicy black fruits, this is already a delicious wine. However, its tannins, dark structure and concentration promise much for the future. Generous and with plenty of ripeness, the wine is going to age well. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Henri Magnien 2015 Champeaux Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This rich wine is firm with tannins. It has structure and concentration as well as layers of black plum and cherry fruits. Put these elements together and it will age impressively. Drink this wine with its juicy aftertaste from 2023.
title: Domaine Henri Magnien 2015 Les Cazetiers Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Wholly controlled by the producer, this walled vineyard on the edge of Volnay village has made a beautifully concentrated, balanced wine. Still young, it already has ripe red fruits with shapely tannins and acidity to match. The smoky aftertaste adds to the complexity. Drink from 2022.
designation: Clos de la Barre Premier Cru
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Clos de la Barre Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: Full bodied, fresh and fragrant, this is a successful celebration of the appellation, bringing together the best of several sites. Dark brooding fruit and forested earth complement one another beautifully as a fleshy rounded texture takes hold.
title: Lynmar 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is rich, with great tannins as well as generous red-berry fruits. With its structure firmly in place, it has the potential to be opulent, ripe and generous. Wood aging adds extra weight to the richness. Drink from 2025.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015 Les Chaffots Premier Cru  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: This full and ripe wine with black cherry and plum flavors is firm and rich. Its tannins promise much for the future, while the fruit is already generous and attractive. The wine has a sumptuous character, ripe and with great fruit. Drink from 2025.
title: Pierre Naigeon 2015 Lavaut Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Not quite as ripe as the 2014 but just as delicious, this biodynamically-farmed estate wine is Rex Hill's top reserve. Its old vine complexity shows in its substantial, full-bodied berry, plum and cherry flavors, a beet root note running down the center. At this time, the barrel aging flavors are a bit hidden, but experience suggests it will continue to improve over the next decade or longer.
title: Rex Hill 2015 Jacob-Hart Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Just as Winderlea gets these grapes from Adelsheim, Adelsheim gets some Winderlea grapes. Both wineries do quite well with each others' fruit; this 1989 planting is dedicated to Pommard clone, and it has made the ripest of Winderlea's 2015 Pinots. Rich and loaded with black cherry fruit, it's sexy and streaked with cola and clean earth, a sneaky minerality driving the finish.
title: Winderlea 2015 Bryan Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Bold ripe fruit flavors find impressive support from firm tannins and refreshing acidity in this natural-tasting and well-structured wine. The black cherry, raspberry and cranberry flavors are vivid and mouthfilling, while a lip-smacking texture keeps them alive on the palate and through a lingering finish.
title: Davies 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Lush red cherry and rosewater aromas meet with muddled sage, pepper dust and wild herbs on the nose of this excellent bottling, where rich fruit and herbal intrigue collide. Thyme, dried sage and even broadleaf parsley flavors show on the sip, set against a background of piquant cranberry and tart red currant, with bountiful energy that carries through the entire palate.
title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 3-D Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine is rounded, rich with jammy black-cherry fruits that are backed up by the still-young structure. Made from vines planted in 1958, it is perfumed with spice and smokiness from the wood aging. The density promises a wine for aging. Drink from 2025.
title: Domaine Heresztyn-Mazzini 2015 Les Milandes Premier Cru  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: This is a well-integrated and composed reserve-tier wine that lives up to its billing. A rich nose of blueberry and baked strawberry-rhubarb give it an edgy, savory quality that's also succulent and velvety on the palate, with long-lasting cardamom spice.
title: Kokomo 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Peter's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine has a strong element of rusticity that's entirely welcoming in its mix of truffled earth and fresh compost. The flavors are lean and sinewy: a tart lingering measure of cranberry and pomegranate perfectly spiked in black tea and cardamom.
title: La Follette 2015 Hawk's Roost Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This impressive wine has power combined with complexity, as expansive aromas of black cherry, cedar and rose petal lead to a full body, firm tannins and concentrated black-fruit flavors that linger on the finish. Aged in only 25% new oak, it will drink best after 2020.
title: MacPhail 2015 Toulouse Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This ripe and bold wine is full of fruit, tannins and potential. Its juiciness is still crisp with youthful acidity that needs to open out and encompass the red-cherry fruits. This will take time with the dry core still firm and solid. Drink from 2024.
designation: Closerie des Alisiers Estournelles Saint-Jacques Premier Cru
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2015 Closerie des Alisiers Estournelles Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Juicy bright acidity comes through the tannins in this bold, rich wine. A fine line in dry tannins comes from the core, making for a wine with great potential and richness. The aftertaste has crisp red currant and berry fruitiness. Drink from 2024.
title: Nicolas Potel 2015 Aux Combottes Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: At this stage, this wine is all about tannins and structure. The weight and black fruits will come later. It has potential richness and a generous, rounded texture along with plenty of juicy acidity. The wine will take time, so consider drinking from 2026.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2015 Les Petits Vougeot Premier Cru  (Vougeot)

description: This wine offers astounding quality for the price, a juicy expression of fruit and spice with a depth of firm resolved tannin, lively acidity and layers of black cherry and cola. Approachable and delicious, it hits the mark on every level being light bodied and refreshingly balanced while complex.
title: Sea Slopes 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Sourced from the estate's original 1999 plantings, this is a chewy, majestic, earthy and deeply dark wine. Its black fruit is ribbed wtih iron, licorice, coffee and graphite notes and framed by earthy tannins that lend texture. It drinks bigger than its listed alcohol would suggest.
title: Bergström 2015 Bergström Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This single vineyard wine is a blend of six separate blocks, each planted to a different clone. It deftly combines savory herb flavors with ripe Bing cherry fruit. The tannins are polished, textured and balanced, leading into a long finish that leaves a final impression of composted earth.
title: Bergström 2015 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Juicy and stemmy, this is a big, bold wine, explosive in highlights of huckleberry, dark cherry and forest floor. With firm tannins for days, it offers enviable length and spice along a smooth grippy texture and forceful complexity.
title: Saintsbury 2015 Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Smoky, with bursts of sage and celery root, this is a wine that is unabashedly earthy, spicy, bold and juicy at its core. Light-bodied and delicate, the palate shows beautiful floral undertones. This is a complex and beguiling bottling that should hold well for years to come.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Terra De Promissio Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Old-vine Pinot Noir has produced a rich structured wood-aged wine. With its opulent texture and ripe full-bodied cherries and red plums, the wine is poised and generous. Drink this impressive wine from 2018.
title: Domaine Bernard Fleuriet et Fils 2015 Anthocyane  (Sancerre)

description: Spicy, seductive and stemmy, this wine from the coveted vineyard site is a celebration of baked rhubarb and cranberry. Velvety on the palate and boldly ripe and rich, it offers highlights of spicy black tea and cardamom that complements and complicates the fruit.
title: Saintsbury 2015 Pratt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: An abundance of richness and depth sets this high-elevation wine apart from the crowd. It has a good deep color, harmonious oak and spiced fruit aromas, and just-ripe flavors like red and black cherries that are concentrated and layered. It finds a near-perfect balance between richness and structure, and is frankly delicious to drink.
title: Spell 2015 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

description: Roses and strawberries rise first on the nose of this well-made wine—a celebration of the appellation in its full embrace of medium-bodied texture and weight. It offers elements of dried sage, black tea and cardamom around bursts of  cranberry, cherry and orange.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The second release from this impressive new project is a touch lighter than the previous vintage, but just as well built. Blending grapes from four different sub-AVAs, this shows a sleek and detailed mix of fruit—strawberry, plum and cherry—married to just the right amount of new French oak (one third of the barrels).
title: Nicolas-Jay 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This complex and powerful wine is loaded with gravitas—big and tannic, yet also offering elegance and detail. The mix of fruit, spice, barrel and tannin components is beautifully orchestrated, recalling boysenberry, black cherry, toasted nuts, pepper and chocolate. With its almost-neverending finish, it should continue to improve through 2028.
title: Big Table Farm 2015 Earth Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Showing just a touch of reduction, this wine is bright, crunchy and explosive on the palate. The palate shows a mix of raspberry, cherry and cranberry that's full of flavor. Seductively smooth, it should continue to evolve and expand with time, as the wine is just beginning to unravel its complex notes of baking spice, vanilla and tea.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Westside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Like the winery's other Pinot Noir, this seems way underpriced for the quality. Its subtle layers of cherry and plum are enhanced with baking spice, toasted coconut and caramel highlights. It can easily stand beside wines costing twice as much. Drink now through 2028.
title: Proteus 2015 Manisa Jo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Winemaker James MacPhail continues to refine his solo project with this Annapolis-sourced effort, a smooth layered expression of baked strawberry and rose petal herbaceousness. Lingering fruitiness makes it lovely to enjoy, as the oak remains a background player in full support of the succulence and ripe power. Still young, it should continue to open further over time.
title: Tongue Dancer 2015 Pinot de Ville Putnam Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Lush and concentrated in texture, this vineyard-designate is bright and tart with a bite of crunchy tannin and a bouquet of rose and lavender lurking on the nose. Light bodied and ultimately balanced, it brightens on the palate with a whirl of blood orange that complements the cranberry, pomegranate and cherry cola.
title: Saintsbury 2015 Sundawg Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Abundantly oaky, this is a friendly, mouth-filling and broadly textured wine that comes off as soft and soothing. Sweet-seeming spicy oak and tobacco aromas lead to generous flavors of ripe cherry and raspberry rounded out by nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla. Concentration and layering raise it way above average.
title: Fulcrum 2015 Fulcrum Anderson Valley Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This well-crafted reserve boasts a solid core of blueberry and black cherry fruit, thickly accented with dark chocolate notes. Produced from heritage (Calera, Swan and Mt. Eden) clones, it's textural and dense, with dark char, espresso and black licorice flavors.
title: Le Cadeau 2015 Merci Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This was half whole cluster-fermented and neatly incorporates hints of earth and bark into its tart cranberry and pie cherry core. Its verticality and tannic power suggest it will age quite nicely through the late 2020s.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Freedom Hill Vineyard Dijon 115 Clone Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There are multiple Freedom Hill selections in this winery's 2015 lineup, but the Pommard clone bottling expresses more of the site's brambly wildness along with its lusciously fruity raspberry flavors. Texture and length elevates it above much of the competition.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: From a vineyard perched 1,700 feet above the Monterey Bay, this wine by brewer-turned-vintner John Benedetti is both very light yet incredibly flavorful. Rusty raspberry and strawberry aromas meet with dill, thyme and white pepper on the nose, while the palate offers soft red cherry and gently sprinkled herbs throughout.
title: Sante Arcangeli 2015 Split Rail Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Broad aromas of black cherry and black-tea spice make for a dark and full nose, which is enhanced by strong soil components of turned loam and gravel. Dark boysenberry and tart plum skins show on the palate along with more tea spice, making for a very full sipping experience.
title: Bernardus 2015 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Still quite young and showing some grapey fruit flavors, this second vintage release is bursting with purple fruit and chocolate malt flavors. Streaks of cola and a mineral-drenched finish add depth and texture.
title: Drouhin Oregon Roserock 2015 Zéphirine Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: From the biodynamically farmed Momtazi vineyard, this adds layers of herb, pine, compost and forest floor components. Fruit is in the mix but is less prominent, giving way to those complex, earth-driven flavors, with a touch of citrus. It seems to give you more the more you give it your full attention.
title: Fullerton 2015 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This light- to medium-bodied wine delivers well-integrated strawberry preserve flavors, along with hazelnut, malt and milk chocolate highlights. It's smooth and well proportioned, and should drink well through 2023.
title: Penner-Ash 2015 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Expanding on their fathers' legacies, the cousins Jean-Laurent and Jean-Dominique Vacheron have a deserving reputation for their almost-Burgundian Sancerre. This latest vintage, packed with both fruit and structure, shows why. It is ripe with red cherries and dark plums laced with acidity. The wine is full of great ripe fruit and generous tannins. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Vacheron 2015  Sancerre

description: This vineyard designate made from 777 clone Pinot Noir was fermented in single-use barrels and aged in neutral wood. It's graceful, seductive and loaded with baking spice, cinnamon toast and mocha highlights. It's drinking beautifully at the moment, so no need to wait.
title: Fullerton 2015 Lichtenwalter Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: From vines planted in 1984 and 1990, this offers subtle, strawberry, raspberry and cherry flavors, accented with refreshing minerality. Its acidity a faint lime flavor, and as is true of all this winery's offerings, the overall balance is impeccable.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Estate Vineyard Old Vine Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Still young, stiff and unyielding, this mixes stem and bitter herb flavors with brambly blackberry fruit. Streaks of espresso and dark chocolate emerge on the finish. It's well-balanced, detailed and layered, with a dominant savory side.
title: Bergström 2015 Le Pré du Col Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Maison Louis Jadot's Willamette Valley project continues to bear fruit and has increased the production of this entry-level cuvée. A lovely, chunky mix of purple and black fruit, it's beautifully proportioned, with plenty of power, lacking only the depth of the older estate vines. It finishes on a lacy note of minerality.
title: Résonance 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This fascinating medium-bodied wine has a wild streak that first brings rhubarb and forest-floor aromas, then deep dark flavor nuances like mushroom, black cherry and more tangy rhubarb. It has good acidity and fine-grained tannins to support all that complexity. It offers all the complexity one looks for in a Pinot.
title: On Point 2015 On Point Christinna's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This cuvée gets off to a good start with rich scents and flavors of strawberry jam, along with ripe plum and cherry highlights. There's a fairly strong herbal component, with a stemmy note that comes out more strongly in the finish as it fades away.
title: J. Christopher 2015 Charlie's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Sporting a smooth, almost satiny mouthfeel, this high-octane Pinot brings a mouthful of brambly berries, with highlights of lightly peppery herbs. The tannins turn astringent, with a green-tea character. Best consumed over the next four or five years.
title: Catman 2015 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This wine is fruit-forward and layered in powerful swathes of grape and cherry flavor, with aspects of earth, forest pine and cardamom seasoning throughout. The structure is moderate and the texture fleshy, with oak pronounced.
title: Napa Cellars 2015 V Collection Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This is intentionally made in a lighter style for near-term consumption, and it's showing salmonberry and raspberry fruit, with a sliver of toasted cracker. Tannins are nicely structured and it finishes with a touch of dark chocolate. Drink now through 2020.
title: Hamacher 2015 H Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Full bodied and flavorful, this still shows its tannic backbone a bit aggressively, but that should soften with another year or two in bottle. The core of fruit suggests berry preserves, complemented with a lick of chocolate.
title: Phelps Creek 2015 Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: A young vineyard has been planted with this old-school clone, which has a broad open mouthfeel, though it's not as concentrated as the Dijon clones. Strawberry and cherry fruit dominates, touched with orange peel and finishing with a lick of almond paste.
title: Anam Cara 2015 Nicholas Vineyard Wädenswil Clone Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This remains stiffly compact, showing blue and purple fruits with a seam of chocolate mint. It was barrel aged entirely in neutral oak, and the tannins are smooth and polished. A bit of aeration would help to open it up.
title: Sokol Blosser 2015 Estate Whole Cluster Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Though it's a bit astringent, the medium-bodied fruit is clean and juicy, with raspberry and cherry flavors. It seems to spread out across the palate, then winds down gracefully as it flattens into a drying astringent finish.
title: Hawkins Cellars 2015 Enigma Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This tasty little Pinot introduces a well-made lineup from this producer. The pretty cherry fruit might seem delicate, but it's nonetheless persuasive. There's no thinness here; it's spot-on varietal and balanced throughout.
title: Holloran 2015 Stafford Hill Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This three-acre site, planted to Dijon 114 Pinot, comes up with strong aromatics loaded with baking spices. Those sweet flavors continue around standard medium-ripe berry fruit. The acids finish a bit chalky, and the effect is to dry out the flavors a bit too quickly.
title: J. Christopher 2015 En Gedi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: There's a strong flavor of grilled fruits, especially peaches, and the red fruits are tangy and concentrated, like raspberry compote. A charred smoky streak runs through the tannins. All in all, though a bit heavy handed, this brings lots of potent flavors. Drink now through 2020.
designation: Lone Madrone Vineyard Three Wives Giulio
title: Remy 2015 Lone Madrone Vineyard Three Wives Giulio Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Elton is a new label under the Willamette Valley Vineyards umbrella, though the vineyard has been a favored designate for the past decade. This latest release offers pretty scents of red fruits. Along with those flavors come some bitter stem components, and a whiff of compost. The tannins at this age remain stiff and hard.
title: Elton 2015 Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: The scents are simple and grapey, like grape candy, and the fruit flavors leave a little bit of a hole in the middle. But it fills in quickly with tart strawberry, ample acids, good balance and some stiff, drying tannins.
title: Erath 2015 Leland Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There's a decent serving of thyme and sagebrush on the nose of this affordable bottling alongside the piquant raspberry and cranberry fruit, with a touch of wet earth in the background. The decently weighted palate shows cranberry and more dried herbs, gaining complexity toward the finish.
title: Rock View 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: The price and special designation suggest that this is considered a reserve-level cuvée. It seems quite dry, even astringent, with tea-flavored tannins around thin berry fruit. There are hints of mint, wintergreen and chocolate, but the wine doesn't show much depth. Perhaps more bottle age is needed. Two bottles were tasted with comparable notes.
title: Sokol Blosser 2015 Twelve Row Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Warmly fruity, this is among the most immediately satisfying of the winery's 2015 Pinots. The berry and cherry flavors carry a light streak of cola, and the tight acids bring a hint of orange juice. Drink now through the early 2020s.
title: Erath 2015 Prince Hill Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Johan grows biodynamically farmed grapes, and generally employs such techniques as native yeast and minimal intervention. The wines, as is the case here, tend to be quite low in alcohol. This offers precise flavors of wild berry, accented with allspice and a toasty note from aging in 30% new French oak.
title: Johan 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The nose is ripe in aromas of red cherry and berry tones, while the palate is less expressive but presents a juicy, easy freshness on a light body. This will also work chilled. Drink soon.
title: Emile Beyer 2015 Eguisheim Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Exotically floral, this wine is extreme in spicy acidity and robust earthiness, a mix of rose petal, citrus and black tea that struggles somewhat to find balance and fruit.
title: Flowers 2015 Seaview Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Light rose buds, dried potpourri and tart cranberry aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate is a touch thin but with decent grip, and delivers easily likable flavors of cranberry and cinnamon.
title: Mignanelli 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: This young wine is quite tight and tannic, with hard fruit flavors of red currant. Stemmy scents and flavors are out in full force, and this might well want another year or two in bottle before it's all pulled together. There's a finishing lick of ultra dark chocolate threaded through those chewy tannins.
title: The Four Graces 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: An austere wine, this does not shy away from flavors of stem, beet root and rhubarb. The fruit touches on strawberry, but does not display the ripe flavors you might anticipate from the listed alcohol. It's high acid, herbal and earthy.
title: Winter's Hill 2015 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A number of wineries draw upon grapes from this excellent site. Here, the flavors are of cranberries and raspberries, and remain tart and rather acidic. The tannins are stiff and leave a slightly bitter aftertaste.
title: Erath 2015 Bishop Creek Pinot Noir

description: Solid, at first seeming to be a bit on the chunky side, this thins out in the mouth, offering tart berry fruit. Along with that come some stemmy components and tannins that are just hitting not-quite-ripe flavors. It's a sound, but not distinguished, estate selection.
title: Erath 2015 Estate Selection Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The winery makes a number of block and clone cuvées, along with regular and reserve Pinots. It would perhaps differentiate them as well as showcase them more distinctively to focus on blending fewer, more complete wines. This reserve has the same high acid, herbal, earth and stem character as the regular bottling.
title: Winter's Hill 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Spicy aromas of licorice and cedar mingle with vanilla and cassis on the nose. The tannins are somewhat gritty on the palate, with spicy black pepper, cedar and pomegranate flavors. The acidity helps pull this wine together but tannic, oaky flavors overpower with only a suggestion of black fruit on the lingering finish.
title: Sutcliffe 2015 Pinot Noir (Colorado)

description: This wine has a persistent bitter note that's part earthy, part savory and a touch extreme. Rhubarb, rose, black tea and cardamom all figure in, but don't get along all together well.
title: Flowers 2015 Camp Meeting Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is part of the winery's Winemaker Series, a limited production wine that was barrel-aged for 17 months in two-thirds new French oak. It remains stiff and quite astringent, with vanilla being the principal flavor. In fact, there is so much vanilla that it more or less covers most of the fruit.
title: Sweet Cheeks 2015 Barrel Select Kody's Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: It's not apparent what's going on with this wine, which tastes disjointed and aggressively stemmy. Its fruit is thin and generic, plain red berries, with a whiff of compost. But the impact of stems (whole clusters?) is what dominates. Two bottles tasted with equal results.
title: The Four Graces 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Scents of wet hay and overripe raisined fruit don't mislead: those are also the flavors. Some tarragon and citrus is in view, but overall it's disjointed and seems already well on the way to being over the hill.
title: Cória 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine starts broody and dusty, with dark cherry, mocha, and woody notes. The palate feels a little hot and at the moment the tannins are huge, tightly wound, and overpowering. The pretty cherry notes are eventually revealed again with time in the glass.
title: Murdoch James 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: High toned red fruit, cola, and baking spice notes are revealed after some vigorous swirling in this initially shy wine. Tightly wound tannins on the palate are balanced by a good lick of acidity and fairly prominent oak.
title: Nga Waka 2015 Three Canoes Lease Block Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: Bay leaf and eucalyptus figure prominently on the nose and palate of this wine, making for an intensely earthy, herbal experience, peppered by forest-floor notes.
title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This expands the winery's portfolio with a nod to the $20 pricepoint that's become a defining limit to affordable Oregon Pinot. This wine is hard, slightly burnt and bitter in the finish, with simple candy cherry-fruit flavors.
title: Maison L'Envoyé 2015 Straight Shooter Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This block-designate wine shows flamboyant aromas of red cherry, cola, purple flowers and light caramel. The palate offers an amazingly cohesive and zesty experience, combining piquant cranberry and tart raspberry with slate-driven minerality and a persistent woody spice. The texture is soft, but lifted by strong acidity.
title: Foxen 2015 Block 8 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: The impressively plump and prominent strawberry and red-currant aromas are alluring on the nose, enhanced by touches of cinnamon and pepper dust. The palate combines savory pepper spice, red plums and berries, with a solidly simmering acidity shimmering through the entire sip.
title: Foxen 2015 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is a stellar representation of the region, combining ripeness with dark earth and wild herb notes. Aromas of black cherry, crushed slate, turned loam, dried hibiscus and violets make for a lavish nose. The rounded palate weaves black raspberry together with gravel, thyme and sagebrush. Iron fist, silk glove, utterly delicious.
title: Siduri 2015 Clos Pepe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: From one of the most coveted vineyards in the Central Coast, this is a well-balanced whopper of a wine, starting on aromas of fresh raspberry, black plum, forest floor, violets and dark chocolate. The palate is rich upfront, showing strawberry and other dark berries, and then gains complexity in notes of sandalwood and myrrh. Thanks to deep acidity and tannic framing, the wine is simultaneously bold and balanced.
title: Siduri 2015 Pisoni VIneyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: From the largest Grand Cru in Vosne-Romanée, this wine has plenty of the structure as well as the fruit that shines in this vintage. It is rich and smoky with black fruits and red-berry flavors. The wine is still young, drink from 2026.
title: Louis Latour 2015  Echézeaux

description: This is the Arnoux family's top wine coming from vines on the revered hill of Corton. It is a powerful wine, properly rich and structured from the vintage. Wood and spice come through although they will soon integrate with the dense black-plum fruits and mineral texture. Drink the wine from 2025.
title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2015 Le Rognet  (Corton)

description: Lush fruits of boysenberry, plump raspberry and strawberry mesh with vanilla, nutmeg and allspice on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard off Drum Canyon Road. Black cherry and more vanilla make for a rich palate, but it's cut by an edge of acidity, darker elderberry, savory shiitake and a bay-leaf character that rises on the finish.
title: Siduri 2015 Dierberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Ripe red-cherry and strawberry aromas are lifted by grated clove and mace spice on the inviting nose of this bottling by longtime Winemaker Eric Hickey. A lively boysenberry-pomegranate combination explodes on the palate, where snapped sage sticks, wild thyme and dried rose petals make for an ethereally light yet stunningly flavorful wine.
title: Laetitia 2015 Single Vineyard La Colline Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Big, rich while also smooth, this is going to be a impressive wine. It has power and firm tannins as well as plenty of ripe black fruits and acidity. This wine, from one of the range of grand crus in Vosne-Romanée, will age well. Drink from 2026.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015  Grands-Echezeaux

description: This is Burgundian opulence, with generous, rounded black-fruit and -berry flavors. Supporting this richness are the tannins that will allow the wine to age. From Louis Latour Domaine vineyards, it has a solid, dense structure that needs plenty of time. Drink from 2027.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Cuvée Héritiers Latour  (Chambertin)

description: Extremely alluring aromas of black plum and blackberry meet with touches of caramel, vanilla and fresh rose on the nose of this bottling. Raspberry and cranberry pop on the sip, but it's the garrigue character of black sage and thyme, plus a bit of white pepper, that rounds out the seamlessly integrated palate.
title: Foxen 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Plump aromas of black cherry, mulberry, vanilla and star anise rise on the rich but not overbearing nose of this wine. There is dark-fruit ripeness on the front, but then comes a heavy array of spices, from allspice and clove to thyme and dried sage. The texture is soft, yet the tannins are noticeable and the acidity is buoyant.
title: Laetitia 2015 Single Vineyard La Coupelle Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: From one of the high-quality Premier Crus that have much of the reflected glory of the Vosne-Romanée grand crus, the beautiful wine is ripe and packed with great red fruits. Its wood aging is a rich support to this opulent wine with considerable potential. Drink from 2025.
designation: Domaine du Clos Frantin Les Malconsorts Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2015 Domaine du Clos Frantin Les Malconsorts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Ripe, warm and with delicious strawberry and red-plum fruits, the wine is generous and full of fruit. The tannins are also there, a structure just to support all this fruit. It will be an opulent and beautiful wine as it ages. Drink from 2025.
title: Albert Morot 2015 Les Cent Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This wine from the Corton Grand Cru vineyard is packed with tannins as well as smoky fruit. It is richly structured and firm, yet the fruit is equally powerful, showing bold black fruits struck against bright acidity. The wine will need considerable aging; drink from 2025.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Château Corton Grancey  (Corton)

description: This structured wine comes from one of the lesser-known Grand Crus of Vosne-Romanée. But it does have the structure and density of the wines from this run of grand crus, with bold tannins over the red-cherry fruits. It is likely to be a structured wine for many years. Drink from 2027.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Les Quatre Journaux  (Romanée-St.-Vivant)

description: Aged for a year in new wood barrels, this powerful, concentrated wine shows both richness and considerable aging potential. It is a powerhouse of ripe damson fruits and impressive tannins. Structured and intense, it needs to age for many years. Don't drink before 2026.
title: Domaine Bertagna 2015  Clos Saint-Denis

description: This is a rich wine with great potential. Its juicy spice and acidity are balanced with the red fruits, the generous texture and the fine structure. It is a wine that sums up the ripeness of the vintage. Drink from 2024.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2015 Champs Pimont Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: The nose on this bottling from the iconic vineyard co-owned by the Pisoni and Franscioni families is quite sultry, with lots of violet and purple-flower aromas as well as mulberry, black raspberry, forest floor and grilled meat. The earthy fruit flavors of mulberry are strong on the sip, playing well with the loamy soils, dusty minerality, stiffer tannins and persistent acidity. A deep and layered wine.
title: Siduri 2015 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This wine is firm yet ripe, with a bold yet tight character that foreshadows a rich wine in the future. The cherry and red plum flavors are lush and generous. It is going to be a delicious wine, full of concentration. Drink from 2023.
title: Louis Latour 2015 En Chevret Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: There are elegant aromas of potpourri, purple flowers, rose hips, fennel, wild mint, blackberries and plums on the nose of this top-end bottling from the Hahn family. Hearty black plum and elderberry mix with black sage and bay leaf on the palate, where a chalky texture and soft mouthfeel complete the experience.
title: Lucienne 2015 Smith Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This wine is the essence of the five premier crus that belong to the Devillard family (they also vinify them separately). It brings out the essential Mercurey: rich, generous and with great ripe red fruits. Tannins are there allowing this impressive wine to age. Drink from 2022.
designation: Château de Chamirey Les Cinq Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Château de Chamirey Les Cinq Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This is a generous wine, although one that will need some serious aging. It is rich in tannins and powered by a firm structure. The fruit offers the weight to counter the tannins. It just needs time. Drink from 2024.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2015 Les Fèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: The elegant and inviting nose of this single-vineyard expression shows plum, just-ripe cherry, pomegranate and red-rose petals on the alluring nose. Rose hips, mulberry and red plum show on the sip, which also carries an exotic spice profile with hints of both cardamom and coriander.
title: Rideau 2015 Garey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: A structured wine that is also full of ripe fruit. Its red-berry fruits are encased in the tannins that still need to soften. The wine will be generous, full of berry flavors and with a dense texture. Drink this big wine from 2024.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: There's a soft stroke of rosewater to the nose of this single-vineyard bottling as well as raspberry jam, fennel pollen and iron. The palate benefits from strong fennel and white sage, which lifts the berry-fruit and raw-meat flavors. The texture is simultaneously light and penetrating.
title: Foxen 2015 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine delivers exactly what old vines should: complexity and intrigue. Delicious sparks of tea and wild strawberry are framed by tightly woven tannins across the broad midpalate, resulting in a velvety texture. The long finish boasts excellent evolution, with underpinnings of cardamom at the end.
title: Lynmar 2015 Old Vines Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Powerful and structured, this opulent wine is succulent with fruit and dense with dark tannins. It has power and structure, a strongly mineral texture still bursting with youthful fruit. This grand cru is one of several that make up over half the vineyards in Aloxe-Corton. Drink this wine from 2025.
title: Louis Jadot 2015  Corton-Pougets

description: This grand cru in the village of Morey-Saint-Denis is grandiose, packed with tannins and fruit, powered by both acidity and swathes of rich black cherries. Both juicy and densely structured, it will be impressive as it ages. Drink from 2025.
title: Maison Roche de Bellene 2015  Clos de la Roche

description: Vineyards on the hill of Corton are the source for this concentrated wine. The 30-year-old vines give density while also providing great fruit and juiciness. It is an impressive wine, richly endowed with black fruits and layers of dark tannins. Drink from 2025.
title: Maison Roche de Bellene 2015  Corton

description: This rich, sumptuous wine is both structured and generous. Bold red fruits give it weight, concentration and a good balance between acidity and ripe richness. It comes from a vineyard close to some of the greatest Burgundy grand crus, which explains the wine's structure and potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Maison Roche de Bellene 2015 Les Beaux Monts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: This first effort by Westwood from an Anderson Valley vineyard favored by Copain and Littorai is a stunner. A deft touch of spicy oak lifts the aroma, and meets compelling, intricate notes of red and black cherry, rhubarb and mushroom on the palate. This elegant, memorable wine has great structure due to firm acidity and lightly gripping tannins, which surround and support the wonderful, exotic and complex flavors. Best after 2020.
title: Westwood 2015 Wendling Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: It's difficult to pick a favorite out of the marvelous Brick House 2015s, but this is it. Native yeasts, biodynamic farming and minimal handling all contribute to an old-school method, though it's a cutting edge wine. From the opening aroma, the complexities compound, offering pepper, spice, cranberry, candied rose petal, red berry and cherry notes. Simply a stunning value.
title: Brick House 2015 Les Dijonnais Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: In this vintage, Kelley Fox produced three different Pinots sourced from the Maresh Vineyard. This one is graceful and elegant, showing both old vine gravitas and delicate sensibility. It leads with a complex, smooth and penetrating mix of strawberry, raspberry and cherry flavors and follows with grapefruit, orange peel and cumin hints, which round out its lovely tannins. It even drinks beautifully two days after being opened and should age well.
title: Kelley Fox 2015 Maresh Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This wine has great fruit, ripe tannins and enormous potential. The density of the wine speaks to that, with full black fruits and layers of solid tannins. Richly endowed, it should age for many years. Drink this powerful wine from 2026.
title: Maison Champy 2015 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: This is a concentrated and robustly ripe wine, spicy and velvety with a powerful punch of toasted oak. Forest floor elements and a depth of earth provide varietal character as rich interwoven flavors of baked cherry and rhubarb give it a warmth that's expansive across the finish.
title: Patz & Hall 2015 Goldrock Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This bold, ripe wine is packed with red fruits and balanced acidity. The density and generous tannins are all part of the concentration and powerful texture. Acidity brings necessary freshness to an impressive wine. Drink from 2025.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2015 Les Noirots Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This vineyard, on the hill above the city of Nuits-St.-Georges, is widely seen as the top premier cru of the appellation. Certainly this rich, structured wine with its great fruit and firm tannins is serious and ageworthy. Ripe, full and concentrated, it needs to age. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2015 Les Saint-Georges Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: More like a focused fruit missile than an indiscriminate fruit bomb, this bottling shows flashy, vibrant waves of pure strawberry, red cherry and black raspberry that are edged by hints of dark earth, light spearmint and sweet bay leaf. The sip offers tart and exotic plums wrapped up in an herbal cape of thyme and potpourri. This will please many palates.
title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Hapgood Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This rich, ripe and structured wine is dense with solid tannins. It is also full of generous cherry and berry fruits that make a great counterpoint to the dry core. These two elements promise well for the future. Drink this wine from 2023.
designation: Domaine des Perdrix Les Terres Blanches Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine des Perdrix Les Terres Blanches Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This dense wine is full of ripe red fruits. Tannins give structure but the main thrust of this rich wine is the sumptuous fruit. The wine is juicy, cut with bright acidity and will be delicious when it matures. Drink from 2024.
title: Hervé Kerlann 2015 Les Borniques Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This powerful wine is both dense and rich. Its tannins and acidity bode well for aging, while the red plum and berry fruits add to promise for the future. From a parcel close to the series of Grand Cru vineyards, the wine shows the density of this fine vintage and its potential. Drink from 2024.
designation: Closerie des Alisiers Les Corbeaux Premier Cru
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2015 Closerie des Alisiers Les Corbeaux Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This wine has the structure that is a part of a fine Vosne-Romanée. Its dense texture is balanced by the great red fruit and good acidity. Of course, the wine is still so young, its fruit still crisp and not yet mellow. Wait until 2026 to drink this impressive wine.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2015 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Dense and full of black-cherry fruits, this is a richly textured wine. Its concentration and firm tannins are there for the long haul, although it is tempting to drink such a delicious wine young. Resist: this wine will be best from 2025.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2015 Aux Chaignots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Big and rich, this is a juicy wine, ripe with generous tannins and full of berry fruits. It's dense, full in the mouth and impressive in its concentration, richness and crisp texture. Drink from 2025.
designation: Domaine des Perdrix La Perrière Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine des Perdrix La Perrière Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This small vineyard forms part of the Jadot estate. Its rich tannins and black-cherry fruits are sumptuous and already delicious. However there is much more to this structured, tannic and dense wine that will give it a great future. It is broad, rich and likely to be ready to drink from 2024.
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Clos des Ursules Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From the largest and most famous of the Beaune Premier Crus, this wine is classically soft and generous. Of course it has tannins although these are already beautifully cushioned by the ripe red-cherry and blackberry fruits. With spice and smokiness from the wood aging, this is a complete, delicious wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Still solid and firm, this wine has impressive potential. Its tannins are a reminder that the vineyard is close to Morey Saint-Denis. Under those tannins runs a seam of ripe fruits that will develop richly as the wine matures. Drink from 2024.
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Les Baudes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: From a spectacular block within the estate Quail Hill Vineyard in the heart of Russian River Valley's Laguna Ridge, this wine is taut and tightly wound, youthfully exuberant in cherry and blueberry compote. Bright and fresh in lifted acidity, it offers length and balance within a velvety complex texture.
title: Lynmar 2015 Summit Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The stunning aromatic profile on this bottling compellingly combines candied fruit with the lift of crushed herbs, while blending cherry and grenadine with mint, bay leaf, a hint of green olive and a touch of crushed gravel on the nose. That lovable core of plush red fruits rides tight tannins on the palate, where bay leaf, thyme and green peppercorn flavors complete the sip.
title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Machado Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This generous wine is still young with its firm tannins, although also rich with black fruits and concentration. It is juicy, ripe with blackberry flavors and packed with spice and a dry core. The vineyard, at mid-slope like all premier crus, is named after the rowan trees that were found around the edge. This is a wine with a great future; drink from 2025.
title: Albert Bichot 2015 Les Sorbets Premier Cru  (Morey-Saint-Denis)

description: This is a blend from five different premier crus in Beaune to celebrate 50 years of winemaking in Burgundy by the Potel family. Its structure is firm, although the wine itself is succulent and juicy, with a good balance between the acidity and red fruit flavors. Solid tannins back up the dense fruit to give a rich, impressive wine that needs time. Drink from 2025.
designation: Cuvée du Cinquantenaire Vieilles Vignes Premier Cru
title: Domaine de Bellene 2015 Cuvée du Cinquantenaire Vieilles Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Properly structured and with solid tannins, this is a concentrated wine. Its firm texture is balanced by ripe black fruits, dark and intense. From a vineyard surrounded by some of Burgundy's greatest, this superb wine needs many years. Drink from 2026.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2015 Les Suchots Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: This generous although also complex wine brings in many elements. With lush tannins and concentrated acidity it has a dry, still very young character. The weight of juicy fruit suggests a future that is rich and for the long-term. Drink from 2025.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2015 Les Pôrets Saint-Georges Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: From a vineyard site in what is known as the reasonably cool Santa Rosa Plain, this is a spicy, oaky and richly concentrated wine. Pomegranate, bay leaf and cardamom flavors are focused, grounded by abundant notes of tart cranberry and strawberry. The mouthfeel is silky, while an herbal underbelly and lingering clove flavor persists through the finish.
title: Gary Farrell 2015 Toboni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Like the North Block designate, this too is made from 100% Pommard clone. Here, the fruit expression is more lush and full bodied, the blackberry, black cherry, mocha, char and espresso flavors carving deeply into the palate. It's a dense, powerful wine that's beautiful now but structured to age. Enjoy it through the next decade.
title: Shea 2015 Block 23 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is still young but potentially rich and full of ripe fruits. Its tannins are balanced by the generous fruitiness, offering both structure and the chance for the wine to age. Drink this full, juicy wine from 2020.
title: Vincent Lumpp 2015 Clos Saint-Paul Premier Cru  (Givry)

description: This is designated as a reserve-level cuvée, and its dark fruit and overall ripeness confirm that ambition. A smoky, earthy component adds depth, and the tannins remain quite astringent. Blood orange and black raspberry flavors stand out at first but fade quickly on the palate. A subtler wine than the previous vintage.
title: Aberrant Cellars 2015 Carpe Noctum Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Made from Pommard clone vines planted in 1973 and 114 clone vines planted in 1993, this pumps some blueberry juiciness into the palate. No new oak was used, and it turns stiff and acidic on the finish. Give it another couple of years in bottle before opening.
title: Goodfellow 2015 Durant Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Part of a new reserve-level series from single vineyard blocks, this wine contains 100% Whistling Ridge Vineyard fruit, fermented with 65% whole clusters. It's tart and citrusy, with brambly berry and cola touches. There are plenty of stem and skin flavors, but the texture and length somewhat compensate. Tuck it away to revisit in the early 2020s.
title: Goodfellow 2015 Heritage No. 4 Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: A difficult wine to analyze, this at first seems dilute. With ample breathing, it fills in and spreads out, showing mineral notes and raspberry and pomegranate fruit. The astringent, tongue-drying finish calls for pairing with a hearty, meaty entrée.
title: L'Angolo 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Ripe, juicy and packed with red-berry fruits, this is an immediately attractive wine. With its rich texture and already well-integrated tannins, it is a generous wine that is ready to drink.
title: Pierre Naigeon 2015 L'Olivier  (Fixin)

description: This firm, chewy wine seems to have a spine of steel. It also has ample cherry fruit and some astringent, grippy tannins. Sealed with a screwcap, it will benefit from aggressive decanting or prolonged aeration before drinking.
title: A to Z 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This hails from the original block of the estate vineyard—a densely planted plot that delivers slightly leafy rhubarb and raspberry flavors year after year. The wine's green, herbal touches—perhaps the result of 43% whole cluster fermentation—gently fade out on the finish.
title: Cristom 2015 Louise Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: From the northernmost village on the Côte de Nuits, on the edge of the city of Dijon, this wine with its perfumed red cherries and ripe red berries is both structured and developing quickly and easily. Light tannins give shape to the generous fruit and good acidity. Drink this ripe, fruity wine from 2019.
title: Louis Jadot 2015  Marsannay

description: This affordable Oregon Pinot Noir has won multiple accolades, and for good reason. It's flavorful and well-balanced, with tart raspberry and black cherry flavors. It's backed by ample acidity and enough tannic weight to firm up the finish.
title: Raylee 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is ripe and smoothly fruity. From a parcel close to Volnay, it is sumptuous, full with layers of red fruits and a generous richness. The acidity is just right to give the wine its shape, aided by the light tannic structure. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Changarnier 2015 Pierrefitte  (Monthélie)

description: This wine has a smoky aroma from wood aging. The wood also shows on the palate but does not mask the bright cherry fruit. With its solid core, the wine is rich and likely to age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Chopin et Fils 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Ripe black cherry and berry tones abound in this plump Pinot Noir. It's more juicy than complex but hints of dark toast and hazelnut lend nuance. Fresh cranberry acidity and fine, persistent tannins add firmness to the finish. Drink now through 2019.
title: Dr. Nägler 2015 Estate Bottled Trocken Pinot Noir (Rheingau)

description: Part of a new reserve-level series from single vineyard blocks, this wine was made from 100% Fir Crest Vineyard fruit that was fermented using 75% whole clusters and aged in 50% new oak. Despite all the care and attention, it shows little besides very tart raspberry fruit and a high-acid finish.
title: Goodfellow 2015 Heritage No. 6 Pinot Noir

description: This crisp, cherry-perfumed wine offers attractive acidity as well as bright red-currant and red-berry flavors. The core of tannins will allow it to age well over the next few years. Drink from 2019.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015  Marsannay

description: This attractive wine smells fruity and spicy, almost liked mulled wine, and has a broad warm texture that makes it easy to sip. A deep color and soft finish complete the picture.
title: La Follette 2015 Pinot Noir (North Coast)

description: This is a reserve-level barrel selection from the estate's oldest vineyard. Animal scents mark the nose, and stiff, earthy tannins mark the finish. It's a wine in which the fruit is masked by dark, bitter flavors like cacao and espresso, along with suggestions of dried herbs.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2015 Latitude 45 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Presumably fermented in a single puncheon, this is soft and supple, with plum and cherry cola flavors and a touch of mocha. Overall, it's smooth and ready to drink.
title: Wetzel Estate 2015 Puncheon Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a tasty, good value effort with fresh strawberry and cherry fruit flavors. Its light suggestions of toast and cocoa point to some time in barrel, as does its pleasant whiff of east Asian spice.
title: Carlton Cellars 2015 Seven Devils Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Young and showing tart cranberry and raspberry flavors, this softens on the midpalate then leans into a chocolate marshmallow finish. It's a bit muddled but offers a lot of interesting flavors.
title: Dobbes Family Estate 2015 Grand Assemblage Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine has plenty of tannins, although they are embedded in ripe, juicy red fruits. This village wine has a solid core as well as bright acidity, offering the potential for aging. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Chopin et Fils 2015 Bas de Combe  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This wine's toasty aromas seem slightly burnt, and that smoky note carries onto the palate. Its strawberry flavors seem to quickly hit a wall, suggesting it may still be a bit shocked.
title: L'Angolo 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This powerful dry wine smells lightly earthy with lots of black cherry. It tastes rather taut and reserved due to very firm tannins and acidity, and has deep blackberry fruit underneath it all. It's very enjoyable in a dry style and will be great with food.
title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

description: This wine's rather light wild berry flavors come with sour plum and green herb notes. The acids have a citrusy note and contribute a bit of chalk to the finish.
title: Penner-Ash 2015 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: One of several single vineyard offerings, this does not live up to the previous vintage. Here, the blackberry fruit feels a bit thin, with citrus and dried leaf notes and a chalky finish.
title: Penner-Ash 2015 Zena Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
