description: This wine's light strawberry and raspberry flavors show even lighter touches of new oak and skin contact. The aromas are quite pretty and suggest it will improve over the next five or six years.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2015 Bovine Vineyards Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: From a block within the Hop Kiln Vineyard, this is made from 100% Pommard Clone grapes. Earthy in compost-like rusticity, it's intense in whole cluster-like spiciness, with a soft nose of rose petal and pomegranate.
title: Zoetic Wines 2015 Block 21 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Saint-Romain is one of the villages in the hills behind the main Côte de Beaune vineyards. As such it produces a cooler style of wine with crisp red-berry and red-currant fruitiness. There is a tang to its texture as well as a layer of tannins. Drink this potentially lively, fruity wine from 2019.
title: Alain Gras 2015  Saint-Romain

description: Oaky and reduced, this wine offers ripe black cherry, cola and subtle spice, with a streak of watermelon-fresh acidity. Medium-bodied, it reveals an underlying earthiness under the toasty oak.
title: Conclusion 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Light berry aromas meet with wet gravel and dank forest-floor elements of pine needle and juniper on the nose of this bottling. The earthy forest-moss flavor is prevalent on the sip, leveled by cranberry, pomegranate and smoke elements. It is a decent everyday Pinot.
title: District 7 Wines 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Initially smooth and sophisticated, this wine then reveals a dark core of tannins. It is rich, structured, full of juicy red fruit as well as a fine line of acidity. The vineyard is south of the city of Nuits-St.-Georges. Definitely ageworthy, the wine has density, concentration and a powerful future. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2015 Les Porêts Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The producer's second release from this famous site, this wine is beautifully balanced and bright, with nuanced layers of depth. Cherry, cola spice and forest floor mingle effortlessly in the glass, as the palate remains silky soft.
title: Davies 2015 Hyde Vineyards Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Richly juicy, this wine, from one of the finest of the Gevrey Premier Crus, is already attractive. It has great fruit, rich tannins and a spicy character from the wood aging. At the moment, the acidity and crisp texture dominate, although this will change to bring out the richness of the wine. Wait to drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Henri Magnien 2015 Lavaut Saint-Jacques Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: A block selection from vines planted in the early 1970s, this shows the herbal side of Pinot Noir, with stem flavors that suggest some whole-cluster fermentation. It's young and still a bit stiff, with sour cherry and sassafras flavors. It has excellent concentration, and more bottle age should lighten up the still-chewy tannins.
title: Kelley Fox 2015 Maresh Vineyard Red Barn Blocks Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Very intriguing aromas of cinnamon, cedar, garden herbs and tight raspberry show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the eastern side of the appellation. The palate is extremely elegant and tightly wound, with bay leaf, Earl Grey tea and potpourri elements flavoring the pomegranate background.
title: Pali 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Showcasing the richness and velvety texture often associated with wines from Savigny, this also highlights the ripeness of the vintage. The result is a wine in which ripe red fruits and a smooth texture overtake the tannins that lend a subtle structure and will help it age. It is a delicious wine that will be ready to drink from 2022.
title: Vincent Girardin 2015 Les Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Juicy, firmly structured and with great fruit, this wine will need aging. With black cherries and juicy red currants, it is both ripe and crisp. Drink this wine, with its excellent potential, from 2024.
title: Albert Bichot 2015 Château Gris Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Ripe and full bodied, this wine is also succulent and juicy. Red fruits show strongly in the concentrated texture and the richness. An impressive wine to age, it will not be ready to drink before 2023.
title: Albert Bichot 2015 Les Chabiots Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Vibrant on the nose and expertly put together, this is a well-made appellation wine, expansive in dark cherry, pomegranate and plum. Generous in oak and tannin in its youth, it shows a full-bodied finish that settles smoothly into velvety waves of cardamom and rose.
title: Benovia 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A lovely, lush melding of berry, citrus and cherry fruit flavors, this appeals from the moment the cork is pulled through the second day. The fruit is nicely framed with light herb and stem highlights and touches of brown sugar and sassafras.
title: Big Table Farm 2015 Sunnyside Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Generous and ripe, this smooth wine has hidden strengths in the tannic structure that lies underneath the rich fruits. The berry and black-cherry flavors are prominent, giving a juicy character to this rich, full wine. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine René Bouvier 2015 Les Fuées Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: From a low-yielding, rocky site, this is a well-structured wine with compelling minerality. Its immaculate raspberry fruit is etched with well-modulated streaks of stem and leaf. It was aged in one fifth new barriques.
title: Lingua Franca 2015 Tongue 'n Cheek Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: While the 50-year-old vines do bring concentration, they also deliver delicious swathes of ripe, juicy fruit. This is a ripe, black-cherry-flavored wine, strengthened by tannins and with a crisp edge of acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Maison Roche de Bellene 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Outstanding fruit shines brightly here, with a beguiling mix of Northwest berry flavors—boysenberry, loganberry and blueberry. It's juicy and tart, with polished tannins that carry a pleasing touch of clean earth. Drink 2020–2030.
title: Rex Hill 2015 Antiquum Farm Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This suave and complex wine has all the classic flavor characteristics like red cherry, black tea and cinnamon along with light oakiness and a luscious texture, a full body and a lingering finish. It feels on the soft side in terms of low acidity and light tannins, but its concentration is impressive.
title: Walt 2015 Blue Jay Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Full body and very ripe fruit flavors give a lot of impact to this deeply colored and concentrated wine made from the heritage Martini clone and aged in 50% new oak. It packs in the black cherry, blackberry and clove flavors, wrapping them in a firm blanket of fine-grained tannins and good acidity, so that it should improve with age. Best after 2019.
title: MacPhail 2015 Wightman House Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This wine can be deceptive, as it doesn't burst forth with glorious fruit. What it does have is texture and detail, and the start-to-finish experience rewards your full attention. Layered with forest floor, earth, rock and wild berry notes, it's underscored by ample acidity. The finish goes on and on.
title: Carabella 2015 Inchinnan Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This excellent bottle pulls Bing cherry, kirsch and orange peel flavors into a full-bodied whole. Aged in French oak for 18 months, it adds a layer of dark chocolate to the finish.
title: Compton Family 2015 Alpine Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Beautiful seductive fruit aromas and flavors make this wine practically irresistible, and a soft silky texture reinforces its luxuriousness. Red and black cherry notes mingle with mild vanilla and cinnamon on the palate and finish.
title: Davies 2015 Goorgian Vineyards Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: The old vines in this densely planted vineyard date back 67 years. This wine has great concentration, tannins and juicy red fruits. Its structure emphasizes the straightforward character of Nuits-St.-Georges, so it will take time to mature. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This hillside vineyard with its eastern exposure has produced a rich wine in 2015. Structured with some firm tannins from fruit and wood aging, it also has plenty of blackberry and juicy black-currant flavors. Acidity gives a fresh character to this delicious wine that will be ready from 2022.
title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2015 Le Clos l'Evêque Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: A rich wine from this 57-acre family estate, this is ripe with black-cherry fruit balanced with juicy acidity. A fine core of tannins gives both structure and aging potential. Drink this generous wine from 2021.
title: Domaine Julie Belland 2015 Beauregard Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This structured single-vineyard wine has plenty of rich red cherry and berry fruits along with a dry core of tannins. Together they make a wine that needs to age to realize the potential for great fruitiness. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Julie Belland 2015 Les Cras  (Pommard)

description: Luscious raspberry and red-cherry flavors abound in this lavish, full-bodied Pinot Noir. Framed by soft, pliant tannins and bright acidity, it's fruity and forward in style but nuanced by hints of crushed granite and river rocks. The finish is marked by wisps of smoke and nuts. Drink now–2022.
title: Franz Keller 2015 Pinot Noir (Baden)

description: Ripe and smoky, this full wine is juicy and packed with both fruit and tannins. It's concentrated, with perfumed red-berry fruits showing strongly along with the tannins and firm structure. Its future looks good. Drink from 2023.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015 Les Jacquins  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: This is named for the white flowers that grow between the the vineyard's rows. It opens with soft cumin and fivespice scents, building toward clean raspberry and lollipop-like cherry fruit. A wet rock minerality adds a zing of freshness. The word charming comes to mind, from the first zippy sniff on through the light, pretty finish.
designation: Maresh Vineyard Star of Bethlehem Flower Block
title: Kelley Fox 2015 Maresh Vineyard Star of Bethlehem Flower Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Earthy wisps of rose garden and wild strawberry invite one into this estate wine, that's brawny and strong in imprint. Concentrated and extracted fruit dominates with highlights of cranberry, raspberry and tan bark with a nod of cola and cardamom adding spice.
title: Lynmar 2015 Quail Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This vintage blends Pommard and 777 clones, and the black cherry fruit is a bit more forward than in 2014. Cola, mineral, tar and char notes come into play, with an energetic feel. Subtle suggestions of pine needles emerge as the flavors slowly fade. It drinks beautifully on the second day.
title: NagyBrown 2015 Argument Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: While tannins give a dry core to the wine, it also has ripe red fruits and plenty of them. Along with structure there is a sense of richness and potential opulence. Drink this wine, with its concentrated, juicy aftertaste, from 2021.
title: Vincent Girardin 2015 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Pommard)

description: The 2015 vintage in Savigny-lès-Beaune brings out the smooth richness of the appellation. In this wine it is enhanced by a core of tannins and juicy red-berry acidity, making for a ripe, generous wine that will also age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2015 Les Peuillets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: The wine is structured, dense with tannins and smokiness from the wood aging. Its fruits, though in the background at this stage, offer fine black-cherry potential. Drink this concentrated wine from 2022.
title: Domaine d'Ardhuy 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: This is a single-vineyard wine which is beautifully rich and already soft and smooth enough to drink. To be sure, it will age further and mellow with time, but for now it is the ripe red-berry fruits and generous tannins that are so attractive. Drink now and until 2026.
designation: Château de Chamirey Clos de la Maladière
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Château de Chamirey Clos de la Maladière  (Mercurey)

description: Dominated by its young tannins, this perfumed wine is bright with acidity. It has spice, an intense, crisp character and the need to age for a considerable time. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Rossignol-Février Père et Fils 2015 Robardelle Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This is an earthy spice-driven wine, full bodied and richly layered in texture and flavor. Dark cherry cola is met by cinnamon and cardamon, with underlying hints of orange zest and dried herb.
title: Frank Family 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Layered tannin wraps around smoky oak and big flavors of marshmallow in this full-bodied densely concentrated wine from the well-known site. Black cherry, earthy forest floor and classic cola combine to form a juicy core of succulence beneath the power.
title: Patz & Hall 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Piquant aromas of cinnamon meet with strawberry, plum, gravel and bay leaf on the nose of this appellation blend by Steve Dooley. That bay leaf joins eucalyptus on the very clean and fresh sip, which surrounds tart raspberry, vanilla and clove flavors.
title: Stephen Ross 2015 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: From one of the highest of the Mercurey premier crus, this wine has a crisp edge to its otherwise ripe red fruits. It has a fine line of wood as well as the juicy fruitiness and acidity. The wine is already balanced, likely to develop easily and quickly. Drink this from 2019.
title: Château de Santenay 2015 Les Puillets Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: With vines forming part of the 22-acre Jessiaume estate, this vineyard—one of the better known of the Beaune premiers crus—has produced a fine, rich wine in this vintage. Although there is plenty of young wood, the fruit is so rich and generous, with such fine potential. Give this opulent wine until 2022.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015 Les Cents Vignes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Winemaker Billy Wathen makes so many single-vineyard wines that he's able to play around with styles, and uses this bottling to explore the lower alcohol side of Pinot Noir. Extremely floral aromas of rose petals, hibiscus and carnation meet with light raspberry on the elegant nose, while the lighter-bodied palate mixes slightly sour red fruit with cedar, thyme and oregano.
title: Foxen 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Baked red cherry, vanilla, cola and sarsaparilla show on the nose of this very approachable bottling by Adam Lee. There is a light touch of licorice to the sip, with strawberry and red-plum flavors as well as more complex touches of tea leaf and candied raspberry.
title: Siduri 2015 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This smoky wine is ripe with a fine balance between tannins and rich red fruits. It is warm, rounded and attractively spicy. The structure and dry core will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Françoise André 2015 Les Vergelsess Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: There's something different and appealing about this cool-climate Pinot. For beginners, the nose is savory and meaty-smelling, but offset by fresh strawberry and plum notes. A smooth palate with a touch of buttery oak tastes of savory plum, cherry and spice. A long finish is comfortable on the fade.
title: Leyda 2015 Cahuil Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Concentrated tannins balance this juicy red-berry flavor wine. The wine is still very young, showing its tannins strongly. They will certainly integrate. Drink this potentially rich wine from 2022.
title: Domaine Rossignol-Trapet 2015 Les Bas Liards  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This rich and structured wine is packed with both ripe black fruits and concentrated tannins. It is a big wine, a fine representation of this appellation with its dense flavors and aging potential. The wine should be ready from 2021.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: The wine has a good structure with sophisticated tannins and perfumed acidity. Black cherry and spice from the wood are balanced by the freshness of the acidity and the rounded aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Domaine Latour  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: This walled vineyard in the Côte Chalonnaise forms part of the 12-acre Domaine de la Ferté. The wine has structure with some firm tannins behind the ripe berry and crisp cherry fruits. It is developing well although it will need some more time. Drink from 2020.
designation: Domaine de la Ferté Clos de Mortières
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine de la Ferté Clos de Mortières  (Givry)

description: Snappy aromas of black raspberry leap out of the glass along with white pepper and bay leaf in this layered red by David Potter. There is solid ripeness to the sip in the form of tangy plums, pomegranate and cranberry, dusted by dried herbs and pepper. It's very fresh and energetic in style.
title: Municipal Winemakers 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Robust and ripe, this wine is still developing—it is so densely packed and concentrated. Youthful flavors of baked plum and licorice meet a spicy backbone of sage and earth, with a slight touch of reduction on the nose.
title: Patz & Hall 2015 Jenkins Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This perfumed wine comes from the home vineyard of the producer. With soft tannins and juicy red-berry fruit, the wine is straightforward, delicious and very much in the style of the vintage. It has a crisp end of acidity that gives it just the right lift. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2015 Les Beaumonts  (Chorey-lès-Beaune)

description: This family vineyard, based in the village of Mercurey has produced a richly fruity wine, generous with its red-plum and spice flavors. Tannins do go through the wine, giving it the possibility of further aging. Ripe and with attractive acidity, the wine will be ready from 2018.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2015  Mercurey

description: Ripe tannins and rich red-plum fruits give this wine a generous rounded character. Bringing out the generosity of this vintage, the wine is a balance between the broad fruits and acidity. In the background, the tannins give the wine extra weight. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Santenay 2015 Les Champs Martin Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Rich, thick and swimming in youthful tannin, this is a powerful statement from the producer's estate, a broad-shouldered explosion of fruity and savory flavors. Spicy tea, pomegranate and black cherry mingle around a tartness of grapefruit and blood orange, coalescing into a balanced whole.
title: Bouchaine 2015 Pommard Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Plump and boldly structured, this full-bodied Pinot Noir offers rich, concentrated blackberry and black cherry flavors. Aged in Hungarian oak, it's lavishly spicy, embellished with notes of vanilla and caramel, but maintains elegant composure and brisk, cutting acidity. The finish is marked by firm, velvet-textured tannins.
title: Whitecliff Vineyard 2015 Pinot Noir (Hudson River Region)

description: The wine is full of acidity—crisp and tight. With firm tannins to back up the red-currant fruit, it is going to take time to open up. Then it will become a rich serious wine. Drink from 2023.
title: Bouchard Aîné et Fils 2015 Les Charmots Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: The Domaine, which is based in Santenay, has produced a wine that has structure as well as ripe fruits. The combination promises good aging with the red-plum fruits likely to mellow into a rich concentrated wine. It is a wine to keep and age, and not drink before 2021.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015 La Comme Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: The wine is ripe with red-cherry and plum flavors and plenty of acidity to balance. It is a rounded wine, generous with fruitiness and with a touch of tannin at the end. This is a fine village wine from this attractive appellation.
title: Louis Latour 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: Supple and delicious, this medium-bodied wine is not a blockbuster but has wonderful berry and black-cherry flavors, fine balance and a touch of fine-grained tannin in the texture. Light cinnamon and cedar notes come out with time in the glass and add complexity.
title: Navarro 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Cherry, chocolate and marshmallow aromas need some airing to show their best. This feels plump but also jumpy and nervy, with no shortage of intensity. Lightly spicy tomato, plum and cherry flavors finish long and dry.
title: Leyda 2015 Lot 21 Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Vines at the base of the famed Corton grand cru hill produce this rich attractively fruity wine. Bold and with warm tannins and light wood-aging flavors, the wine is generous and full of red-berry fruits. It also has a more serious side as witnessed by the tannins. Drink from 2019.
title: Château de Santenay 2015 Les Brunettes et Planchots  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: Thick, ripe and jammy, this is an explosive wine, broadly rich and rewarding in black-cherry, berry and licorice layers of flavor. Firm, tight tannins offer structure and power, with an intriguing hint of fennel funneling through.
title: D.R. Stephens 2015 Silver Eagle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a smooth-texture wine with a great future. It has acidity, ripe tannins, generous fruit and balance. As the wine develops, the rich red-berry fruit will show strongly. The wine is concentrated, with a solid base. Drink from 2025.
title: Albert Morot 2015 Les Algrots Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This structured firm wine is full of tannins as well as ripe fruit. It is concentrated, showing smoky wood flavors as well as plenty of red berries. The wine will develop slowly, with the rich fruits coming through to give a generous wine. Drink from 2024.
title: Albert Morot 2015 Les Teurons Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: From one of the grandest premiers crus, this wine is dense and rich. With great fruit tones and finely integrated wood, it is complex, beautifully balanced and shows great intensity. The juicy red fruits are shot through by firm tannins that will soften as it matures. Drink from 2025.
title: Domaine Bertagna 2015 Les Beaux Monts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Delicate aromas of raspberry, sagebrush and white pepper make for a lighter yet complex expression of Pinot Noir from this estate vineyard of Richard Longoria, who's a regional veteran like the Foxen owners. Tart and taut flavors of black raspberry, pepper, oregano and leather combine for a very earthy experience, which is simultaneously subtle and stunning.
title: Foxen 2015 Fe Ciega Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The wine is beautiful—ripe with generous red fruits and with balanced acidity. It has concentration, juicy acidity and a smoky background. This is going to be an opulent wine, rich in tannins and in fruit. Drink from 2022.
title: Albert Morot 2015 Les Toussaints Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Powerful tannins and wood flavors dominate the wine at this young stage. It has plenty of the richness of the vintage to promise a generous future. Packed with ripe red-berry fruits and balanced acidity, it will be a very fine wine. Drink from 2024.
title: Château de Santenay 2015  Clos de Vougeot

description: This is a rich opulent wine. Its red-berry fruits are just the starting point for a series of layers of fruit, tannins and intense perfumed ripeness. The wine is firm at this young stage with great potential to develop into a generous wine as it matures. It comes from vines at the northern end of the Beaune premier crus. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2015 En Genêt Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Cranberry, rhubarb and allspice combine effortlessly in this well-made, memorable red. Silky on the palate, it shows a refinement of character and robust grasp of dark spicy notes that betray a baked, brooding quality of balanced richness. On the finish is a refreshing seasoning of orange zest.
title: Lucie 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From one of the parcels that make up the larger Corton Grand Cru, this is a powerful wine with a proper sense of its dignity. It is stylish as well as rich—an elegant blending of ripe red fruits, tannins and acidity. The wine of course has great potential and will not be ready to drink until 2025.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015  Corton Vergennes

description: This is an intense expression of cola and cinnamon stick, provocatively spicy on the tongue. Boldly ripe and full bodied, it unpacks layers upon layers of baked cherry, blueberry pie and orange flavor, wrapped within a velvety lush texture that's lifted by underlying acidity.
title: Sojourn 2015 Ridgetop Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is from a great vineyard near the Wohler Bridge in Forestville, and the fruit is well-represented in this bottle. Boldly layered, and richly designed, it's fragrantly floral with cherry blossoms. Those scents are paired with contiguous flavors of raspberry and cherry. Within a framework of upfront but integrated tannin and oak, it finds balance on the earthy finish.
title: Sojourn 2015 Wohler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a powerful wine with concentration and dark tannins. It is rich, packed with black fruits and acidity. The wine has spice, a bold structure and a great future. The wine, from one of the vineyards within the Corton Grand Cru, is likely to be ready to drink from 2025.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015 Renardes  (Corton Les Renardes)

description: The wallled Clos des Ursulines is wholly owned by this producer. This perfumed wine is showing strong wood aromas as well as concentrated spice. Underneath, the generous juicy fruit has a fine balance between red plums and bright acidity. Drink from 2022.
designation: Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Ursulines
title: Albert Bichot 2015 Domaine du Pavillon Clos des Ursulines  (Pommard)

description: Among the most northerly of the run of Beaune premier crus, the wine is structured but the structure is cushioned by the ripe red-berry fruits to give a generous wine. Backed by tannins, the wine will age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Perrières Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A firmly structured wine, solid with tannins and with structure. The wine is also full of fruit potential, ripe with red berries. It is dense wine that needs to age. Drink from 2025.
title: Maison Champy 2015 Aux Cras Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: A structured wine, full of tannins and with good concentration. The wine is juicy, bringing acidity and red-plum and berry fruits together with the tannins. It is a wine that will need aging. Drink this powerful wine from 2023.
title: Domaine Françoise André 2015 Les Reverses Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This is a ripe jammy wine, full of creamed-strawberry flavors. All this fruitiness is balanced by the acidity. The tannins are a comfortable cushion under the fruit. The wine will develop easily and it should be ready to drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Rossignol-Trapet 2015 Les Teurons Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This firmly structured wine is packed with solid tannins as well as ripe juicy red fruits. It comes from the upper part of the Rugiens Premier Cru, one of the top sites in Pommard. Dense and needing to age, the wine will be ready from 2023.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Les Rugiens Hauts Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This bottling from the famously rich wine-making vineyard shows incredible restraint on the nose, starting with the reserved aromas of lavender, white pepper, bergamot, pomegranate and snappy raspberry. The blackberry fruit runs quite deep on the sip, edged by bay leaf, menthol and purple flower touches. Simultaneously elegant and powerful.
title: Bernardus 2015 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Dark red cherry, crushed carnations, rose petals and a hint of nutmeg spice show on the nose of this bottling from an increasingly famous vineyard in this region. The palate's rich expression combines black plum, clove, red-cherry and mace flavors, bolstered by a fresh acidity.
title: Bernardus 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a serious wine, firm with tannins. Its juicy red fruits are still shy in coming forward, although they are certainly there. With its structure and the potential of its rich fruits, the wine will develop well and impressively. Drink from 2022.
title: Château de Santenay 2015 Clos du Roi Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Deep and hearty aromas of blackberry, candied violet and dried lavender are enhanced by a touch of roasted pork on the nose of this red by Adam Lee. The full-bodied palate is framed by soft yet structural tannins and a slow-rising acidity, showing dark berries, charred beef and a hint of licorice.
title: Siduri 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is a structured wine, dark and firm as tannins meld with the ripe berry fruits. It has the weight to have great potential. The wine, with its concentration and dense tannins, will be ready to drink from 2025.
designation: Domaine Clos de la Chapelle Champs Pimont Premier Cru
title: Meurgey-Croses 2015 Domaine Clos de la Chapelle Champs Pimont Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This is a ripe generous wine with soft tannins and already delicious red fruits. It lives up to the ideal of Volnay, rich and sumptuous, although with an attractive cut of acidity to balance. Drink this wine from 2022.
designation: Domaine Clos de la Chapelle En Carelle Premier Cru
title: Meurgey-Croses 2015 Domaine Clos de la Chapelle En Carelle Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This is a firm wine that is structured with dense tannins. At the same time, its ripe black fruits and acidity promise a generous rich future. From a walled vineyard, once belonging to the local bishop, the wine is set for some long-term aging. Drink from 2023.
designation: Château de Chamirey Clos l'Evêque Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Château de Chamirey Clos l'Evêque Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This suave and sophisticated wine is so smooth to sip that its depth of flavor is a little deceptive. A subtle potpourri of clove, cinnamon, black tea and blackberry aromas swirl around a great core of mild acidity, fine-grained tannins and many layers of concentrated fruit flavor. The texture is velvety and the finish lingers for at least 30 seconds.
title: Navarro 2015 Methode A L'Ancienne Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This wood-aged and structured wine is concentrated and dense. It comes from the Premier Cru vineyard just to the west of the village. With generous tannins and juicy ripe red fruits, the wine is broad and going to be rich. Drink from 2023.
title: Arnaud Baillot 2015 Les Platières Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This vineyard is wholly owned by Domaine Bertagna, making it, in Burgundy terms, a monopole. The wine is still showing its wood aging, although the weight of ripe fruit will surely come through as it matures. It is a rich reflection of this fine vintage, dense and with packed with black-plum fruits and with a smoky aftertaste. Drink from 2022.
designation: Clos de la Perrière Vougeot Premier Cru
title: Domaine Bertagna 2015 Clos de la Perrière Vougeot Premier Cru  (Vougeot)

description: This young, richly structured wine comes from a vineyard to the north of the town of Nuits Saint-Georges. It is powered by spice and toast from wood aging that are balanced by the ripe red-plum fruits and acidity. The combination is going to produced an impressive, foursquare wine as it ages. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Bertagna 2015 Les Murgers Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a perfumed wine, opulent and with a fine smoky structure. With great ripe berry and red-currant fruit, the wine has a juicy character, bright and crisp with acidity while also solidly textured. Drink this wine from 2023.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2015 En Sazenay Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: The grapes were harvested in the early morning to preserve the real freshness that is here. The attractive, rich wine is full in the mouth with its red-berry and red-currant fruits that are cut with citrus. The wine is ready to drink.
title: François Millet 2015 Domaine des Côtes Blanches  (Sancerre)

description: There's a diluted nature to this wine, from a selection of varietal clones. Dry, it holds back on flavor, delivering a light texture and soft red-fruit flavors.
title: Robert James Wines 2015 Little Fox Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Floral, pretty and light, this wine was made for porch sitting and all-around relaxing. It never gives up on fruit and complexity, offering a medium body and vibrant acidity around the rose-petaled texture. This is a lovely sipper.
title: Starmont 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: The slightest shade of yellowish pink, this wine is a great study of fresh acidity and compelling texture in a rosé. Very slight and soft strawberry and squeezed lemon aromas kick off the experience, followed by light red fruit sliced by tangy kumquat on the palate. The flavors are not particularly complex or unique, but the sip is fascinating.
title: Stephen Ross 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Record heat in the Dundee Hills in 2015 brings extra richness to this bone-dry rosé. Bright strawberry fruit flavors are set in a bed of racy acidity. It's as fresh and flavorful as a rosé can be, so enjoy it before 2016 draws to a close.
title: Sokol Blosser 2015 Estate Rosé of Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: When a rosé pushes past 14% alcohol, that's an indication of a pretty potent wine. Here's a fine example, showcasing ripe strawberry and peach fruit, with excellent concentration and mouth-filling flavors. Using all free-run juice, this is fresh and full-bodied.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 Whole Cluster Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This bright and fruity Beaujolais-style wine is as light and refreshing as a young wine can possibly be. It delivers a smile-inducing burst of strawberry and cherry fruit—round, ripe and juicy. You absolutely want to drink this sometime in 2016 while all that youthful energy remains.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 Whole Cluster Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The mini-trend to making white Pinot Noir is taking off in Oregon, and the wines get better with each new vintage. There's not a trace of color here, but plenty of flavor, headed with chunky apple and white peach fruit. Overall fruit-forward describes this best, with some of the flesh of a good stainless Chardonnay.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2015 White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: No longer an oddity, making a white wine out of Pinot Noir creates a most useful alternative to Chardonnay. Apples and white peaches abound, with a full, creamy mouthfeel. It's round and fresh with a pleasing sprinkle of cinnamon spice.
title: Oak Knoll 2015 White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Some appealing floral highlights rub against flavors of orange crush, cherry soda and toasted cracker. This young wine seems structured for early drinking.
title: Left Coast Cellars 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Smoky, stalky plum, cherry and tea aromas set up a dry, full-sized palate with herbal raspberry flavors touched up by briny salt and woody pepper notes. A racy, salty finish reflects cool-climate origins.
title: Indomita 2015 Gran Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Orange rind, leather and black cherry aromas are a touch funky. This dark-colored Pinot is big in body and bulky. Black plum, tea and berry flavors are drawing on the finish.
title: Cucao 2015 Reserva Pinot Noir (Limarí Valley)

description: Pointy cherry, tomato and horsey aromas announce a fresh, raw palate. Bright, peppery red plum and citrus flavors finish lean, dry and grating.
title: Santa Carolina 2015 Reserva Estate Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: This Romanian Pinot Noir has aromas of sweet black cherry, smoked meats and red raspberry. In the mouth there are flavors of smoke and black plums.
title: Cramele Recas 2015 Dreambird Pinot Noir (Romania)

description: Cherry and plum aromas are dusty and dry. This Pinot Noir has a pinched, distant feel and woody flavors that are low on fruit. On the finish, this has no fruit to speak of and only dry oak-spice flavors.
title: Autoritas 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Valley)

description: A light, easy and cheery selection, with direct aromas and flavors of sweet cherry, red raspberry and strawberry. The mouthfeel is soft and approachable, with virtually no tannins and a clean, short finish. Drink up.
title: Le Petit Cochonnet 2015 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Cool, herbal aromas of blueberry are unusual. This is blocky in feel, with a low level of finesse. Candied, herbal cherry and medicinal berry flavors finish with mint and spice notes along with a green character.
title: Porta 2015 Estate Bottled Reserva Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)

description: Extremely light in color save for a slight shade of pale pink, this awesome rose invites the nose with unique aromas of baked lemon and strawberry cream sauce, proving both delicate but richly layered. It's clean, crisp and quaffable on the palate, where lime rind and nectarine flesh make for a flavor profile that goes down like water.
title: Stolo 2015 Estate Rosé of Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: This clone-specific wine is light, refreshing and tangy, a medium-bodied celebration of mandarin orange, lime and cranberry, with an earthy undertone that picks up complexity on the lengthy finish.
title: Martin Ray 2015 Clone 943 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A light, bright, affordable quaffer, this youthful wine is flinty with a juicy core of fresh-pressed grapefruit and lemon peel. It retains varietal character and a buoyancy throughout, finishing with grace and persistence.
title: Brick & Mortar 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A 100% varietal wine fermented in stainless steel, this is a bright, lively tangle of cherry and orange built around bristling acidity that practically sizzles on the palate. Light-bodied and plenty crisp, it mellows to show length and breadth on the finish.
title: Ousterhout 2015 Woods Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Pink-orange in color, this is a tangy, high-acid wine that's not for everyone, given its bracing mix of tangerine and grapefruit. Light-bodied, yet textured, it's a good quaffer and food-friendly companion.
title: Merriam 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Grapefruit, orange and cherry mélange nicely together on the palate of this tantalizingly zesty wine, the acidity front and forward. Fresh and refreshing, the tang mellows on the finish, providing medium body and weight.
title: Martin Ray 2015 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Pink with the slightest touch of yellow and orange on the edges, this wine offers very even aromas on the nose of ripe strawberry, raspberry, nectarine, melon and orange on the nose. The palate is round with bubble gum, light strawberry and peach flavors, epitomizing the crisp while lush style of rosé that's preferred by the masses these days.
title: Charmed 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (California)

description: Dark orange-red in color, this perennial favorite is a steal of a deal, light and refreshingly fruity in dried cranberry, strawberry and orange zest accents, without a trace of unnecessary sweetness. From grapes grown in Carneros, this is a light, bright wine that's easy to love.
designation: Eye of the Toad Dry Rosé of
title: Toad Hollow 2015 Eye of the Toad Dry Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Josh Jensen enters his fourth decade of pink wine with this bottling, which shows ripe strawberry, red apple, white peach, plum and red cherry on the fleshy and full now. It tightens up on the palate, showing tart berries, orange peels and pencil lead minerality, finishing with a long stroke of cherry-watermelon. Lots of depth for a rosé.
designation: Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Vin Gris of
title: Calera 2015 Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Vin Gris of Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: This is a direct but tasty and well-balanced Pinot, with vibrant aromas and flavors of juicy cherry, blueberry and wild strawberry, all graced by hints of purple flowers and sweet spice. The mouthfeel is soft yet structured, with delicate tannins and a slight lushness that lingers on the finish.
title: Le Pépin 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This is a juicy, fruit-forward selection, boasting vibrant notes of red cherry, raspberry and strawberry on the nose and mouth. A hint of vanilla adds a sweetness to the finish, which otherwise ends clean and mouthwatering. Drink now.
title: Bougrier 2015 Alain de la Treille Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: A hint of foliage graces the otherwise fruit-forward bouquet of this easy-to-like Pinot, with core aromas and flavors of crisp strawberry, raspberry and cherry. The tannins are soft but provide a subtle structure, while flavors of plum and cherry skin lend texture to the finish.
title: Voiturette 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Ripe aromas of black plum, cherry and boysenberry are at the forefront of this richly fruited wine. The wine's lushness is complemented by hints of pepper and baking spice, as well as medium tannins that lend a subtle structure to the palate.
title: La Châsse 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Hearty black plum, mulberry and blackberry notes show on the nose of this bottling, alongside scents of gravel, turned earth, dried sage and toast. Violet and blackberry flavors unfold on the dark palate, but vibrant acidity and a solid structure expertly balance the richness.
title: Lucienne 2015 Doctor's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: There is much to like about the youthful vibrancy of this wine from Texas-raised Ryan Roark. It packs bright and fruity raspberry, pomegranate, hibiscus and crushed violet aromas on the nose. The refreshing palate pairs snappy raspberry fruit with fennel pollen and eucalyptus touches.
title: Roark Wine Co. 2015 Burning Creek Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Winemaker Paul Clifton excelled in this vintage, finding the balance between the region's ripe fruit, natural acidity and powerful spice. Baked black cherry, hibiscus, earth, gingerbread and cola notes show on the nose. The palate is creamy and lush, but the acidity is persistent, carrying its dark red fruit and minty chocolate flavors into the finish.
title: Lucienne 2015 Hook Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Burnt tea, forest floor and crushed leaf aromas ride atop dense layers of turned earth and stemmy rose scents in this intriguing wine from a beloved site. Moderate acidity keeps it fresh, highlighting its succulent black cherry fruit with lavender and Asian spice notes that emerge on the finish.
title: Siduri 2015 Keefer Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Aged in four-year-old barrels for 16 months, this bottling allows its elegant fruit to shine, showing concentrated black cherry, cola, rose petal and ginger aromas. A tight boysenberry note emerges on the palate, dusted with clove and lavender and cut by lively acidity. A thorough and complete wine.
title: Fess Parker 2015 Older Barrel Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This vintage delivers a wine with deep and rustic cherry, boysenberry, sweet herb and rose aromas, the latter contributing a penetrating floral dimension. Pure raspberry, potpourri and thyme notes pop on the palate, where clean acidity and tight tannins provide a light frame and carry the flavors toward a caramelized finish.
title: Windrun 2015 Vintage Selection No. 12 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A barrel-selection, top-of-the-line cuvée, this is intensely aromatic with black cherry, soft leather and baking spices in play. Flavors focus in the midpalate, leading into supple tannins and a smattering of cocoa powder. Overall it's a big wine, full flavored, balanced and already drinking very well.
title: Bethel Heights 2015 Casteel Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Deep and dark in the glass, this bottling from a family-owned winery shows aromas of cola spice, wild cherry, cocoa dust and game. On the palate, rich black-cherry fruit is expertly cut by accents of dried sagebrush and licorice. Persistent, bountiful acidity carries it to a black raspberry-inflected finish.
title: Boekenoogen 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is all Pommard clone Pinot from a vineyard in the McMinnville AVA. It's loaded with ripe, fleshy cherry fruit and suggestions of steely minerality, typical of the terroir. Big, full, delicious and nicely balanced, it wraps up with a yummy chocolaty finish.
title: DanCin 2015 Écarté Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This bottling's core of black cherry fragrance is wrapped in sugar plum, balsamic, allspice and nutmeg notes, combining elegance and power. Mulberry and wild cherry flavors show on the palate, lifted by baking spice and gingerbread accents and balanced by solid acidity and tannins. A sagebrush note pops on the finish.
title: Decroux 2015 Rosemary's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Finely chopped herb notes, recalling marjoram, thyme and anise, combine with with dried rose and red cherry aromas on the delicately wild nose of this bottling. The palate adds forest floor flavors to its dark red fruit, making for a heady expression that grows in complexity sip after sip.
title: Chanin 2015 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This succulent wine's brawny earth is steadied by fresh acidity, adding tart flavors of tangy rhubarb, cranberry and rose. Crushed rock and dried herb notes add savory complexity and texture, but it's the pretty aromas that ultimately seize the day.
title: Siduri 2015 Parsons' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a fabulous example of a light, balanced wine from the Santa Lucia Highlands, which is perhaps better known for richness. It shows savory aromas of smoked cherries, nose-tickling sage, juniper-laced sausage and cayenne pepper. The palate is energetic, with a pleasant viscosity that carries its cranberry, cherry, thyme, oregano and sandalwood flavors into the finish.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Earthy notes of sweet beets and mushroom mingle amidst violet and lavender in this beautifully fragrant, complex wine. It's brisk and fresh with acidity yet penetrating in black cherry and currant flavors. Dense, deeply penetrating tannins frame a long, bold finish.
title: Thörle 2015 Saulheimer Kalkstein Unfiltriert Trocken Spätburgunder (Rheinhessen)

description: This wine shows a touch of spicy, smoky oak from aging in 20% new French barrels, setting off powerful fruity, earthy flavors that create a complex, layered and fascinating personality. It's full bodied, mouth-filling and moderately tannic.
designation: Family Reserve Selezione Susie Toulouse Vineyard
title: Sante Arcangeli 2015 Family Reserve Selezione Susie Toulouse Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Rich red cherry, rust, smoke and crushed gravel aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the historic vineyard. Smoked meat, lavender and rose petal notes play with cranberry, pomegranate and hibiscus flavors, creating a pleasant mix of delicate and savory elements.
title: Fess Parker 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Juicy, penetrating raspberry fruit launches this tight young wine into the center of the palate. The overall balance and prominent acidity suggests that it is a good cellar candidate. Drink 2020 to 2030, and aerate aggressively if you plan to pop it in the near term.
title: Alexana 2015 Zena Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Quite light in color, this wine has a ton to like, starting with its thyme, oregano, juniper and tart cranberry aromas. The palate is overloaded with energy, showing snappy raspberry, kalamata olive and iron-rich mineral notes. A great example of fresh Pinot Noir.
title: Weatherborne 2015 La Encantada Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: From a Green Valley vineyard high on a ridge, this is an exceptional and softly layered wine, with cola, plum and black cherry notes. Offering length and breadth with moderate acidity and oak, it's dark and brooding in all the best ways.
title: Sojourn 2015 Riddle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Lightly smoky and spicy oak nuances top off this deeply fruity and concentrated wine, which has firm tannins and good acidity to support its richness. Almost-sweet plum and black cherry notes form its core, while vanilla and baking spice notes complete the picture.
title: Jackson Estate 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This barrel selection is loaded with tart cherry and blackberry fruit. Scents and accents bring hints of bread, butter, vanilla and coffee. The finish is lengthy and detailed, with no fall off in complexity. It was aged 18 months in roughly half new French oak.
title: Lachini 2015 Cuvée Giselle Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: The name Septette references seven blocks planted to seven clones in the estate vineyard. The fruit flavors mix red berries and purple plums, with some tangy tropical details. It's big, plush, delicious and finished unfined and unfiltered.
title: DanCin 2015 Septette Pinot Noir (Southern Oregon)

description: This bottling smells much like a bundle of freshly cleared sagebrush, with hints of fennel, charred tomato, wood, cola and wild black cherry. Its extremely soft mouthfeel massages the tongue with lush tannins, and its black cherry richness is cut by tart pomegranate-like acidity and lifted by cocoa, coffee and ginger spice notes.
title: Boekenoogen 2015 3 Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: From 100% Pommard clone grapes, this ripe and luscious wine is packed with razor-sharp, brambly-berry fruit. Lively minerality underscores the ample acidity, keeping the wine fresh and focused. The extended finish is pleasantly peppery.
title: Dowsett Family 2015 Becklin Vineyards Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This Pinot, from the cool climes of the unsung region of North Canterbury, is downright sultry. This shows a dense nose of blue fruit, cherry, chocolate, baking spice and violets, while the palate slinks with tart cherry and earth, hugged by elegant, fine grained tannins and a long, chocolatey finish. Drink now–2022.
title: Mt. Beautiful 2015 Pinot Noir (Canterbury)

description: With a melody of earth, ripe strawberry, dried leaves, iron, and coffee tones on the nose, the palate of this wine is backed by silky tannins, plush red fruit and a long meaty finish. Drink around a campfire on the first chilly night in fall.
title: Rockburn 2015 Devil's Staircase Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: This fine, small-production wine offers heavenly lavender and rose aromas and a seductive texture brightened with fresh acidity. Juicy strawberry, cherry and cola flavors contrast its earthy black tea and forest notes.
title: Siduri 2015 Ewald Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The vineyard is in the Chehalem Mountains AVA, though the label simply reads Willamette Valley. Light toast and dark fruits abound, with black cherry, char and roasted-coffee flavors leading the charge. Utterly delicious, this is a fine single-vineyard offering from Adam Lee. The barrel aging is subtle and complex, with a hint of coconut in the finish.
title: Siduri 2015 Muirfield Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: From one of the larger estates in the Edna Valley, this wine has sweet-smelling plum, cherry candy and grenadine aromas. The palate is front-loaded with sagebrush, thyme, dried lavender and rosemary notes, while a hibiscus flavor unfolds in the background.
title: Chamisal Vineyards 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Subtle aromas of mulberry, mace and vanilla meet with more intriguing notes of animal blood, rust and iodine on the nose of this bottling by Jennifer Hoage. Snappy and tart raspberry pops on the palate alongside forest underbrush and sandalwood. It's a great, balanced and even-handed entry point for those looking to explore the less ripe side of the grape.
title: Decroux 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There's a potent smoky character on the nose of this bottling, with hickory and oak aromas wrapped around the strawberry and plum flavors. The palate is fresher in a note of red plum, yet smoke, salt, peppercorn and oregano tones pervade. It's savory without being rich, showing a strong backbone of acidity.
title: Landmark 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Light in the glass, this bottling by Winemaker Lane Tanner offers plum, red cherry, baked earth, shredded slate and a hint of vanilla-laced croissant on the nose. The palate shows energetic acidity and a grippy texture, with underripe strawberry, plum skin and green-peppercorn tones.
title: Lumen 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Earthy aromas of pepper spice, roasted meat crust and red cherry sauce show on the nose of this bottling from a new property in Ojai. The flavors are clean yet pleasantly rustic, full of cooked herbs, dust and rounded cranberry. It's light in body, soft in texture and easy to drink.
title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine is brooding in aromas of dark fruit, earth, cola, chocolate, dried herbs and a whiff of smoke that carry to a toasty, medium-bodied palate, leading to a medicinal, herbal and oaky finish. The structure and fine tannins of this wine suggest it will age into something quite lovely. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Ata Rangi 2015 Pinot Noir (Martinborough)

description: A slight hint of ripe, red cherry appears on the nose. The palate has a gentle, red-fruited freshness and a juicy generosity. A slight frame of tannins provides a gentle structure in this honest, fresh-faced and highly appetizing Pinot Noir.
title: Mayer am Pfarrplatz 2015 Nussberg Pinot Noir (Vienna)

description: There's an overt richness to this wine, with bold aromas and flavors of muddled berries and cherries that are hit by cocoa powder and Dr. Pepper. The medium-weight palate boasts a surprisingly firm and structured texture, with the lingering grip countering the ample ripe fruit. Drink now–2023.
title: Meerlust 2015 Pinot Noir (Stellenbosch)

description: High-toned red fruit is complemented by citrus-squeezed vibrancy in this full-bodied red, that presents as fleshy on the palate. A grit of oak adds power to the lengthy spicy finish.
title: David Bruce 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This vintage of a widely available bottling is a solid everyday sipper for the price, with aromas of star anise, fresh red cherry and snappy hibiscus punch. The palate is fresh and vibrant with raspberry fruit, thyme and white pepper dust, with a warm baking-spice note on the finish.
title: Carmel Road 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: Rose, hibiscus and pistachio mark the aromatic profile of this hearty, well-made wine, dipping into juicy, succulent and bright layers of blueberry and black cherry. A round rich tannin structure provides a welcome fleshiness, with a backbone of acidity.
title: Merry Edwards 2015 Coopersmith Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is made in a light nuanced style, and is somewhat shy at first on the nose. Perfumed rose eventually comes through to accent welcoming, bright flavors of orange and red cherry. The oak is tight-grained and supportive.
title: Ousterhout 2015 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A rose petal aroma starts things off in this wine, while the palate provides a delicate rendering of rhubarb, strawberry and forest floor flavors, buoyed by a gravelly texture and balanced ripeness.
title: Sean Minor 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Plonk this on the table at just about any dinner party and it's bound to be enjoyed by all. Be it the appealing nose of red-currant jelly, flowers and savory, stony minerality, or the silky, plush-fruited, light-on-its-feet palate, this easy-drinking wine from one of New Zealand's biggest names offers a lot.
title: Villa Maria 2015 Cellar Selection Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Dried herbs, plums, blueberries, bark and a little dusty oak coalesce in this wine from one of the better known single vineyards in the Awatere Valley. Lean, light and crisp, the palate comes with tart red fruit, more drying herbs and some toasty oak notes on the finish.
title: Villa Maria 2015 Taylors Pass Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Currently, notes of mocha and chocolate-covered cherry lead the nose of this wine, but there's earthy nuance and restrained red-fruit notes underneath that suggest this wine could benefit from a bit more time for full expression. The structured tannins provide a crushed-velvet texture that retains good grip through the close, with cherry- and plum-skin flavors that carry on through the lingering spicy finish. Try in late 2018 and through 2022.
title: Paul Cluver 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Elgin)

description: Made from biodynamic-certified grapes grown on a coastal-influenced property, this wine is bright in cherry and cardamom spice, with fully realized elements of forest pine, gravel and pomegranate. Fully oaked and somewhat tannic in its youth, it shows vigor and vibrancy as it finishes.
title: Benziger 2015 De Coelo Abore Sacra Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Smokey and earthy in style, notes of charred meat, blackberry, black olive and dried oregano are all followed by a savory palate with medium tannins. This is a love/hate wine where winemaking prowess overpowers terroirs.
title: Cloudy Bay 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Cola, Montmorency cherry juice, star anise and sagebrush aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's soft, easy and familiar on the palate, with clove spice giving depth to the cooked raspberry and strawberry flavors.
title: Foley 2015 Bar Lazy S Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Highly aromatic notes of raspberry and wild strawberry immediately charm the nose. These notes carry to a rich flourish across the supple palate. There is warmth countered by lovely freshness and some bite. A wine with immense charm.
title: Schandl 2015 Pinot Noir (Burgenland)

description: Reserve aromas of black cherry, plum, clove and tarragon-crusted roast pork show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines pomegranate and rhubarb with subtle star anise spice, proving altogether delicate and easy to drink.
title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Zoto Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This opens with bright red-cherry and strawberry aromas that are supported by a minty-mocha accent. The palate offers more herbal impression, in waves of fresh mint and licorice that sit atop the fruit core. Oodles of cocoa and woodspice unfold on the lush finish, with some lingering tannic grip and persistence. Drink now–2022.
title: Botanica 2015 The Mary Delany Collection Pinot Noir (Western Cape)

description: This is a fresh light spicy wine that's well balanced and flavorful without overdoing the body or extract. It blends red cherry, cinnamon, vanilla and strawberry and has good acidity and a touch of tannin to heighten the mouthfeel.
title: Cherry Pie 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County-Santa Barbara County)

description: From a selection of clones and vineyard sites, this affordable varietal wine offers forest pine, cardamom and pomegranate, the fruit elusive within its more savory nature.
title: Friedeman 2015 Dichotomy Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Made from Bacigalupi Vineyard fruit, which is located on Westside Road, this wine offers a generous bouquet and outlay of dark cherry, baked vanilla, toasted oak and forest notes, its heart savory and tart in additional characteristics of clove, cranberry and pomegranate.
title: Gracianna 2015 Westside Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Gentle red cherry fruit appears on the nose and swishes across the juicy palate where tannins and freshness provide a frame for all the cherry abundance. This majors on delicious fruit but comes with a lovely grip.
title: Höpler 2015 Pinot Noir (Burgenland)

description: Candied cherry dominates in this densely concentrated wine, its tannins pronounced. Rose petal aromatics contribute a savory underbrush added to by forest, black tea and cardamom characteristics, as lasting acidity provides freshness.
title: Ancien 2015 Toyon Farm Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Cherry, grenadine and rose petal mix on the nose of this vineyard-designate, which is creamy and fully rich on the palate, with a touch of gravel. Vanilla shows through on the grip of oak.
title: Gracianna 2015 Estate Mercedes Riverblock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Dry spicy aromas of tomato leaf and oak are fiery more than finessed or fruity. This is another 15% PN from Clos des Fous, and it's round, creamy and a bit low on acidity. Cherry, chocolaty oak and related barrel spice flavors finish full and plump.
title: Clos des Fous 2015 Pucalán Arenaria Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Costa)

description: Just-ripe cherry and raspberry fruits open the nose of this restrained Pinot Noir, with touches of mocha and oak that lend depth. The medium-weight palate shows good balance between the ripe fruit flavors, ample acidity and fine tannins, while the finish boasts a kiss of warm, woody spice. Drink now–2020.
title: Boschendal 2015 Appellation Series Pinot Noir (Elgin)

description: Smoky oak dominates on the nose of this burly wine, a study in black cherry, cola and sanguine undertones of forest, rose and meat. Moderate in acidity, it presents as fully fleshy and ripe, with a soft smooth texture.
title: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Intensely forested, this wine's fruit is compressed and tightly packed on the palate, with the texture somewhat gravelly in nature. Spicy nutmeg rides alongside cranberry, raspberry, plum and orange flavors, all wrapped in a medium-bodied frame.
title: Portalupi 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This marks the debut of consulting winemaker Matthew Courtney's take on the estate site. It dazzles in complex notes of exotic Asian spice, lavender and crushed rock, while focused acidity provides a context of substance and depth.
title: MacPhail 2015 Mardikian Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Though still exploring the zesty acid-driven side of Pinot Noir, Marc Piro adds depth and richness to this bottling. Red cherry compote and cordial meet fennel, dill, tarragon and tapenade on the nose. The extremely lively and fresh palate unleashes an array of flower petals, just-pressed tart berries and Kalamata olives. A deep structure and thorough acidity complete the picture.
title: Piro 2015 Presqu'ile Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Despite amazingly luscious aromas of star anise, stewed black cherry, black currant pie and coffee cake, this bottling still offers a prominent line of wet gravel and river stone minerality on the nose. Exotic mulberry and black cherry flavors ride atop the soft tannins and an underlying acidity, while white pepper dust and menthol unfold on the finish.
title: Walt 2015 Rita's Crown Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a stunning Pinot Noir, especially from a Syrah-focused winery. Beautiful aromas of lavender, thyme, wild mint and dewy spring sage meet with crushed graphite and fresh raspberries on the nose. The palate coalesces those elements expertly, with red cherry and strawberry syrup dusted by herbs and finished by licorice, all presented on a soft yet engaging texture.
title: Zaca Mesa 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: The very intriguing nose of this bottling by a winery that explores all types of Pinot Noir sites and styles shows sarsaparilla, sandalwood, incense and fresh boysenberry aromas. The palate is all about freshness, with blackberry and black raspberry flavors lifted by anise, peppercorns and wild thyme. Great depth and verve throughout.
title: Tantara 2015 Zotovich Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Crisp acidity buoys sharp red fruit in this delectable wine—a blend of multiple sites across the appellation. Medium build, it shows youthful tannins and oak that supports without intrusion, allowing the crunch of cranberry, strawberry and pomegranate to speak forcefully.
title: Gary Farrell 2015 Russian River Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Very light in the glass, this fascinating exploration of the underripe side of Pinot Noir shows green olive and crushed cherry tomato aromas on the nose, with prevalent bay leaf, green peppercorn and pine resin. Those elements converge on the sip to make a cranberry, spicy herb and eucalyptus nut tea, which is tangy and complex.
title: Ryan Cochrane 2015 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: On the western edge of the appellation, in what locals call the Sebastopol Hills, this wine shows its provenance well, imparting wild, exotic aromas and flavors of crunchy red fruit and Asian spice. Silky, savory and inviting, it's also pretty, with impressive depth, persistent acidity and chunks of turned earth and pine.
title: MacPhail 2015 Pratt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: There's intensely sharp fruit character on the nose of this bottling from a single clone and block in this historic vineyard, with candied raspberry and pomegranate aromas that are leveled by Early Grey tea and pressed purple flowers. The palate is extremely lively and tightly structured, with dark boysenberry and candied raspberry flavors that rise into a minty finish.
title: El Lugar 2015 Rincon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: Blue and red fruit wrap around ample, tangy acidity in this medium-bodied, velvety textured wine, so classically styled for the appellation. Pomegranate, rhubarb and floral rose are all highlighted along its gradual evolution in the glass.
title: Siduri 2015 Bellflower Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a remarkable, lovely wine, made from a site in the extremes of Annapolis. It is delightfully complex and layered, with a richly concentrated palate of dark cherry, blueberry and Asian five spice, with spikes of sea breeze and tea.
title: La Crema 2015 Shell Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Fresh raspberry sorbet aromas meet with an herbal edge of pine oil, eucalyptus leaf, green peppercorn and dark sandalwood on the very compelling nose of this bottling by Edgar Torres. It's extremely lively on the palate, light in body but heavy in acid and tannic structure, with wild thyme, mint and sage decorating the mellow red-fruit flavors.
title: Hug 2015 Rancho Ontiveros Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Fresh and easy aromas of raspberry, plum candy, dark rose petals, boysenberry and allspice show on the nose of this clonal study. The palate blends big, joyous purple fruit and grippy tannic tension, also presenting lavender and Sichuan peppercorn tones.
title: Fess Parker 2015 Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This elegant bottling is named after the late actor-turned-vintner's daughter, who still runs the company. It features well-integrated aromas of cherry, rhubarb and smoke. That smoke also shows on the palate, where piquant raspberry, dried lavender, thyme, rosemary and allspice sizzle toward a lively finish.
title: Fess Parker 2015 Ashley's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Juicy and earthy, this lovely appellation wine is voluptuous with a spicy thread. Blueberry and huckleberry fruit meld seamlessly into savory bites of tree bark and forest as the whole offers length and breadth.
title: Patz & Hall 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Candied red fruits of raspberry and pomegranate meet with rhubarb pie, sweet thyme and ripe tomato on the nose of this bottling by a San Francisco accountant-turned-vintner. It's supple and soft on the palate, with more tomato flavors as well as fennel pollen and tarragon.
title: Ryan Cochrane 2015 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Fresh aromas of carnation, framboise, cherry cola and blooming rose petals show on the nose of this bottling by Coby Parker-Garcia. Bright flavors of hibiscus tea, pomegranate and raspberry ride a clean line of crushed thyme and peppercorn dust on the lively palate.
title: El Lugar 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Dark purple flowers and tart boysenberry paste show on the nose of this intensely concentrated wine, alongside pencil shavings, bay lead and a lot of iron minerality. More bay leaf and pine needle show on the herbally full and texturally grippy palate, giving minty spice to the dark fruit flavors.
title: Tantara 2015 Dierberg Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Lilacs and wisteria combine for a floral and approachable nose in this clonal study, which is also loaded with clove, peppercorn, rosemary and elderberry aromas. It's soft and lush on the palate, with rich plum and black cherry flavors leveled by notes of anise, potpourri, fresh mint and Earl Grey tea.
title: Fess Parker 2015 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Marc Piro continued to hone his craft under Jim Clendenen at Au Bon Climat, and that expertise shows in this bottling, which combines Presqu'ile and Bien Nacido Vineyards to produce a wine that's both zesty in the underripe style yet full of fruit as well. Aromas of wild oregano, thyme, tapenade and red cherry lead into a palate full of tantalizing acidity, with tart Montmorency cherry, tangy tomato and fennel spice.
title: Piro 2015 Points West Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This elegant bottling by two service-industry veterans shows tons of potpourri, dried lavender, black raspberry and red plum on the nose. The flavors are quite broad and inviting, with hibiscus and ripe tomato meshing into juniper and clove. It's light in mouthfeel and weight, but well structured.
title: Point & Line 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Elegant and beautiful aromas of Montmorency cherry, tart orange peel and balsamic fig reduction sauce prove precise and show some mature vine age. Roasted fig flavors meet with salt and pepper seasonings on the palate, which is well structure and full of bright acidity.
title: Tantara 2015 La Encantada Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Beet and plum juice aromas meet with hearty clove and juniper spice on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard located 16 miles from the Pacific Ocean. It's a dark and deep expression on the sip, with blackberry, wet earth and pine-forest flavors, proving quite muscular and manly, with a menthol lift on the finish.
title: Tantara 2015 Lindsay's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Fresh and lean as a sea breeze and tautly wrought in tense acidity, this memorable wine is bright and crisp. The palate shows earthy flavors met by subtle notes of black cherry and strawberry.
title: Metzker Family Estates 2015 Laurent Fort Ross Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: With a fruity exuberance of crisp cranberry and red cherry, this wine delights in touches of nuanced herb and earth. Light bodied and refreshing, it maintains elegant complexity and depth, a lovely example of site and winemaking.
designation: Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled
title: Balletto 2015 Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Cherry liqueur, candied rose petals, rhubarb, sweet truffle and wet earth converge for a very sultry and dynamic nose on this bottling, showing that quite a bit of complexity can come from one clone. Well-integrated flavors of dark red fruit, vanilla and nutmeg show on the sip, which is woven together by persistent acidity.
title: Fess Parker 2015 Clone 2A Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Very light in the glass, this bottling shows tons of underripe cranberry, dried rose petals, marjoram, white pepper and tangy olives on the nose. The light-bodied palate shows similar qualities, with fully extracted flavors of tart red fruits, purple flowers and white tea.
title: Point & Line 2015 Gold Coast Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Aromas of cherries baked in a flaky vanilla crust meet with cola, fresh boysenberry and damp herbs on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Bright raspberry shows on the lighter-framed and very energetic palate, with flavors of fennel frond, dried marjoram and a gravel-laced minerality.
title: Cattleya 2015 Donum Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Concentrated aromas of violets and rose buds meet with black raspberry on the nose of this bottling. Quite light in the glass, it's full of tart red-fruit flavors, from cranberry to red-plum skins, with herbal tones on the midpalate: oregano, marjoram and dried lavender. The finish is grippy and driven by menthol.
title: Point & Line 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Earthy and brawny in pungent compost aromas, this wine has a citrus-laden edge of crisp mineral and bitterroot. Full-bodied and richly layered, its fruit components are dipped in baked rhubarb and black tea.
title: Siduri 2015 Van Der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)

description: Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this opens with aromas of raspberry, Alpine herb and a balsamic note. The juicy palate doles out ripe strawberry, mineral and a hint of baking spice alongside supple tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Andriano 2015 Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)

description: The nose of this bottling begins with juniper and chaparral scents, building toward black cherry fruit and cola spice. Cooked red plum and cranberry flavors emerge on the palate, where oregano, pine and eucalyptus touches add nuance.
title: Sandler 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: What a great value! This medium-bodied wine has spicy oak accents and mouth-filling fruit flavors. It's ripe and generous, with plump cherry and raspberry notes and a palate marked by mild tannins and soft texture.
title: Three Thieves 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This wine has benefited from the warm vintage. It's ripe with attractive cherry fruit and a touch of spice from wood aging. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015 Grande Cuvée  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune)

description: The nose of this bottling is pleasant and straightforward, with light red cherry, rose petal and earth aromas. Bright acidity on the palate reveals raspberry fruit accented with oregano and thyme, proving complex enough for a weeknight dinner but not a showstopper.
title: August West 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Light in color, this wine from the cooperative of the Hautes Côtes comes from vineyards in the hills to the west of Nuits-St.-Georges. It's an attractive, smoky wine with enough tannins and acidity to age for a while longer. Red berry and cherry flavors are cut with a crisp texture and firmness. Drink from 2019.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: This 100% Pinot Nero opens with aromas of red currant and baking spice. The lively palate delivers red cherry, black tea and a hint of ginger alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.
title: Kössler 2015 Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)

description: Produced by the cooperative of the Hautes Côtes, this wine is bright and fruity. It has light tannins and warm, red cherry character. With its acidity and structure it could age, although not for long. Drink from 2018.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Beaune

description: This widely available bottling is a shy on the nose in terms of fruit, showing instead crushed gravel and wet rock aromas. The palate brims with chalky texture and loamy soil, sagebrush and bay leaf flavors.
title: San Simeon 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: This is a smooth wine with gentle tannins and red berry fruit. It has juicy acidity and a slight toastiness from oak. With spice and acidity, it will be an attractive wine to drink from 2018.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015  Beaune

description: A substantial dose of fruit and good, grippy texture make this hearty wine ready for any protein dishes. It has full body, tasty black cherry and plum flavors and moderate tannins that lend structure.
title: Angeline 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

description: Earthy leafy aromas suggest compost. This feels lean in the middle but also creamy. Spicy oaky flavors of clay and dried red fruits are light and inoffensive.
title: Domaine Bousquet 2015 Reserve Made With Organic Grapes Pinot Noir (Tupungato)

description: Jammy aromas and equally ripe sweet fruit flavors give this wine a candied character. It's full-bodied and feels a little warm on the finish.
title: Sand Point 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Intense baked plum and black cherry aromas meet with vanilla, caramel and sagebrush on the nose of this bottling from one of the appellation's most coveted vineyards. The tangy, energetic and grippy palate offers crushed cranberry flavors, more black plum, gingerbread and exotic Indian spice on the finish.
title: Loring Wine Company 2015 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Young Pinot Noir can sometimes dazzle you with juicy expressive downright sensational fruit, as this does. Though tasted prior to its official release, the wine drinks beautifully, offering a big hit of citrus flesh and rind along with lovely raspberry and blueberry fruit. It's forward, fresh, balanced tightly against its lush acidity, and is already just about irresistible.
