title: Toil Oregon 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A lush and expressive bottling from a brand new vineyard, this shows candied black cherry, Vietnamese coffee, baking spice and licorice on the approachable nose. The ripeness extends to the palate, hemmed in by a tannic structure that ensures long aging. Asian pepper, rum barrel, caramel and cherry flavors complete the picture.
title: Claiborne & Churchill 2015 Greengate Ranch & Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Right on the heels of their excellent 2014 version, this ups the ante still further. Young and forward, it's nonetheless well-balanced and ready for prime-time drinking. Bright raspberry and cherry fruit abounds, with the freshness and supporting acidity to age nicely for up to a decade.
title: Laelaps 2015 Nemarniki Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This intriguing category—white wine made from red grapes—finds another winner in this new release from Aberrant Cellars. A pale copper hue, it's rich and full bodied, loaded with flavors of poached pear. Highlights of pepper and toast give way to a finish that somehow suggests Butterfinger candy. It's flat-out gorgeous from start to finish.
title: Aberrant Cellars 2015 Philtrum Blanc Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Despite the rather high listed alcohol, this looks and feels elegant, even refined. The well-balanced barrel treatment puts highlights of toast and caramel around fruit flavors that sing of spicy plum cake.
title: Iris Vineyards 2015 Bayliss-Bower Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: A gentle lift of crushed black cherry rises from the glass. There also is an edge of medicinal herb. The body is light and juicy, fresh and highly aromatic. There is concentration without weight, luxuriant fruit without plumpness. This is fresh and pure, lifted and profound. An utterly honest and uplifting rendition of Pinot Noir.
title: Domaine Ostertag 2015 Fronholz Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This fascinating, distinctive wine has a frame of grapefruity citrus around peppery pomegranates. It's well knit, textural, and finishes with more citrus rind phenolics. It's sleek and polished, though not a opulently fruity as the listed alcohol might suggest.
title: Iris Vineyards 2015 La Cantera Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Pure notes of black cherry rise from the glass. The palate comes in with equal purity and quite some concentration. There is a creamy richness countering that fresh crunchy cherry fruit which shimmers and shines. This is medium bodied, bone dry but juicy and wonderfully aromatic, even elegant.
title: Clément Klur 2015 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Orange-cranberry in color and medium in body, this wine is sourced from three vineyards. It shows bright cherry, raspberry and orange flavors, with a lift of acidity. Juicy on the finish, it refreshes and rewards in depth and complexity.
title: Ousterhout 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: While light-bodied, gentle and intricate, this wine offers plenty of flavor nuances. Cranberry and herb tea aromas mark the nose, while the mouthfeel is at once soothing and tangy, with mulled cherry and clove aromas that slowly emerge and persist on the finish. It's a treat to sip and savor.
title: Phillips Hill 2015 Boontling Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Stewed black plum and tangy black cherry fruit meet baking spice and cola on the nose of this bottling from Lompoc-based Brian Loring. The palate is tangy with black cherry and cranberry, with a touch of herbs and forest floor.
title: Loring Wine Company 2015 Kessler-Haak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There is a hint of flinty reduction that still clings to the nose. Underneath that is shy crisp red-cherry fruit. The palate adds glimpses of lifted conifer aromas to that. There is lightness and a very fine structure, but also depth. This is very elegant and understated but all the more touching for that. The finish is totally refreshing and dry.
title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2015 Réserve Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Plush, lush and warmly seasoned in Asian spice, this wine offers length and balance, with a delicate layering of black cherry and cola flavors.
title: Cobden Wini 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Notes of freshly turned soil and rich forest fruits mix on the nose. That interplay of earthy energy, fruity lift and richness constantly repeats itself on the lively, dry and rustically grippy body. This is full of juiciness and life and finishes with a little exuberant heat. This is unusual and rustic, but also very charming.
title: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2015 Alsace Rouge Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: There is a wonderfully heady hint of elderberry on the nose. On the light-footed but structured palate, elderberry is joined by fresh dark-cherry hints. There is something darkly alluring about this. The elderberry lingers on the dry finish. This is lovely now but will develop. Drink now through 2023.
title: François Baur 2015 Schlittweg Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This is the best of the 2015 vineyard designates from Soléna. It's a pretty wine with bright raspberry fruit. There's a gentle touch of stem, which helps to frame it, and a dark vein of espresso and cacao running through the tannins.
title: Soléna 2015 Prince Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: From the coastal ridges of the appellation, this lovely wine is tart in strawberry, pomegranate and orange, with a beautiful floral element that lifts the pronounced acidity and darker, more savory forest-floor tones. Spicy and complex, it hits the palate with an intriguing twist of sea spray.
title: Gary Farrell 2015 Fort Ross Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)

description: Wonderful complexity and an appealing earthiness help this mouth-watering wine stand out. It has earthy, forest-floor aromas and bold but not overtly ripe flavors like rhubarb and sour cherry while the texture is nervy and alive with good acidity and moderate tannins. It's worth a search for something this unique.
title: Phillips Hill 2015 Oppenlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

description: Strong cinnamon and clove aromas lead to bold, ripe black-cherry and cassis flavors in this full-bodied, well-structured and ultimately nuanced wine. It has lots of grip on the palate from firm tannins and bright acidity, while the spicy oak flavors last all the way to the finish.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

description: Sagebrush, French toast and raspberry-syrup aromas make for a dynamic and delicious nose on this bottling. Then chaparral spice meets with salt, pepper, bay leaf and juniper on the palate, spicing up the ripe dark-red fruits.
title: Foley 2015 T Anchor Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Great structure and a brilliant sense of restraint make this vividly flavored and medium-bodied wine a keeper—and nearly as good as the winery's vineyard designates. A couple of years in a cellar or cool closet will enhance its red cherry, tea leaf and rhubarb flavors while softening the rather lean texture just a bit. The wine is elegant, appetizing and will be best after 2020.
title: Phillips Hill 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Rich, heady notes of cola, charred meat, currant, earth and stones are followed by a silky, peppery palate with more currant notes and an earthy core. Perfect for fire side sipping, and at a great price to boot.
title: Sileni 2015 Plateau Reserve Pinot Noir (Hawke's Bay)

description: This is a stunning wine that highlights the beauty and complexity to be found from a South African Pinot Noir. Minty fynbos and forest notes greet the nose upon first whiff, followed by a core of rich cherry and currant tones that are dusted by earth and cola spice. A subtle umami-like, wild-mushroom accent lends additional depth. The medium-weight palate boasts a satiny texture that's full of ripe fruit expression, yet not overdone. The long, evolving finish transitions seamlessly from fleshy berry to cherry skin then earth and bark before landing on a note of lightly toasted oak. Well balanced and complete, this is delicious now but should cellar and develop well through 2026.
title: The Drift 2015 There Are Still Mysteries Pinot Noir (Overberg)

description: This is a complex and compelling wine from one of Hawkes Bay's top producers. Cherry and orange notes mingle with black olive, cracked pepper, smoke and cumin. These lead into a medium body, with balanced acidity and silky tannins. Drink with a wide variety of Middle Eastern cuisine.
title: Trinity Hill 2015 Pinot Noir (Hawke's Bay)

description: Smoked pork, dark soil, forest floor, purple flowers and dark-purple fruit show on the nose of this bottling. Rust and dried hibiscus petals are evident on the sip along with potpourri-laced cranberry and carnation flavors. It is quite complex and tasty.
title: Foley 2015 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: As the last bottling of this vineyard from this producer, this is a fine way to go out. It's a salty, gravelly and complex red, aromatic in rose, lavender and orange blossom. Tart acidity uplifts the weightier aspect of the present tannins, as dried herb, sea spray and black tea season the fruit.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Hirsch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: From the site around the winery on Westside Road—which is planted to heirloom clones—this wine has a refrained, balanced approach to ripeness, showing focused black cherry, black tea and baked rhubarb tones. The moderate structure allows for a soft, layered texture that could use more time in bottle. Enjoy best from 2020–2025.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Williams Selyem Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A fruity nose opens the way to piquant, tart acidity in this coastal cool-climate wine. Concentrated extracted flavors of pomegranate and Bing cherry dominate, rounded by a grit of texture and cola spice.
title: Benziger 2015 De Coelo Quintus Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: There's a compelling mix of sweeter fruit and dry earth on the nose of this bottling, with strawberry compote and rusty rock aromas along with a vanilla-laced brioche. The palate loses the ripe fruit a bit, instead showing tighter and fresh flavors of black raspberry with anise, white pepper and sagebrush, proving quite sleek and restrained in style.
title: Black Kite 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This well-named project comes from a seaside vineyard that may get the last direct sunlight of the entire Central Coast, and the cool-climate aspects thrive. Aromas of dewy sagebrush, shaved pine and myrrh mix with mulberry and underripe raspberry on the nose. The mouthfeel is full while the flavors are tart with tangy cranberry cherry tomato and Kalamata olive, leaving the palate refreshed.
title: Last Light 2015 Derbyshire Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: This is a concentrated, fleshy coastal wine, weighty in oak and tannin. The vibrancy comes via well-defined layers of cherry, wild strawberry and forest, with wisps of black tea and cardamom knocking on the door.
title: Davies 2015 Piedra Libre Vineyards Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: A gamy, earthy hint plays on the nose, while the palate reveals a rich seam of tart, red cherry fruit. Freshness and a web of superfine but firm tannins allow the fruit to shine and glow without stealing any of its limelight or purity. This is firm and graceful, with the merest sprinkling of rusticity. Lovely now but will evolve. Drink 2018–2028.
title: Loimer 2015 Dechant Langenlois Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)

description: Lots of spicy oak aromas and vivid, ripe, concentrated fruit animate this medium- to full-bodied wine that nevertheless has great acidity and firm tannins to support all that showy flavor. It smells like cinnamon and cherry tart, and tastes full of black cherry, sour cherry and cranberry. Best after 2021.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Burt Williams' Morning Dew Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Cranberry, hibiscus and rosewater converge on the soft, plush nose of this bottling, which also shows hints of star anise and baked goods. It's a light and playful wine on the sip, where juicy raspberries meet with gravelly minerality. This is light, fresh and full of long, simmering acidity.
title: Foley 2015 Rancho Santa Rosa Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Gritty in oak, this coastal appellation wine is bright and herbal, offering crisp, vibrant overtones of cranberry, pomegranate, strawberry and rose. A streak of fresh mint and lavender adds floral elements that contribute to its lovely profile of delicate elegance, supported by mellowed oak.
title: Merry Edwards 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The nose gives very little away. While the palate also still needs to unfold and blossom, it shows all of the elements needed for successful development. Ample freshness and a fine tannic grip showcase the beautifully pure red berry fruit. A beautifully understated and elegant wine, drink 2019–2028.
title: Schloss Gobelsburg 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)

description: Aromas of roasted red cherry, sharp black raspberry and herb-tinged smoked pork in mulberry sauce make for a mouthwatering entry to this bottling. The oak is strong on the palate, giving a vanilla overlay to the cranberry and rose petal flavors. A hint of juniper shows on the finish.
title: Landmark 2015 Overlook Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County-Sonoma County-Monterey County)

description: Low yields from a cool vintage make for a delicate nuanced experience in the glass in this perfumed velvety wine. Plum and cherry flavors are crisp and tart, with the acidity persistent. White pepper and ocean spray contribute context and complexity.
title: Flanagan 2015 Platt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Strong spice aromas and ripe, bold fruit flavors make this a powerful, extroverted wine with a lot of flavor impact. It seems to represent a style shift at Williams Selyem. Nutmeg, ginger and clove leap from the glass and laser-focused black-cherry flavors fill the palate, supported by firm tannins and acidity. Best after 2021.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Rich in fruit and oak flavors, this medium to full-bodied wine has cinnamon and cedar aromas, ripe black cherry and red-cherry flavors, a firm and rather tannic texture and an oaky spicy finish. A sense of warmth and sweetness makes it hard to resist.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Angel Camp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: The inviting nose on this bottling combines rich black cherry, zesty raspberry, allspice and dried ginger aromas. The palate delivers big fruit flavors of baked boysenberries and ripe cranberries, which are balanced by a bit of tartness.
title: Foley 2015 JA Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine is more full bodied and rich than first glance would suggest. It has a rather light red mahogany color. Generous strawberry and red-cherry flavors on a mouth-filling texture show light tannins and relatively soft acidity but plenty of viscosity. It was made from 100% Pommard clone vines and aged in 60% new French oak.
title: Foursight 2015 Charles Vineyard Clone 05 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Lovely aromas of exotic red cherries, sultry mace, spicy cinnamon and white sage show on the nose of this fresh and crisp bottling. There is ample peppery spice to the palate and a strong tannic tension, with flavors of Earl Grey tea, cranberry and pomegranate. Cherry compote shows on the finish.
title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Paso Robles isn't known for Pinot Noir, although this historic vineyard has been growing it successfully, and with plenty of aging ability, since 1964. Aromas of light berries, tarragon and sandalwood lead into a palate full of mint, fennel pollen, mulberry and dried plum, altogether exhibiting a li hing mui sort of character.
title: Adelaida 2015 HMR Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Adelaida District)

description: Herbal notes of menthol, garrigue and blackcurrant leaf are upfront on the bouquet of this wine, supported by red forest-berry fruits. Medium in weight and body, it offers fine yet present tannins that frame the red currant, strawberry and rhubarb fruit. Hints of sous bois and spicy oak dance on the earthy finish. Drink now–2023.
title: Chamonix 2015 Feldspar Pinot Noir (Franschhoek)

description: This lovely wine has a baked aspect to the fruit that makes it warm and welcoming. It's otherwise edgy in high-toned characteristics of rhubarb, cranberry, orange and forest floor, with bolts of cardamom throughout. Complex, the oak is prominent yet integrated.
title: Davies 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Winemaker Tom Mortimer also produces the outstanding Aubichon wines; this is his own label, and it offers exceptional value. It's stylish, modern and elegant, with precisely-defined raspberry fruit accented with sweet ripe tomato. The wine has a crisp sculpted mouthfeel, and just the slightest suggestion of barrel toast framing the finish.
title: Joleté 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: From the village at the southern end of the Côte de Beaune, this wine is warm and ripe, with great berry flavors and a good sense of structure from tannins and wood aging. It's packed with fruit and likely to age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Labouré-Roi 2015 Clos Rousseau Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: Dense in tannin and yet bristling in acidity, this youthful wine is still looking for its ultimate identity. Still, it works, as a complex, adolescent combination of cinnamon, clove, cola and dried herb.
title: Neyers 2015 Placida Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: As in 2014, this budget label from Paul O'Brien winery is a stunning value in an Oregon Pinot Noir. A total of 20% of the fruit was sourced from the Willamette Valley, and all was barrel aged for 10 months in 25% new French oak. Concentrated raspberry and cherry fruit is complemented with streaks of earth and bark. The texture is compelling, and the stiff tannins will continue to soften up over the next decade or so.
title: Oregon Territory 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: The name references a type of soil. The flavors combine red berries and a whiff of mushroom, along with spice, orange peel and citrus. The wine seems to tighten up through the midpalate, which leaves the finish feeling a bit restrained. Try giving it a good long decanting, or cellar till 2020.
title: Ruby 2015 Laurelwood Blend Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This has the pretty slightly candied flavors of a black-raspberry lifesaver, but with the extra dimensions of flavor that well-crafted wines provide. The acids are ample and the tannins light, but somehow this rather delicate wine carries gracefully on through a lingering layered finish. Nicely done, in a lovely package, and a fine value.
title: Black Magnolia 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This larger-production wine is sourced from several single-vineyard sites, including Rodgers Creek, Sangiacomo and Gap's Crown. Together they find unity in fruit-forward flavors of blueberry, cherry and pomegranate, the oak persistent and powerful amidst a backdrop of tight-grained tannin. The concentration is pronounced.
title: Sojourn 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Light and easy on the nose with hibiscus, cranberry and pomegranate notes, this bottling from a famous vineyard also picks up some crushed slate aromas as well. Compared to the many rich bottlings from this region, this is rather reserved on the sip, with tart cranberry, peppery spice and black tea flavors.
title: Testarossa 2015 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Bottled to celebrate the brand's 15th anniversary, this “Essence of Oregon” blend includes grapes from 35 different vineyards. It's a lively lovely wine, with spicy raspberry and cranberry fruit, framed in dark chocolate. Balancing acids keep it fresh and focused, and it has some of the lush jamminess of the better 2015 Beaujolais.
title: A to Z 2015 The Essence of Oregon Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Light pomegranate, red plum, cranberry and rose petals eventually show on the nose of this wine, which is somewhat simple at first. The palate delivers a solid sip, however, with snappy raspberry and graphite flavors, framed by grippy tannins and energetic acidity. Holds its own against much more expensive wines.
title: Estancia 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: This attractively perfumed wine shows the structure of Pommard without pushing too strongly. It has ripe red plum and cherry fruit that will balance the tannins as it ages. Drink from 2020.
title: Labouré-Roi 2015  Pommard

description: Pure Pommard, this has more concentration and forward fruit than the other single-block wines in this series. A pleasing mix of strawberry, raspberry and cherry flavors, along with a dash of flat seltzer, it carries through clean and refreshing to a moderately long finish with a hint of herb.
title: Winter's Hill 2015 Block 10 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This young wine brings scents of cola, truffle and black cherry. It's light and lively, with those flavors coming along with notes of chicken stock and a juicy mouthfeel. Though not a big wine, it's complex and interesting.
title: Winter's Hill 2015 Block 10 Whole Cluster Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Chocolaty oak aromas rest heavily atop notes of scrub brush, briar patch and red fruits. This Pinot feels juicy but scouring and grating. Flavors of buttery oak, plum and raspberry are both woody and tart, while this is punchy on the finish. Give this another year or two and it may knit together better than now.
title: Kingston Family 2015 Alazan Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Pale in color, this wine offers bright aromas of potpourri and strawberry. The red-fruit flavors are full in feel, seeming overweighted at times but still bringing enjoyment, with a mouthwatering finish.
title: Palencia 2015 Pinot Noir (Ancient Lakes)

description: Young and fragmented, this displays zigzag streaks of acid, purple plum, sour raspberry, citrus and wet rock. Time may well pull it together: at the moment it's a potpourri of not quite pulled together components.
title: Minimus 2015 Mariafeld Clone Johan Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Soft and pretty, this marries light spice to fruit flavors of apple and strawberry. Think blanc de noir without the sparkle and you're on the right trail. It's got substantial palate weight and a fairly thick mouthfeel.
title: Emerson 2015 White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Often cited by winemakers as their favorite clone, the Pommard reliably delivers round pretty cherry fruit. Here there are highlights of orange rind and non-carbonated lime soda. It's light and lively and most refreshing.
title: Winter's Hill 2015 Block 9 Pommard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Old vines lend a fine structure and density to this wine. It's not for longterm aging, with its ripe red plum fruit and generous texture, but is delicious now. Drink from early 2018.
title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Mercurey)

description: One of Oregon's best-kept secrets is this well-made budget-priced Pinot from Eola Hills. Aged in French and American oak for just under one year, it's labeled as a plain Oregon AVA, but it's 95% Willamette Valley fruit. That brings an extra dimension to the wine, with some tannic muscle and a streak of dried leaf and forest floor flavors along with ripe strawberry fruit.
title: Eola Hills 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Strong scents of cola and chocolate come up quickly from the glass, and those flavors notes override the light strawberry and cherry fruit. With a bit of breathing time they all combine gracefully, crafting a full forward wine with a pleasing creamy texture.
title: Gersing 2015 Madrona Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This single clone, single-block wine offers a well-defined, tight and concentrated streak of pretty cherry fruit. It's underpinned with minerality, and carries on through a clear, crisp finish.
title: Winter's Hill 2015 Block 9 114 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Ripe with a warm character, this wine has both bright red berry fruit and a rich, generous structure. Its fruitiness shows that it's still young—its acidity very much upfront. It will fill out and develop richness with time in bottle. Drink from 2020.
title: Labouré-Roi 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: An extremely light and lithe take on the region, this shows light red fruit and a gravel and riverstone quality on the nose. There is chalky structure to the sip, with tart and bright red plum skin flavors, but it's rather dull overall, albeit cleanly made.
title: Sandler 2015 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: One of a pair of wines from the estate vineyard, this is medium bodied and modest in all proportions. Light citrus and cherry flavors combine in a pleasant, everyday style of Pinot Noir.
title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2015 Gemini Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Block 8 is pure Wädenswil clone. This is exceptionally aromatic, with bramble and underbrush prominent. Light strawberry fruit comes up with hints of sassafras and drying tannins. It's an interesting component but would be even better in a blend.
title: Winter's Hill 2015 Block 8 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Hints of caramelized sugar and dried raspberries abound from nose to finish in this Pinot Noir vinified like a white wine. Dry on the palate, its rounded texture is augmented by soft, yielding acidity. Drink now.
title: Von Schleinitz 2015 Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Mosel)

description: This offers light red fruits and a dusting of spices. It's modest and balanced, with proportionate tannins and a chocolate note from aging in French oak barrels. It's a light, pleasant, but nondescript wine.
title: Gersing 2015 Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is ready to drink, quite pleasant, though it leans a bit generic in flavor. Light berry fruit comes with hints of cola and a green streak. The finish turns tannic and lets those stemmy flavors abide.
title: Soléna 2015 Grande Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a soft, warm wine with ripe red fruit and attractive cherry flavors, its tannins subtly in the background. Open and generous, it's ready to drink.
title: Labouré-Roi 2015  Chorey-lès-Beaune

description: Warm red-cherry aromas meet with light hints of sage and leather on the very shy nose of this bottling from one of the region's larger growers. The flavors are also light and rustic, with tart cranberry and hints of leather and game.
title: Scheid Vineyards 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Earthy mushroom and (no joke) smoke, entertain a simple layering of robust strawberry, raspberry and vanilla in this ripe wine.
title: Smoke Tree 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Woody and herbal, this full-bodied robust wine is approachably thick and round, with distinct characteristics of forest floor, mushroom and black tea.
title: Karah Estate 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: For value-priced Pinot, give this its props for being fair and consistent with past vintages. On the nose, this smells a bit furry and spicy, with meaty plum and tea notes. A medium-bodied palate feels a touch resiny, while this tastes of spice, wood and ripe red fruits.
title: Terrapura 2015 Pinot Noir (Chile)

description: Cherry and latex aromas are lean and limited. This feels tight, juicy and jumpy, with raw acidity. Spicy, herbal plum and raspberry flavors lack body on a dry, racy finish.
title: Morandé 2015 Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: With 4% Petite Sirah, possibly for color, this wine shows a preponderance of caramel-vanilla oak and big bones of body and concentration. Unfussy, it softens in the glass, showing cherry-cola flavor and a dash of herb.
title: Scott Family 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Perfumed and silky, this wine is meaty in ripeness and texture, with the flavors somewhat askew and leaning tart and tangy.
title: Decoy 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Bread-like, yeasty aromas adorn a simple thickness of smoky char, dark cherry and bold concentration in this wine, which seems heartier than the varietal tends to be.
title: Virginia Dare 2015 American Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Dark color and a punch of smoky oak underline this wine's big burly hold of tannin and ripe fruit. Tobacco, tar and baked cherry highlight the flavor wheel.
title: Cline 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Perfectly baked red cherry aromas are dusted with cola, slate, olive, sumac and Middle Eastern spice on the nose of this bottling from the historic vineyard. The palate expertly balances tight tannins, bright acidity and a vibrant energy to deliver tart raspberry, thyme, forest floor and roast beef flavors that sail into the zingy finish.
title: Chanin 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: From a meticulously farmed site, this robust wine is intense and powerful, with a baked fruit component that makes it compelling and delicious. Forest floor, sage and rhubarb jam notes enwrap its concentrated weight and texture, with an underlying acidity that tingles the tongue.
title: Lynmar 2015 Kanzler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The nose of this bottling explodes with exotic cherry scents and compelling strokes of iron, rose, carnation and cinnamon. It's refreshingly tart and earthy on the palate, where dewy sage, mint and tarragon touches lift its youthful raspberry and green olive flavors. Easy to guzzle, yet intriguingly complex.
title: Claiborne & Churchill 2015 Twin Creeks Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: This head-turning wine was made from vines planted in the 1970s and 1990s—a selection that shocks with its complex beauty. Pine forest and Christmas spice notes accent cranberry, rhubarb and tart citrus flavors, all seemingly infused with seductive smoke. At its juicy core is an earthy, mushroomy component.
title: Gary Farrell 2015 Rochioli Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Very light in appearance, this sprightly bottling offers tart yet warm aromas of wild cherry, cranberry, sweet oregano, sandalwood and wet earth. Pomegranate, strawberry, slate and cedar notes show on the palate, which showcases ripeness in a restrained fashion. Drink now–2035.
title: Chanin 2015 Los Alamos Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: This powerfully built, youthful wine was made from coastal fruit grown in Susanna's Vineyard. Brawny and smoky, it offers a concentrated black-cherry note that takes on a refined, baked quality. The fruit is cradled in soft, seductive acidity and a hint of leather.
title: Lynmar 2015 Anisya's Blend Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This wine is velvety smooth, thick and savory—a complex and nuanced celebration of a great site that's meticulously farmed. It unspools black tea, clove and spicy cola flavors as it opens.
title: La Follette 2015 Sangiacomo Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: As it opens, this wine's ever-so-slightly-dried black-cherry aroma emerges with elegance and power, alongside unending layers of potpourri, crushed flowers, juniper and dark spice. The palate leads with a tart cranberry note that broadens into a warmer strawberry flavor, laced together with tingling acidity and sagebrush spice.
title: Lucienne 2015 Lone Oak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Expansive on the palate, with lively acidity, this is robust, ripe and complex. Its powerful core of strawberry-rhubarb fruit is layered with forest pine, rose, and crushed rock notes, the texture velvety thick but balanced.
title: Siduri 2015 Betty Ann Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From the family's westernmost vineyard, this bottling is fabulously complex. It shows dense dried fruit and turned earth aromas, along with chaparral, smoke, clove and nutmeg. Those wild elements figure strongly on the sip, which shows thyme, rosemary and sagebrush accents around a core of plum, pomegranate and hibiscus flavors. A vanilla flair graces the finish.
title: Fess Parker 2015 Parker West Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Intensely dark and focused, this bottling from Santa Barbara County's historic vineyard is unrivaled in intensity, showing mulberry, elderberry, crushed rock, roast beef and a hint of sagebrush. Full but not sweet boysenberry flavors come through on the palate, balanced by dusty earth, wet stone and more chaparral spice notes.
title: Fess Parker 2015 Sanford & Benedict Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Juicy dark-purple fruits hold the center of this supple, engaging wine that's still young, with chewy tannins. There's tangy bite to the acids and plenty of muscle for aging. Drink 2020 through 2030 and possibly longer.
title: Bethel Heights 2015 Justice Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: From a vineyard at 1,100 feet elevation in the southern part of the appellation, this bottling shows light and lively raspberry, plum, white pepper, fennel and damp herb aromas. The palate abounds with red fruit, well-woven acidity and layers of herbs. A raspberry jam note pops on the finish.
title: Comartin 2015 R-Bar-R Ranch Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Earthy forest floor and sage notes make for a savory experience in this otherwise juicy wine. Robust, full-bodied and concentrated, it offers developed flavors of baked plum, strawberry and rhubarb compote, the fruit edged with menthol.
title: Della 2015 Keefer Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From four vineyard sites across the appellation, this coastal wine shows an intriguing note of rose petal and turned earth before unleashing full-bodied waves of chewy, cool-climate tannin. Its rhubarb and red cherry fruit has a savory edge; acidity carries it long into the finish.
title: Della 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: From a section of the producer's Quail Hill Vineyard, this wine sings with smoky sage and forest floor notes, its tingling acidity emphasizing freshness. Its backbone of thick tannins offers strength and power, contrasting more delicate layers of blueberry flavor.
title: Lynmar 2015 Block 10 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This bold and distinctive wine from an outstanding vineyard in the Marin County hills has exotic blackberry and pine needle aromas, vivid and concentrated black cherry flavors and a focus that's unmatched. It's layered and persistent, with a luxurious tide of ripe fruit, moderate tannins and a nicely viscous texture.
title: Sean Thackrey 2015 Andromeda Devil's Gulch Ranch Pinot Noir (Marin County)

description: Made from three vineyards within the appellation, this displays exemplary blending. Slightly reductive now, in its youth, it effortlessly melds together dark blackberry, strawberry and chocolate flavors, with a surly shock of pine forest-like earthiness. Decadent and velvety.
title: Della 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Sizzling acidity enlivens the succulent, juicy fruit in this lush expression of the appellation. Made from grapes sourced in the Olivet Lane area, it builds in exotic spiciness, with forest, herb, earth and tea accents that grace the foundation of strawberry and blackberry flavors.
title: La Crema 2015 Fog Veil Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Big, brawny tannins carry wave after wave of ripe black cherry, cola and clove flavor in this ethereal, earthy wine. Its velvety texture is rich and rewarding, balanced by a persistent thread of acidity and a tease of ash.
title: Della 2015 Terra De Promissio Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a delicious, memorable wine that does the vineyard justice, offering layers of baked strawberry fruit tempered by moderate acidity. As it slowly opens, it reveals rose petal, cherry and pomegranate flavors, its texture broad yet defined.
title: Sojourn 2015 Reuling Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Maybe released just a little too soon, this cuts off its tart rhubarb and raspberry flavors with stiff hard tannins. They bring the flavors to a quick halt, leaving just an impression of stemmy earth.
title: Sweet Cheeks 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Aromas of wood, citrus peel and oak-related coconut introduce a choppy bumpy palate with raw acidity. Lean dry tart red-fruit flavors come with peppery spice and oak notes, while this finishes with earthy berry flavors and rubbery choppy tannins.
title: Veranda 2015 Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)

description: Rich cola and cinnamon spiciness round out this light-bodied, somewhat disjointed effort, which presents as syrupy and dense in texture.
title: Elkhorn Peak 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: There is barely a trace of any varietal fruit character here. The wine seems soaked in vanilla, probably from some sort of oak treatment. Whatever the cause, it's vanilla all the way from start to finish.
title: Omen 2015 Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)

description: A standout even in this terrific lineup of 2015 releases from Patricia Green, the Weber opens with a burst of cola and tobacco scents and accents. It continues, subtle and detailed, with flavors of oranges, vanilla, tea and milk chocolate discreetly threaded through ripe blackberry fruit.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Weber Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: From 18-year-old vines, this supple well-balanced effort blends flavors of mocha, cherry, vanilla and breakfast tea. Superbly integrated and delicious even at this early stage, this wine seems destined for a long and savory cellar life. Drink now through 2028.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Estate Vineyard Wadensvil Block Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Winemaker Bill Brosseau hits a single vineyard home run with this bottling from one of the Central Coast's oldest sites. It shows exotic plum, tangy cranberry, pine needle, juniper and pencil shaving scents on the nose. The palate is steeped in mulberry, marjoram and curry-like Indian spices, proving dynamic and delicious in the most compelling ways.
title: Testarossa 2015 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: An aromatic textural wine, Wichmann sources fruit from the winery's oldest vines. Strawberry and cherry flavors are woven into details of citrus and tea. This elegant well-proportioned effort provides a feminine contrast to the sturdy Coast Range bottling.
title: Trisaetum 2015 Wichmann Dundee Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Cranberry, baked rhubarb, anise and crushed slate aromas show on the nose of this always-excellent bottling from the Franscioni family. The palate abounds with energy, driving black raspberry fruit accented with earthy loam, fennel, oregano and juniper through a compellingly round midpalate.
title: Roar 2015 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Intensely aromatic, yet big and even chunky in the mouth, this young wine remains compressed and hard-edged. Give it ample aeration, and cranberry, blackberry and black cherry fruits come alive. Dense with fruit and detailed with wet stone minerality, this should be cellared a few years, and consumed from 2020 to 2030.
title: Trisaetum 2015 Ribbon Ridge Estate Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This gorgeous wine deftly integrates a lively mix of currant, cherry, breakfast tea and dried leaves into a seamless and seductive whole. Produced from vines dating back to the early 1970s, it finishes with a delicious streak of milk chocolate. Drink now through 2030.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Durant Vineyard Bishop Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Fruit from the oldest blocks in this pioneering vineyard is sourced here. It's bright, spicy and focused, with forward citrus-scented Bing cherry flavors. The concentration and length are outstanding, with just the lightest suggestion of green herbs rounding out the finish.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Medici Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Juicy, vivid black cherry fruit appears on the nose of this wine, with a touch of tar and brooding elderberry. The palate brims with those appetizing flavors and adds an edge of licorice to the fruit. It's fresh and vibrant, with a fine, taut, gossamer structure. A delicious Pinot Noir that's as elegant as it is refreshing and honest.
title: Meinklang 2015 Blauburgunder (Burgenland)

description: This wine's fresh, ripe red cherry and aromatic strawberry touches make for an inviting nose. The palate shows the same intense primary fruit, bolstered by freshness and a fine, filigreed structure. Its supple, pure fruit makes it very enjoyable now, but it's sure to evolve further with bottle age. Drink now–2025.
title: Stadlmann 2015 Classic Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: From the vineyard planted by the Pisoni and Franscioni families, this wine delivers bright raspberry and strawberry aromas with sweet star anise spice. The medium-bodied palate is lively and boisterous, with ripe cranberry, tangy red plum skin and sour cherry flavors, accented with a helping of dried herbs.
title: Testarossa 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: The floral, vanilla tone of new oak marries with ripe, red cherry notes in this wine, supported by clove and violet highlights. It's young and taut on the palate, its fine tannins still firm and crunchy, needing time to evolve and relax. Pure fruit and the pervasive freshness promise a bright future. Drink 2019–2025.
title: Malat 2015 Classic Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)

description: Textural and beautifully detailed, this offers front-loaded flavors of cola, cocoa, graphite and tobacco, wrapped around blackberry and black-cherry fruits. Despite the relatively steep alcohol, this drinks in a lighter, more elegant, yet quite showy style.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Balcombe Vineyard Block 1B Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The biggest production and lowest priced of all the winery's vineyard designates, this is sexy, substantial and one of the best offerings from any winery sourcing fruit from this exceptional vineyard. A riot of berries, plums and Asian spices fills the mouth—well-integrated, layered and detailed right on through the extended finish. A light dusting of cocoa powder lingers and invites the next sip.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Stunningly good for an entry-level Pinot Noir, this new Tavola gets the sort of care generally reserved for reserves. Native yeast fermentation and almost a year in 20% new French oak is where it starts; then a barrel selection is made and it's bottled unfined and unfiltered. Deep flavors emphasize black fruits, with a dash of pepper highlighting the finish.
title: Ponzi 2015 Tavola Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This was the first winery to make a truly white Pinot Noir (back in 2004). Produced exclusively from Pommard clones, it's barrel fermented and aged much like a Chardonnay. Along with great texture and length, there's plenty of acid supporting its palate-pleasing mix of white peach, melon and gooseberry. It finishes with a thread of lightly buttery caramel.
title: Domaine Serene 2015 Coeur Blanc (White Heart) Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine required considerable aeration before it began opening up. Once there, the airy pretty fruit flavors emerged, a mix of Bing cherries and a dusting of malt powder. It's got a buoyant midpalate and a pleasing streak of orange Creamsicle.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Olenik Vineyard Wadensvil Block Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Slight pepper spice mingles with subdued, tart berry fruit on the nose of this wine. The palate adds supple vanilla and strawberry notes, with fine, smooth tannins and pervasive freshness. For now, the vanilla still dominates, but a little bottle age will help. Drink 2018–2022.
title: Markowitsch 2015 Pinot Noir (Carnuntum)

description: This cool site, set on sedimentary and volcanic soils, brings a blend of five clones into focus. Dark and juicy, muscular and complex, it weaves together plum and cherry fruit, a whiff of truffle, and finishes with a touch of coffee from the barrel aging.
title: Trisaetum 2015 Coast Range Estate Pinot Noir

description: Beautiful blueberry aromas and plump black cherry and blueberry flavors lend a unique character to this ripe, fruity and full-bodied wine from interior Mendocino. Any oak accents take a back seat to the concentrated, layered and luxurious berry character that fills out the wine's broad but soft mouthfeel.
title: Masút 2015 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eagle Peak)

description: One of four monopole Central Coast bottlings from the Los Gatos winery, this bottling offers rich red cherry, vanilla, rose petal and watermelon scents on the nose. The palate is dry and structured, showing tart Montmorency cherry and hints of licorice and eucalyptus.
title: Testarossa 2015 Fogstone Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Blended from eight separate vineyards, this appellation wine doesn't hold back on quality. It offers a seamless, integrated foundation of juicy cherry, cranberry and orange flavors, dusted with cardamom spice.
title: Holdredge 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Mulberry, wet rock and sagebrush show on the nose of this single vineyard bottling from a site owned by the Hahn family. The palate is tangy at first, revealing dark red fruit with a smoky kick as it opens, backed by hints of juniper and dust.
title: Testarossa 2015 Doctor's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Generous on the palate, this wine from the famous site is ripe with wild strawberry and pomegranate fruit and accented with the distinct spiciness of cardamom. It displays its youth through assertive tannins and oak-derived scents, layering the thick finish with cinnamon bark.
title: Siduri 2015 Saralee's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Red and black cherry aromas mark the nose of this wine. The palate is similarly primary and vibrant, with supple ripe berry and cherry notes. On the finish, the freshness and taut structure become apparent. This is irresistibly juicy right now but will evolve. Drink now–2023.
title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2015 Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: Bright, compressed fruit stars in this approachable and affordable Pinot Noir that's rounded with tannin and focused acidity. Cranberry, orange, cherry and cola flavors highlight its medium-bodied power and concentration.
title: Siduri 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Just one barrel of this bottling was produced, but it falls short of the other Dundee Hills cuvées this vintage. It starts out thin, with dilute fruit, cola and mineral notes. With hours of breathing time, it begins to fill out in the middle, so aggressive decanting is recommended.
title: Timothy Malone 2015 La Colina Vineyard Dundee Hills Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The winery's value bottling, this was vinified in a mix of neutral oak and stainless steel. Enjoy soon for its pretty mix of savory herb, black cherry and molasses flavors.
title: Fullerton 2015 Three Otters Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is focused but soft in the mouth, making it approachable right now. It's balanced, forward, easy-drinking and mature-tasting, its red fruit highlighted with candied orange peel and toast.
title: Henry Estate 2015 Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)

description: It's a good solid wine that shows the forthright fruity aspect of the varietal. A quite deep color and spicy earthy cola aromas are followed by nicely ripe plum and black cherry on the palate, where the full body gives a mouth-filling sensation and the firm tannins add some welcomed grip.
title: McFadden 2015 Blue Quail Pinot Noir (Potter Valley)

description: This medium-bodied wine has an abundance of spices in its aromas and flavors, along with a smooth texture and good balance between acidity and ripeness. The fruit flavors are plummy and straightforward and the easy drinkability is undeniable.
title: Kendall-Jackson 2015 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir (California)

description: Rich and fruity, this wine full of black-cherry and red-plum flavors. There is no wood aging, just fruit and crisp acidity that between them fill out the lightly tannic texture. Drink this wine from 2018.
title: Joseph Mellot 2015 Domaine des Emois  (Sancerre)

description: This is a light- to medium-bodied, silky wine. Floral and leafy shadings add interest to black-cherry fruit, while vanilla and cedar notes fan out on the finish. Drink now–2020.
title: Wairau River 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: While there is a youthful stalky element to this wine, it also has plenty of ripe black-cherry fruit. That suggests a warm ripe future as the tannins soften. Drink this potentially rich, spicy wine from 2019.
title: Isabelle et Pierre Clément 2015 Tradition  (Menetou-Salon)

description: This affordably priced Pinot Noir is part of the winery's popular Evolution series. It's smooth and forward, with pretty red fruit supported by juicy orange flavor. It has the tannin and stuffing to work well with roast poultry or as a stand-alone fireside sipping wine.
title: Sokol Blosser 2015 Evolution Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The winery calls this their “Bunny Cuvée” due to the rabbit on the label. It's well made, of fair value, with sharp details. Cranberry and raspberry fruit flavors punch through with a gentle streak of cola. The finish comes with a hint of composted earth.
title: Coelho 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This shows light, tangy cranberry and raspberry flavors on the fresh, straightforward attack. Beyond that, it doesn't offer much detail, finishing with a touch of acidity.
title: Samuel Robert 2015 Willamette Valley Cuveé (sic) Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a stiff and herbal wine without much charm, even after considerable breathing time. Rubbery scents, bitter tannins and a chicken stock note obscure its tart berry and black cherry fruit.
title: Hyland 2015 Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This is a good bargain for a varietal that's very difficult to make inexpensively. Whiffs of wood smoke meet ripe concentrated black-cherry flavors in this full-bodied smooth-textured wine. It has moderate fine-grained tannins for grip and a lingering spice and smoke finish.
title: Belle Ambiance 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: The softness of this Pinot Noir brings out red berries and a supple texture. It is ripe, fruity and with a generous warm aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Domaine Benoît & Mathieu Fleuriet 2015 Renaissance La Magie des Caillottes  (Sancerre)

description: The Burgundy-based producer has made a fresh, cherry-flavored wine that is identifiably Pinot Noir. It has soft tannins and a dry core, yet is dominated by red fruit and acidity on the finish. Drink now.
title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: In comparison with other new releases from the winery, this seems dilute. With its watery raspberry fruit and astringent acidity, it lacks the stuffing to handle the 55% new oak it was aged in, making the barrel flavors apparent. More time in the bottle may help.
title: Chehalem 2015 Stoller Vineyards Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This is pale in color, with light aromas and strawberry, spice and herb notes. The fruit flavors are also restrained, seeming faint but still bringing appeal.
title: Primarius 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This is a generous, richly fruity and well-oaked wine that blends almost-jammy cherry and blackberry flavors with sweet-seeming accents like vanilla and cinnamon. It's relatively soft in texture and easy to sip.
title: HandCraft 2015 Artisan Collection Pinot Noir (California)

description: This light-fruited wine is the most widely available of the winery's Pinots. Its cherry and orange candy flavors give it a pleasant, albeit superficial, entry. Don't expect complexity, but for a light and accessible taste of the Willamette Valley, it's a fair value.
title: Coelho 2015 Atração Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Made entirely from Pinot Nero, this opens with red-skinned berry and cooking spice aromas. The bright, straightforward palate delivers strawberry and cinnamon notes, with smooth tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy soon.
title: Stemmari 2015 Pinot Nero (Sicilia)

description: The production of this nationally-distributed wine almost doubled this vintage, making it one of the most visible Oregon Pinots in the country. It's medium bodied and offers good varietal character, but there is a slight off-note on the nose, which carries through the finish, albeit subtly.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a light fruity style of wine, full of red cherries. It has a spicy edge along with a supple base of tannins. With its fruit and acidity, the wine is ready to drink.
title: Michel Vattan 2015  Sancerre

description: This medium-bodied wine features a heavy dose of baking spices and vanilla layered atop notions of earth and red cherries. It's a little dry and woody, but cinnamon and clove notes add charm.
title: Ten Sisters 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This wine's aromas are marked by bright cherries and an undercurrent of button mushrooms. It's medium bodied and crisp, with just enough silky-textured tannin to give it some grip. Drink now.
title: Dashwood 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This pleasant, easy-drinking wine from five different Pinot Noir clones mixes citrus and berry flavors. It was aged in 30% new oak and is nicely balanced, with firm acidity.
title: Dion 2015 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This wine boasts an attractive nose of rose petals and red cherries, followed by cherry and pomegranate flavors on the lightweight palate. The tannins are supple and the finish fades quickly, making this a drink-now proposition.
title: Tablelands 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: A reductive note of rubber tire threads through the mélange of cherry cola, iron ore and red licorice flavors in this wine. The components have not yet integrated, leading to a finish marked by bitter skin and tannins. Give it another couple of years of bottle age before pulling the cork.
title: Dauntless 2015 No Man's Land Wädenswil Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Jammy aromas and flavors that are as rich as maple syrup give a sweet accent to this full-bodied and mouth-filling wine. It has a touch of tannin for grip and finishes on the sweet side.
title: Z. Alexander Brown 2015 Uncaged Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Napa County-Sonoma County)

description: Made from certified organic fruit, this impressively dark and tannic bottling is essentially the second wine of Huia. Dark cherries and vanilla finish firm. Drink it now with grilled meats, or hold it until 2018–2019 and see how it develops in the cellar.
title: Hunky Dory 2015 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Some aspects of this wine have changed since the 2014 vintage: the alcohol is lower, and the exposure to new French oak (50%) is higher. There's something amiss, however. While light strawberry fruit and hints of chicken stock show on the palate, there's a foreshortening and feeling of dilution on the finish.
title: Coelho 2015 Zeitoun Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This juicy wine is rich with acidity and red-berry fruits. It is still young, with tannins and a dry core that will allow it to age. The concentration and ripeness suggest power for the future. Drink from 2024.
title: Hervé Kerlann 2015 Les Goulots Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Situated just to the north of the village of Pommard, this eight-acre vineyard has produced a typically structured wine with firm tannins and a dry core. The wine also has the rich black-cherry fruit of the vintage. Together with the wood aging, the wine will develop richly and powerfully. Drink from 2023.
designation: Clos de la Commaraine Premier Cru
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Clos de la Commaraine Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: This bottling by Lane Tanner, who used solely clone 667 and employed 50% new Hungarian oak, offers intense cherry on the nose alongside rose petals, carnations, preserved oranges and North African spice. There's bountiful energy to the sip, where bay leaf, thyme and green sage meet with dark red fruit.
title: Lumen 2015 Presqu'ile Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: From the lovely Petaluma Gap site, this wine is a mix of menthol, forest floor and noble reduction—totally savory in style. Moderately concentrated and ultimately fresh in bright acidity, it has a thickness of wild strawberry and cherry and a length of cardamom spice.
title: Lutum 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Ripe and juicy, this is a richly fruity and structured wine. With acidity to keep it crisp, the wine has layers of warm cherry flavors and generous tannins. It has an excellent future, so drink from 2022.
title: Maison Roche de Bellene 2015 Champeaux Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: From one of Mornington Peninsula's top artisan producers, the 2015 Pinot Noir is beautiful for sipping now while also being age worthy. Like a warm autumn day, it smells of drying red fruit, dried flowers, earth and a touch of cinnamon and smoke. The palate is juicy and elegant, with silky tannins and lively acidity. An elegant, serious yet utterly gluggable drop. Drink now–2024.
title: Moorooduc 2015 Pinot Noir (Mornington Peninsula)

description: This wine's concentrated fruit is perfectly ripe, with berry flavors and a deep black cherry core. Everything is in proportion and well integrated, a gentle touch of new oak and clean earth underpinning all the gorgeous fruit.
title: Rex Hill 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The best Private Stash to date, this pumps up its strawberry and raspberry jam flavors with apricot highlights. It's concentrated and boldly fruity but balanced and long, buttressed with well-matched acids and tannins.
title: Roco 2015 Private Stash #13 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This classy wine is sourced from one of the finest vineyards in Oregon, with a proven track record of ageability. Bright raspberry fruit flavors extend into the mineral-driven finish, which opens to reveal more subtle textures and layers as it breathes. Aged in 35% new oak, it has a touch of coconut on the nose and finish also. Drink from 2020 to the early 2030s.
title: Winderlea 2015 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Smooth and fruity, this wine is easy to enjoy from the first classic whiff of red cherries and tea to more substantial black cherry and clove flavors. It's medium in body and has light, velvety tannins. Great balance and liveliness thanks to good acidity help lift this wine above the pack.
title: Davies 2015 Ferrington Vineyards Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: The structure in this wine with its tannins gives a core of dryness to the otherwise ripe, generous fruit. The wine is tight with acidity, smokiness and a firm character that will allow it to age. Juicy acidity at the end promises much. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2015 Les Hauts Jarrons Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Mimi Casteel is the grower, hence the cuvée name. A full 70% included whole clusters, foot-stomped and barrique-aged. That new oak shows minimally, and the fruit, at least for now, is somewhat subsumed by stem and leaf flavors. It's a demanding style that will reward long-term aging. The texture and complexity begin to emerge after many hours of aeration. Drink 2022–2035.
title: Lingua Franca 2015 Mimi's Mind Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This dry, firm wine is currently all about tannins, with a backdrop of rich berries and spice from wood aging. Produced from a small portion of the Aux Perdrix Premier Cru, it does have the weight to show its potential as it ages. Consider drinking this wine from 2025.
designation: Domaine des Perdrix Aux Perdrix Les 8 Ouvreés Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine des Perdrix Aux Perdrix Les 8 Ouvreés Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The firm tannins of this wine show its youth. Black cherry and damson flavors provide a good foil for this structure. It is ripe, richly generous and offers both a crisp texture and a warm, ripe future. Drink from 2024.
title: Maison Champy 2015 Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Lovely black raspberry, hints of sage, sandalwood, soil, sweet dill, tarragon and fennel make for a very expressive nose on this single-vineyard selection. The palate deftly combines dark but tart plum, pluot and black raspberry fruit with notes of baking spices. The texture is pitch perfect, with judicious acidity and structural tannins.
title: Pali 2015 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Rustic red cherry, baked earth, pretty rose petals, candied currants and a bit of sweet oak show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard just east of Cambria. The herbally tinged palate places fresh thyme and dill against a backdrop of light cranberry and pomegranate, proving lightly bodied but extremely energetic with acidity. Vanilla pops on the finish.
title: Stolo 2015 Creekside Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)

description: Brown sugar and Asian spice components make this wine warm and inviting—a strong, powerful expression of the variety that's concentrated in flavor and body weight. Tart cranberry and raspberry are seasoned in elements of dried herb, adding complexity.
title: Walt 2015 Brown Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Dark as night in the glass, this lavish take on Pinot Noir, which would work great in a steak house, shows black cherry, licorice, black sage and crushed asphalt on the nose. Lush tones of black cherry and creamy caramel also show on the sip, but there is earthy minerality, roasted meat umami tones and vibrant spearmint touches as well.
title: Walt 2015 Clos Pepe Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Sourced from the original (1990) planting of Pommard clone vines, this shows thick black cherry fruit, scattered with multi-seed bread and wet hay notes. The flavors are persistent and full, with streaks of coffee and chocolate from having aged in 30% new oak. It's astonishing that Doug Tunnell can offer such glorious wines at such mild prices.
title: Brick House 2015 Cuvée du Tonnelier Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This robust medium-bodied vineyard-designate is complex and lengthy, a showcase of reduced oak, black cherry and berry and well-defined aspects of white pepper, Asian five-spice and black tea. The finish brings some heat that settles on the palate to show power and grace.
title: Bruliam 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This limited-production top-tier cuvée is high-toned, with bright raspberry fruit set against ample, minerally acids. Aging in 50% new French oak has given it subtlety and balance, though there's a slight suggestion of heat on the finish. It will unquestionably benefit from a few more years of bottle age, so drink from 2020 to 2025.
title: Antiquum Farm 2015 Luxuria Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Firm and structured, this is a dark, concentrated wine. It has a solid character, rich and ripe with black plums and berries that come through the dry core. This wine is certain to age well; drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2015 Les Bousselots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The typical firm, tannic structure of a Gevrey-Chambertin is very present in this young wine. The tannins are balanced with the juicy red-berry fruits, crisp acidity and minerality. Together these elements make an impressively dense wine that will age well. Drink from 2022.
title: Maison Roche de Bellene 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: The tannins of this wine are classic Nuits-St.-Georges. Under the weight of this dry, toasty core, rich fruit will allow the wine to mature well. It is concentrated and dense with a rich potential. Drink the wine from 2024.
title: Nicolas Potel 2015 Les Vaucrains Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: From a site expertly farmed by the Martinelli family, Burnside is leathery and earthy, a deep dive into mint, cedar and pine as well as pungent rose garden. Spicy cardamom and black tea are supported by a grip of oak and tannin that tastes bold and big, yet finishes in balance.
title: Patz & Hall 2015 Burnside Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Appealing aromas of mint, charred pine and forest floor decorate a core of mulberry and dried cherry fruit on the nose of this wine by Karen Steinwachs. Similar flavors show on the sip, where pine needles and moss meet with minty black raspberry, presented on a lighter fresher body.
title: Seagrape 2015 Mermaid's Pearl Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Both structure and ripe fruits mark out this wine. It has richness, a tannic structure and generous red berry and black-cherry flavors. With these elements, the wine is certain to age well. Drink from 2023.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2015 Les Cazetiers Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: A blend from numerous blocks on the estate, this is a lovely and classic expression Oregon Pinot Noir. From the rose-inflected aroma to the brambly blue fruit and polished tannins, it's a knockout bottle. Barrel aging adds a sexy touch of mocha to the long, delicious finish.
title: Shea 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Layered and intricate, this plush and complex wine is a beauty. It starts with enticing aromas of black cherry and clove, while more cherry and spice character unfolds on the palate and a broad, rich texture coats the mouth. Everything is smooth, well integrated and tasty.
title: Theopolis 2015 Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)

description: For fans of rich and lavish Pinot Noir, this appellation blend gives a taste of what Winemaker Megan Gunderson is all about, without the soaring price tag. Black cherry, chocolate chip cookie dough, crushed slate and light mint show on the nose while the soft, lush palate is creamy in black-plum pudding and coffee cream flavors as well as hints of bay leaf, black tea and juniper.
title: Walt 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: For a cool-climate Pinot Noir, this is ripe, rich and round. Its ample weight delivers broad, complex flavors of clove, cinnamon, black cherry, plum and cola, but its oaky overcoat may dissuade purists. Although the fruit comes from Tasmania, the wine was made on the mainland at Giant Steps in the Yarra Valley. Drink now–2023.
title: Maison L'Envoyé 2015 Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

description: This dark, full-bodied and well-balanced effort is jam-packed with flavor. A big burst of blackberry, blue plum and black cherry holds down the center palate. It's focused, fresh, ripe and lingers broadly. It's a wine to buy by the case and drink over the next decade.
title: Sineann 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This is a finesse wine, with light flavors of pomegranate and cranberry. There's a suggestion of burnt toast—just a hint—around the tannins, which remain a bit stiff and chewy. Give this another year or two and it should open up further.
title: Sineann 2015 Russell-Grooters Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: An inviting plum color, this continues with plummy fruit, accented with tart flavors of Meyer lemon, Satsuma mandarin and nectarine. Fermented on the skins for a full week, then aged in neutral French barrels, it exhibits a discreet suggestion of toast as it winds down. An all-around excellent bottle of rosé, with the body and power to accompany a winter's roast chicken.
title: Vinum Ferus 2015 On Skin Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A fresh, fruity and fun rendering of Pinot Noir, this medium-bodied wine features lightly floral aromas, red cherry and raspberry fruit and a silky, mouthwatering finish. Drink now–2020.
title: Wakefield 2015 Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: Aromatically complex with hints of dusty compost, peat moss and coffee grounds, this moves gracefully into a lively palate. Orange and lemon peel, black tea and juicy acids highlight a red berry core. This is a totally gulpable and thoroughly delicious young Pinot.
title: Acrobat 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Quite tart, in a bracing, food friendly way, this foot-stomped rosé brings pretty notes of crushed roses and sweet cherries to the fore. There's impressive body and length, with a lick of citrus extending the finish.
title: Vinum Ferus 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Don't let the indecipherable labels deter you from exploring the wines of Vinum Ferus. The Valour is a good place to start. It's a single vineyard, Hanzell clone, 100% whole cluster cuvée, bursting with warm fruit flavors of maraschino cherry. There's a light dash of white pepper and refreshing acidity, with a lick of minerality.
title: Vinum Ferus 2015 Valour Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Fresh, primary red cherry and raspberry flavors are punchy and bright on this easygoing Pinot Noir for everyday enjoyment. It's not a complex wine but pristinely fruity, balanced neatly by a crush of cranberry acidity. The finish lingers elegantly marked by fine, feathery tannins.
title: P.J. Valckenberg 2015 Undone Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)

description: An impressive value, this is a rather full and weighty Pinot that stays supple through the finish. Dusty earth and cherry notes marry nicely on the nose, followed by flavors reminiscent of cola, cherry and raspberry. Drink now–2019.
title: Shoofly 2015 Pinot Noir (Victoria)

description: This is an unusually firm, structured Pinot Noir for $20. Floral notes and hints of ripe cherries mark the nose, while the flavors feature cherry and vanilla. Probably best paired with slightly fatty or rich dishes, like roast pork.
title: Innocent Bystander 2015 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)

description: Pretty aromas of cherry and plum blossoms give way to fully ripe, slightly confectionary fruit, backed by hints of mocha. This medium-bodied Pinot Noir is supple in texture and softly dusty on the finish, making it an easy one to drink over the next couple of years.
title: Riposte 2015 The Dagger Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: A pale copper color, this delivers crisp strawberry and light apple fruit, nicely framed with juicy fresh acidity. It finishes up with a touch of spice. Drink over the next few months while the freshness remains.
title: Irvine Family Vineyards 2015 Rosé Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Cherry, tea, spice and citrus peel aromas lead to a balanced palate. This tastes of citrus, raspberry, spiced plum and lightly buttered oak. A creamy sense carries over to the finish, but mostly this is lively and solid.
title: Don Rodolfo 2015 Art of the Andes Pinot Noir (Mendoza)

description: Light plum and cherry aromas come with a note of bitter horseradish. This feels full and rubbery, with creamy cherry flavors that show an herbal side. On the finish, mild notes of green herbs share space with creamy weight and briny hints.
title: Aniello 2015 006 Riverside Estate Pinot Noir (Patagonia)

description: Tan in color, with dry lightly oxidized aromas as well as notes of white pepper and peach pit, this white Pinot Noir is low on fruit and feels tight, acidic and raw. Tart apple and sour lemon flavors include a note of fino Sherry, while this closes with a steady beam of sharp acidity.
title: Aniello 2015 Soil Blanco de Pinot Noir (Patagonia)

description: This fruity wine brings a mix of strawberry and watermelon, in a smooth and simple format. There's a suggestion of some over-ripe fruit in the mix, so best to drink this chilled down.
title: Pino 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Aromas of oak and orange peel include a strong whiff of clove. This is creamy and resiny in feel, while oaky flavors—clove in particular—sit on top of red-fruit notes. Dry barrel-related flavors are hot on the finish.
title: Altocedro 2015 Año Cero Pinot Noir (La Consulta)

description: This is a Pinot-based refresher with substantial body, dry and tart with streaks of cranberry and raspberry. The stand-out character comes from its savory element of spice and sea spray, in addition to the weightiness that makes it welcome with food.
title: Levendi 2015 Nicoletta Rosé of Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)

description: A crush of raspberry and maraschino-cherry perfume persists throughout this pristine pretty Pinot Noir. Punchy red-fruit flavors are concentrated and fresh, gilded by subtle tones of violet, toast and crushed mineral. The finish is long, framed neatly by penetrating but finely grained tannins.
title: Hosmer 2015 Pinot Noir (Cayuga Lake)

description: This is a blend from different Premier Cru vineyards in Beaune. At this stage, it is dominated by the wood aging. That gives a bitterness to the wine that needs to soften and allow the ripe fruit to come out. It does have potential, although the maturity will take time. Drink from 2019.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Dark pink in color, this wine offers a pleasing brightness of strawberry and grapefruit, with moderate acidity that retains body and texture. It finishes ripely succulent.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2015 Vin Gris Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This light-hued, coppery-tinged rosé features delicate aromas of crushed stone and stone fruit. It's medium bodied and crisp, with peach and melon fruit that finishes dry and refreshing. Drink now.
title: Spy Valley 2015 Rosé Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Five acres of vines next to Château Mi-Point are the source for this red-fruit flavored wine. It has a soft texture and only light tannins even in a wine this young. With integrated acidity and red-berry flavors, it is likely to be ready to drink soon, certainly from late 2017.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Château Mi-Point  (Mercurey)

description: Coming from the southernmost of the Côte de Beaune appellations, this is a light, fruity and very accessible wine. It has juicy red-cherry flavors and attractive acidity to give the wine its crispness. It can be drunk now for its fruitiness, although it will be better from late 2017.
title: Philippe Jeannot 2015 Quentin Jeannot Vieilles Vignes  (Maranges)

description: There is just a hint of the structure normally associated with the appellation. Otherwise, the wine is broad and soft with rounded berry and cherry flavors. It comes from vines on the flatter vineyards in the valley. It's a wine that will mature quickly. Drink from 2018.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This is a pale-colored wine with a soft texture and gentle strawberry fruits. The texture comes through slowly to give a firmer edge to what is a wine for medium-term aging. This is stylish and smooth. It should be drunk from 2018.
designation: Quentin Jeannot La Fussière Premier Cru
title: Philippe Jeannot 2015 Quentin Jeannot La Fussière Premier Cru  (Maranges)

description: Produced from vineyards in the hills above the Côte de Nuits, this wine benefits from the ripe vintage of 2015. It has open red fruit and soft tannins that are both lifted by the acidity. Made to be drunk young, this is ready to enjoy now.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection  (Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: Attractive floral aromas and bright cherry and raspberry flavors make a light, refreshing impression. This medium-bodied wine has light tannins and lively acidity in the texture.
title: Tortoise Creek 2015 Mission Grove Pinot Noir (California)

description: The Hautes Côtes de Nuits is in the first range of hills behind the famed Côtes de Nuits. Its cooler climate produces lighter wines, although in this warm vintage this is ripe style of wine. With its red-berry fruits and juicy acidity, the light tannins just give structure to a wine that is ready to drink.
designation: Closerie des Alisiers Les Dames Huguettes
title: Maison Stéphane Brocard 2015 Closerie des Alisiers Les Dames Huguettes  (Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: This is an impressive appellation blend, sourcing from the proprietor's Bob's Ranch as well as Gap's Crown Vineyard and others. Earthy compost and forested tea gird a full-bodied concentrated experience highlighted in dried cranberry, raspberry and rhubarb, a leathery hint of sarsaparilla adding creaminess.
title: Walt 2015 La Brisa Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Based in the Napa Valley, this brand from Kathryn Hall focuses on Pinot Noir. This release features grapes from one of Oregon's best sites—the Shea Vineyard, located in the Yamhill-Carlton AVA. It's jam-packed with black cherry and cassis fruit, nuanced by firm streaks of tobacco, espresso and sweet spice. Its density and balance are superb.
title: Walt 2015 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Rich and exuberant aromas of black cherry, vanilla and brown sugar meet with a more floral depth as well as crushed gravel on the nose of this bottling by Winemaker Megan Gunderson. Buoyant acidity pops right away on the sip, allowing the silky tannins to present flavors of black plum, dark cherry, loamy earth and dark spices, from sandalwood to allspice.
title: Walt 2015 Sierra Mar Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Ripe and juicy with berries, this structured wine also offers great fruitiness and opulence. The acidity and the tannins promise the future while the ripe fruits show the fine vintage well. This is a wine to age, best enjoyed from 2024.
title: Bouchard Père & Fils 2015 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: There's an intriguingly earthy character to the nose of this bottling by Greg Brewer, with snapped sagebrush, dill, green olive and tart pluot aromas leaning into the herbal side of the grape. There's great tension to the sip, which is fresh and flavorful with underripe fig and strawberry, orange rind and a hint of green peppercorn.
title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Drum Canyon Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This stands apart for its complex melding of citrus and berry fruit. Its raspberry and blueberry flavors are accented with floral highlights. At first, it seems almost delicate, yet it gathers strength as it breathes. Ten months in 50% new French oak has pumped up the tannins significantly. Drink now–2035.
