title: Antiquum Farm 2015 Passiflora Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Lavish strokes of vanilla, spice and toast lend a slightly aspirational feel to this Pinot Noir, but its undoubtedly a concentrated, solidly structured wine in need of some time to harmonize. Sumptuous red cherry and raspberry flavors are fleshy and deep, invigorated by a crush of cranberry acidity and a cool mineral undertone. Bold, chunky tannins should meld nicely from 2025.
title: Franz Keller 2015 Franz Anton Schwarzer Adler Pinot Noir (Baden)

description: Ripe and juicy, this rich wine has crisp acidity and generous tannins. With its structure and firm core, it's full of potential. The density gives the wine complexity and ageability. Drink from 2024.
title: Hervé Kerlann 2015 Les Corbeaux Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This wine opens with incredibly floral aromatics—a perfume of rose and lavender that shines along a delicately layered and textured wine. Cherry pie flavors provide juicy succulence and delight. The freshness lasts and lingers, dotted in cardamom and black tea.
title: Lynmar 2015 Susanna's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Ripe and full bodied, this is already an attractive wine. Smoky tannins give a structure to the generous texture and swathes of rich berry fruits. It's impressive, open and, despite its early accessibility, likely to age well. Drink from 2025.
title: Maison Champy 2015 Les Beaux Monts Premier Cru  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: A near-neighbor of Vosne-Romanée, this premier cru produces structured wines such as this. The tannins and weight derive from the rich fruit as well as the spicy, smoky wood aging. It has power, black fruits, serious tannins and great concentration. Drink from 2022.
title: Maison Roche de Bellene 2015 Aux Boudots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This wine opens with a rustic forest element of garrigue, before unleashing its full embrace of crisp red fruit. Rhubarb, strawberry and cherry combine within an oaky, tannic framework of power that falls away slowly in the glass, refreshed in acidity.
title: Patz & Hall 2015 Bootlegger's Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Ripe strawberry aromas are a fine setting for this rich and generous wine. Its opulent character is reinforced by firm tannins and broadened out with the red-cherry fruit and acidity. This full-bodied wine will not be ready before 2024.
title: Pierre Naigeon 2015 Les Feusselottes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Ripe blackberry fruit shines brightly here, backed by bracing minerality. Lighter hints of black olive, dusty earth and espresso add depth and detail as it carries into a long, balanced and textured finish. Good as it is, it should continue to improve with further cellaring.
title: Shea 2015 Block 5 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Homer is the winery's top barrel selection reserve, aged in 71% new French oak. Sturdy, tight and compact, it's packed with black fruit and barrel flavors. Its polished tannins are threaded with cinnamon spice, pepper and coffee ground notes. Drink 20202028.
title: Shea 2015 Homer Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: All the voluptuousness of Volnay awaits in this ripe, full wine. The tannins are richly cushioned by the red-berry fruits and lifted by acidity. It is a beautiful wine, focused on fruit and with just the right amount of structure for it to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Vincent Girardin 2015 Les Santenots Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: This barrel selection is a 50/50 blend of Pommard and Dijon clones, all biodynamically farmed. It's spicy and complex, with cranberry, orange peel and lemon aromas. Those flavors are in the mix, along with black cherry, clean earth, and a dash of cola and sassafras. A glorious wine, it should be enjoyed now through the late 2020s.
title: Brick House 2015 Evelyn's Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Dense and dry, this is a richly structured wine. Bold tannins are equaled by the forward red fruits. Together they have produced a dense wine that will need several years aging. The potential is for a concentrated wine that will be sumptuous and generous. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2015 Les Grèves Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: Richly dense, this is a well-structured and rich wine. Its tannins are a part of the opulent black fruits, ripe acidity and wonderful juicy fruitiness. A dark core of tannins will allow the wine to age so well. Drink from 2025.
designation: Domaine des Perdrix Aux Perdrix Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine des Perdrix Aux Perdrix Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Beautifully perfumed, this wine is also concentrated and dense, with a sumptuous, ripe texture that will propel it to great things. Red berries, cherries and balanced acidity are all there along with a serious backdrop of tannins. Drink from 2025.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2015 Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This is Greg Brewer's appellation blend rather than his single-vineyard expressions, but it's still incredibly dynamic and delicious. A fresh and fruity strawberry-slushie aroma is met with notes of crushed slate and star anise-spiced cookies on the nose. The palate is bright in flavors of slightly tart cherries and ripe cranberries, but then come juniper and pine needle on the midpalate. Acidity pumps into the pomegranate and menthol finish.
title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Rich and with plenty of ripe fruit and generous tannins, this is a rich, smoky wine. It is concentrated, full of red-berry flavors that are layered with black cherries. This dense wine will age well. Drink from 2020.
title: Jaffelin 2015 Hervelets Premier Cru  (Fixin)

description: This premier cru vineyard lies at the northern end of Nuits-St.-Georges, close to Vosne Romanée. That explains the structure and richness of this firm wine. It is dense with tannins that give a dry core to the rich red fruits. With acidity still right up front and with the tannins, the wine needs aging. Drink from 2021.
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Les Boudots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This wine, from a unique single-vineyard on steep slopes, has power along with complexity, combining aromas like sun-baked earth and dry leaves with layered cherry, tea and rhubarb flavors and a firm, nicely tannic texture. This will stand up to rich entrées very well, and should improve through at least 2021.
title: Patz & Hall 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)

description: Plump red cherry, rust, dried sage, wild thyme and baking spices show on the nose of this top-end regional wine from Bill Foley. The palate shows cohesive well-woven flavors of strong red fruits, turned earth, brown spice, cracked pepper and a menthol-like finish. The acidity is perfect, the tannins soft but structural.
title: Two Sisters 2015 Lindsay's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Very ripe and very lush, this wine oozes opulent black cherry and blueberry from the aroma through the lingering finish. The fruit flavors are concentrated and deep, and a touch of baking spices adds complexity as the wine spreads across the palate and seems to coat the tongue.
title: Walt 2015 The Corners Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Winderlea Legacy is a limited selection from the site's original vines, planted in the mid-1970s. Unusually low in alcohol, it surprises with subtle rose, wild berry, wet stone and tanned leather flavors, all twisted into a marvelous tapestry. It demands your full attention and a bit of breathing time, and should age beautifully. Drink now through the mid-2030s.
title: Winderlea 2015 Winderlea Legacy Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Lavish yet acutely balanced, Wittmann's basic-label Spätburgunder offers deep, ripe blackberry and red currant flavors off set by bristling acidity. Layers of bramble, toast and smoke add complexity to nose and palate, along with a reverberating crushed-granite finish. Framed by fine, persistent tannins, its approachable already but should show beautifully for another decade to come.
title: Wittmann 2015 Rotwein Trocken Spätburgunder (Rheinhessen)

description: The tannins in this wine are firm and still prominent, giving both richness and aging potential. The fruit is full, weighty, packed with dark tannins and with firm concentration. This a dark, firm wine needs to age. Drink from 2024.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2015 Les Cazetiers Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: This wine is dry, packed with tannins and has good weight and structure. Concentrated and dense, it will need many years. The wine does have some bitter extraction although this should go as it matures. At the same time, the acidity and the rich berry fruits have good promise. Drink from 2025.
title: Domaine René Bouvier 2015 Fonteny Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Snappy black-raspberry aromas meet with thyme sprigs, carnations, cinnamon and a hint of smoke on the very fresh and lively nose. Elegant flavors of cranberry, pomegranate and hibiscus are hit with a dash of potpourri on the sip, and it's refreshing that this reserve-type bottling aims for vibrancy and grace rather than simply strong oak.
title: Etude 2015 Forté Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Rich aromas of rhubarb, alpine strawberry, red rose petals and cinnamon spice show on the nose of this bottling. It's more tightly wound and quite dry on the sip, with fresh wild red-currant and mace flavors framed by a chalky backbone and solid acidity.
title: Crawford Family 2015 Walk Slow Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Dark red cherry, turned earth and bloody iron aromas show on the extremely soil-driven nose of this bottling. The texture is rounded on the tip of the sip, and then comes the pop of piercing acidity in the midpalate, carrying flavors of dark red fruit, clove, cinnamon and crushed rose petals. The acid needs some time to mellow.
title: Etude 2015 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This is a balanced delightful expression of the variety, possessed of cherry, cola, tree bark and cardamom aromas and flavors. The star of the show is the vibrant acidity, which refreshes and impresses in complexity.
title: Blue Rock 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This combines grapes from two sites, the Hummingbird Hill Vineyard in the Petaluma Gap and a site on the warmer Westside Road in Russian River Valley. Fruity and inviting, it's also tannic and lengthy in stem, bark, tea and cranberry-raspberry, with a tease of orange zest.
title: Cellars 33 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This Pinot is sourced from a 61-acre estate located in the northernmost part of the Haute Vallée de l'Aude region, at 820–1,640 feet above sea level, with clay-limestone soils that are well suited to the variety. The wine is powerful and concentrated, with abundant notes of blackberries, black cherry and currant that are hit by ample doses of garrigue and baking spice. The palate is plush and velvety, with medium acidity to lift the ripe fruit tones. Notes of black tea, menthol, licorice and toasted cocoa nib ride out the lingering finish. Drink 2020–2025.
title: Gérard Bertrand 2015 Aigle Royal Pinot Noir (Haute Vallée de l'Aude)

description: Rusty aromas of raspberry and cranberry meet with dust, turned earth and a slightly gamy funk on the dynamic nose of this bottling from veteran vintner Rick Longoria. That feral quality extends to the palate, where chaparral herbs and peppery spices add intrigue to the wild cranberry flavors. It is well structured with lots of depth to the finish.
title: Longoria 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This engaging wine is nicely complex, not overly ripe or too full-bodied. Aromas of black tea and red cherries precede tangy rhubarb and intricate spice flavors backed by a good structure of light tannins and juicy acidity.
title: Writer's Block 2015 Pinot Noir (Lake County)

description: This organic single-vineyard wine comes from the lieu-dit of Solaire, a 17-year-old plot exclusively planted to the variety. It opens with pronounced aromas of purple flowers, bay and licorice that frame the ripe black-fruit tones of plum, cherry and raspberry sauce. Rich and generous, it boasts a plush texture, structured tannins and ample acidity, with enduring notes of sweet spice, toasted oak and licorice root on the close. Drink 2019–2023.
title: Domaine de la Métairie d'Alon 2015 Solaire Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Haute Vallée de l'Aude)

description: Marty's is a vineyard in the Green Valley possessed of Goldridge soils. This wine reflects its provenance, showing an intensity of reduced, spicy and concentrated flavor, a mix of black cherry, cola and sarsaparilla. The palate is full bodied and concentrated.
title: EnRoute 2015 Marty's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From a site within the producer's estate-farmed Grace Benoist Ranch, this wine is earthy in rose petal and a strong layering of cranberry and rhubarb. An underlying element of nutty almond paste adds richness to the otherwise medium-bodied effort that's tart in acidity.
title: Etude 2015 Temblor Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Firm and tightly wound, this Pinot needs some time in glass or decanter to show its true colors. When it does, it offers plenty of complex aromas like plums, blueberries, dark cherries, licorice, medicinal herbs and hot stones. The oak is a little apparent on the palate. Structurally everything is there: fine grained tannins, plenty of acidity and an earthy core. Drink now–2026.
title: Quartz Reef 2015 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Amisfield's Pinots can often veer towards power over elegance, but this straddles a line between both. The nose is attractive in notes of chocolate, cherry cola, and florals, while the medium-bodied palate comes with silky, savory tannins, plenty of juicy dark and red fruit and a solid, earthy core. This is approachable now with food but should also age nicely for the next five to seven years.
title: Amisfield 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Stemmy and earthy, this small-production offering is etched in tart and tangy flavor, with a strong underlying influence of oak. The medium-bodied core is succulent in cranberry and rhubarb.
title: Cellars 33 2015 Hummingbird Hill Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Herbal and floral, this wine offers a depth of muddled, baked strawberry and rhubarb. The fruit is wrapped around a full-bodied core of earthy underbrush that's well structured.
title: Sleeping Giant 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This is an elegant style, accentuating its tart apple and berry fruit with delicate impressions of stems, wood and a touch of maple syrup. The wine is drinking at or near its peak, so enjoy over the next year or two.
title: Konzelmann 2015 Lakefront Series Pinot Noir (Niagara Peninsula)

description: Enticing aromas of fresh mint, violet and bramble add depth and interest to the core of wild raspberry, strawberry and cherry tones in this wine. Medium-plus in weight, it's surprisingly full and rich for a Pinot, though well-balanced by ample acidity and just enough tannic structure to support the fleshy fruit flavors. Hints of cocoa and bark unfold on the close.
title: Domaine de la Métairie d'Alon 2015 Le Village Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: This wine is well-made while subdued on the nose, opening slowly to reveal forested spicy notes of cardamom and nutmeg. Full bodied and ripe, it offers inherent tension and bold flavor—a mix of dark cherry and vanilla.
title: Davis Bynum 2015 Jane's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Bittersweet chocolate, licorice and cocoa tones frame the ripe boysenberry and raspberry fruit on the nose and mouth of this wine. Medium in weight, it offers fine tannins to lend a subtle structure to the palate, and ample acidity to keep the mouthfeel fresh. Hints of black tea and baking spice linger softly on the finish.
designation: Maison Vialade Family Selection Grande Réserve Pinot
title: Les Domaines Auriol Claude Vialade 2015 Maison Vialade Family Selection Grande Réserve Pinot Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: A bit stiff and tannic at first, this touches on rusticity but maintains its footing and fills the palate with black fruits, graphite, coffee grounds and lightly grainy tannins. It's textural, full-bodied and downright interesting. Drink up over the next couple of years.
title: Reif Estate 2015 Pinot Noir (Niagara River)

description: The exploration of underripe tones must have some limit, and Ernst Storm pushes that line in this bottling, which starts with pickled tomato, brined olives, vinegar-soaked peppercorns, under-ripe boysenberry and dust on the nose. The pickled aspect carries to the palate, where the tomato-like acidity is fascinating, and yet may prove a bit too weird for the mainstream.
title: Storm 2015 Presqu'ile Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Crushed gravel, tight cranberry and lots of turned earth show on the nose of this appellation blend. The flavors are relatively light on the palate, with tart cranberry and white pepper riding waves of acidic energy.
title: Mignanelli 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This is a larger production wine that's well-made and in an affordable price point, offering a big full-bodied presence marked by earthy mint, black tea and black cherry. It finishes in toasty oak.
title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Deep red cherry, sharp cinnamon spice, crushed gravel and wet cement show on the nose of this clonal selection. The palate shows red plums and star anise, proving tangy and tart.
title: Wrath 2015 Pommard 4/777 Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Crushed slate, black raspberry and eucalyptus show on the nose of this bottling from the winery's estate vineyard. The palate is tart and lighter bodied, with baked earth, loam and cranberry flavors riding an acid-driven frame.
title: Wrath 2015 San Saba Vineyard Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: There's a lot to love about this Pinot's aromatics, with notes of florals, meat, roasted peppers, chocolate covered cherries and whole peppercorns. The palate, however, is less in tune, for the moment at least. Light to medium-bodied, the oak is prominent, very nearly drowning out the juicy fruit, and the acidity is almost biting. The tannins, though, are silky and well-structured. Drink 2019–2025.
title: Mohua 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Extremely dark and dense in the glass, this is a cleanly made and flavorful wine, it's just so ripe and extracted that many won't recognize it as Pinot Noir. Stewed berry, black plum pudding and campfire smoke aromas lead into a palate full of tangy boysenberry syrup and baked licorice.
title: Volatus 2015 Pinot Noir (Adelaida District)

description: Sweet oak-kissed cherry and raspberry tones are front and center on the nose of this lush, ripe wine, with hints of sage and balsamic dancing in the background. The palate boasts a pleasant tannic grip, with a texture like crushed velvet. Flavors of dense black fruit transition into hints of licorice and tea on the medium-length finish. Drink now.
title: Jean-Luc Aegerter 2015 Les Enfants Terribles Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: This is a solid if rather unexciting example of Otago Pinot, with notes of dark cherry and black current combined with savory, oaky characters of olive, cedar, vanilla and a hint of smoke. The oak is more apparent on the palate and is on the bitter side, although there's also plenty of cherry cola and dark chocolate flavors. Texturally it's a little thin, with grippy tannins and a good lick of acidity.
title: Mud House 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Otago)

description: Herbal, foresty tones set the stage for red cherry, strawberry and rhubarb aromas on the nose of this earthy wine. Fresh and light on its feet, it offers soft tannins to frame the ripe red-fruit flavors. Clean, juicy and approachable, enjoy this now.
title: Laurent Miquel 2015 Solas Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Winemaker: Charles Hopkins. There are some meaty, gamy hints in the nose of this wine, partnered with tones of green peppercorn, red currant and cherry. It's tart and salty on the palate, with bright, almost spritzy acidity, though gripping tannins soon takeover and carry through the close.
designation: Cape Winemakers Guild Op Die Berg
title: De Grendel 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Op Die Berg Pinot Noir (Ceres Plateau)

description: Cherry, strawberry and baking spices combine in this medium-bodied wine that offers texture and soft, supple layers of refreshing acidity.
title: Pacific Heights Wines 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This very underripe expression of Pinot Noir will win hardcore fans of that style. Tart raspberry meets with green peppercorns, underbrush and Kalamata olives on the nose. The palate is also full of olives, from Kalamata to green, with damp sagebrush, forest floor and more green-peppercorn flavors.
title: Waxwing 2015 Lester Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Wild cherry and sagebrush show on the nose of this fairly restrained bottling that doesn't rely on any new oak. Thyme and pepper spice show on the sip against a well-woven black-cherry frame. The acidity is balanced and the texture is soft, but the complexity is low.
title: Wrath 2015 Ex Anima Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: Boysenberry, dried rose petals, lilac and lavender show on the nose of this iconic winery's affordable bottling. Pencil shavings show on the sip, where the dark purple and boysenberry fruits are cut by deft acidity.
title: Santa Barbara Winery 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: An earthy, leathery aroma and flavor dominate this light-bodied, smooth-textured wine. It brings on modest plum, tea and forest-floor flavors to broaden its appeal on the palate.
title: Pey-Marin 2015 Trois Filles Pinot Noir (Marin County)

description: A bit reserved on the nose at first, this stylishly labeled bottling offers aromas of bright red fruit, crushed graphite and light fennel. Flavors are a bit simple though completely pleasant, with sagebrush spicing up the darker cranberry fruit.
title: City Winery Chicago 2015 Lake Shore Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Bright, simple and moderate in acidity and body, with a wealth of ripeness, this wine offers a strong sensibility of smoked cherry and cola flavor, finished in oaky vanilla.
title: Pali 2015 Bluffs Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Very fruity and rather soft in texture, this wine has a sense of sweetness from the buttery, grape aromas to the ripe, almost jammy flavors and gentle finish.
title: Prophecy 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: A buttery, plummy aroma, and flavors like cherry cobbler make this medium-bodied, dry wine attractive to sip. A rather firm texture keeps it appetizing.
title: B.R. Cohn 2015 Pinot Noir (North Coast)

description: This art-forward, canned-wine project hits a bit of a freshness wall here. The wine is quite light in the glass yet full of dried and tired red-cherry-syrup aromas and an odd cola spice. The palate is somewhat viscous without being sweet, showing concentrated red-cherry flavors and clove spice.
title: Nomadica 2015 Mission Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)

description: This medium-bodied wine has ripe plum and cherry-candy aromas. Equally fruity flavors are accented by some oak spice, with pretty good balance from mild tannins and acidity.
title: Red Rock 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (California)

description: This winery always manages to pack in rich fruit and hearty spice. This bottling shows bay leaf, anise, pine needle and black tea aromas that accent a core of plum. That hearty dark fruit carries through to the palate as well, but warms up with earthy soil, licorice and minty fudge flavors. A luscious, lingering mouthful.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 San Benito County Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Cody Wright sources his fruit from an A-list of Willamette Valley vineyards, and Shea is right at the top. Cloaked in a milk chocolate shell, this sophisticated wine melds blackberry fruit with flavor-extending streaks of cola and caramel. In scent and finish, there is a slight intriguing hint of pine sap.
title: Purple Hands 2015 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Smooth as silk and soft as butter, this glides across the palate in a smoky, sexy and seductive manner. Butter and berry, black cherry and a finishing flourish of chocolate nibs, capped with espresso, give this a complete start-to-finish set of flavors. Drink now and over the next decade.
title: Domaine Divio 2015 Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: An outstanding vintage for this cuvée, this sports a concentrated mix of plum and cherry fruit, matched to perfectly proportioned acids. Tannins are supportive and yet subtle, and this easily passes the two-day test, drinking beautifully a full 24 hours after first being opened and tasted.
title: Purple Hands 2015 Holstein Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Juicy, tart and crisp with acidity, this is a standout vineyard designate with a bold, velvety texture. Blue fruit-driven, it's full-bodied and fleshy in all the best ways, with a plush finish that teases with cardamom and tea.
title: Siduri 2015 Barbieri Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: One of the better wines on the market in the $30 range, this bottling from winemaker Aaron Walker shows beet, rhubarb, raspberry and dried mint aromas. The flavorful red fruit on the palate is lively and boisterous, its acidity and peppery spice combining for a very memorable sipping experience.
title: Pali 2015 Summit Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Ripe pomegranate and candied raspberry aromas meet with potpourri and cinnamon touches on the nose of this bottling from the Franscioni family. The palate is very approachable, with raspberry sorbet flavor and a graphite edge, providing both the richness that the appellation is known for and smart restraint.
title: Roar 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Hibiscus, rose petal and sour cranberry kick off the nose of this bottling, but its most compelling aroma is the stark and ethereal minerality, recalling iron and crushed gravel. Strawberry fruit pops on the palate, as does ripe cranberry, but that earthy soil and crushed rock quality rises to the top again.
title: Hoi Polloi 2015 Illicit Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This wine is sourced from Griffin's Lair, Sun Chase Vineyard and Terra de Promissio—three sites cooled by the coast. Candied and perfumed with robust oak and pine, it shows dark red fruit and supportive tannin, with a richness that remains balanced and fresh.
title: Lombardi 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This vineyard is really coming into maturity, and it shows in the firm, polished and dense flavors. Black cherry and savory herb components meld nicely, with streaks of minerally earth. Some skin contact is apparent in the tannins, which will benefit from a bit more bottle age.
title: Purple Hands 2015 Stoller Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Outgoing and easy to like, this brings tart and juicy raspberry and pomegranate fruit front and center. Details pile on: hibiscus tea and rosewater in particular. It's stylish through and through, with a long clean finish.
title: Big Table Farm 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Charred wood and myrrh hints meld with hibiscus, rosehip, tea leaf and tangy plum skin scents on the nose of this delicate but layered bottling from Doug Margerum. The palate boasts vibrant energy, which cuts through soft raspberry and graphite flavors. That vibrancy will last a long time. Drink 2018–2035.
title: Barden 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Incredibly suave dark strawberry and cherry aromas meld with chocolate and dusty earth notes on the nose of this bottling from one of the appellation's largest vineyards. The palate is more tightly wound, offering dried thyme, bay leaf and peppercorn instead of opulent fruit.
title: Fulcrum 2015 Brosseau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)

description: This small-production wine from two spectacular sites in the Petaluma Gap is robustly earthy and spicy, showing compost and blue fruit flavor. Broadly structured, it expands on the palate, its finish dotted with black tea and clove.
title: Guarachi Family 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The 2015 vintage in Mornington yielded dark concentrated wines. This one is atypically (for the estate) full bodied and bold as a result, with plum and black-cherry fruit and hints of mint, sage and bay leaf. Long and a bit drying on the finish, it needs a couple of years to come into balance. Drink 2020–2030.
title: Kooyong 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Mornington Peninsula)

description: A steely mix of raspberries and cherries frames the core fruit with tart citrus. There's a hint of gunmetal, along with tight well-ripened tannins. Solid winemaking all around.
title: Purple Hands 2015 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: When first opened, this seemed a bit shallow, but it blossomed with breathing time into a lovely brambly berry-soaked wine with a full-bodied palate. Streaks of cola and molasses come up also, lengthening the finish and adding texture and detail.
title: Purple Hands 2015 Kropf Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Cherry spice and earthy compost meet in this well-made, full-bodied wine from a warm vintage. Despite its density and concentration, it's freshened by bright acidity and a streak of cinnamon cola that lasts into the finish.
title: Rochioli 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From a north-facing, late-ripening section of the estate planted to 100% Pommard clone, this brings a juicy mix of spicy berry and cherry fruit. There's a suggestion of chocolate malt as well, and a mineral touch in the underlying acidity. Among the winery's sensational 2015 releases, this might be the lightest.
title: Shea 2015 North Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine leads with roasted cashew scents and follows with tart raspberry and cherry fruit and a light dusting of cocoa. Although aged 10 months in 20% new French oak, it emphasizes minerality and minimizes the influence of the barrels.
title: Winderlea 2015 Crawford Beck Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This aromatic wine is the ripest of the winery's fine lineup of 2015 Pinots, with a sweet, soft, round and smooth entry. Its pretty strawberry and cherry fruit is swathed in mocha, proving supple and immediately appealing. The still slightly stiff tannins suggest further improvement awaits over the next five years.
title: Big Table Farm 2015 Pinot Noir

description: An excellent vintage of this east-facing block-sourced wine, it seems to have ripened gracefully. It's flavorful and concentrated, with raspberry and cherry fruit. There's a hint of chicken stock on both the nose and palate and firm, astringent tannins that balance out the finish.
title: Cristom 2015 Jessie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Although not a premier cru, this village wine has plenty of the firm tannins and sense of structure that give Pommard its reputation. The wood aging shows through in spice and toast while the wine has plenty of black-cherry fruit and acidity to allow it to age well. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Domaine Changarnier 2015 Les Vignots  (Pommard)

description: This rich wine has beautifully integrated tannins and ripe fruit. With a generous character and succulent fruit over a base of firm tannins, it has excellent potential. Its tannins need to soften more for the wine to be ready to drink, so wait until 2023.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2015 Aux Champs Perdrix Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This wine is lean and initially austere. With dominant tannins and great concentration, it is firm but has the fruit weight to match with the extracted texture, so the wine will age well. It needs time for that structure to soften. Drink from 2025.
title: Roux Père et Fils 2015 Les Borniques Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: This wine's compact black cherry fruit carries some stemmy hints due to the inclusion of 30% whole clusters. It has substantial grip and is hard and tight at this young stage. Give it ample breathing and/or some extra years of bottle age.
title: William Rose 2015 La Chouette Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Maybe it's the fir tree branch and cone on the label, but there seems to be a hint of pine needle in this wine's aroma. That scent sneaks into its rhubarb and black cherry flavors, along with a touch of root beer and beet root. Those components may sound disparate, but they blend nicely, with a pleasantly chocolaty finish. Give it a couple more years of bottle age for optimal drinking.
title: Big Table Farm 2015 Wirtz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a structured, firm wine with a dry core of tannins, which bodes well for the future as the rich fruit comes slowly through the structure. It has weight and juicy potential. The wine comes from a walled vineyard wholly owned by the producer. Drink from 2021.
designation: Clos de la Perrière Premier Cru
title: Albert Bichot 2015 Clos de la Perrière Premier Cru  (Fixin)

description: The second vintage of this Dundee Hills-grown cuvée from winemaker Dominique Mahé is sharp and spicy on entry. That sharpness yields to tart cranberry, raspberry and cherry pie flavors, with streaks of stem and herb. Native yeast fermentation seems to have contributed extra texture. Tuck this away for another year or two before drinking.
title: Furioso 2015 L'Altra Linea Furioso Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Part of a new reserve-level series from Goodfellow, this was made from 100% Durant Vineyard fruit, half fermented using whole clusters. It shows more fruit flavor than the winery's other 2015s, offering plum and cherry notes supported by refreshing acids. Orange peel, pink grapefruit and Meyer lemon accents keep the palate lively.
title: Goodfellow 2015 Heritage No. 5 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This is a ripe wine with good structure as well as generous fruit. It has acidity, tannins and a smoky aftertaste while emphasizing the rounded red fruits that will make it delicious in a few years. It comes from vines on the flat lands stretching out into the Saône Valley. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Jadot 2015  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: This is an attractive Pinot, bright in cherry and strawberry fruit, with vanilla and a hint of orange tang on the nose. The flavors are more in the dried red fruit and leaves spectrum but there's lightness and bounce to keep things ever so gulpable.
title: Robert Oatley 2015 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)

description: This fruit-forward wine offers pretty blue fruit flavors, such as blueberry and plum, along with a touch of blackberry. Aged for 17 months in French oak, it finishes with mocha and sweet spice highlights and astringent tannins.
title: Sokol Blosser 2015 Blackberry Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This bottling is the perfect introduction to the biodynamic wines of Brick House. It has generous herbal scents and flavors, which may account for its entry-level pricing. But its pretty cherry fruit, complex aromas, cola-like touches and textured tannins all reflect the same care and substance as the rest of the portfolio.
title: Brick House 2015 Select Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: Wisps of licorice, bramble and smoke mingle into ripe black cherry throughout this juicy, fruity Pinot Noir. Fleshy and full on the palate, it's approachable and primary, but fresh in acidity and nuanced by a touch of bitter herb on the finish. Drink now–2020.
title: Dr. Heyden 2015 Oppenheimer Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Rheinhessen)

description: This dark and structured wine has a rich, solid character. The wine is concentrated and juicy, with ripe berry flavors and a firm core of tannins. It will certainly age, and it will be worth waiting until 2023.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015 Petite Chapelle Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Quite rich in texture and generous in flavor, this medium-bodied wine has notes of black cherry, toasted baguette and pomegranate. These flavors mingle with the broad mouthfeel, offering depth and layering that leads to a lingering finish.
title: Old Soul 2015 Pinot Noir (Lodi)

description: There's bountiful red cherry on the fruit-driven nose of this bottling, alongside loamy soil, dried sage and mint. The flavors are fresh and bright, with red fruit and lifting herb tones that are completely integrated so that no component stands out above the others. The tannic structure arises on the finish.
title: Pali 2015 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: There's a strong amount of newer wood aroma to these early releases from this new project. This bottling shows ample charred oak as well as roasted cherries, damp earth and crushed slate on the nose. Dark berries reaveal themselves on the sip alongside oak smoke.
title: Peake Ranch 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Though unabashedly earthy, this is packed with red plum, cherry, citrus rind and cut tobacco components. Such complexity is rare in a budget-priced Oregon Pinot. It glides gracefully into a mineral-drenched finish.
title: Portlandia 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This is a juicy exploration of the coast—a well-made effort that showcases notes of forest floor, black tea and savory pine. The black cherry and currant fruit leans dark and brooding, with an impressively balanced, medium-bodied hold on the palate.
title: Trombetta 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Hannah is a block selection from the upper portion of the Tualatin estate vineyard. Rich and rounded, it shows preserved strawberry, cherry compote and chocolate flavors. A full degree higher in alcohol than the 2014, it's just on the edge of showing some heat. But with its big, forward fruit, it's spot on for immediate enjoyment.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 Hannah Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This cuvée underwent 100% whole cluster fermentation using natural yeast and spent 16 months in French oak, just 10% new. It's compact and a bit subdued, as though the flavors are in hiding. Tart raspberry fruit shows through, with a suggestion of wet cement. Give it ample aeration or tuck it away for a couple more years.
title: Winderlea 2015 Winderlea Imprint Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Don't let the label mislead you; this is a well-made, well-ripened wine that deserves a classier package. Its mix of sweet blueberry and black cherry fruit is set against polished tannins. Those flavors carry seamlessly through a smooth, lightly toasty finish.
title: Deer Creek 2015 Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)

description: This single-vineyard wine is powerful, dense and structured. In contrast, it also has the potential for rich berry and black-cherry fruits. A core of tannins will give it longevity. Drink this rich wine from 2021.
title: Domaine Arnoux Père et Fils 2015 Les Pimentiers  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This aromatic, elegant 2015 is better balanced than its predecessor, while adhering to a similar style. Cherry blossom and rose petal aromas mark the nose, and lean, tart red fruit defines the palate. Short aging in 30% new French oak has brought in a light dusting of cocoa. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Bells Up 2015 Titan Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This exceptional vintage of Plowbuster is solidly built and packed with blackberry and cherry fruit. It has a sea salt chocolate component also, which adds both texture and flavor. This is not a keeper, but with its quality to price ratio, it's certainly a drinker.
title: Carabella 2015 Plowbuster Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Aged for 12 months in wood, 30% new, this rich, full wine is packed with black fruits, spice and tight tannins. A strong juicy character comes from the acidity and the blackberry fruitiness. From one of the 17 acres of premier cru owned by this producer, the wine will be ready to drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2015 Les Naugues Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Red cherry, rust, cinnamon, vanilla and wet herbs make for a crisp and compelling nose on this bottling by winemaker Tim Slater, who manages to elicit cooler climate properties from a warmer region. A wide array of herbs, including thyme, oregano, marjoram and sage, decorate the firmly structured hibiscus, red currant and cranberry backdrop. The acid goes deep into the finish.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)

description: This reserve-level best-barrel blend spent 16 months in 40% new oak. It's dark, chewy and toasty, with black cherry, black coffee and dark chocolate all in the mix of flavors. A solid and substantial wine, it drinks well young and may best be consumed over the next five years.
title: Megan Anne 2015 Black Love Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This single-vineyard wine is rock solid, with punchy black-cherry fruit, a streak of mineral and a sprinkling of coffee grounds. Clean earth and graphite add more complexity, and the tannins—ripe and sturdy—provide a perfect foundation. The wine was aged for 17 months in one-third new French oak, and should drink well into 2028.
title: WildAire 2015 Fairsing Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This typifies the best wines from this AVA, with well-matched components. Ripe sweet red berries are at the core, with accents of dried herbs and a whiff of cannabis. Everything is smoothly integrated and works well as a seamless whole.
title: J. Christopher 2015 Bieze Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This barrel selection is still tight and tannic, with compact, yet substantial cranberry, raspberry and pie-cherry fruit. It's got muscle and depth, and opens up nicely with aeration, displaying ripe and polished tannins through a long finish.
title: MonksGate 2015 Trinity Pinot Noir

description: Again in 2015 this offers reserve-level density and extra complexity, with the added bonus that it's the winery's biggest production Pinot. Winemaker Tony Rynders loads it with appealing cinnamon, caramel and milk chocolate components from aging in half new French oak. This is all nicely integrated into a base of fresh raspberry fruit. Tasty and ready for near-term drinking.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2015 Pinot Noir

description: This lovely wine shows its dark side throughout, mixing black fruits with strong flavors of black coffee. Barrel aging, just under a year in one-quarter new French oak, brings up flavors of dark chocolate and chicory. It's delicious and substantial, ready for drinking over the next half decade or longer.
title: Ayoub 2015 Memoirs Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Demeter-certified biodynamic grapes go into the making of this light and delicate wine—a fine example of coastal cooling. Layered in earthy rose petal and cardamom, it shows length and breadth around a quiet core of tart rhubarb and pomegranate.
title: Benziger 2015 Signaterra La Reyna Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is round and pretty, and seems, at least for now, to be a bit more accessible than some of the more compact and ageworthy 2015 single-vineyard selections from Ken Wright. Drink it up soon, and enjoy the light touches of orange peel and cinnamon highlights.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Tanager Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Secondary characters of smoke, soy sauce and dried leaves take the fore, with dried strawberries and flowers chiming in. There's a roundness and softness to the palate, which embraces more autumn forest characters amidst nicely structured tannins. Drink now–2025.
title: Wicks 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: This wine is spicy, savory and dense—a full-bodied wine from the sparkling wine producer which farms throughout the appellation. Buzzing acidity lies beneath a hearty helping of black cherry, strawberry and cola.
title: WindVane 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Plush and candied aromas of red cherry compote, rum butter, vanilla and mulling spice show on the nose of this bottling. Opulent cherry and rhubarb flavors mix with dark spice, bay leaf and tarragon on the palate, all riding a compelling texture with sizzling acidity.
title: Wrath 2015 KW Ranch Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This reserve has the same detail and overall finesse as the regular estate bottling, but here there's an extra dollop of black fruits. Overall, the 12-barrel select is a bit bigger and fruitier, but much in the same style.
title: Alloro 2015 Estate Riservata Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This is a whopper of a Pinot Noir, seen through the eyes of a Paso Robles winemaker. Dark and thick in the glass, it shows black cherry, clove and allspice on the nose. The massive palate offers blackberry and boysenberry flavors, with spicy gingersnap notes giving balance.
title: Cordant 2015 Kessler Haak Vineyards Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Gentle ripe, red cherry makes for an appetizing opening on the nose. The same fruit is vivid on the smooth and fluid palate where freshness gives wonderful direction. The tannins exercise their fine grip with elegance. This has lovely depth, elegance and resonance.
title: Domaine Charles Frey 2015 F Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This wine is delightfully fruit-forward in cherry cola and strawberry jam, balancing the strong well-defined flavors against a backdrop of powerful tannin and oak.
title: Eric Kent 2015 Sascha Marie Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The Latchkey vineyard is shared with Cody Wright (of Purple Hands). Spicy cranberry, strawberry and raspberry fruit shines here, young and fresh and vibrant. It's snappy and sappy, with good grip and supporting acidity. It should drink best in the early 2020s.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Latchkey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: There's a dusty character to the tannins, which complement the tart pomegranate and raspberry fruit. It's already quite smooth, lightly toasty and finished with a dollop of cinnamon.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Savoya Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: This juicy bottle bursts open with pomegranate, cherry and orange zest. Hints of Dr. Pepper streak through, but overall it's an elegant and detailed wine, showing more finesse than sheer power.
title: Alloro 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This exceptional site was planted back in the 1970s, and winemaker Jay Somers pulls some of that old-vine depth and nuance out of his first release from Medici. Bursting with ripe cherry fruit, it's got a base of clean earth, with highlights of coffee grinds and dark chocolate.
title: J. Christopher 2015 Medici Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This remains tightly wound, but the deep flavors of black cherry and cassis suggest that once it unwraps it will add muscle and mass. Highlights of coffee and charred wood lead into an astringent finish with drying tannins.
title: Ken Wright 2015 Guadalupe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Smooth and toasty, this cuvée pushes pretty barrel flavors front and center, well-defined and framing crisp fruit flavors of raspberry and cherry. There's a dash of orange marmalade that seals the finish. The wine spent 16 months in barrel, 40% new and 60% once-used.
title: Megan Anne 2015 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This medium-bodied Pinot offers aromas of tree bark, vanilla, dried leaves, cherry cola and a hint of licorice. The palate is supersmooth, with silky tannins and a tart cherry finish.
title: Ninth Island 2015 Pinot Noir (Tasmania)

description: Pommard and Wädenswil are the clones, and the wine spent 18 months in roughly two-thirds new French oak. It's luscious and loaded with blueberry, cherry and chocolate flavors, gliding into a finish with moderate tannins, a whiff of coffee and a streak of caramel.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2015 Heritage Clones Pinot Noir

description: Two clones and two vineyards combine here, with 18 months in French oak pulling it all together. It's a tasty mix of fruit, spice and barrel, with pomegranate and red-plum flavors at the core. Baking spices suggest buttered cinnamon toast, with a touch of cocoa powder adding the coup de grâce.
title: Quintet 2015 Yamhill Duet Pinot Noir

description: A solid effort, this brings plum and blueberry, black cherry and baking spices together in a substantial, even muscular style. Earthy tannins form a strong base, and the overall sturdy character, along with the balance and texture, suggest that this will age nicely over the next decade. Drink now through the late 2020s.
title: WildAire 2015 Timothy Pinot Noir

description: The top selection of the 2015 vintage, this estate-grown wine has a lovely mix of strawberries, raspberries and plums. Tangy citrus brightens the acids, and a dusting of cocoa amplifies the finish.
title: Alexana 2015 Revana Vineyard Block 7 Pommard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The Nicholas reserve sees 40% new French oak yet isn't at all oaky. Rather, it's fruit-powered, smooth and supple. Blue plum and black cherry come with pastry spices and a dash of sassafras.
title: Anam Cara 2015 Reserve Nicholas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Rich black cherry, clove, gingerbread and nose-tickling Christmas spices show on the rich nose of this appellation blend. It's also rich on the tip of the sip, with dried black cherry and more clove, but there is a black plum skin tang that holds it in check.
title: Cordant 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: The vanilla and wood scent of new oak is evident on the nose. On the palate this is more integrated, the fine wood notes intertwining with the ripe cherry fruit. The tannin structure is fine and firm, supported by vivid freshness. This is lovely now but will mellow over the coming years. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Kuentz-Bas 2015 Trois Châteaux Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Rich red cherry, plum and raspberry tones lead the nose of this fruit-forward wine, with hints of cocoa and cola spice dancing in the background. Those notes follow through to the satiny palate, framed by soft tannins that lead into a solid, medium-length finish.
title: La Forge Estate 2015 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Cherry, chocolate and toast aromas are bright and mildly oaky. This is snappy on the palate, with good energy. Raspberry and briny plum flavors are a touch spicy and finish racy and juicy.
title: San Pedro 2015 1865 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Elqui Valley)

description: This is a generously fruity wine with light oak aromas, lots of straightforward black-cherry flavor, a smooth texture and full body.
title: McManis 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Standard Pinot aromas of cherry and earthy spice are basic but sound. This feels snappy, tight and edgy, with plum and currant flavors. A mild but lasting finish shows a touch of hickory and smoke.
title: Indomita 2015 Duette Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Bright and fruity, this opens with attractive aromas of strawberry and red cherry that are accented by hints of cola spice, foliage and orange oil. Medium yet fine-grained tannins provide a subtle structure to the palate, while flavors of cocoa-dusted cherry and plum flesh linger on the close.
title: Calmel & Joseph 2015 Villa Blanche Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Sourced from a vineyard near Limoux, this Pinot leads with aromas of red cherry, raspberry leaf and a touch of blackberry. The mouthfeel is light and accessible, with soft tannins and berrylicious flavors that dominate the palate.
designation: Estate Single Vineyard Collection Saint Hilaire Vineyard
title: Paul Mas 2015 Estate Single Vineyard Collection Saint Hilaire Vineyard Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Band-Aid and baked red-fruit aromas set up a plump palate with creaminess. Candied smoky-berry flavors finish oaky and toasty, with enough true PN character to make this worthwhile.
title: Viña Casablanca 2015 Cefiro Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Scents of ripe red berry and cherry fruits are upfront on the nose of this friendly red, with hints of sweet spice, cherry cola, plum sauce and tree bark adding depth and interest. Lightweight and easy drinking, it boasts silky tannins and a fresh-fruited palate. Drink now.
title: Maison Nicolas 2015 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Medicinal cherry and red-plum aromas come with a whiff of latex. This feels plump, chunky and grabby. Medicinal candied-berry flavors end with racy acidity. This seems like a full step down from the 2014 version.
designation: Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard
title: Lomas del Valle 2015 Coastal Cool Climate Wine Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: With an extra-deep color and smoky-sweet oak aromas, this wine doesn't taste like its peer group, but seems to be going for commercial appeal as a spiced-up generic red. It's full bodied, almost thick in texture and firmly tannic.
title: Replica 2015 Misbehaved Pinot Noir (California)

description: Notes of red currant, rhubarb, tart strawberry and Cherry Dr. Pepper grace the nose and mouth of this straightforward and easy-drinking red. It's lightweight and softly structured, with a short but clean and pleasant finish.
region_1: Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne
title: Laroque 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de Pays Cité de Carcassonne)

description: This opens with grassy, green aromas of candied raspberry. A chunky palate delivers candied, caramelized, slightly weedy red-fruit flavors. Not a lot besides acidity and heat is driving the finish.
title: Agustinos 2015 Reserva Pinot Noir (Bío Bío Valley)

description: Gritty, heavily roasted aromas of peanuts and herbal berry fruits lead to a scratchy, tannic palate. This tastes of burnt oak, raw plum and currant, while the finish tastes briny and harsh. The 2012 version of this wine was much better. This is rough from front to back.
title: Koyle 2015 Costa Pinot Noir (Colchagua Costa)

description: This is a stunner because it shows such minerally depth, which many strive for but few achieve on a pink wine. The classic shade of pink gives way to bubblegum, lime juice, orange rind and smashed raspberry aromas. The zesty, vibrant lime juice acidity cuts right through plum fruit, but it's the graphite and chalky tension that wins the palate.
title: Presqu'ile 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Theoretically a very light rosé, the “Eye of the Partridge” is really a Pinot Noir blanc in this vintage, and joins a growing cohort of such wines from Oregon. Strong acids compete with some residual sugar, in a tart and sappy wine chock full of yellow plum, white raspberries and citrus fruit. It's rich and delicious, with impressive length and concentration.
title: St. Innocent 2015 Zenith Vineyard Oeil de Perdrix Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Production has increased six-fold in this vintage, good news for rosé lovers. Dry and flavorful, this all-Pinot wine deftly incorporates floral (rose petals), botanical (gin-like), citrus (orange peel) and peach-skin components. It's fresh and penetrating.
title: Acrobat 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Yet another example of the increasingly strong crop of rosé wines in recent vintages, this light-pink wine shows puréed strawberry and Big League Chew bubblegum aromas on the appealing nose. It's a lively wine on the palate, thanks to lime zest-powered acidity, with crisp pluot and just-ripe plum flavors as well as a touch more bubblegum.
title: Sanford 2015 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: More like an off white in color than actually pink, this 100% barrel-fermented, free-drained wine shows lemon blossoms, Pink Lady apple and lime zest on a very restrained nose. The palate is lively with tantalizing acidity, and fresh with light Meyer lemon zest and juice flavors.
title: Center of Effort 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Spicy, medicinal cherry, tomato and herb aromas lead to a palate with rubbery tannins and moderate astringency. A fresh and tasty mix of spicy, rooty berry flavors ends with brushy, herbal, chocolaty notes on the finish.
title: Bodega Chacra 2015 Barda Pinot Noir (Patagonia)

description: Berry preserves—raspberry, blueberry and cherry—are coupled with hints of sweet spice and forest floor on the nose of this attractive wine. A soft texture of fruit-skin tannins frame the berry core, with lingering hints of baking spice on the close.
title: Saget la Perrière 2015 La Petite Perriere Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Though labeled white, this is a pale rosé, 100% Pinot Noir and one-quarter barrel fermented in neutral oak. It's slightly nutty, with a touch of oxidation and flavors of toasted grain. More dry extract than fresh fruit, despite its youth, and what fruit is there is tart as rhubarb pie.
title: Hawks View 2015 Cellar Series White Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Mulchy and earthy on the nose, this smells both slightly horsey and also like citrus peel. Full in body but rough around the edges, this delivers earthy, dry flavors of leafy plum and berry fruits.
title: Manos Negras 2015 Pinot Noir (Patagonia)

description: Fresh, fruity cherry, citrus and rose aromas are light and airy. This feels a bit raw and scratchy, while currant, red plum and brown sugar flavors finish juicy, snappy and uncushioned. This has all the requirements of a good picnic Pinot Noir.
title: Alfredo Roca 2015 Fincas Pinot Noir (Mendoza)

description: This is a solid and balanced wine, with lively aromas and flavors of red cherry, strawberry and banana. Light weight and easy drinking, the softly tannic structure transitions seamlessly into the clean, fruity finish.
title: J.P. Chenet 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: This is a delicious expression of the genre, medium bodied and forcefully crisp, with delicate lacings of cherry, apricot and peach. The underlying hint of vanilla gives it a welcome succulence and touch of sweetness though the wine otherwise presents dry.
title: Kobler 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Winemaker: Gordon Newton Johnson. Herbal streaks of foliage and earthy spice frame the core raspberry, cherry and game tones of this pretty Pinot. It's lightweight and easy drinking, with soft tannins and ripe red-fruit flavors that are accented by notes of Dr. Pepper and forest floor. Though it's approachable and drinkable now, it should also cellar well through 2020.
title: Newton Johnson 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Seadragon Pinot Noir (Hemel en Aarde)

description: Sweet scents of sun-kissed watermelon and raspberry perfume this irresistibly zingy wine. The bright berry palate is deeply concentrated, but also shaded by tones of bramble and mineral that lend depth and substance. It's satisfyingly full in body with a thirst-quenching finish.
title: Anthony Nappa 2015 Anomaly Pinot Noir (New York)

description: This was made from a saignée after a full-day's skin contact, resulting in a sultry, soulful, tiny-production wine that's refreshing and fruity in orange and lime, dry and completely in balance.
title: Bruliam 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Sweet-tart red cherry and raspberry flavors cling lusciously on the palate of this dry yet buoyantly fruity wine. It's easy-quaffing yet elegant, marked by vibrant cranberry acidity on the finish.
title: Raphael 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (North Fork of Long Island)

description: Winemaker: Gottfried Mocke. If you like herbal, minty Pinots, then this wine is definitely for you. Intense aromas of eucalyptus, rooibos tea, pomegranate, fennel bulb and currant leaf are at the forefront of the bouquet and carry through to the lifted, mentholated palate. The medium-weight palate offers fine yet structured tannins and a long, herbal finish. Drink now–2020.
title: Gottfried Mocke Wine Projects 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Pinot Noir (Coastal Region)

description: Medium-bodied yet chunky in feel, this is a smoky wine, tinged with hints of roasted beetroot and mocha. Savory and earthy, it seems atypical for the variety and region.
title: Marisco Vineyards 2015 The King's Fury Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: Done in a forward tutti–frutti style, this puts all the flavor right up front. Grape candy is what comes to mind, with a light tannic finish. It's a good gulping wine for decks, campers and picnic outings.
title: Second Growth 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This medium-bodied wine has a light color, earthy and herbal scents, a tart cherry flavor and a dry finish.
title: Sola 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: A light, ethereal quality ignites this wine's compelling high-toned acidity and subtle, integrated oak. Juicy orange and cranberry form its core, as roses permeate the nose. The texture is silky smooth and inviting.
title: Les Belles Collines 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is one of the first $120 Pinot bottlings from the Edna Valley, and it impresses with power and complexity. Aromas of black plum and boysenberry are lifted by sandalwood, clove and loamy earth scents. The palate's deep berry fruits are spice by shaved licorice and cinnamon, with a tightly woven structure that contributes to a long lasting finish.
title: Tolosa 2015 Primera Edna Ranch Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Plump mulberry and black plum aromas are generous but reserved enough on the edges to keep it elegant, lifted by spicebox and sweet tobacco touches. Lovely layers of flavors explode on the palate, with a strong spicy character lifting the core of dark red fruit. There's also an earthy flavor, and perfect acidity binding it all together.
title: Testarossa 2015 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This is an inaugural release from this site, an ocean-viewing, high-elevation perch overlooking the Pacific Ocean that loves the variety. A sanguine element rides a canopy of dense, thick forest floor and dark cherry compote, the tannins and oak sizable and present. A length of cardamom provides a memorable spiciness to the finish.
title: Sojourn 2015 Walala Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This 100% 667 clone bottling by Bill Brosseau is extremely beautiful on the nose, with scarlet rose petals, perfectly ripe cherry, hot raspberry pie and cinnamon spice aromas. That red fruit with cinnamon touch carries through the sip, which is flavorful but remains light on its feet, showing a touch of herbs and acid that persists into the finish.
title: Testarossa 2015 Rosemary's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: The name refers to the rocks in this section of the estate vineyard, and they can be felt as well as tasted in the wine. The mouthfeel is slightly astringent, with hints of metal and stone, and the alcohol is muted, allowing the more subtle suggestions of citrus and beet and truffle and wild strawberry to emerge. All in all it's the most complex and intriguing of the winery's offerings, and merits your full attention.
title: Le Cadeau 2015 Rocheux Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Cinnamon red hots and a depth of forested pine greet the nose in this compelling, medium-bodied wine, which is wholly exotic in approach. Asian spice and a nutty character form flavor and texture amidst a light, delicate ripeness of fruit and tannin.
title: Neyers 2015 Roberts Road Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Deep black cherry, sarsaparilla and vanilla show on the full and hearty nose of this bottling from the historic vineyard that was planted in the 1970s. It's tightly woven on the palate, with earthy spice and dark red fruits. The acidity holds crisp deep into the finish.
title: Testarossa 2015 Sanford & Benedict Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Rich round cherry fruit, lightly infused with tobacco highlights, introduces this delicious wine. There is a pleasing softness to the palate, without it being in any way flat or flabby. The fruit seems more mature than the young vintage would suggest, and it's drinking more like a wine from half a decade ago, which means you don't need to cellar it to get cellar-style flavors. Pie cherry, orange peel and even a touch of pineapple peeks through the lingering finish.
title: Aubichon Cellars 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Light at first, almost delicate, this pretty wine has strawberry and pomegranate fruit, gentle herbal highlights, and tannins that taste of green tea. The finish turns a bit astringent, with a lick of cola. Give it some hours of aeration and it fleshes out, with a lush mix of tart fruit and milk chocolate barrel flavors.
title: Aubichon Cellars 2015 Riverside Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Earth, mushroom and forest floor intrigue from sip one in this thick, densely structured effort from the great site. Cardamom, pine needle and cranberry contribute additional intrigue and spiciness to the palate, which is buoyed by bright, lengthy acidity and integrated oak.
title: Sojourn 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Hearty and thick aromas of raspberry, mulberry and sugar plums meet with a touch of bay leaf on the nose of this bottling from a famous vineyard. Woody and dark red fruits show on the sip, with juniper and sour cherry flavors most prominent.
title: Testarossa 2015 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Baked blackberries, nutmeg and star anise aromas make for a dense and full but not overly powerful or rich nose on this bottling. It's fairly thick and soft in body, but with some textural grip, showing flavors of black plum skins, graphite and sandalwood, before finishing on a eucalyptus kick.
title: Tolosa 2015 Heritage Edna Ranch Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Tight-grained tannin plays a supporting role to this wine's undeniable earthiness, a mix of compost and wild mushroom. Subtle on the nose, the savory character gives way eventually to a density and concentration of brighter flavors, from cherry and citrus to spiky pine.
title: Sojourn 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is an outstanding value in a Willamette Valley Pinot Noir—soft, subtle and spicy, with sweet strawberry and cherry fruit. All neutral oak fermented, the mouthfeel is smooth and supple, and the flavors have a sexy, delicious quality that says “drink me now!”
title: Ruby 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: After an initial wave of briny rubbery aromas, this turns towards lively raspberry scents topped by toasty oak. Fresh and punchy in the mouth, with elegance, this tastes of red raspberry and herbal plum. A lightly salty finish with tomato and plum flavors is fresh and lasting.
title: Errazuriz 2015 Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Valley)

description: Earthy aromas of rust, loam and dark red plum meet with scents of charred oak on the nose of this bottling. There is a bright acidity to the sip, but it surrounds a darker core of cran-raspberry fruit, with peppery spice and well-integrated rosewater flavors showing toward the finish.
title: Testarossa 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The reserve bottling shows more phenolic bite than the easy-drinking regular release. There are tight deep streaks of stem and earth, along with scents of cola and sassafras, and stiff tannins framing tight cherry fruit. This is the one to tuck away for a couple more years while drinking the regular Willamette Valley bottling.
title: Aubichon Cellars 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Lush and full-bodied layers of velvety texture support firm flavors of baked cherry, pomegranate, pine forest and earth, a vibrant current of acidity bursting beneath. Layers of tannin provide a hearty mouthfeel and sense of density, signaling a robust vintage.
title: Sojourn 2015 Rodgers Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Rich aromas of milk chocolate share space on the nose with mushroom, cherry and currant notes. Although this ranks as a fuller-bodied Pinot, the palate retains a sense of crispness courtesy of bright acidity. Flavors of tomato, herbs, black plum and spice are just oaky enough, while this finishes with a blend of barrel notes, cherry and plum. Drink through 2020.
title: Kingston Family 2015 CJ's Barrel Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Scott Shull (Raptor Ridge) consults here. This brings a blend of clones from the estate vineyard, with ample new wood still showing through. Black fruits and a vein of coffee are also in the mix, with a balanced, somewhat muscular mouthfeel. This has the strength to stand up to a lightly blackened grilled seafood filet.
title: Le Cadeau 2015 Diversité Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Slightly liquorous when first opened, this pushes the alcohol up towards a place where some of the nuances are lost. But it has plenty of flavor, power and punch. Black coffee, black cherry, black olive and black licorice are entwined here, with some heat in the follow-through. Give it a good decanting and it will start to smooth out.
title: Le Cadeau 2015 Équinoxe Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There's a whiff of volatility upon opening, then a rush of bright, tangy orange and cherry fruit. The 20% new oak aging does not really come through in scent or flavor. Though not in any way effervescent, this young release carries an impression of carbonation in the finish. Give it another year or two of bottle age and drink after 2019.
title: Ruby 2015 Steve's Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Earthy aromas of clay and wet slate meet with tangy red fruit on the nose of this bottling, which is a best-barrel blend. There is expert acidity and nicely polished tannins, with dark berry flavors along with more slate-driven earthiness. Relatively mellow and reserved for a top-tier effort.
title: Testarossa 2015 Niclaire Pinot Noir (California)

description: This red-label cuvée is made exclusively from estate-grown fruit. Lively and aromatic, it carries a streak of beetroot threaded through blackberry fruit. It's tight and tense, like a coiled spring, suggesting that some additional bottle age will help to open it up. The concentration is impressive, and the flavors continue on through a lengthy finish, with a suggestion of gunmetal as it subsides.
title: Le Cadeau 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Although this wine is tight with tannins and wood aging, it shows the softer side of the appellation with its ripe red berry fruit. Needing more time in bottle to deliver the opulence of its fine Premier Cru vineyard, it will be best from 2022.
title: Labouré-Roi 2015 Les Marconnets Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Plum, berry and raspberry aromas are light and elegant. This feels medium to full in body, with tannins that grab a little but don't clamp down. Ripe black-fruit flavors of plum and currant finish with an herbal note of basil along with flavors of oak and tomato sauce.
title: Concha y Toro 2015 Marques de Casa Concha Pinot Noir (Limarí Valley)

description: Ripe red fruits are given a soft cushion of tannins in this smooth rounded wine. It has a fine juicy balance with rich fruits and good acidity. Drink from 2020.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015 Le Village  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This wine really benefits from the delicious ripe fruit of the vintage. So broad, rich red-berry flavors give the wine a generous character with just the right amount of the balanced acidity. The wine is full, fruity and ready to drink.
title: Maison Jessiaume 2015  Bourgogne

description: Laurent Dufouleur is the current director of Tramier and has created a series of wines under his name. This wood and red-fruit-flavored wine is likely to be attractively ripe and jammy as the wood softens and integrates. There is fine acidity at the end and the wine will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Laurent Dufouleur Cuvée Grégoire  (Bourgogne)

description: Intensely dark blackberry fruit meets with game and minty chocolate on the nose of this appellation blend by Adam Lee. The flavors are woody with forest undergrowth, and surround a core of mulberry.
title: Siduri 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: It is not clear while a simple appellation Bourgogne should need a wax capsule and heavy bottle. It all makes it that much harder to get to the warm ripe wine inside. With its strawberry fruit that is laced with acidity, the wine is generous, reveling in the fine 2015 vintage. Drink from 2018.
title: Arnaud Baillot 2015  Bourgogne

description: This is a crisp fruity wine, full of red-berry fruits and acidity. It has the vintage's rich character, juicy and with a core of tannins that will soften quickly. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Château de Chamirey  (Mercurey)

description: Pinched, briny red-fruit aromas are rubbery. This has a distinctly raw but juicy and fresh palate. Tea, plum, currant and pink-peppercorn flavors are gamy, savory and a bit salty on the finish. In every way, this reflects its cool coastal origins.
title: Leyda 2015 Las Brisas Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: This single-vineyard village wine comes from a small parcel close to woods on the western edge of the Mercurey appellation. With soft red fruits and attractive acidity, the wine is fruity, easy and with a crisp aftertaste. It will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: Château de Santenay 2015 Le Bois de Lalier  (Mercurey)

description: A jumbled mix of aromas includes notes of rubber, berry fruits, plum, grass, fennel and oak. In the mouth, this is full and blocky. Rubbery flavors of plum and berry finish salty, savory and spicy, with unintegrated oak that stands out.
title: Ritual 2015 Monster Block Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: There's an overwhelming sense of menthol to this bottling, with a minty character extending over the pomegranate of the nose. It's also prominent on the sip, with camphor masking the cranberry fruit.
title: Laetitia 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: The wine is juicy with intense acidity. Its red-currant flavor is consistent with this acidity. Tannins are firm and will soften. The juicy aftertaste gives the wine crispness.
title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2015 Aux Serpentières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is an open delicious wine, full of red-cherry and red-currant fruit with a touch of minerality to add texture. Some wood aging has smoothed out the crisp fruit and added vanilla to the mix. Drink this ripe wine from 2018.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Buissonnier  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: Wood aromas and spice show strongly in this wine. On the palate, there is a toasty character that gives a bitter edge to the ripe red fruits. That needs to go, so wait to drink this wine from 2019.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine de la Ferté  (Givry)

description: Showcasing the rich vintage, this is a generous fruit-driven wine. With red-berry flavors and plenty of acidity to balance, the wine is soft and juicy. Drink it from 2018.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Le Renard  (Bourgogne)

description: This large appellation in the Côte Chalonnaise can produce fruity wines like this. With red-berry fruits and light tannins, the wine has spice and crisp edge of acidity that comes from fruit that was just ripe, surprising in the rich 2015 vintage. The wine will be ready to drink from 2018.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Laurent Dufouleur Château Mi-Pont  (Mercurey)

description: This appellation blend is nowhere near as amazing as the winery's single-vineyard expressions from this vintage, but it'll work for an everyday sipper. Light red cherry meets with damp herbs, wet hay and forest floor on the nose, while the simple palate combines red fruit with more herbs and orange peels.
title: Foxen 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Spicy and earthy, this medium-bodied red is rewarding in its layers of dried herb, sage and strawberry patch. The tartness lingers on the lean palate, ending in cranberry and cardamom.
title: Spicy Vines 2015 Peter's Delight Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Light in color and body, this restrained, classically styled red is tart in fruit character and acidity, with a thickness of concentration that surprises. A hint of reductive oak meanders through.
title: Ampelos 2015 Ampelos Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: One of the more reliable grocery store brands on the market right now, this bottling shows aromas of hot cherry pie with a vanilla and nutmeg crust. The palate moves more toward darker boysenberry flavors, with cola, mace and dried wild herbs.
title: SeaGlass 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Smoked red-cherry and pomegranate-juice aromas show on the sip of this appellation blend. The palate shows fruit punch with touches of lavender and vanilla, which tastes good altogether, even though it is not very complex.
title: Josh Cellars 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Leathery red-fruit aromas turn more gritty and earthy with airing. This feels chunky and full, without much elegance. Plum and rubbery berry flavors finish with a chocolaty oak note.
title: Coleccion Privada 2015 Gran Reserva Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: Pure Pinot Noir from the south of Beaujolais, this is soft, fruity and with attractive acidity. Red fruits and a crisp acidity give this wine its bright character. Ready to drink now.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Les Pierres Dorées  (Coteaux Bourguignons)

description: Delicate notes of earthy herbs and cola spice grace the red chery, currant, rhubarb and cranberry tones on the nose and mouth of this easygoing wine. It's light in weight and softly structured, with ample acidity lending freshness through the close.
title: Domaine de Cabriac 2015 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)

description: Produced from old vines in the Aegerter Domaine, this wine is dominated by red fruits and spice from wood aging. It is fruity, perfumed and likely to be ready to drink soon. Drink from 2018.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: Named after neighboring winery owner Mike Etzel (Beaux Frères), this exceptional wine is brilliantly focused and rippling with muscular depth. The palate is etched with blackberry and black cherry fruit, immersed in lush vanilla, coffee and caramel tones. It's instantly gratifying, impossibly seductive and exceptional in every way.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Estate Vineyard Etzel Block Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
