description: From the Lakeview Vineyard in Green Valley, this deeply concentrated bottling shows blackberry, crushed graphite, asphalt-laced gravel, dried violets and rose petals on the richly layered nose. The palate is soft and approachable, yet firm enough to ensure a long life, carrying flavors of elderberry, elderflower and a meaty richness. Drink 2018–2035.
title: Cattleya 2015 Cuvée Number One Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This reserve-level selection was aged in 100% new French oak and sports a green label that distinguishes it from the dozen or so other Pinots in the winery's portfolio. It's dense and deeply flavored, its black fruit supported by an assortment of highlights—cola, coffee and moist earth most prominent. There's a faint hint of barnyard funk, adding yet another element to a most impressive effort. Drink now and over the next half decade.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Notorious Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: From the heart of the appellation, a sweet spot for the variety, this wine is explosively delicious in rich red berries. It boasts a lush, voluptuous texture that somehow feels graceful, balanced by juicy acidity that lifts the ripe fruit and cardamom cola flavors.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Olivet Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a triumph of blending, a cuvée that over-delivers on the sum of its parts, imparting a profile of raspberry strudel and juicy Bing cherry. With underpinnings of spicy cardamom, savory tones of forest and tea invite you further into the glass, finishing with a tease of dark chocolate.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Black cherry and cola flavors burst from the glass in this wine. Its fruit core has a candied, lollipop-like character, but that's not to suggest that it's anything but complex, deep and utterly delicious. The delicate finish extends the pleasure for minutes on end.
title: Patricia Green Cellars 2015 Freedom Hill Vineyard Coury Clone Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Dark cranberry and red cherry notes meet with a clay minerality and a touch of purple flowers on the nose of this widely available bottling. Strong acidity on the sip present flavors of rose petals, cranberry and potpourri. Give it some time and it opens quite nicely.
title: Cupcake 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Warm cherry pie and hibiscus notes meet with candied vanilla and cream soda elements on the nose of this bottling. The palate is rounded with red fruit and a clay minerality in the background.
title: Layer Cake 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Some rosés are made simply by bleeding the juice from the fermenter, to concentrate the remaining wine. Whether or not that is the case here, the wine has the simple pleasant lightly candied strawberry flavors one might expect from such a technique. It's fruity and undemanding. Drink up.
title: Z'IVO 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: From vineyards across Burgundy, this soft wine is an attractive entry point to the region. It has red fruit and a soft character, with just some youthful tannins that melt as it opens. Drink now.
title: Florent Descombe 2015  Bourgogne

description: Streaks of stem, bark and stone dominate this wine, with barely ripe fruit well in the background. Tannins are stiff and dominant, and the overall finish feels a bit green. It's a serviceable rather than sexy style.
title: Winter's Hill 2015 Watershed Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: There's a funky, foxy note and a sour edge to this wine, which seems disjointed, or perhaps still showing a little bottle shock. Component flavors include sour plum and wild cherry, and the finish is leathery and tannic.
title: A Blooming Hill Vineyard 2015 Trouble Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This soft and cushiony wine has light red cherry fruit, gentle tannins and an attractively soft, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
title: Labouré-Roi 2015  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: Clean but modest raspberry aromas set up a wiry palate. This tastes of tart plum, tomato and herbs. A minty green note rises up on a snappy palate that includes a touch of oak.
title: Chilensis 2015 Reserva Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Maule Valley)

description: Raspberry and strawberry aromas suggest fruit punch. This feels stocky and sticky due to low acidity. Flavors of plum and berry come with buttery oak notes, while this is short and hollow on the finish.
title: Seraphim 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Valley)

description: This is a simple, fruity wine. Its red cherry fruit is cut with a stalky, crisp texture and layered with acidity. It's made to drink young.
title: Lacheteau 2015 Tip Top Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Dusty cherry and tomato aromas are neither elegant nor elevated. A jagged palate lacks flow, while this tastes of salty sour plum. A low-depth finish tastes peppery. Overall, this is simply adequate Pinot Noir.
title: Aresti 2015 Special Release Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Granular aromas of latex, plum and animal lead to a choppy piercing high-acid palate. Dilute flavors of generic berry fruits are candied on one hand and tart and weedy on the other.
title: Cono Sur 2015 Organic Pinot Noir (Chile)

description: This rusty looking PN smells roasted and stewy, with forced oak. In the mouth, this is chunky and flat. Stewy oaky plum flavors run sweet and heavy on clove, while this reverts to creamy on the finish.
title: Siegel 2015 Special Reserve Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Concentrated cherry and plum aromas meet with iron, cinnamon and gingersnap on the nose of this single-vineyard wine. The flavors surpass the aromas in succulence—star anise, nutmeg and bay leaf seemingly wrapped in buttered pastry.
title: August West 2015 Graham Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Extremely luscious on the nose, this bottling is redolent of baked black cherries, vanilla, smoke and wet riverstones. That fruit-forward style carries over to the palate, with cherry pie and baking spice flavors, backed by a solid and an expertly balanced acidity that holds those rich flavors in check.
title: Tolosa 2015 Hollister Edna Ranch Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Plump but sour cranberry fruit aromas meet with sweet sandalwood, clove and forest floor on the nose of this San Francisco-made bottling from the historic property. Sanguine touches on the palate lead to raspberry, cherry, cinnamon and juniper flavors, ending in a menthol finish.
title: Sandler 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Bright and peppery with spice, this bottling from Ed Kurtzman delivers all that's lovable about Pinot Noir in a fresh, light style. Its raspberry fruit is accented and lifted by bay leaf, thyme and white pepper notes, with a saline hint of kalamata olive. That boundless energy continues on the palate, where crisp pomegranate blends with marjoram.
title: August West 2015 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Made from organically grown grapes, this wine is rich and concentrated. Acidity lends a crisp edge, while not detracting from the black fruit and ripe tannins. With its impressive, dense texture it's a wine to age and drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Laleure-Piot 2015 Ile de Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Arguably the finest premier cru in Pernand-Vergelesses has produced a structured wine with plenty of the vintage's characteristic ripe fruit, generous tannins and a dry core. As it comes together, it will blossom into a rich, full wine. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Laleure-Piot 2015 Les Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Candied red cherry fruit meets wild herb and wet slate aromas on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard planted in 1988. Boisterous acidity kicks off the palate, where raspberry and tart strawberry fruit flavors lead to round red plum and a slate-like rockiness. The finish is bright with acidity.
title: Sandler 2015 Keefer Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Hearty blackberry, smoke, plum skin and gravel scents show on the nose of this bottling from a winery that's retooling its focus toward high-end Pinot. It's rich on the palate, with surprisingly sticky tannins that carry its dark red fruit and roasting herb flavors, bolstered by judicious acidity.
title: Tolosa 2015 1772 Stone Lion Edna Ranch Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: Round red cherry, deep plum and ripe cranberry fruit mix with ginger spice and wet slate on the nose of this appellation blend from Ed Kurtzman. There's an iron tinge to the palate, giving its wild red cherry and thyme flavors a mineral kick, framed by leathery tannins and zesty acidity.
title: August West 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This 100% Pinot Nero offers enticing aromas of fragrant blue flower, wild red berry and a whiff of baking spice. The sleek savory palate delivers raspberry, green tea, graphite and a white pepper note. Fresh acidity and firm but refined tannins provide balance. Enjoy soon.
title: Abbazia di Novacella 2015 Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)

description: This bright wine opens with attractive aromas of red berry and blue flower. The savory palate delivers wild strawberry, red cherry, beet and a hint of mint alongside sleek tannins. Drink soon to enjoy the fresh fruit flavors.
title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2015 Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)

description: Soft in aroma, this bottling shows plush black raspberry, dewy sagebrush, sour plum and slate on the nose. Assertive wet rock flavors show on the palate, where bright acidity will preserve the soft red fruit flavors for years to come.
title: Sandler 2015 Boer Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)

description: This 100% Pinot Nero offers intense aromas of red berries and black currants. The elegant palate delivers raspberries, green tea and a hint of cinnamon alongside silky tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy soon.
title: Tiefenbrunner 2015 Turmhof Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)

description: This estate, now owned by the negociant Champy, specializes in the vineyards around Pernand-Vergelesses. This single parcel wine is ripe and jammy, benefiting from the richness of the year. Soft tannins and red strawberry fruit dominate and will remain the main theme as the wine matures. Drink from 2018.
title: Domaine Laleure-Piot 2015 Clos de Bully  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling offers black plum skin, clay, gravel and berry pie aromas. The mouthfeel is full of polished tannins and edged with sharp acidity. Dark fruit and wet earth flavors dominate.
title: Tolosa 2015 1772 Edna Ranch Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: This is a young, fruity wine with bright acidity and red berry fruit that comes across as lean. Its structure and tannic core suggests it needs to age. Drink from 2019.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015 Grande Cuvée  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: This almost translucent brick-colored Pinot offers aromas of lettuce leaf, orange peel and dried red fruits. It's light, edgy and fresh in feel, with flavors of salted meat and herbal plum. A tangy citric finish is primed with racy acidity. Fermented and aged in egg-shaped cement tanks.
title: Zorzal 2015 Eggo Filoso Pinot Noir (Tupungato)

description: This is a classic, concentrated but elegant wine, from the wonderful black cherry and forest underbrush aromas to the ripe fruit flavors, full body and polished texture. Aging in 30% new Hungarian barrels gave a subtle spicy accent.
title: Poseidon 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Savory aromas of black pepper, leather and sandalwood provide depth to the core mulberry fruit on this clonal selection. Rounded flavors of black plums and dark berries are lifted by sagebrush, dried ginger and Christmas spice on the palate that offers layers and layers of depth.
title: Alma Rosa 2015 Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Dark mulberry, black raspberry, wet slate and a touch of whole nutmeg show on the nose of this bottling by a Chicago-based winery from a vineyard that now goes by the name Shokrian. It's dry and tart on the sip, full of sour wild berries along with lots of sage and thyme, culminating in a cola and candied-plum finish.
title: City Winery Chicago 2015 Verna's Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara)

description: This is a great example of a lower alcohol, somewhat underripe Pinot Noir that shows solid depth and lovable freshness. Lively aromas of black-raspberry sorbet and dark strawberry show on the nose, while the palate picks up a tart cranberry character. White pepper, thyme and juniper enliven the fruity flavors.
title: Tessier Winery 2015 Saveria Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This twist-top, widely available bottling packs both fun and elegance into the bottle. It starts with aromas of freshly smashed red cherries, vanilla cake and sharp mace on the nose. Fresh energy marks the grippy palate, where layered flavors move from tart cherries to salt and pepper, then thyme and brown spice.
title: Baileyana 2015 Firepeak Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)

description: This delicious, accessible, easy-sipping wine has everything in moderation, from gently fruity aromas, to light but complex flavors of plum, black tea and spices, to medium body and a supple mouthfeel. It will taste good on practically any occasion.
title: FEL 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Deep red-cherry aromas meet with crushed slate, wet rocks, wild mint and bay leaf on the complex nose of this bottling by Richard and Thekla Sanford and winemaker Nick de Luca. It's soft on the sip, with slightly tart red plum, cranberry and raspberry, lifted by more bay leaf, thyme and dried fennel.
title: Alma Rosa 2015 Clone 667 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Red cherries, sagebrush and dried violets show on the nose of this clonal selection. The medium-bodied palate offers even-keeled flavors of red cherry, cranberry and cracked pepper, providing lots of flavorful action on a relatively light frame.
title: Bargetto 2015 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Strawberry tea and rose-petal aromas open this wine with nuance and elegance, a nice entry to a velvety texture that's both spicy and sublime. Forest floor and clove contribute complexity as a touch of smoky oak rises on the finish.
title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: From six vineyards across the Central Coast, Josh Jensen's annual cuvée shows black cherry, cola and nutmeg on the straight-ahead nose. Solid herbal backbone shows on the sip, with juniper, bay leaf and pine needles giving tang to the sour cranberry fruit. A menthol character carries in to the finish.
title: Calera 2015 Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: This playful and punchy wine stands out from this producer's often more reserved style. Aromas of concentrated pomegranate and hibiscus team with cola and vanilla on the nose. The palate is quite joyous, with candied cranberry and raspberry and even a touch of soda-like Hawaiian Punch.
title: Alma Rosa 2015 Bentrock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Almost confected, candied notions of red berry appear on the nose. The palate tones these down and comes in with a smooth, rounded and ripe body. Alcoholic power becomes evident on the finish, as does a fine-meshed tannic structure. This is a plush but elegant Pinot Noir with just a little spice.
title: Jalits 2015 Pinot Noir (Burgenland)

description: Broad aromas of cranberry and pomegranate are dusted with dried sage, tea and forest woods in this single-vineyard expression. The sagebrush and woody spice flavors show strongly on the sip, giving depth to the pomegranate and hibiscus notes. Quite dry and tangy, this should age well.
title: Alma Rosa 2015 Rancho La Vina Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Hearty and plump aromas of plum and mulberry shine above the baked soil and cinnamon elements on the nose of this bottling from the Watsonville area. The texture is right down the middle, with even weight and expected acidity, allowing the flavors of anise and dark red fruit to arise.
title: Bargetto 2015 Regan Vineyards Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Ripe and appetizing red cherry and juicy raspberry flavors make for an inviting nose. The palate is soft and pliable, juicy and fresh, tingling with peppery spice. The body is slender and fluid but the ripeness of the vintage is palpable, coming across as alcoholic warmth. The flavors are juicy and the finish has uplifting freshness.
title: Gebeshuber 2015 Lage Viereck Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: A gentle hint of soft and mellow vanilla frames the ripe, red-cherry fruit that appears readily on the nose. The palate discloses that same mix of fruit and oak influence, wrapping fresh cherry, both tart and ripe, in a rounded, smooth cloak of smoky vanilla. Tannins are fine and gentle. This wine is both fresh and fruity, with a bright, fresh finish.
title: Esterházy 2015 Pinot Noir (Burgenland)

description: Red wine doesn't get much smoother—and values in Pinot Noir don't get much better—than this. The wine has attractive red- and black-cherry aromas, a sense of richness on the palate and a silky mouthfeel that's hard to resist. Subtlety and restraint keep this wine from tiring the taste buds.
title: Mirassou 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Winemaker: Jan Coetzee. There's a lot of pressed floral character on the nose of this wine, with a fruity core of red cherry and plum to support the earthy, herbal tones. It's like crushed satin in texture, with fine but supporting tannins and ample acidity for balance. Flavors of baked currant and rhubarb finish sweet and spicy. Drink now–2021.
title: Vriesenhof 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Pinot Noir (Stellenbosch)

description: Full bodied and effusive, this is a likable, approachable wine. Moderate in acidity, it offers a wealth of pine, strawberry and black tea.
title: Roger Roessler 2015 Black Pine Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is a broad-shouldered wine, sourced from several appellations, with a good portion coming from the Antinori family's Antica Vineyard on Atlas Peak. Baked cherry and rhubarb provide a richness of tart reward along a layered, velvety texture.
title: Rossi Wallace 2015 Pinot Noir (Napa-Sonoma-Monterey)

description: This bottling from a vineyard west of the Sta. Rita Hills by David and Anna deLaski explores the lower ripeness, exotically spiced range of Pinot Noir. Aromas of tart boysenberry, sour hibiscus, sumac and white pepper show on the nose. The palate picks up a bit more viscosity to deliver cranberry, Kalamata olive and cardamom flavors.
title: Solminer 2015 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: Sourced from Dutton Ranch, this well-priced wine provides a great tasting expression of dark, brooding black cherry and full-bodied density, seasoned in black tea and cardamom for added depth and interest.
title: Jax 2015 Y3 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A deep color and effusive fruit aromas get this medium-bodied wine off to a big start, then vivid black cherry, blackberry and clove flavors kick in. It's focused on fresh fruit notes that go relatively deep on the palate and linger on the finish.
title: Lazy Creek 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: A dark color and concentrated, raisin-like aromas lead to very ripe fruit flavors and a sense of sweetness in this medium-bodied wine. It's focused, bright and cherry-like on the palate, and the richness continues on the finish.
title: Lazy Creek 2015 Middleridge Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Moderate in structure, full bodied and ripe, this wine is tightly wound in firm, strong tannin. Light flavors of cherry and orange integrate spiky accents of clove, tea and dried herb.
title: Roger Roessler 2015 Lennox Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A blend of three vineyards, located between Corralitos and the Summit area, this bottling conveys rusty, earthy cranberries, cherries and Earl Grey tea on the nose. The earthy character also shows on the sip, where animal hide, sour cranberry, red plum, rose petal and pine-forest flavors converge.
title: Sante Arcangeli 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This blend combines 70% Monterey County fruit with 26% from Sonoma County and 4% from Santa Barbara County to create a dense expression. Baked black cherry, black-plum pie, vanilla crust and anise show on the nose. The palate offers plum juice and rose petals, proving a bit thick but entirely pleasant.
title: J Vineyards & Winery 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Sonoma County-Santa Barbara County)

description: From a site on top of Taylor Mountain, in full view of the Petaluma Gap, this wine is minty and surrounded in pine, the oak toasty and firm. Cranberry, citrus and spicy clove round out the light-bodied experience.
title: Passaggio 2015 Black Knight Vineyards Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This widely available and comparatively cheap bottling nabbed quality fruit to present aromas of black raspberry, dark cranberry, crushed graphite and chaparral. There is refreshing if slightly dried fruit on the palate, where blackberry paste is lifted by thyme, marjoram and turned-earth flavors.
title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: Medium-sized in build and body, this affordable wine offers dark cherry and hearty tannin amidst a fistful of earth and gravelly texture.
title: Pali 2015 Riviera Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: The line of premier cru vineyards runs to the west of the town of Givry, with Servoisine touching the town's last houses. The wine is ripe and juicy, hiding its tannins in the heart of generous rich red fruits. It is likely to be a wine that will develop quickly and should be ready from 2019.
designation: Domaine de la Ferté Servoisine Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine de la Ferté Servoisine Premier Cru  (Givry)

description: While the producer does have vines in Volnay, this wine comes from the negociant side of the business. The wine has structure and some firm tannins. At this stage, the Volnay roundness lies behind the dry surface. But it does have weight and the potential to age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Maison Jessiaume 2015  Volnay

description: Nuits Saint-Georges is the home of the Aegerter family and its Domaine. This ripe spicy smoky wine is rich both from the vintage and from the core of tannins that are typical of the appellation. It is a smooth rounded wine although it will need some aging. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Domaine Aegerter  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This medium-bodied appellation wine is impressive in its combination of crisp red fruit, rhubarb, watermelon and pomegranate flavors alongside a dash of orange citrus. The smooth texture adds to the whole, as does a seasoning of allspice, while the finish is snappy in acidity.
title: Balletto 2015 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a smoky, obviously wood-aged wine. The fruit is dominated by the high toast flavors needing time to integrate into the blueberry fruit flavor. That will happen, allowing this crisp, balanced wine to shine. Drink from 2020.
title: Vignerons de Buxy 2015 Clos Jus Premier Cru  (Givry)

description: Firmly tannic and structured this is a young wine that will need time to soften. It has the foursquare character that is often found in Nuits Saint-Georges. The fruit weight is there, promising a ripe red-fruit future. The wine should be ready from 2020.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Laurent Dufouleur  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: The 2015 vintage is a strong one for Woodbridge. Ripe fruit tones, bright acidity and lightly mouth-puckering tannins underpin red cherry, clove and blackberry flavors, while the texture is mouthfilling. It's a treat to find an inexpensive wine with such good backbone.
title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Old vines on the Aegerter Domaine in Savigny-lès-Beaune give a rounded ripe wine. It has a crisper red-cherry side to its otherwise smooth texture. The tannins support all this juicy fruit and offer a chance for the wine to age. Drink from 2020.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Perfumed spice aromas give this wine its toasty character. The wood aging dominates the fruit. The fruit is ripe and will develop. Give this wine until 2024.
title: Domaine Faiveley 2015 Clos de l'Ecu Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: This still-young wine is jammy while firmly structured with dry tannins. There is a foursquare character that misses subtlety with its broad-brush approach. The wine does need to age and will be ready to drink from 2023.
title: L. Tramier & Fils 2015 Collection Tramier  (Corton)

description: While the wine is fruity, it does have a bitter edge that comes from the toasty wood aging. Red-berry fruits have potential, offering a future when this bitter edge will go. Wait until 2021.
title: Laleure-Piot 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: Elegant aromas of black plum, asphalt, black tea and sandalwood show on the nose of this appellation blend from Adam Lee. The palate offers hints of forest floor with mushroom and mulberry flavors, as well as a persistent woody spice.
title: Siduri 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The wine is structured and with bold red fruits. It also has a firm texture, layers of tannins and a solid texture. Acidity shines through at the end. These elements promise a serious wine that will age well. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015 Les Ecussaux Premier Cru  (Auxey-Duresses)

description: Standard red-fruit aromas meet with cola and sandalwood on the nose of this bottling. The palate proves more interesting, with aromatic potpourri and lavender flavors as well as snappy raspberry fruit.
title: Sarah's Vineyard 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)

description: Showing a dry character from the wood aging, this spicy wine also has fruit weight. While it is still young, its ripe berry flavors laced with black cherries are right up front. It does have the rounded character of a Beaune and this will develop more strongly. Drink from 2021.
title: Albert Bichot 2015 Clos de l'Ermitage  (Beaune)

description: Soft and aromatic, the wine is fruity with open tannins and plenty of acidity. It is smooth and developing quickly, showing its red-currant fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine d'Ardhuy 2015 Aux Clous Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Light and lean on entry, this wine builds up steam and power as it develops in the glass, becoming a robust exploration of rhubarb and cranberry. The texture on the palate is velvety and moderately rich, dotted in sultry spice.
title: Sean Minor 2015 Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Dominated by red-currant fruits, this is a soft wine with tannins in the background. It has a toasty edge from the wood aging while leaving most of the singing to the fruit. Drink from 2021.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is ripe and fruity with attractive red-fruit flavors and a touch of tannins to keep it all in place. The wine is soft with just a layer of tannin and plenty of red cherries at the end.
title: Louis Latour 2015  Marsannay

description: Behind the main vineyards of the Côte de Beaune, this village makes some delicious wines, both red and white. This village wine, full of fruit, also has wood-aging flavors and firm spicy tannins. It is coming together well and will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015  Auxey-Duresses

description: The Domaine des Perdrix is based at Nuits Saint-Georges, so this wine comes from the Côte de Nuits. It is richly fruity with layers of warm red fruits and soft tannins. Rounded and ripe, the wine is an instant success. Drink now.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine des Perdrix  (Bourgogne)

description: The wine is ripe and warm with generous red-berry fruits and touches of spice. The wine is rounded, full of fruitiness with a layer of tannins that is nicely judged to give support and breadth to the fruit. Drink from 2019.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits)

description: The red wine from this vineyard (which also produces a white) is firm with layers of toast from wood aging as well as the potential for ripe red fruits. It is going to need some time to lose that spicy flavor that currently dominates the wine. Give it until 2021.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015 Les Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This aromatic wine is delicious Pinot Noir. With fine ripe red fruits that are shot through with tannins for aging and crisp acidity for refreshing drinking, this is a rich wine that should be drunk now.
title: Domaine Michel Goubard 2015 Mont-Avril  (Côte Chalonnaise)

description: A deep color, oaky aromas and ripe dark-fruit flavors give a sense of richness and breadth to this full-bodied wine. It's dry and smooth on the palate, with a warm spicy finish.
title: Francis Ford Coppola 2015 Votre Santé Cuvée de Patron Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Spring blossom and ginger notes perfume this pretty, aromatic Pinot. Crisp red cherry and cranberry notes are zesty on the palate, accented by hints of leaf and herb. Full bodied yet crisply composed, it finishes with delicate, fine-grained tannins.
title: Billsboro 2015 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: Grapes are sourced from the producer's Grace Benoist Ranch, among other sites, including Emeritus Vineyard in the Russian River Valley. It shows a warm-climate character of rich, robust cherry cola, generous oak and tannin, with the profile made fruity by layers of strawberry and dried herb.
title: Beringer 2015 Beringer Estates Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This appellation blend shows black raspberry, crushed violets and cola on the dark and brooding but well-balanced nose. The sip is a bit more simple than the winery's single vineyard offerings, but shows easily enjoyable flavors of plum, boysenberry and white pepper.
title: Bernardus 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: This clos within a clos has produced a crisp red-fruit and light-tannin-flavored wine. Its red-currant and raspberry fruits are balanced with acidity as well as tannins. The wine has a bright aftertaste. Drink from 2019.
title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015 Clos du Clos Genet  (Santenay)

description: This is a softly fruity wine, full of raspberry flavors. It is rich, juicy and with fine acidity. The wine will develop easily and quickly, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2015 Aux Gravains Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This vineyard emphasizes rather steely mineral-driven flavors. The fruit is ripened in an austere mode, firm and sculpted, with flavors of wild mountain berry. A whiff of tobacco follows through, with a similar vein in the finish. It's a dense wine that will reward aggressive decanting.
title: Ayoub 2015 Brittan Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: A hint of underripe cherry is all the nose gives away right now, but the palate opens into pure Morello notes. The body is poised and tart, fresh and vivid, with a lovely little crunch. This is light and crisp—ideal for those who love Pinot Noirs with an aromatic, light touch.
title: Emile Beyer 2015 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This is a lean style and still a baby with its sappy red strawberry and raspberry notes, with cinnamon, tar, violets, warm stones and furniture polish. The palate is tightly wound, ending on a long, tart cranberry and raspberry finish. Drink now if you like your Pinot al dente, otherwise cellar through 2025.
title: Henschke 2015 Giles Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)

description: The nose brings suggestions of rum, hazelnuts and cocoa; in the mouth the wine is deep and delicious. Brambly berries are mixed with well-integrated barrel flavors of toasted nuts. The wine was aged in half new French oak for 20 months.
title: Ponzi 2015 Aurora Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: A fleshy fruity wine with tangy cranberry and red plum, and carrying a lush vein of pretty milk chocolate. The tasty barrel flavors are beautifully proportioned, with a finishing lick of cinnamon spice.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2015 Dijon Clones Pinot Noir

description: Violets and black cherries perfume this lavish, intensely fruity Pinot Noir. Concentrated in lush black plum and berry flavors, it's a full-bodied and fleshy wine but fringed by soft tannins and a long granite finish. Drink now through 2030.
title: August Kesseler 2015 N Pinot Noir (Pfalz)

description: This winery is under new ownership and off to a good start with this widely available, succulent and flat-out delicious Pinot. Spicy cranberry, raspberry and cherry flavors fill out a big midpalate. It boasts tannins that are ripe, supple and proportionate. This lovely wine should be enjoyed over the next couple of years.
title: Firesteed 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A fleshy hint of ripe cherry creates an inviting nose. The palate is similarly fruity but also firm with fine tannins. There is something rustic, rugged and earthy about this, but in a very engaging way. Slightly rustic but quite alluring. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Hugel 2015 Classic Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Classic is a pretty good description of this wine. It's meaty, firm, muscular and loaded with ripe blackberry and black-cherry fruit. The ripe ample tannins support that compact strength, and it has the balance and structure to cellar for the next decade. Drink 2020–2030.
title: MonksGate 2015 Classic Pinot Noir

description: Once again this cuvée expresses exceptional elegance and finesse. There's a floral top note that leads into a quite pretty palate, with plum, cherry and a touch of cocoa. Drink now through the mid-2020s.
title: Phelps Creek 2015 Cuvée Alexandrine Pinot Noir (Columbia Gorge (OR))

description: A smooth entry is focused on red and blue berries and plums, with a whiff of sweet tobacco and a vein of chocolate. There's a stiff edge to the tannins, and overall this seems a bit lighter, less concentrated, than in past vintages.
title: Ponzi 2015 Abetina Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling from three famous vineyards in the appellation shows intriguing aromas of candied raspberry with hints of sage, thyme, star anise and pickled rose petals. It's light and easy on the palate, with flavors of hibiscus and cranberry. Goes down fast.
title: Scar of the Sea 2015 Seven Leagues Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This is three-quarters Pommard, the rest a field blend from low-yielding reserve-quality vines, and treated to 50% new French oak. Lightly peppery and herbal, its berry fruit comes with suggestions of chicken stock and a dash of sea salt. Not quite as concentrated as previous vintages, but balanced and drinking nicely.
title: Anam Cara 2015 Mark IX Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: The aim here, according to the winery, is to show both floral and earthy components. The floral, sweetly fruity aspect is front and center, and you can find lighter, more subtle suggestions of earth and dried leaves as well. It's a working blend, and a wine best consumed over the next five years.
title: J. Christopher 2015 Sandra Adele Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: The 2014 was designated as Nysa vineyard; this is simply labeled Dundee Hills. Very young, almost like a barrel sample, this offers raspberry and cherry fruit backed with ample acidity and showing a touch of heat. The finish turns tangy, with a hint of interesting funk.
title: Megan Anne 2015 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Rich and fruity, this is a lovely, satisfying wine that's medium bodied and salty in oak. Asian five spice and cola dominate alongside black pepper and cinnamon, the dark cherry and strawberry dense and balanced.
title: Hawley 2015 Oehlman Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A limited (two barrel) vineyard selection, this offers mixed citrus and berry fruit, principally oranges and raspberries. It's set up by refreshing natural acidity, and finished with a broad streak of milk chocolate. All in all it's ready for near-term enjoyment and medium-term aging.
title: Helioterra 2015 Björnson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Fleshy strawberry and cherry fruit carries some phenolic bite. The tannins have a slightly granular feel. The fruit is dappled with dried herbs and the finish threaded with smoke. This young winery is the project of second generation Beaux Frères founders Jared Etzel and Marc-André Roy.
title: Maison Roy 2015 Petite Incline Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This bursts forth with spicy cranberry and cherry fruit. It's a bright vivacious wine, fruit-driven and lightly peppery. Thoughts of roast turkey inevitably come to mind—save a bottle for next Thanksgiving.
title: Anam Cara 2015 Nicholas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: A dark potent wine, this blends smoky black-cherry fruit with a streak of cola and a generous helping of brown spices. The chewy finish has a nice lick of minerality which keeps it aloft.
title: Alexana 2015 East Blocks Volcanic Soils Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Pommard clone wines are generally fruit-forward, as shown here, with a pleasing array of red and blue berries and fruit. Tangy acids prop up the focused core and lead into a tight finish dotted with baking spices.
title: Alexana 2015 Revana Vineyard Single Clone Pommard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This cuvée aims, the winery explains, for the most elegant expression of the estate vineyard. It succeeds, with minimal barrel influence (50% once-filled) around pretty flavors of raspberries and citrus. Finishing details bring up lemon rind, pineapple and a touch of cola.
title: Anam Cara 2015 Heather's Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Given the size of the winery, there unfortunately is very little of this single-vineyard offering, which is the best of the 2015s. Black-cherry fruit conjures up the classic flavors of the AVA, with good flesh and light notes of toast and mocha from the barrel aging.
title: Erath 2015 Knight's Gambit Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This cuvée has a bit less new oak than its companions and seems a tad less ripe, though certainly ripe enough. There's a tart streak of pineapple and orange under firm red-currant fruit. A light hint of char and chocolate wraps up the finish.
title: Saffron Fields Vineyard 2015 Spectrum Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Creamy flavors of strawberry puree and milk chocolate are given some extra zing with hints of bitter black tea. The ample tannins provide heft and added length, and the wine will drink nicely now through the mid-2020s.
title: Atticus 2015 Pinot Noir

description: This barrel selection from the estate's Revana vineyard offers medium concentration and tart fruit flavors of wild berries and Bing cherries. The acids add a note of citrus, but overall this lacks a bit of the oomph expected in a reserve.
title: Alexana 2015 Signature Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Though at first it feels a bit thin in the mouth, this block selection has pleasant strawberry fruit, with hints of compost in the bouquet and the finish. With ample aeration it expands a bit, then fades gently through a clean finish.
title: Alexana 2015 West Blocks Sedimentary Soils Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Pale and slightly bricked in hue, this delicately concentrated Pinot Noir offers a rather ghostly expression of the grape. Its floral perfume suggests dried violets and lavender and its brandied cherry and berry notes are faded and demure. Dusty tannins are soft but pleasantly bitter on the finish. It's showing signs of maturity already so enjoy now through 2021.
title: Günther Steinmetz 2015 Unfiltered Pinot Noir (Mosel)

description: This solid, even chunky style brings brambly black-cherry fruit, dotted with scents and hints of fresh thyme. Cask fermented and barrel aged, it adds a light touch of chocolate to the finish.
title: Verve 2015 Croft Vineyards Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This appears to be the top cuvée, at least by price, among the winery's 2015s. Cherry fruit comes through in a solid full-flavored core, leading into tannins that are still stiff and astringent. Give this extra breathing time, or a couple more years in the cellar.
title: Erath 2015 Willakia Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is a structured, full-bodied wine that has solid tannins and concentrated fruitiness. It is packed with red-berry flavors, ripe tannins and spice from the wood aging. The wine will take time to develop. Drink from 2022.
title: Seguin-Manuel 2015 Les Lavières Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: A layered, somewhat delicate nose of rose petals, purple flowers, cola spice and raspberry-laced chocolate serves as the introduction to this bottling. Cherry, cranberry and raspberry emerge subtly on the sip, lifted by potpourri and sagebrush that fit into a chalky and tight structure. This will age very well.
title: Stephen Ross 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyards Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: While the wine does have plenty of fruit, at this stage it shows more structure than fruitiness. Give it time, the weight of the fruit will balance the tannins to deliver a ripe, always structured, wine. Drink from 2025.
title: Albert Morot 2015 Les Bressandes Premier Cru  (Beaune)

description: The Suremain family winery in the main street of Mercurey has cellars going back to the 17th century. This wood-aged wine will have been kept here, where it has developed into a structured and firm wine, full of dry tannins as well as ripe red-berry fruits. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine de Suremain 2015 Les Crêts Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: Structured and dense with tannins, this is a big wine with a big future. Its black fruits, acidity and solid texture all point to its weight and richness. It is going to be a rich fruity wine. But wait until 2023.
title: Chanson Père et Fils 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: This wine is structured and concentrated with solid tannins. It has great ripe red fruits and plenty of berry flavors. It is going to be a fine wine, full of both fruit and structure as it develops. Drink from 2022.
title: Jaffelin 2015 Les Vergelesses Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Fruity and with plenty of acidity, this is a crisp wine, still exposing the tight mineral texture. The red-currant and raspberry fruits are prominent, shot through with acidity. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaine Rossignol-Février Père et Fils 2015 Les Angles Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: At the heart of the 90-acre Chamirey estate are five premier cru vineyards of which this is one. It has produced a firm and tannic wine, solidly textured and concentrated. Along with the red-berry fruits, this structure shows the wine needs some serious aging. Drink from 2023.
designation: Château de Chamirey En Sazenay Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Château de Chamirey En Sazenay Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: The wine has density and a good structure. It also has the acidity that marks the vintage. Red-cherry fruits and a crisp texture are balanced by the firmer tannins and solid character at the end. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2015  Morey-Saint-Denis

description: This is a generous wine with fine potential. Its rich red fruits and acidity are contrasted with dense tannins and spice from the wood aging. It will be slow but sure to develop into a delicious wine. Drink from 2021.
title: Château de Santenay 2015  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: For those wondering what minerality means in a red wine, this bottling is the answer. Against the black cherry and dark strawberry on the nose rise powerful crushed slate and smashed graphite aromas. The palate starts with cranberry and pomegranate, but the slate and rocky-soil flavors swing back in, giving backbone to the hints of bay leaf and herbs.
title: Bernardus 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: The wine comes from a single vineyard in the large 90-acre Château de Chamirey estate. It is beautifully balanced, rich and generous. Great red-plum fruits are there along with acidity and finely textured tannins. This is going to be a warm wine with a fine future. Drink from 2022.
designation: Château de Chamirey Clos du Roi Premier Cru
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Château de Chamirey Clos du Roi Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: With ripe fruits and solid tannins, this is going to be a rich wine. It has plenty of acidity to balance this richness. At the same time, the tannins are going to allow it to age well. Drink from 2023.
designation: Carelle sous la Chapelle Premier Cru
title: Domaine Rossignol-Février Père et Fils 2015 Carelle sous la Chapelle Premier Cru  (Volnay)

description: While there are wood aromas and wood flavors, the wine is equally about ripe fruit and generous tannins. It has spice, red-berry fruits and a rounded structure. It will age well, giving a rich wine from 2022.
title: Henri de Villamont 2015 Clos des Guettes Premier Cru  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: This is firm, in the Pommard style. But because this is a 2015 vintage, the wine is also generously rich and with great red berry fruits. The acidity is in the back of this wine with its bold flavors and concentrated texture. Drink from 2023.
title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2015 Les Arvelets Premier Cru  (Pommard)

description: Light and fresh aromas of red cherry, dark strawberry and sagebrush make for a fairly easy but rather deep nose on this single-vineyard bottling. Rich cranberry and pomegranate flavors coat the palate, with compelling edges of fennel, root beer and light clove.
title: Foxen 2015 Melville Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The juiciness of this wine, made by a producer based in Savigny, is what makes it so good. It is so fruity, with the tannins really only in a supporting role. That means it will develop quickly with the typical Savigny generosity. There is an attractive sprinkling of spice at the end. Drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Antonin Guyon 2015 Les Goudelettes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: The wine is dense with fine concentration and a solid dry tannin character at the back. It is full of black fruits and balanced acidity. Its richness reflects the quality of the vintage and its aging potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Louis Latour 2015 Les Chaillots Premier Cru  (Aloxe-Corton)

description: A bit of aeration brings out depth to bright cherry, violet and rose petal notes in this perfumed Pinot. Scintillating acidity lends a brisk tone to fresh raspberry and sour cherry flavors on the palate. It's a crisp, exceptionally light-footed wine with a delicate, lingering tannic backbone.
title: N. Kendall Wines 2015 Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes)

description: Mellow and subtle, this is a soft-spoken but deeply flavorful special bottling from Navarro. It has great balance, reserved raspberry and black cherry flavors and an appetizing, firmly tannic texture. Save a few bottles until 2020 to see how well it develops.
title: Navarro 2015 Deep End Blend Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: The wine is structured with solid tannins and a foursquare character. Ripe fruits with plenty of balancing acidity give this wine its density and its crisp edge. This is a fruity wine that will develop slowly and well. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2015  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: This is a soft, approachable wine, rightfully representative of its roots in the heart of the appellation. Allspice, plum and rhubarb provide a heartfelt offering of baked flavor and spice, as mild-mannered acidity keeps the fruit components fresh and persistent.
title: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2015 Winemaker's Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is a ripe wine, soft on the normal tannins of this appellation and big on the black-cherry and berry fruits. It does have a firm core, cushioned by the generous fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2020.
title: Château de Santenay 2015  Pommard

description: A ripe and full wine, packed with fruit. It has a toasty character, spice and bright red-berry fruits that give the wine its crisp acidity and balance the riper smooth texture that is developing. Give this wine until 2022.
title: Denis Père et Fils 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune

description: From a vineyard block full of little stones, this bottling shows cherry cola, sagebrush, rose petals, nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla on the nose. The texture is extremely smooth on the sip, where flavors of cherry, cranberry and chalk are compelling, if a bit less complex than the winery's other top-end bottlings.
title: Laetitia 2015 Les Galets Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)

description: From Quinta Santa Rosa Vineyard, this blend of three clones shows plump red-plum and hibiscus aromas on the nose as well as sharp cinnamon, cola and sumac spices. That tangy sumac character extends to the sip, where tart raspberry makes the eyes water. Also present are fine-grained tannins and a slight touch of Early Grey tea.
title: Prodigal 2015 Cuvée Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A ripe, balanced wine that has juicy red strawberry and raspberry fruits and fine acidity to balance. It is warm and rounded, full of dense fruits, with its tannins surrounded by the cushion of the fruit. Drink this already delicious wine from 2021.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015 Planchots  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: A smoky spicy wine that is full of berry fruits and with some toasty wood-aging flavors. With its tannic structure it will need to age, although already the bright berry fruits are generous and ripe. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Structured and firm with fine red fruits and acidity, this is a wine that brings out all the structure of the appellation. It has acidity and red cherry and berry fruits that are shot through with a crisp texture. Drink from 2020.
title: Louis Latour 2015  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: Produced at a Domaine that is run by the Arnoux family, the wine has both a rich side and a firm side. The rich side is expressed in the bold red fruits, while the firm side comes through in the tannins and structure that will allow the wine to age. Drink this dense wine from 2020.
title: Domaine Des Meix Porons 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Very woody and herbal aromas of wild thyme, sagebrush and bay leaf meet with rust, orange rinds, blistered tomato and crushed hibiscus on the spicy nose of this clonal selection. Wild red currants and cranberry-orange compote make for a sour tangy sip, with minty herbs in the background.
title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 459 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Undeniably spicy, this wine is tart and tangy in acidity, too—focused and full of tension. Notes of dried herb, black tea and cardamom punch first, before allowing room for the fruit, which presents itself as an irresistible combination of cherry and pomegranate.
title: Gary Farrell 2015 Hallberg Vineyard Dijon Clones Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There are prominent hints of pine needle and menthol that ride atop the core of bright red cherries and rusty alpine strawberries on this single-vineyard bottling. The palate seamlessly integrates those juniper, dill and mint notes into the cranberry, raspberry and pomegranate juice flavors, all presented on a soft texture.
title: Pali 2015 Rio Vista Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Though the name may strike some as a bad pun (recalling fumé), the winery explains it's Chinese for “rich and beautiful,” honoring the mother of one of the owners. This white version of Pinot Noir has a chunky mouthfeel, but it's nuanced with delicate citrus rind, flower and honeycomb details. It continues to develop as it opens, offering a layered mix of citrus and stone fruit balanced with hints of fresh-picked herbs.
title: Patton Valley 2015 Fu-Mei Blanc Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There's a strong smoky character to this bottling, with pork roast and hickory smoke rising above the cranberry compote and orange rind aromas on the nose. The smoke extends to the sip as well, but there's also a strong and tangy pomegranate and sour cherry-flavor profile.
title: Peake Ranch 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Brambly fruit flavors show prominently in this vintage, including purple berry, underbrush, clean earth and a hint of stem. It's complex, per usual, and built for cellaring. Drink now through 2030.
title: Rex Hill 2015 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A small parcel of vines, less than an acre, has produced a rich, structured wine. Its tannins and black-cherry fruit are integrated with the firm wood flavors and acidity. This is a wine for aging, so drink from 2020.
title: Domaine Changarnier 2015 Meix Bataille Premier Cru  (Monthélie)

description: On the slope above Santenay, this vineyard has produced a richly structured wine, firm with tannins and spice from wood aging. Rich red and blackberry fruits, juicy acidity and elegance give this wine a great future. Drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Jacques Girardin 2015 Clos Rousseau Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This juicy, fruity wine, perhaps named after the stony soil, is bold, rich and structured. With firm tannins and acidity, it is definitely a wine for aging. The promise is there with the generous acidity and crisp, bright aftertaste. Drink from 2023.
title: Labouré-Roi 2015 Les Cailles Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This clos is a walled section of the En Caradeux Premier Cru. It produced a beautifully perfumed wine, juicy with a core of tannins and ripe red-berry fruits. The structure and acidity will allow this cool, poised wine to age well. Drink from 2022.
designation: Clos de la Croix de Pierre Premier Cru
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Clos de la Croix de Pierre Premier Cru  (Pernand-Vergelesses)

description: This well-balanced wine pushes cherry fruit front and center, underscored by refreshing minerality. The tannins are polished and firmly set on the finish, with a cinnamon kick that resonates long after the last swallow.
title: Love & Squalor 2015 Sunny Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This well-known and widely-admired vineyard doesn't disappoint in this wine, delivering lovely cherry fruit touched with a citrusy edge. The concentration builds gracefully, with tasty highlights of chocolate-covered orange peel and roasted coffee.
title: Love & Squalor 2015 Temperance Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This wine is rich with supple tannins and layers of red berry fruits. Its structure and ripeness are immediately attractive even if the wine will needs to age. It is concentrated and likely to be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Pierre Naigeon 2015 Hervelets Premier Cru  (Fixin)

description: This wine's complex fruit flavors run the gamut from orange marmalade to cherry pie and are bolstered by underlying minerality. It's still very young and will benefit from another year or two of bottle age, after which the tannins will soften and the fruit flavors will unpack themselves.
title: Roco 2015 Knudsen Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Past releases of this wine were sourced solely from Antiquum vineyard; here, there is an additional source. The quality remains quite high despite the substantially larger production and lower price. Win, win, win! Raspberry, cherry, sassafras, cola and mocha flavors are in play. The inclusion of 20% whole clusters and aging in neutral barrels have added light touches of flavor.
title: Trathen Hall 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is an especially good vintage of this blend from the Winderlea, Weber, Maresh and Murto vineyards. Beautifully fragrant, it's a delicate potpourri of rhubarb and wild berry, with a streak of barrel toast. Darker notes of espresso and cocoa emerge on the extended finish.
title: Winderlea 2015 Dundee Hills Vineyards Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This 100% Pommard clone wine delivers sweet and tangy cherry fruit in abundance. It's bedecked with grapefruit, orange rind and almond highlights, and the finish comes with a burst of refreshing minerality.
title: Winderlea 2015 Meredith Mitchell Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: Juel fits comfortably in an emerging era for Oregon Pinot Noir. Native yeast fermentation adds texture and depth, and the wine's alcohol and oak aging reflect a deft hand at the controls. Its ripe fruit suggests jammy strawberry, and the acidity and tannins are perfectly balanced. The lovely mouthfeel brings tobacco, herb and grain details, completing the sophisticated picture.
title: Antiquum Farm 2015 Juel Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Forest-floor mushroom and pine add spark to a rustic framework of restrained ripeness and savory spice, most definitely cardamom. Medium in body and oak, its fruit is satisfyingly elusive, a mix of rhubarb and pomegranate.
title: Bailarin 2015 Suacci Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: A steep vineyard with a south-eastern exposure is just right for the ripe fruit that goes into this wine. It is full bodied, rich with red-berry and red-cherry flavors touched by spice from the wood aging. Developing well, this wine will be ready from 2019.
title: Domaine Changarnier 2015 Les Clous Premier Cru  (Monthélie)

description: Candied black cherry, smoked pork, cola and crushed asphalt show on the complex, inviting nose of this smaller-block bottling from the estate's large vineyard. The flavors are deep and dark yet not rich or heavy, with hints of tar, black pepper, wild blackberries and black plum, all hung from a firm zippy structure.
title: Cambria 2015 Element Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Tannins are firm and concentrated in this richly textured wine. With this good structure, all it needs is for the dark plum and black-cherry fruits to come through. The weight of the wine assures that, giving it both potential richness and a ripe character. Drink from 2023.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine des Perdrix  (Vosne-Romanée)

description: Smoky char meets noble reduction in this medium-bodied tightly wound wine. Youthfully grippy, it unravels slowly to show aromas and flavors of dark cherry, chocolate mint and forest floor, finding a balance between power and grace.
title: Patz & Hall 2015 Moses-Hall Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This flagship wine showcases the estate vineyard's complex, biodynamically farmed, old vine grapes. It's a well-matched mix of red fruit and citrus flavors, with palate-cleansing minerality. A light suggestion of toast from 11 months aging in 20% new French oak highlights the finish.
title: Winderlea 2015 Winderlea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Violet and bramble tones perfume this lavishly floral red. Brisker and brighter than Germany's warmer-climate Pinots, this Mosel Pinot Noir offers concentrated but crisp black cherry and berry flavors rimmed by a fine edge of bitter tannins. It's silky in texture, with a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2025 to enjoy its freshness.
title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2015 Kanzemer Altenberg Pinot Noir (Mosel)

description: Still closed and tight, this crisp, mineral-textured wine has acidity and citrus fruits that still need to show their real potential. It needs to age; drink from 2020.
title: Domaines Devillard 2015 Domaine des Perdrix  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This wine's brambly raspberry fruit has a distinctive, sharp edge. It's tightly framed with peppery tannins. Extended aeration reveals some barrel toast and warms up the finish. It was sourced from select barrels and should age nicely for up to a decade.
title: Furioso 2015 La Linea Furioso Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A great example of a beautiful, focused wine, this medium-bodied offering from one of Anderson Valley's stalwarts has wonderful pure fruity aromas, a rich texture that's well supported by moderate tannins, and expressive red and black cherry flavors accented by cinnamon and all-spice.
title: Husch 2015 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Generous in oak and quiet tannin, this is a ripely bold and fruity wine that manages to also be balanced and savory—the texture grainy and gritty. Cardamom, dried herb and cola play well against black cherry and rhubarb.
title: Longboard 2015 Mystos Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is rich with dusty tannins and a dry core that will allow it to age. With its glitter of juicy fruits and red berries, it is both structured and sumptuous. This impressive village wine likely will mature well. Drink from 2024.
title: Manuel Olivier 2015  Vosne-Romanée

description: There are a lot of intriguing and unique aromas on the nose of this bottling, from candied pomegranate and wild blueberry to olive, rosewater, cinnamon and carnation. Those deep fruits and exotic spices show on the sip as well, where a tense acidity leads into a tart cherry finish.
title: La Honda Winery 2015 Sequence Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: This textural barrel selection is loaded with mineral highlights. Its pretty cherry fruit is lightly touched with cola and has a pleasing, creamy finish.
title: Trisaetum 2015 Estates Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Austere and elegant in its cool-climate, light-bodied way, this wine is dark and brooding nonetheless, offering a wild bramble of berry and rhubarb flavors. Firm in tannin and subtle in oak, it is dotted in black-tea and savory forest-floor edges.
title: Flowers 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This delicious wine shows focused black cherry, cola, cream soda and baking spice flavors. It's perfectly balanced, with all components in proportion and settled nicely together. Drink now through 2022.
title: Domaine Drouhin Oregon 2015 Dundee Hills Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This top tier effort captures all the most distinctive characteristics of good Oregon Pinot Noir. Black cherry fruit, a liberal dash of cola, a touch of sassafras and a dusting of baking spice combine in a burst of flavor. Delicious already, it will drink well for another half decade or longer.
title: Fullerton 2015 Bella Vida Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This cool, late-ripening site brings a complex, aromatic mix of sage, fennel, mountain berry and other savory notes. With its innate austerity and underlying minerality that lingers with a resonant finish, it's the type of wine you might wish to revisit in a decade or two.
title: Bergström 2015 Temperance Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: With a riper profile than the 2014, this vintage of this wine is instantly delicious and bursting with sweet cherry fruit. Full flavored and fruity, it finishes on lasting milk chocolate, sweet herb and cola notes.
title: Fairsing 2015 Sullivan Pinot Noir

description: This bottling offers an expression of velvety plush texture that's persistent in stony minerality and an edge of graphite. Cranberry, rhubarb and orange provide tart, tangy fruit flavors that are irresistible around the complex spice core.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: This is made from a selection of diverse vineyard sites, the combination winning in its compact concentration of wild strawberry and smoky oak. Medium bodied, its thick tannin layering becomes velvety on the palate and expansive in the dark brambly richness that adds hits of spice as it goes.
title: Spell 2015 Nichole's Blend Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)

description: Integrated in oak and tannin, this medium-bodied moderately ripe wine offers big flavors of cherry, strawberry and orange and melds them together well into a cohesive whole. Juicy and delicious, it succeeds in achieving a level of balance and complexity that doesn't shy away from an overall likability.
title: Saintsbury 2015 Lee Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This dense and complex wine far exceeds its modest price point. Its deep plum and cherry flavors are inscribed with dark veins of graphite, licorice and charred wood. It finishes long and yet remains subtle, hinting at the dark flavors rather than slathering them on excessively.
title: Proteus 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Sourced entirely from the estate vineyard and aged in a combination ofnew and neutral French oak, this is spicy and focused. Its tart cranberry and raspberry fruit seems to fade a bit past the midpalate, but that may well change with another year or two of bottle age.
title: Nicolas-Jay 2015 Bishop Creek Pinot Noir

description: This reserve-level wine is a barrel selection from a particular block of the vineyard. It's aromatic, with wet hay, raspberry and cherry scents. The flavors have a lightly spicy lift, punching through with a chipotle pepper-like edge but finishing on ripe fruit. Best through 2022.
title: Le Cadeau 2015 Équinoxe Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Formerly the deLancellotti vineyard, Silice brings fresh, supple flavors of bright raspberry and cherry fruit. A distinctive ashy stone note forms the bassline, holding the finish firm. It should benefit from another year of bottle age. Or give it a long decant to enjoy now.
title: Bergström 2015 Silice Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This puts the spotlight on a single Dijon clone and delivers polished cherry fruit. It follows through with hints of graphite and the underlying minerality that is characteristic of this AVA. The wine is young and should be decanted, having spent just nine months in barrel prior to bottling.
title: Hyland 2015 Dijon 115 Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This widely available and well-priced appellation blend shows dark aromas of black raspberry, elderberry, wet slate and crushed gravel on the nose. The wine makes a soft entry on the palate, where mulberry meets with Earl Grey tea and a pinch of anise.
title: Hahn 2015 SLH Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Smooth as silk, this widely-available cuvée brings ripe strawberry, cherry and dark chocolate flavors into play. Aged for 10 months in one quarter new French oak barrels, it's seamlessly melded and shows both power and grace.
title: Adelsheim 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Snappy black raspberry and fresh plum combine for an almost effervescent experience on the nose, which also benefits from smoked beef and carnation aromas. The palate is also very energetic with black-plum and orange-juice flavors, finishing with strong acidity. This will last for years, but needs at least another year to fully integrate.
title: Bernardus 2015 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Wood aged and ripe, this is a structured wine that is full of fruit and still young. It has bright cherry flavors that have been softened and smoothed out by the wood aging. There is also a mineral edge to the fruitiness. It will be a rich wine but it needs more time. Drink from 2019.
title: Daniel Chotard 2015  Sancerre

description: Pommard and Dijon clones planted in 2001 fuel this tasty wine. Its dusty plum and black cherry fruit carries a touch of dark chocolate, all framed by firm yet polished tannins. Built to age, it can be enjoyed now with a good decanting.
title: Elk Cove 2015 Clay Court Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Earthy in sage and black tea, this wine is lightly layered and seamless in texture, with an underlying minty flavor. Cardamom and cola provide a spiciness that persists along a road of great length and breadth.
title: Saintsbury 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This perfumed and wood-aged wine is so stylish. It is smooth in texture, paced with acidity and shows well-balanced red fruits. The wine finishes with fine acidity and delicious fruitiness. Drink now.
title: Domaine Bernard Fleuriet et Fils 2015 Tradition  (Sancerre)

description: This limited cuvée is made from the smallest block at the estate vineyard. Quite dry in mouthfeel, it has dehydrated mushroom scents and flavors, along with a steely minerality. Although its tart berry fruit is in the background, it shows an overall well-wrought and balanced set of flavors.
title: Bergström 2015 Winery Block Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Consistent with the 2014 Confero, this blends multiple clones from five different vineyards. Its details are sharp, framing taut red fruit with a vein of licorice before resolving into dusty tannins. It delivers excellent length, muscle and definition.
title: Aberrant Cellars 2015 Confero Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a powerful Pinot Noir that jumps toward the nose with black raspberry and other dark fruits as well as strong cedar and caramel aromas. Thick raspberry and rounded cherry flavors show on the sip, which enjoys strong and compelling spice notes of clove, star anise and even some licorice. Pair with steak.
title: Diora 2015 Le Petite Grace Pinot Noir (Monterey)

description: This private selection is nicely structured, pitting clean raspberry fruit against tight tannins. Those strong components are accented with touches of cola and earth and a subtle undercurrent of barrel toast.
title: Dois Irmãos 2015 Two Brothers' Private Selection Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine's cranberry, raspberry and cherry flavors are spicy and tart, carrying a suggestion of hard candy. It's consistent throught its tart finish and promises much development ahead. Drink now through the late 2020s.
title: Elk Cove 2015 Mount Richmond Pinot Noir

description: A lovely shade of tawny gold, this is 100% Pinot Noir made as a dry white. It has plenty of body and delicious fruit that brings Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and other white wine grapes to mind without quite duplicating their flavors. However you describe it, it's delicious and a fine value besides.
title: Proteus 2015 Illusion Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This solid, spicy and somewhat chewy Pinot is the most widely-available from the Trisaetum lineup. Hints of golden raisin, fig and plum lead into a smooth, chocolatey finish.
title: Trisaetum 2015 Willamette Valley Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A cleverly threaded mix of black cherry extract, cola, brown sugar and baking spice notes, with a dash of espresso, this is undeniably flavor-packed. It's big but remains balanced and nuanced, with all components in proportion. It's drinking well now, so don't delay.
title: Timothy Malone 2015 Chehalem Mountains Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: An outlier grape for southern Italy, this Pinot Nero is primary in its ripe cherry and raspberry flavors. It's light, bright and juicy nature make it an easy-drinking selection.
title: Cantine del Borgo Reale 2015 Pinot Nero (Puglia)

description: Weathered wood and sawdust aromas are drab. That palate is rounded by flavors of vanilla, oak planks and cherry. Lacking acidity, this finishes flat and oaky.
title: Laurentia 2015 Field Blend Pinot Noir (Grand River Valley)

description: Intense aromas of potpourri mask cedar and red currant on the nose. Tart cranberry and cedar create a sour palate, while gritty tannins feel disjointed. The finish brings underripe flavors of raspberry and cedar.
title: Dablon 2015 Pinot Noir (Lake Michigan Shore)

description: This wine takes a light-handed approach, allowing its soul to speak quietly in a blur of perfumed rose petal, lavender and wildflower. The expansive, velvety palate offers highlights of pomegranate, strawberry and freshly squeezed citrus, with pronounced earthy sensations of crushed rock, salt and turned earth.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Allen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine offers incredibly inviting aromas and a fresh, vibrant fruit-driven framework which suggests long-term potential. Youthfully gritty tannins hide beneath a forceful foundation of black raspberry, rose petal and warm baking spice, with a hint of dried herb creeping in. Enjoy 2020–2025.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Rochioli Riverblock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Perfumed and meaty, this coastal wine offers strong elements of cured bacon and intense hints of smoke. The nose is additionally gorgeous in rose and dried herbes de Provence. Crisp, savory fruit gives it freshness and complexity, a succulent tartness that lingers a long time on the palate.
title: Martinelli 2015 Bella Vigna Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This multi-vineyard wine is sourced from hillside sites on the eastern edges of the appellation, including Foss and Calegari vineyards. Perfumed in clove and other baking spice tones, it has beautiful aromatics and ripe, firm tannins. The palate is marked by flavors of plum, rhubarb and cherry clafouti.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Eastside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Velvety in concentrated black-cherry and strawberry flavors, this age-worthy wonder also displays floral intensity and persistent, supportive tannins. Bright acidity is layered throughout, adding a sense of energy to the robust nature of its brambly undercurrent of dry-farmed fruit. Enjoy 2020–2025.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Precious Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: From a cool site above Occidental, this shows smoky peppercorn, high-toned strawberry and raspberry notes—the fruit expansive and succulent throughout. Focused acidity provides a persistent energy and freshness, with a measured sense of oak.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Fox Den Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)

description: Flavor complexity and a lot of finesse in the texture give just about everything a Pinot Noir can give. This wine, from a tiny, high-elevation vineyard, has enticing aromas of mint, clove, bay leaf and red cherry followed by vibrant flavors of red cherry and black tea (that are satisfying but don't overpower the firm texture), fine tannins and welcome acidity. Best after 2020.
title: Phillips Hill 2015 Valenti Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)

description: This organically farmed ranch on the eastern edge of the Sta. Rita Hills is producing amazing wines, including this bottling, which combines boysenberry, forest moss, gamy meats and a mud-pit earthiness on the nose. Focused and intense flavors of earth, ripe elderberry, sagebrush and a hint of truffle show on the sip, where the tannins are polished but structurally sound. Drink now–2030.
title: Pence 2015 Unum Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Made from grapes sourced from several sites across the appellation, this shows deft winemaking skill in its velvety, gritty texture and beautiful aromas and flavors of cured meat, rose petal and Asian five spice. Bright acidity lifts the tones of cranberry, rhubarb and mushroom earthiness, with a touch of crushed stone.
title: Merry Edwards 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The merest touch of earthy, tarry smoke plays on the closed nose. The body presents a more generous picture of juicy, ripe plum and blackberry fruit, aided by fresh acidity and a finely woven tannic structure. This brims with ripe fruit and is already approachable, but it will develop its alluring aromatics even more.
title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2015 Holzspur Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: Playing to the tangier side of the grape, this bottling offers dewy sagebrush, barely ripe red currant, white pepper and a hint of tapenade on the nose. The flavors are more rounded with tart cranberry and tangy red-plum skins, enhanced by thyme, dill, green peppercorn and exotic coriander spice. It is very well structured.
title: Pence 2015 Fugio Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine presents as weighty and broad on entry, a successful exploration of juicy black cherry, toasted oak and cardamom that is both succulent and complex. It develops nuance and balance in the glass, with an exotic floral quality that's hard to resist.
title: Black Kite 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Baking spice and baked plum highlight a juicy, velvety explosion of sultry fruit in this well-made, full-bodied wine. Toasted oak wraps around hints of pine forest and mushroom, with a layering of dried herb and a tart rhubarb-kissed finish.
title: Merry Edwards 2015 Flax Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Charming, just-ripe fruit flavors and a silky texture make this wine elegant and polished. It has a lighter color than average, but that doesn't make the generous black cherry and rose petal flavors any less gorgeous, or the medium-body and good acidity any less appetizing. It's a beauty from one of Anderson Valley best sites.
title: Phillips Hill 2015 Cerise Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This 35th anniversary vintage bottling is as excellent as ever, with aromas of black cherry, boysenberry, wild thyme and sagebrush on the nose. The palate treads the same balance between dark fruit and chaparral spice, with baked red cherries, nutmeg and star anise flavors.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Vista Verde Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Benito County)

description: A rather shy nose gives nothing away apart from a slight hint of earth. The palate is also subdued in flavor, but presents a firm structure of fine tannin and a spine of bright freshness, balancing out alcoholic warmth. This needs to develop and unfold, all the harmony is already there, the fruit just needs to come out of its shell. Drink 2022–2030.
title: Johanneshof Reinisch 2015 Grillenhügel Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: A heady whiff of woodsmoke combines with aromatic cherry fruit on the nose. The beautifully taut palate allows freshness to show the purity of the fruit. Right now the oaky smokiness still envelopes the firm fruit, supported by a fine tannic structure. Wait a little and this will blossom. Drink 2020–2030,
title: Malat 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)

description: A gamy streak plays on the nose as well as a touch of tart, red fruit. The palate also has an earthy undercurrent and a peppery, gamy edge. The fruit shimmers shyly amidst the finely taut tannins, with the promise of luscuous red cherry to come. This will benefit from further integration and will make an intriguing, savory wine.
title: Loimer 2015 Anning Gumpoldskirchen Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)
