description: Soft, velvety, lush and broad, this is a full-figured, darkly brooding wine, steeped in concentrated flavors of strawberry and blackberry. Baked bread, milk chocolate and rose petals accent it well, with supportive, measured oak adding a touch of toast.
title: Merry Edwards 2015 Meredith Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This is an envelope-pushing wine that's distinctive and untamed in the way that it combines earthy, savory and mineral aromas with complex, meaty and fruity flavors that have wonderful depth on the palate and length on the finish. The balance is spot-on due to firm acidity and lean tannins, supporting the tangle of unusual and enjoyable tastes. Zero in this case means no added yeast, no new oak and no fining or filtration.
title: Foursight 2015 Charles Vineyard Zero Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: From a challenging vintage at times, a tiny amount of this subdued wine was made. The nose offers a sense of peatiness, like a good Scotch. Tart orange and grapefruit define an essential crispness to the fruit, as crushed rock and rose petal play along. The tannins and oak are soft and seamlessly interwoven.
title: Williams Selyem 2015 Coastlands Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Delicious fruitiness and full body are a winning combination in this luxuriously oaky, very ripe-tasting and impressive wine from Marin County—not exactly a household name for wine, but it should be. The black cherry and stewed-plum flavors are so rich they seem sweet, but a good structure of acidity and firm tannins keeps the wine balanced.
title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Azaya Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marin County)

description: There is extreme florality throughout this bottling, starting with wisteria and dark carnations on the bright and fresh nose, alongside black raspberry fruit. The flowers are a bit more subdued on the sip, yet violet, lilac and rosewater flavors persist, decorating the suave strawberry and rhubarb background.
title: Gainey 2015 Limited Selection Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This wine combines so much of what we've come to love about New Zealand Pinot. It's light and bright but serious too, with plenty of site expression. Raspberry and blueberry compote, violets, baking spices and sun-baked stones all dance together on the nose. There's plush fruit on the palate but a savoriness too, framed by sinewy tannins and finishing on a stoney, mineral note.
title: Nautilus 2015 Southern Valleys Pinot Noir (Marlborough)

description: This wine goes to the limit with ripeness and full body, showing an especially dark color, very ripe and effusive fruit flavors like macerated cherries and blackberry jam and a mouth-filling texture packed with lots of expansive tannins. It's hard to resist its exuberance and concentration.
title: Patland 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Aromatic notes of ripe red berries and much more tart Morello cherries play on the nose, joined by a faint hint of woodsmoke. The palate is beautifully translucent in pure cherry fruit, with a graceful structure of very fine tannins. Both ripeness and extraction are beautifully judged here. Lovely already but sure to evolve. Drink now–2028.
title: Bründlmayer 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Niederösterreich)

description: Bright black raspberry aromas meet with shaved licorice, fresh fennel, tarragon and purple rose petals on the nose of this single vineyard expression. The sip dries up considerably at first, with loamy, minty flavors, but they open toward strawberry, sumac and candied red cherry. Cinnamon and menthol spice fire up the finish.
title: Black Kite 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Max Reserva Pinot Noir is one of those consistent performers: it's always very good, if not spectacular. This version is lean and earthy, with a good balance of acidity, dry red-fruit character and varietal correctness. Flavors of spiced tomato, red currant and herbs finish tight and raw.
title: Errazuriz 2015 Max Reserva Pinot Noir (Aconcagua Costa)

description: Generous in ripe black cherry, pine forest, tar and toasted oak, this is a hearty wine, robustly full bodied, with a gravelly aspect to the texture that provides complexity and ample length.
title: Migration 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: In the northern reaches of the country, just above Auckland, this winery is best known for its Burgundian style Chardonnays. Their 2015 Pinot certainly walks to its own beat. A mélange of orange peel, cumin, florals, meats, dried leaves and wet earth all swirl together. The palate is light to medium bodied, with flavors of earth, stones, and dusting polish. There's a slightly off-putting bitterness on the finish, but this is nevertheless charming in an old school kind of way.
title: Kumeu River 2015 Hunting Hill Pinot Noir (Kumeu)

description: Spicy aromas of clove and allspice announce a fully oaked wine. A plump palate with tomatoey acidity and a resiny feel is home to woody savory flavors of smoked plum and currant. A woody smoky finish maintains consistency.
title: Ventisquero 2015 Herú Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Furry berry aromas are a touch oxidized, and overall the nose on this Pinot lacks sizzle and freshness. A full-bodied palate shows little to no acidic lift. Given all that, it's not surprising that this tastes of chunky berry and plum, while hints of clove and wood spice appear on the finish.
title: Ritual 2015 Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: While this is good, there are many disparate parts to this Pinot from southerly Malleco. The nose is strained, raw and a bit horsey, while this feels grabby and full on the palate, even creamy. Heavy oak and saucy plum and berry flavors turn chocolaty on the finish. At 15.5%, this is riper than most Chilean PN's.
title: Clos des Fous 2015 Latuffa Pinot Noir (Malleco)

description: Gritty, earthy aromas of plum and cherry lead to a chunky oaky palate that's slightly abrasive and warm. A heavy oak character matches the wine's creamy plum and berry flavors, while a short oaky finish is limited. At 15.1% abv, this is not about finesse.
title: Clos des Fous 2015 Subsollum Pinot Noir (Chile)

description: Subtle spice and earth notes accent core plum, currant and cocoa aromas. This is a full oaky style of Pinot with toasty plum and berry flavors that don't qualify as elegant. Mild heat and oak are players on a chocolaty finish.
title: Luis Felipe Edwards 2015 Marea Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)

description: Punchy, reedy aromas of currant come with hints of leather and latex. This is a wiry wine with acidity as its main driver. Salty currant and plum flavors come with some buttery oak, while high residual acidity on the finish makes this shear on the back end.
title: Manos Andinas 2015 Reserva Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Bright vibrant acidity persists in this vineyard-specific wine, made in a fleshy full-bodied style with plenty of toasted oak and gravelly, tannic texture.
title: Gracianna 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Lean, herbal currant aromas are lightly briny and prickly. A palate with moderate acidity and some creaminess feels good, while this tastes of spiced cherry and currant. A short finish doesn't expand or evolve.
title: Loica 2015 Pacific Series Pinot Noir (Rapel Valley)

description: This is a very affordable, gentle, medium-bodied wine with good ripe-fruit flavors, hints of spice and a soft, plush texture. It's smooth to sip and has a welcome sense of ripeness along with low acidity.
title: Castle Rock 2015 Cuvée Pinot Noir (California)

description: Baked cherry, pine forest and earthy compost combine in this medium-bodied lightly oaked wine from a vineyard planted to multiple clones of the variety. Native fermentation lets the fruit and spice speak quietly.
title: Friedeman 2015 UV Lancel Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: The nose, with fiery red-fruit scents, includes a hint of latex. This feels full and slightly heavy on the palate, while lightly burnt berry and plum flavors end in blocky fashion, with a note of chocolate.
title: Veramonte 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Valley)

description: Currant, tomato and grassy scents bring ripeness into question. This feels solid but grabby, while slightly green and oaky flavors of medicinal red fruits carry over to a steady finish.
title: Viña Chocalan 2015 Gran Reserva Origen Pinot Noir (Maipo Valley)

description: Rustic cherry, rhubarb and turned loam, along with a touch of fresh thyme, show on the nose of this fancifully labeled twist-top bottling. It's a bit thin on the palate, with sour red fruit, bay leaf and anise flavors.
title: It's a Headsnapper 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)

description: Rustic leafy aromas are gritty and lean. This light-colored, lighter-bodied Pinot is racy up front, with a sticky note of animal fat on the back palate. Earthy, lightly oxidized flavors finish without elegance.
title: Prisma 2015 Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)

description: Very shy aromas of red berries and wet mud make for an earthy muddled nose. There is a flash of acid on the sip, followed by dust, more red fruit and a slightly woody spice.
title: Martin Ranch 2015 J.D. Hurley R.E.D. Vineyards Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: This wine tastes quite mature and savory and feels soft, showing some complexity of sun-baked fruit and earthy undertones.
title: Shooting Star 2015 Pinot Noir (Lake County)

description: Medium-bodied and pleasant to sip, this unassuming wine has subtle plum flavors and a smooth texture. The mouthfeel is soft and the finish is short.
title: Geyser Peak 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This wine is a blend of fruit from Antoine Creek and Gingko Forest vineyards. Quite light in color, the aromas show a light volatility, along with notes of raspberry, strawberry and maraschino cherry. The fruit flavors are light, simple and sweet, finishing with peppermint notes.
title: Rio Vista 2015 Pinot Noir (Columbia Valley (WA))

description: Slightly weak aromas of pomegranate-laced fruit punch, herbs and dust show on the nose of this bottling. Strawberry and fennel flavors are evident on the palate.
title: Firefly Ridge 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)

description: This wine is thick in barrel imprint yet somewhat thin in texture, with a syrupy backbone of black cherry and almond. With moderate structure, the finish is flat.
title: Tin Barn 2015 Ricci Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: This wine has a funkiness to it that's intensely earthy, with a harshness of oak and tannin.
title: Trecini 2015 Vicini Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This grand vineyard is one of the jewels of Morey Saint-Denis. The structure and density behind this vintage of the wine is generously impressive, with a dark, dry core and fine tannins. To balance this, the wine has weight, opulent fruit and acidity. The result, as it matures, will be a major wine that will age for many years. Drink from 2025.
title: Louis Jadot 2015  Clos de la Roche

description: Produced from vines owned by Louis Jadot, this wine, like all the grand crus in Gevry-Chambertin comes from a vineyard halfway up the slope behind the village. It has the proper structure, but such is the richness of this vintage, the fruit is already sumptuous, full of ripe cherry and berry flavors. At the same time, it is elegant and with such as stylish, smart aftertaste. Drink from 2025.
title: Louis Jadot 2015  Chapelle-Chambertin

description: A bright wave of spicy sarsaparilla rides alongside crunchy, vibrant tones of crisp red cherry, pomegranate and dried herbs in this impressive, well-balanced wine from a tremendous site. Medium bodied, it shows grace and strength in equal measure for superb overall balance.
title: Patz & Hall 2015 Chenoweth Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: From one of the series of grand vineyards that line the slope of Gevrey-Chambertin, this powerful and dense wine is packed with tannins as well as beautiful fruit. Its red fruit flavors are supported by a solid structured and concentrated tannins. Despite this power, the wine is stylish, striking a fine balance between structure and fruit. Drink from 2025.
title: Maison Roche de Bellene 2015  Charmes-Chambertin

description: This wine is all tannins at this stage, smothering the black fruits. That will change as it matures, revealing dense blackberries and plums as well as keeping its tannins as a base for the exuberant fruitiness. The wine comes from a blend of different parcels that together make up just over four acres of this vineyard owned by Louis Jadot. Drink this wine from 2025.
title: Louis Jadot 2015  Clos de Vougeot

description: Exotic and wild, this wine has a funky, floral and herbal core accented in rose garden and whole-cluster crunch. Decadent, the black cherry, blueberry and Asian spice components accentuate a voluptuously velvety texture and miles of black tea and persistent spice.
title: Lynmar 2015 Monastery Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: There is a hint of earth and roasted pumpkin on the nose. The palate has a similarly smoky and dusky aspect and surrounds crisp red-cherry fruit. The body is light with a slight but fine tannic grip. A pleasantly bitter finish counters the pumpkin richness. The finish is very fresh and dry but strangely moreish. This will benefit from a bit of bottle age. Drink now through 2022.
title: Emile Beyer 2015 Lieu-Dit Sundel Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The nose is shy and does not give much away. On the palate, beautifully pure red currant and tart red-cherry notes come through. The slender body is pervaded by freshness and has lovely overtones of conifer and oak leaf. It is later on that the fine but firm structure comes to bear. This is light but has depth and the potential to develop.
title: René Muré 2015 Signature Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: An aromatic hint of pine mixes with the red cherry notes on the nose, creating a very appetizing opening. The ultralight palate is translucent and slender, with the same leafy conifer aromas and lots and lots of red currant brightness and freshness. The light crunchy nature of this wine suggests that this is ideal for chilling. It's a weightless, very aromatic, and ultra-light-bodied red.
title: Allimant-Laugner 2015 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This full-bodied rosé uses the 777 clone from a vineyard on the eastern edge of the Willamette valley, in an area known locally as Pete's Mountain. The Dowsett Family originally owned the Charles Coury property and started Laurel Ridge. Chris Dowsett is the winemaker at Buty as well as handling his own project. This offers a lush symphony of fruits—orange, grapefruit, pineapple and peach. It's tart, tangy, tasty and made to age for an extra year or two, in the mode of a Bandol.
title: Dowsett Family 2015 Becklin Vineyards Georgia Rose Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Fresh notes of crunchy red cherry have a spicy edge of pepper. The body of this slender Pinot Noir is very light, totally peppery and very appetizing. The structure is soft and very refreshing. This could also be chilled and is a fabulously light-bodied but sprightly lunch red. The finish is perfectly dry and very enlivening.
title: Domaine Rieflé-Landmann 2015 Bonheur Convivial Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This young release is quite pretty, with full-bodied Bing cherry fruit that is lightly spicy and appealingly fresh. It's bursting with just-picked flavor, the sort of ebullient flavor you'll find in young Pinots that have somehow avoided the teenage funk. It's balanced and flinty, finishing lightly toasty. Drink now or tuck away for drinking after 2020.
title: Brigadoon 2015 La Chouette Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Round dark strawberry, mulberry and pound cake aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend from winemaker Eric Laumann. Bright raspberry and strawberry fruits show on the palate, lifted by sage and bay leaf notes and framed by a structure of mouth-cleansing tannins.
title: Cambiata 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Lovely pure notes of red crunchy cherry dominate the nose. They are also present on the slender, almost slight, palate that is completely dry but full of the charm of the fruit. Ample freshness brightens the entire wine which is well-suited to being chilled. It's a friendly easy charming red.
title: Jean-Marc Bernhard 2015 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Earthy flavors of beet root and black cherry combine here, and the wine carries on with dark flavors and substantial tannins. Astringent black tea highlights resonate through the finish. Give this ample decanting and/or a couple more years of bottle age.
title: Soléna 2015 Zena Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: alance, ripe fruit and a dash of cinnamon make this wine easy to appreciate and fun to drink in light of its reasonable price. It has medium body, plum and red cherry notes and a hint of spicy oak.
title: Julia James 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: Crunchy fresh notes of red cherry dominate aromatically. The palate is light, juicy, crisp and very refreshing. This is rustic and ready, but also full of charm with its animating red fruit. The finish is dry and invigorating.
title: Kuentz-Bas 2015 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: A coniferous lift weaves through tart red-cherry notes. The slender, translucent and crunchy palate is pervaded by the same aromas and a lot of freshness. This is a light-bodied aromatic red wine that is ideal for lunch, for picnics or for serving chilled.
title: Joseph Cattin 2015 Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Round and fruity, this differs from Willamette Valley Pinots, in that it's broad, fruit-driven, perhaps less complex but readily accessible and quite delicious immediately. Cherry lollipop, oranges and light tropical-fruit flavors abound. Drink while it's young and fresh—slightly chilled if you wish.
title: Melrose 2015 Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)

description: Despite the reserve designation, this is a tasting-room-only wine. It's rather light and elegant in style, with a raspberry veneer over sturdy herbal tannins.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 Founders' Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Gentle glints of raspberry are hinted at on the nose. The palate does not quite follow up but is totally light and crunchy. The midpalate reveals some warmth and depth along with more berry aromas. This is bone dry, fresh, aromatic and slender. Ideal for a picnic basket or for serving chilled.
title: Domaine Charles Baur 2015 Rouge d'Alsace Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: The nose just hints at earth and autumnal oak leaf. The palate comes with slight grip, very fine tannins and more earthy leafy aromas. Red-cherry fruit is just hinted at. This is slender and bone dry and will come into its own when served with subtle mushroom or game dishes.
title: Domaines Schlumberger 2015 Les Princes Abbés Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This value offering spent almost a year in French oak, and went through native yeast fermentation. The added nuances amplify a full-bodied, cherry-flavored wine, with streaks of clean earth and clay.
title: Brooks 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Plum and grape aromas kick off this bottling from Brian Loring, accented by clove, Indian spice and crushed cinnamon. Stewed black plum, peppercorn, turned earth and broad fruit flavors combine in a somewhat muddy formation on the palate.
title: Loring Wine Company 2015 Clos Pepe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: A common thread among the 2015 Soléna Pinots is a stiff herbal beet flavor rather than fully ripe berry fruit. This tilts into cranberry and very tart raspberry, but finishes astringent and hard. Give it plenty of decanting (two or three hours) to help it open up.
title: Soléna 2015 Domaine Danielle Laurent Pinot Noir

description: It's rare to find Willamette Valley fruit (70%!) included in a Pinot Noir at this price. This well-made wine offers red-plum fruit, annotated with lemon, orange and tangerine. The impression is of substantial acidity, in a tasty young wine that punches through the palate with authority and verve.
title: Jezebel 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: Hints of earth are the only aromas on the nose, which seems devoid of fruit. The palate has a similar leafy earthiness and slight berry aromas. There are bitter edges on the very slender, soft and easy body. This has a picnic-style rusticity about it and a very clean and dry finish.
title: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2015 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: Named for a barrel that once rolled off a cliff, this forward fruity wine blends numerous sources to craft an easy-drinking, no-frills style. Think a strawberry lollipop in a glass, and you're on the right track. That's not to say it lacks concentration, but its strength is the pretty fruit.
title: Brooks 2015 Runaway Red Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Dundee Hills Pinot doesn't come along at this price very often. This is classy and well defined. Strong citrus flavors frame a core of plum and chocolate. It will benefit from another couple of years of bottle aging. Drink 2018 to 2022.
title: Lujon 2015 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: A blend of grapes from North Canyon and Fiddlestix vineyards, this bottling shows hickory smoke, cherry pie and floral aromas on the nose. The palate offers tart blackberry, cranberry, clove and vanilla flavors, with a smoky, roasted pork touch.
title: Lyric by Etude 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)

description: The strawberry fruit shows a wild herbal side, with a touch of toasted grain. The tannins are firm and the finish carries a hint of chicken broth.
title: 2Hawk 2015 Pinot Noir (Rogue Valley)

description: A slightly funky lift precedes a very crunchy light palate. There is freshness and frank up-front red-cherry fruit along with ample juiciness. This picnic-style wine will benefit from being served chilled.
title: Domaine Ostertag 2015 Rouge E Pinot Noir (Alsace)

description: This vineyard, and the AVA it occupies, is often characterized by some sharp metallic mineral-driven flavors. Here it seems just marginally ripe, with beet, black tea and metal dominating the astringent finish.
title: Soléna 2015 Hyland Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)

description: This is the brand's first bottling under new ownership, and the result of this blend of Monterey, Sonoma and Santa Barbara county fruit is familiarly ripe—due in part to the inclusion of 10% Merlot, 6% Chardonnay and 2% Syrah. Pomegranate, clove, vanilla and rum aromas lead into a juicy palate of candied red fruit, slate, anise and Earl Grey tea. It's slightly sweet but easily enjoyable.
title: Meiomi 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Sonoma County-Santa Barbara County)

description: This young release carries strong scents and flavors of cranberry, along with the sharp acidic attack that implies, which qualifies it as a good choice for many fatty dishes. It's rather simple, fruity, with no hint of new oak. Drink up while it's young and fresh.
title: Oregon Trails 2015 OTWC Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Fresher is better as a general rule for inexpensive Oregon Pinots, so grab this new release for near-term drinking. Light red fruits and a dash of chocolate carry the flavors, with a slight hint of bouillon to wrap it up.
title: 60 Souls 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The Pinot Noirs from this new project from Evening Land founders Larry Stone and Dominique Lafon are intellectually challenging and palate-stretching in their austerity. Evoking rhubarb and citrus on the nose, this wine emphasizes citrus on the palate, particularly grapefruit, along with refreshing minerality. Like all the winery's Pinots, it rewards extended aeration and your full attention.
title: Lingua Franca 2015 Ryan's Plow Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This concentrated and richly structured wine has good acidity as well as firm, solid tannins that support the red currant and red cherry fruits. It also has a dry core that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2022.
title: Maison Roche de Bellene 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: This generous wine is ripe with rich berry fruits enhanced by red-cherry flavors. Full in the mouth, the wine is going to deliver great structure and fruit as it matures. Drink from 2020.
title: Manuel Olivier 2015  Chambolle-Musigny

description: Well structured and full of ripe fruit, this is already a very drinkable wine. But there is more to come and this wine will show great swathes of fruit, balanced tannins and acidity, and a rich character as it matures. To enjoy it at its peak, drink from 2020.
title: Philippe Jeannot 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Santenay)

description: Well defined and medium bodied, this offers strawberry lollipop and cherry fruit flavors. Pretty upon first taste, it gains substance as it breathes and will reward decanting and some additional cellaring. Drink now through 2022.
title: R. Stuart & Co. 2015 Daffodil Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This tightly-focused, stylish wine offers raspberry and pomegranate fruit as it opens. The acids are generous and natural tasting, with a fresh snap that brings orange juice to mind. Thirty percent whole clusters were used.
title: William Rose 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)

description: This is the lightest of the winery's single vineyard cuvées. Its strawberry and pale cherry fruit has hints of barrel toast and pepper, and there's a cleansing minerality to the mouthfeel. It thins out a bit on the finish and should be consumed now through 2022.
title: Big Table Farm 2015 Cattrall Brothers Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Old vines give concentration to this wine, although its main character is of rich red fruits. The tannins are in the background while right up front are fruit, acidity and an attractive touch of spice. This smooth, rounded wine will be ready to drink quickly, certainly from late 2018.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Intense black plum and cherry perfume juxtapose savory tones of smoked nuts and wet earth in this fresh and fruity yet composed wine. Plump black fruit flavors are broad and rich but framed by brisk acidity and a trace of mineral complexity. A fantastic introduction to German Pinot that's surprisingly easy on the wallet.
title: Gryphon Crest 2015 Pinot Noir (Baden)

description: The fruit flavors in this young wine are fresh and forward, suggesting raspberry and cherry over a mineral base. The nicely textured palate carries wet stone flavors along with the fruit, and a streak of cola adorns the finish.
title: Marshall Davis 2015 Beacon Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir

description: Luscious, sun-ripened blackberries and cherries are boldly concentrated in this easy drinking but elegantly composed Pinot Noir. Fresh acidity and fine-grained, pleasantly bitter tannins make it an approachable introduction to German Pinot with a gentle price tag. Drink now through 2020.
title: Villa Wolf 2015 Pinot Noir (Pfalz)

description: This solid wine is classic Nuits-St.-Georges, with the addition of sumptuous fruit, making it a ripe wine with a core of dark tannins. The vineyard, just south of the city, sits on a steep slope with great exposure. Drink the wine from 2023.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2015 Les Crots Premier Cru  (Nuits-St.-Georges)

description: Like all the Cristom Pinot Noirs, this was made with native yeasts and a significant amount of whole clusters. Although three fifths new oak was used, it has had little affect on the aroma, with no noticeable toast or caramel accents. It's tight and minerally, with wild raspberry fruit and a steely frame.
title: Cristom 2015 Eileen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Threads of citrus, cherry, cola and chocolate weave through this tasty wine. It's medium bodied, focused and immediately accessible. The blend includes seven different clones of estate-grown fruit, and it was aged in French oak for 16 months.
title: Carabella 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Vintage dated and made in the classic Champagne method, this tasty brut is a pretty shade of copper-hued rose. It has lovely cherry fruit and ample length. Overall, a very tasty effort.
title: Eola Hills 2015 Rosé Methode Champenoise Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: There is plenty of crisp acidity in this wine, with bright red fruits that come through the tannins. That makes for a juicy, firm wine, crisp and with a dry core. It will be ready to drink from 2024.
title: Nuiton-Beaunoy 2015 Clos du Chapitre Premier Cru  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Very light aromas of pomegranate, vanilla dust and sweet pastry show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are also quite subtle, with red currants, a touch of bitter cranberry and dried garden herbs.
title: Pali 2015 Cargasacchi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: The AVA Series comprises small-production, single vineyard wines that showcase specific Willamette Valley terroirs. This one, sourced from the outstanding Alloro vineyard, is a delicious mix of red fruit, charred wood, caramel and sea salt. The 30% new oak is right up front—toasty and quite tasty.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 AVA Series Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: The Maladière vineyard has given a structured wine full of dark tannins and concentrated black fruit. With acidity to match and a dry core, it is a rich wine with considerable potential. Drink from 2022.
title: Domaine Jacques Girardin 2015 Maladière Premer Cru  (Santenay)

description: The vines of Ladoix are at the base of the Corton hill but much less well known and therefore better value. Juicy acidity and the core of tannin suggest a wine that is ageworthy, while the black-plum fruits give richness now. Drink from 2019.
title: Louis Jadot 2015  Ladoix

description: This reserve-level wine was assembled from barrels representing six different vineyards. It's aromatic, with berry and cherry scents that carry into the midpalate. It was aged for 10 months in 40% new oak. Cellaring for another year would certainly be advised.
title: Penner-Ash 2015 Pas de Nom Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine's cherry fruit is framed by aggressive phenolic notes. They bring a definite bite to the flavors, and the tannins remain stiff and rather hard. Additional bottle age and/or aggressive aeration are recommended, as the wine improved significantly after being open for a full day.
title: R. Stuart & Co. 2015 Autograph Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This was sourced from vines planted in 1978—a rarity at this price. It's floral on the nose, with light baby powder scents. Pretty plum fruit, sweet spice and a streak of cola add texture and complexity. It's drinking nicely, so don't wait.
title: Spindrift Cellars 2015 OSU Woodhall III Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a single-vineyard wine, although not a Premier Cru. It is ripe with plenty of strawberry fruit. Still young though, it is also filled with tannins and tight, juicy acidity that need to soften into the fruits. The wine is potentially warm and ripe. Drink from 2021.
title: Vincent Girardin 2015 Terre d'Enfance  (Santenay)

description: From the oldest section of the estate vineyard, this offers rounded strawberry and Bing cherry flavors. It's appealing, though not quite as interesting as some of the other 2015s, and should be enjoyed within five years of the vintage.
title: Cristom 2015 Marjorie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: From vines that lie behind the main Côte de Nuits, this rich wine shows how even the cooler vineyards have made sumptuous wines in 2015. The wine is soft, gently tannic with plenty of red fruits. It is likely to develop quickly and will be ready to drink from 2019.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Côtes de Nuits Villages)

description: This smoky, toasty wine is ripe with swathes of bright red fruits. It is also structured, offering rich tannins and juicy acidity in an appealing combination. Melding richness and fruit, the wine will be ready to drink from 2020.
title: Manuel Olivier 2015  Gevrey-Chambertin

description: This wine's inviting cherry pie aromas come with chicory, burnt sugar and smoke overtones. The tannins are drying, but the flavor and power are greater than the price tag would suggest.
title: Pike Road 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This opens with black cherry fruit that carries a hint of dill. It's tart and somewhat thin, with an astringent finish marked by strawberry and citrus flavors.
title: Sokol Blosser 2015 Dundee Hills Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This small domaine in the Côte Chalonnais has produced a wine that is tough with tannins and with a dry core. There is some potential in the juicy acidity and spice that comes through the firm structure. It will need some time, so drink from 2020.
designation: Clos du Cras Long Premier Cru
title: Vincent Lumpp 2015 Clos du Cras Long Premier Cru  (Givry)

description: The wine is soft and ripe with gentle fruit and an attractive crisp aftertaste. A touch of vanilla and a smoky backdrop add to the flavors of this ready-to-drink wine.
title: Domaine Chavet 2015  Menetou-Salon

description: The wine has a lean texture, presenting fruit that is shot through with tight acidity. Cherry flavors are firmly balanced with tannins and a dry core. Definitely cool-climate Pinot Noir.
title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2015 Grande Côte de la Vallée  (Sancerre)

description: Smashed pomegranate and raspberry aromas meet with underlying mocha, herbs and plum skins on this bottling. The palate's sour-plum flavor slides into turned loam and dried herb, which makes the wine complex but not quite delicious. A bit more time may smooth it out.
title: J. Wilkes 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This opens with tart purple fruit and underlying minerality before hitting a wall and stopping short and bitter. Give it a lot of aeration if you intend to drink it anytime soon.
title: Rain Dance 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: Widely distributed and often praised, this seems a bit off-kilter this vintage. It delivers light berry and rhubarb fruit but also a hint of plastic and little sense of depth or flavor that go beyond basic red wine.
title: Cloudline 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is a wine without wood aging. Instead, it is all fruit with soft tannins and a light texture. The stalky red-currant and cherry fruits are textured and smoky. It is not a wine for aging, so drink now.
title: Joseph Mellot 2015 Les Thureaux  (Menetou-Salon)

description: A bit of charred wood and black pepper in the aroma give way to lush berry and cherry flavors that spread across the palate and cling to the sides of the mouth. This wine is lightly oaky and has an attractive richness that lasts on the finish.
title: Gnarly Head 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This is a crisp cherry-flavored wine. Cool-climate Pinot Noir has a light texture that gives the wine a hint of tannins although it is much more about fruit and bright acidity. Drink now.
title: Domaine de Reuilly 2015 Pinot Noir (Reuilly)

description: This wine is smooth and densely packed in earth and blackberry, the overall tone voluptuously concentrated and full bodied, with a tenacious embrace of ripeness.
title: Bowman Cellars 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Sweet-leaning aromas of black cherry, cola and anise show on the nose of this appellation blend. The flavors are much more subtle, with touches of cherry, cranberry and gravel.
title: Firestone 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This small producer has adopted WWI motifs for its labels; the wines are less striking. Here, a soft entry followed by a thick streak of vanilla. Oak treatment buries the fruit, making it drink like a cheaper, more generic wine than it purports to be.
title: Dauntless 2015 Howitzer Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This fruity red wine has firm tannins and juicy acidity. Its soft, rounded aftertaste makes it easy and warm.
title: Tussock Jumper 2015 Pinot Noir (Vin de France)

description: Spicy new-oak flavors dominate the modest fruit notes in this over-worked wine, knocking it off balance.
title: Bread & Butter 2015 Pinot Noir (California)

description: This is a Pinot Noir for lovers of lush expressions. Fat black cherry meets with nutmeg, vanilla, clove, raw meat and leather on the nose. Juicy blackberries and black currant explode on the sip, alongside sandalwood and myrrh. It's super rich and a tad sweet but also lively with persistent acidity.
title: Mooney Family 2015 Boekenoogen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Power and elegance come together in this beautifully proportioned, flavorful and pure-tasting wine. It has depth, concentration and a luxurious but structured texture that pulls the pomegranate, black cherry and cranberry flavors through to a lip-smacking, lingering finish. This can only get better with time; best after 2022.
title: Saintsbury 2015 Donnelly Creek Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: A shy nose hints at crushed autumn leaves, fresh red fruit and soft vanilla. The palate has that same interplay of earthiness and red-berry fruit, supported by a gentle nudge of oaky vanilla. Slender and layered, the body shows a firm grip of very fine tannin. Freshness is evident on the finish. While lovely now, this elegant, poised wine will blossom over the coming years: the fruit is pure and ample; the structure firm and lasting. Drink 2020–2030.
title: Wieninger 2015 Select Pinot Noir (Vienna)

description: Elegant and lush aromas of black plum and boysenberry mesh with violets and lavender on the nose of this wine. Earthy tones of mace, cinnamon and crushed gravel enhance the bouquet, while wild berries pop on the palate. Flavors of bay leaf, coffee bean and more lavender ride atop the soft and polished tannins.
title: Beckon 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: Velvety smooth, this wine seduces from the get-go, robust in black fruit, tea and delicate offerings of rose petal and lavender. Intensely full bodied, it retains a balance of bright, natural acidity that tames the spicy tannin.
title: Guarachi Family 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Subtle, intricate aromas and equally sophisticated flavors of baking spices, tamarind and cherries make this a fascinating wine to taste. It's full bodied but lithe. Energizing acidity and firm tannins give it great structure and help carry the complex flavors through a lingering finish.
title: Betwixt 2015 Helluva vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: This new wine from an estate vineyard is the strong, quiet type that's not effusively fruity but instead emphasizes mineral elements and great structure. An attractive chalky, spicy aroma leads to beautifully restrained red cherry and pomegranate flavors that seem to grow and expand with each sip. The texture is firmly tannic but also polished, supported by perfect acidity that keeps everything sharp and focused.
title: Long Meadow Ranch 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Light cranberry and pomegranate show on the nose of this always-anticipated bottling by Dan Lee, with a pine-needle aroma to provide depth. The slightly sour flavor of Montmorency cherries mixes with snappy cranberry and underripe red currants on the sip, which gains herbal and peppery spice complexity as it breathes.
title: Morgan 2015 Double L Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: Black-cherry syrup, dark slate, turned loam and cherry-laced gingerbread cake aromas show on the nose of this rich and lavish bottling by Michael Mooney. The palate is extremely juicy and fruit-forward, with complex blackberry-orange peel jam, ginger and vanilla flavors.
title: Mooney Family 2015 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: From the producer's 1,400-foot-high estate vineyard atop the Petaluma Gap, this wine is richly layered in boysenberry, baked cherry and pine. Moderately structured, it has an underlying minerality of stony earth to keep it fresh and balanced despite its robust power and concentration.
title: Guarachi Family 2015 Sun Chase Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Winemaker: Andries Burger. There's a very fine balance in this attractive Pinot, offering both ripe red-cherry and forest-berry fruits that are graced with hits of bittersweet cocoa, cola spice and forest floor. It's silky and seductive, with well-integrated tannins and ample acidity to keep the palate fresh. Pleasant notes of earthy baking spice and cherry pit carry on through the close. An elegant and refined wine, this should age well through 2023.
title: Paul Cluver 2015 Cape Winemakers Guild Auction Selection Pinot Noir (Elgin)

description: Bright raspberry aromas are cut by a slightly funky touch of composting violets, dried bay leaf and animal hide on this deeply layered bottling from the legendary producer. The palate is equally complex, with mulberry, tangy cranberry, juniper and earthy mushrooms. It offers a great experience for the price.
designation: Logan Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Estate Grown
title: Talbott 2015 Logan Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)

description: A promising touch of reduction still plays on the nose, riding above ripe notions of redcurrant and red cherry. The palate is ripe, mellow and smooth, showing rounded berry notes and a gentle structure supported by spicy freshness. Oak is beautifully integrated and nothing is overdone. The ripeness of the vintage is evident, but it is on the finish that this shows its true colors: a good structure and lasting freshness.
title: Heinrich Hartl 2015 Classic Pinot Noir (Thermenregion)

description: Dark, tangy black-plum skin and tart boysenberry meet with purple flowers and rosemary on the nose of this bottling, which promises plenty of life in the cellar. The palate is lightly bodied but firmly structured, with tannic depth upholding the dark purple fruits and subtle black spice. These flavors will concentrate and intensify with time. Drink 2018–2025.
title: Waxwing 2015 Ascona Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Robustly spicy in cardamom and cinnamon cola, this wine explodes in dark berry fruit, its medium-bodied layers smoothed and velvety on the palate. From one of the more prominent sites within the Petaluma Gap's wind tunnel, this wine has a coastal influence of salty air about it.
title: Fulcrum 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: This is an engaging, nervy wine, with a light, savory aroma and tangy red-cherry flavors riding on a firm frame of fine-grained tannins and good acidity. It does not try to overwhelm with superripe fruit or oak, but just lets the purity of the grapes shine through.
title: Bravium 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)

description: Fat red cherries and red plums are laid across slate and star anise on the nose of this bottling based on a historic clone. There is solid tension to the sip, with rocky, grippy minerality framing hibiscus, pomegranate and chaparral flavors.
title: Bargetto 2015 Mount Eden Clone Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)

description: Fresh aromas of licorice-laced plum, chaparral herbs and pristine alpine strawberry show on the nose of this single vineyard expression. The clean palate balances tart and ripe flavors, with firm tannins veiling the fruit and spice, and a flash of thyme showing on the finish.
title: Pali 2015 Rancho la Vina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: This juicy four clone blend bursts with tart raspberry and strawberry fruit. Excellent concentration, a lively mouthfeel and textural details all contribute to its fine value. It spent 11 months in 30% new French oak; hints of pepper dot the finish.
title: Vidon Vineyard 2015 Mélange Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: The small appellation of Auxey-Duresses, tucked into the hills behind the main Côte de Beaune, often offers good value for a Burgundy. This ripe wine, full of soft red fruits, is a case in point. Its generous texture and soft tannins are attractive already, giving a full, smiling wine. Drink from 2019.
title: Vincent Girardin 2015 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Auxey-Duresses)

description: Smoky and big-boned, this is a robust, complex and enticing wine, aged in French oak (28% new). Strawberry and balsamic notes are joined by black tea, cardamom and cola on the medium-bodied palate.
title: Bouchaine 2015 Dijon Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: The old vines add their concentration to this ripe wine. It is smooth, smoky from wood aging and offers ripe red-berry and black-cherry fruits. It already has a delicious juicy character that will be enhanced as it ages. Drink this rounded wine from 2020.
title: Domaine de Bellene 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)

description: Owner Benoît Eschard is the sixth generation to run the family estate that includes this wholly owned premier-cru vineyard. This wine is soft, ripe, full of spice, black-plum fruits and integrated acidity. Its softness is balanced by the core of tannins that promise some aging. Drink from 2021.
designation: Clos des Grands Voyens Premier Cru
title: Domaine Jeannin-Naltet 2015 Clos des Grands Voyens Premier Cru  (Mercurey)

description: This is a soft, smooth and decadent wine, gritty in texture and firm in structure. Candied cherry pie is seasoned in cinnamon and clove with dried herb adding a savory twinge between the medium-bodied layers.
title: Kokomo 2015 Gopher Hill Peters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)

description: Aged 11 months in one third new French oak, this bright and spicy bottle is priced a bit lower than the single vineyard offerings from Rex Hill. Its raspberry, blackberry and cola flavors combine with a dash of peppery herb.
title: Rex Hill 2015 Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: This 100% Wadenswil selection from Block 7 delivers ripe strawberry and cherry fruit flavors. The fruit has a pleasing brambly quality that shows on both the nose and palate, with lightly lemony acids that carry a hint of minerality.
title: Shea 2015 Block 7 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The AVA Series comprises small-production, single vineyard wines that showcase particular Willamette Valley terroirs. This one—sourced from the Lichtenwalter vineyard—captures the complex opulence of Ribbon Ridge. At this young age, its toast and caramel flavors from aging in 30% new French oak are front-and-center. Other highlights include whiffs of cherry tobacco and coffee. It's smooth and appealing and may be cellared for up to a decade.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 AVA Series Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This limited production, single-vineyard clonal selection is balanced and surprisingly moderate in body, given its high alcohol. Its firm raspberry jam flavors suggest very ripe fruit, and its tarry tannins come with ground coffee notes.
title: William Rose 2015 777 Clone Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: A vibrant, youthful garnet hue imbues this wine, which is fragrant with rose petal scents and lush with tart cranberry and red currant fruit. At this stage, it remains tight and astringent, but it should improve further with bottle age. The Murto vineyard dates back to 1978, though some replanting has been done since.
title: Winderlea 2015 Murto Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This wine, made from old Pommard clone vines, hails from a site previously known as the Ana vineyard. It showcases the clean, crisp style that typifies all Winderlea Pinots: pomegranate and raspberry fruit and a juicy, acid-driven mouthfeel that amplifes its refreshing minerality.
title: Winderlea 2015 Weber Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: There's a lot going on in this complex yet approachable Yarra Pinot. It's herbal and medicinal in tangy cranberry and cherry notes, with cumin and a stalky, earthy core. The palate is balanced and finesse. Drink now–2024.
title: Yering Station 2015 Village Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)

description: A true old-vine bottling, this comes off the original block of a vineyard planted in 1968 by Oregon pioneer Dick Erath. It's a complex, spicy and balanced amalgam of berry, cherry and plum fruit. As is often the case, it rewards aeration and attention. The acid/tannin balance is just about perfect.
designation: Chehalem Mountain Vineyard Block B3 Old Vines
title: Aberrant Cellars 2015 Chehalem Mountain Vineyard Block B3 Old Vines Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)

description: The second release under this new label from Spindrift Cellars is a sharp, focused expression of crushed raspberries, the flavors ripe and jammy. That lovely fruit is framed by skin and stem phenolics. The tannins are solid, suggesting it will benefit from another year or two of bottle age.
title: Compton Family 2015 Llewellyn Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This is Cristom's entry-level Pinot, and it over-delivers in every regard. The texture, depth and detail of higher-priced vineyard designates are all here, matching brambly berry fruit and streaks of char and coffee grounds. Drink now through the early 2020s.
title: Cristom 2015 Mount Jefferson Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The second release from this site from this producer, Hudson provides bold, rich flavors of cherry coulis and blackberry, and a hint of chocolate-covered orange giving it both a decadent feel and a hit of freshness. Rose petal aromas add a pretty profile to the length and balance of acidity.
title: Davies 2015 Hudson Vineyards Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Rich and hearty black cherry, clove, star anise and vanilla team with a bit of crushed slate minerality on the nose of this block-designated bottling. Dark berries, cola, chaparral herbs and white pepper show on the sip, where squeaky tannins arise toward the finish.
title: Cambria 2015 Mesa Terrace Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)

description: This dense and tannic wine, from the lower slope of the village, is firm and solid. It has a powerful core of tannins as well as rich black fruits that are developing behind the structure. Concentration and dryness mean the wine needs to age, so drink from 2021.
title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2015 Les Murots  (Gevrey-Chambertin)

description: Set at the eastern limit of Santenay next to Chassagne-Montrachet, this vineyard produces structured wines that reflect its neighbor. In this vintage, Valérie and Philippe Jeannot took advantage of rich red-cherry juiciness with a touch of pepper and almost refreshing acidity. Drink this succulent wine from 2021.
title: Philippe Jeannot 2015 Passetemps Premier Cru  (Santenay)

description: This is an earthy wine interwoven in blueberry and tangy cranberry and pomegranate fruitiness. Light in texture and approach, it's as earthy as it is fruity, with subtle offerings of rose petal, cedar and sage. A citrus-like squeeze of acidity hits on the finish, a welcome goodbye.
title: Bouchaine 2015 Estate Swan Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: Still firm and tight, this structured wine at the moment is about tannins rather than fruit. Don't worry, the fruit is there, giving weight to the wine with its rich berry character. Just allow it time and drink from 2021.
title: Domaine Antonin Guyon 2015 Les Cras  (Chambolle-Musigny)

description: Cherry aromas and rich spicy fruits make this an accessible wine. It has delicious rich fruits, a light layer of tannins and an open texture. Drinkable soon, this wine will be ready from 2019.
title: Domaine Changarnier 2015 Champs Fulliot Premier Cru  (Monthélie)

description: Here's a solid, polished effort from winemaker Tom Fitzpatrick. It neatly weaves together blue plum and black cherry flavors, highlighted with pipe tobacco and a hint of caramel. Its smooth tannins are framed with light composted earth notes.
title: Élevée Winegrowers 2015 Élevée Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This stand-out wine is not showy, and has nice fresh fruit flavors shaded by baking spices, a good, lightly gripping texture due to moderate tannins and supportive acidity, and a lingering finish. It's well balanced and not at all tiring to keep sipping.
title: Halcon 2015 Openlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

description: Young and showing primary fruit flavors of cranberry and raspberry, this wine isn't shy about incorporating stem and grape skin flavors. It's a style that favors longterm aging over immediate accessibility and will reward decanting and/or cellaring. Drink 2020–2030.
title: Lingua Franca 2015 Avni Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This wine is a good representation of this appellation. It is structured with tight, dry tannins as well as juicy red fruits that shine through in this vintage. Give this wine more time and drink from 2019.
title: Louis Jadot 2015  Nuits-St.-Georges

description: Lovely cherry lollipop flavors introduce this smooth and tasty effort. Its juicy and irresistable sweet fruit is highlighted with sliced orange and lemon peel notes. A streak of coffee runs through the finish, and the wine is substantial enough to cellar for another half decade or longer.
title: Love & Squalor 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Light in color, this bottling shows suave pomegranate and piquant cranberry on the nose alongside subtle potpourri, bay leaf and juniper. The palate packs in wild forest flavors of sage, thyme and more bay leaf, with a slight hint of green olive giving complexity to the tart red fruit.
title: Seagrape 2015 Jump Up Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)

description: Consider 2015 an off year for this estate wine. Its thin red berry fruit comes with citrus flavors, high acidity and dry, astringent tannins. Some appealing cherry candy flavors emerge as the wine breathes, but it doesn't seem to have the depth to age. Drink now and over the next two to three years.
title: Willamette Valley Vineyards 2015 Bernau Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine is spicy and earthy, with brawny, rustic and ripe waves of cherry and vanilla at its core. Simple in structure it's robust in tannin and oak, aspects that persist on the finish.
title: Zoetic Wines 2015 Hop Kiln Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: This wine is full bodied, very ripe tasting and has a soft expansive mouthfeel. Touches of earth and barnyard join stewed plum flavors for a rustic but enjoyable taste profile.
title: Barra of Mendocino 2015 Pinot Noir (Mendocino)

description: Vincent's Pinot Noirs are fermented with native yeasts in a mix of once-used and older barrels. This bottling opens with fresh strawberry and raspberry flavors, lemony acids, and an underpinning of wet stone. It's on the lighter side and was made (and priced) for everyday enjoyment.
title: Vincent Wine Company 2015 Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)

description: This reserve-level Pinot Noir spent 17 months in neutral oak yet carries strong scents and flavors of vanilla and toast. Those elements accent a core of preserved strawberry fruit. If that hits the mark for your palate, you'll want to drink this while it's young and fresh.
title: Vista Hills 2015 Heritage Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: This perfumed wine is ripe and packed with red fruits. Its soft texture, generous fruits and acidity are balanced to give a smooth, rich wine that will be ready to drink in 2018.
title: Louis Jadot 2015 Le Chapitre  (Bourgogne)

description: Six barrels—one each from six vineyards—comprise this cuvée. This vintage is on the earthy side, with soil, skin and bark flavors alongside light plum and berry fruit. The acids, as in most of the winery's Pinots, leave a chalky aftertaste.
title: Torii Mor 2015 Dundee Hills Select Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Medium in body and high in acidity, this herbal wine shows a tartness of sour cherry and baked rhubarb flavor, held tight within a subtle casing of oak.
title: Truchard 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)

description: The best of Vincent's vineyard designates, this shows riper fruit than the others, with red plum, cocoa and dried herb notes in the mix. An impression of Red Hots candy comes across on the nose and adds a hint of spice to the palate.
title: Vincent Wine Company 2015 Zenith Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: Though 18 months in neutral oak is indicated in this wine's technical notes, it has an arrestingly toasty scent and flavor, which may indicate some other form of oak addition. It shows pretty, though simple, red fruit and is pleasantly appealing. Drink over the next year or two.
title: Vista Hills 2015 Treehouse Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Soft and fruity, this attractive wine reflects the generous 2015 vintage in red wines. It is full of red-cherry and red-currant fruit, cut with just the right acidity and ready to drink from mid 2018.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2015 Les Maladières  (Bourgogne)

description: Lots of whole bunch stalkiness happening here, showing notes of Big Red gum blended with cherry cola. The intense cinnamon and red fruit characters continue on the palate where there's a tannic grip and good amount of acidity. While winemaking technique overpowers terroir here, this is nevertheless a fashionable style plenty of people will enjoy.
title: Giant Steps 2015 Applejack Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)

description: A bit disappointing, this tannic wine spent 17 months in half new oak. Its light rhubarb and berry flavors are overtaken by astringent tannins that leave a bitter aftertaste. More bottle age may help smooth them out.
title: La Chouette 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This soft and fruity wine brings out all the succulent red-fruit flavors of the vintage. Light on tannins, rich in juiciness, it is ready to drink.
title: Maison Roche de Bellene 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne)

description: This wine offers plenty of funk notes: raw meat and barnyard with cherry notes far in the background. The palate, however, is another beast all together in its red fruit and searing acidity.
title: Rob Dolan 2015 True Colours Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)

description: This is a pretty sunset rose color and offers gentle, somewhat muted flavors of rhubarb and bramble berry. Meyer lemon and orange peel highlights accent the midpalate, which opens up with a flash of cherry pie flavor.
title: Torii Mor 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: Earthy in rose petal and forest floor, this wine is medium bodied and somewhat tannic, with a finesse of raspberry and strawberry flavor. It shows well and is made in volumes that provide affordability and accessibility.
title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)

description: Stiff, herbal and tannic, this wine seems reluctant to offer much fruit. What it has in abundance are stem and skin flavors, which may be intentional but offer little pleasure.
title: Goodfellow 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: This wine's odd name would seem to indicate there's Chardonnay in the blend, but in fact it's only Pinot Noir. Although technically a white, the color and flavor say rosé. Light rhubarb and strawberry fruit comes forward, with a round, pleasant mouthfeel. Drink up.
title: Redgate 2015 Char-Noir White Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: With the alcohol barely topping 12%, this might have made a better rosé than full-fledged Pinot Noir. Its strawberry and citrus flavors are dilute, though clean and fresh. High, citrusy acidity is the prominent characteristic.
title: Vincent Wine Company 2015 Silvershot Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This wine is slightly spritzy, with forward flavors of strawberry soda pop. It drinks like a much less expensive bottle and should be consumed chilled—now through 2019.
title: Vista Hills 2015 Piedmont Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: Though this cuvée is far more limited (and expensive) than the winery's regular release, it's imbued with strong coffee and vanilla flavors that overwhelm the fruit. Its tannins are hard and the fruit rather generic. Another year or two in bottle may bring it into better balance.
title: Henry Estate 2015 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)

description: This soft, rich wine is a delicious reminder of the great fruit in this vintage. It has broad red fruits with balanced acidity and a crisp edge. This wine that comes from vineyards at the southern end of the Côte de Beaune is ready to drink now.
title: Philippe Jeannot 2015  Bourgogne

description: This wine's light cranberry fruit suggests that the grapes were barely ripe or perhaps sourced from young vines. The flavors are pretty but quickly dissipate, leaving residual tastes of stem and bitter herb. Give this another year or two of bottle age.
title: Vincent Wine Company 2015 Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: This is a light wine with red-currant fruitiness and a crisp texture. It has a light tannin edge as well as juicy acidity, bright and fruity at the end. Drink from late 2018.
title: Domaine Chevillon-Chezeaux 2015  Bourgogne Hautes Côtes de Nuits

description: This vineyard designate must have stood out during the winemaking process, but at the moment its better qualities seem to be hiding. Neither place nor variety show with any particularity; it's just a light, generic red wine.
title: Vincent Wine Company 2015 Bjornson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)

description: It's difficult to review wines that show significant bottle variation, like this one from Vista Hills. Here, the first example had a leathery dryness that killed any impression of fresh fruit, with a final glue-like note. The second bottle was better, with raspberry fruit and none of the tack room scents and flavors of the first. But bitter phenolics and drying tannins suggest it should be consumed soon.
title: Vista Hills 2015 Skyraider Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)

description: An assertive butter and spice overlay makes this otherwise lean wine a little off-balance, but it's not hard to enjoy the vanilla and cedar aromas and crisp spare fruit flavors.
title: Nine North Wine Company 2015 Chasing Lions Pinot Noir (California)

description: Mulberry and blackberry fruit combine nicely in this wine, but it doesn't quite come together. There are disparate threads of tannin and acid, a hint of plastic and some residual bitterness on the finish.
title: Wetzel Estate 2015 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)

description: The white wines in the Wine by Joe portfolio are fresh and well-made and offer exceptional value. This budget Pinot Noir tries hard but offers in-your-face vanilla and cola flavors, suggesting some sort of oak chip treatment. There's plenty of flavor here, but not much Pinot Noir character.
title: Wine by Joe 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
